reviews.review: An oasis in the middle of the city - fascinating, interesting, delightful!. The grounds are really lovely, and altho I don't like to see animals in captivity a lot of the animals we saw had lots of room and there was a lot of relevant information on their background. The birds particularly were fascinating to watch.
Something for everyone! . A wonderful place for all ages and taste! Make sure you have all day when you'll be there for you are going to spend a number of hours to see everything in the zoo.

Really good !!. We went here just to pass the day thinking "here's another zoo" to add to the list of ones we've done ! I have to say the aquarium section of the Zoo was Amazing ! We loved it and would recommend it based on that even alone ! Great little carts for putting toddlers around in which were cool ! Overall very impressed !

Visit the baby elephant. I often go to Artis alone or with friends. They are now trying to creat bigger spaces for all animals especially for the cats. I like their promise to never get any more animals and try the best for the ones that already live there. A new born elephant is now in that family. The price of the tickets though is way too high. I used to get the annual member card but I can't afford that at the moment either. It would be nice if they now and then give some discount offer for more ppl to get the chance to visit the zoo. But I know that the cost to keep everything well is really huge.

Lovely zoo in the centre of Amsterdam. We went a couple of times. Every time we saw something different. The zoo offers an educational programme (check website) which bith my parents and children loved. Suitable and lived by all ages

A small but quality zoo. Cards on the table time: I like zoos. I know a lot of people don't, but for me the captive breeding programmes and educational value alone make them near essential. Getting close to our fellow creatures is also a bonus. Amsterdam zoo represents all that is best in zoos. Animal welfare is clearly at the top of their agenda as well as trying to educate folks (the place was full of school kids when we went). It isn't the biggest zoo in the world, but has a good array of animals (the aquarium is particularly impressive). The African hunting dogs are a nice touch too. And, there are lions, giraffes and other crowd pleasers too.There is a good range of grub and a wonderful diorama. The gift shop has a good range too. Go - it's great.
Great!. Lovely well kept zoo. Loads of different types of animals although we couldn't see the gorillas during our visit. Would return!
Awesome. Best zoo i have ever been in. Get close to the animals at Artis Zoo. Planetarium and Aquarium included. Don't use the IAmsterdam card here because you will spend the whole day here.

Large zoo with plenty to see. Great place to take teenagers and kids of all ages. It's mainly outdoor so best on a clear day. Well placed catering all the way round with really good quality food at very reasonable prices, although the layout and service was shambolic so on a busy day expect queues.

small yet well managed. Very nice park with lots of animals. I'm not a great fan of zoos, but here the animals seemed rather comfortable. A lot of locals spending their time with kids. Flamingoes - stunning.

Fun fun fun. This is a small city zoo. The collection is mostly African animals. They were easy to see and interact with but safely. The camels were right next to the restaurant so you could watch them while you eat. Really nice visit. Two and half hours.

Amazing. . This is by far the best zoo I've been to. It's very interactive and the animals are very lively. The zoo itself is beautiful and very well laid out - and all flat! Would 100% recommend a visit here.

Perfect day out in a city, if you love nature & animals. A Zoo within a city!. If you have kids, this a a must see. It is not too big and a takes a few hours ( about 3 hours) to enjoy this place. Of course,you can spend more time if you love animals and spend the entire day. It costs about 20 euros for entry. It has lots to see like Giraffes, Zebras, deers,Elephants, wolves, lions, birds, buttrerlfy house and also a large Aquarium. Some of you may feel that there isn't much room for the animals but they look well cared for.I have been to this place twice and with children. They loved it too.

Big neat Zoo. I do not know the price because we had free entrance with amsterdam card. It was a cold morning but it was great walk trough this big zoo. There are plenty of animals and everything is extra clean and obviously well maintained. You can buy food and drinks inside.

"I Wanna Be An Apeman". Took my Honey Bee here for her first visit, my 10th. It blew here mind; we started at the Planetarium with an animated trip through space to distant galaxies revealed by the Hubble telescope. We then wandered among many small primates in an exhibit with tarsirs, sloth, marmosets and flying foxes loose in the room, toured the whole scene and ended up with the aquarium which shows an underwater view of the Amsterdam canals. It is impossible to list all of the cool stuff; we spent a day there and had a picnic. So fine, as Ray Davies says: "I wanna Be An Apeman!" Enjoy!

Outstanding Collection of Asian Animals. This is an outstanding zoo. A few things struck me immediately. First, there is very little that separates the animals from the visitor. I was amazed at how close some of the animals, such as the spider monkeys, can come to an individual. No way that would fly in the States. Secondly, the lack of sufficient restroom facilities...the perpetual issue in Europe.The butterfly building is beautiful. A great habitat to show case a wonderful collection. Although we have seen bigger and more diverse butterflies, this is one of the biggest habitats and more beautifully landscaped exhibits we have ever seen.Kudos to the zoo for having such a diversified collection of animals represented here. There were so many animals we have never seen in American zoos. The white throated martins and the Malaysian tapirs are just 2 examples of rare and unusual species not found in American zoos. For the most part, the exhibits are well done and suitable, although I found a few of the habitats dated. It appears the zoo is undergoing a major construction project so hopefully some of the old, less spacious enclosures will be done away with.We thoroughly enjoyed our visit here. Between the aquarium and the indoor and outdoor exhibits there is so much eye candy. The staff was extremely friendly and willing to answer questions. It appears to be a well run outfit.The entry fee is high...well over 50 euros for the 2 of us. They do not give out free maps. We had to purchase a map for an additional 2 euro fee. That irked me. There is no reason for it.You can easily spend the majority of the day here. There is so much going on. Definitely worth the effort to visit if you are in Amsterdam.

Weekend get away. We have been to this zoo before it's amazing to find it situated in the heart of Amsterdam . The animals are well cared for the staff are friendly and the restaurant good value for food. It's a great day out easy walking no hills and plenty of animals to see.

Worth a visit. This was a nice place but I was wasn't very happy with the zoo, I just thought some of the enclosures were too small. But the butterfly house made it, it was amazing and an experience I won't forget
Really nice zoo. Well worth a visit, plenty of rest stops and plenty to see. Just make sure you get a map as you could miss some exhibits.

So much to see... defiantly worth a visit...beauiftul place to spend the day.... We had a lovely day at the Zoo, it was massive with so many animals to see, the animals seemed well looked after although I did feel there should have been more staff presents in some areas for the more vulnerable animals in their enclosures such as the Meerkats, which were getting poked and fed different things by visitors..! That said its an excellent tourist attraction with so much to do and see and lots of different eating areas, a beautiful place to spend the day.

Lovely zoo with nice garden areas. Often in a zoo you see that the animals are treated to lovely enclosures whilst the humans walk around in an area much less pretty, but not with Artis. The animals looked well looked after and the garden elements were beautiful, but what more can you really say about a zoo other than the fact that it's a zoo and they're all pretty much the same!! Would recommend for a family.

Brilliant but not enough information. This was a lovely place to visit, with a variety of animals quite close up. Unfortunately there wasn't a lot of information given about the animals and no large map of the zoo. We had to find our way by a few signposts. We had been offered the chance to buy a map with our tickets but there was no later opportunity and no map inside. Also, while some of the animals had labels and information, lots didn't and we couldn't find anyone to ask, especially in the tropical house.Good cafe and lots of places to sit. Very enjoyable afternoon.
Nice zoo and aquarium. This zoo is not that big compared to other ones in Europe. However the animals they have are good. The aquarium building is one of the nicest areas, don't miss that one.

It's Just Another Zoo BUT. My partner wanted to go to the zoo. I thought, if you've seen one zoo, you've seen them all. I was mistaken. The Artis is beautiful and you get an aquarium and planetarium as well. Do not miss the butterfly house - I could have stayed in there all day.
Best zoo. Visited artis zoo 3 years ago and had the best time, spent hours looking around there was so many animals to see would love to go again and it is definitely worth the money.

Brill. This was included in our 'i amsterdam' card.We loved this zoo. Nicely laid out zoo and good environment for the animals. Normally the cages aren't big enough but I thought this was as good as a zoo can be.The aquarium was very impressive with large tanks with huge fish. Another highlight was walking through one of the rooms that had little monkeys - super cute and really nice you can see them up close. Wasn't too busy either - we went on a Monday - late morning.

greatness amongst the beasts. well what can i say , i love being around animals and being high at the time made it all the better . my advice would be to grab yahself a hand full of those magic truffles they have and wander around the zoo twipping all day , the animals are aware they get high too ... just wish the pictures we took looked the same as we saw them lol ... (yes i said twipping) be free ... enjoy and love ...

Fantastic day out! . A great visit for families, or groups of friends. The whole zoo has a feeling of relaxation, there are very few cages, and the lemur enclosure is even open to go into! It's also nearby to some fantastic restaurants and is a short walk from the city centre. Make sure to visit when the weather is good, most of the zoo is outdoors.

Interesting zoo and vibe. Visited several times now and always enjoy a certain ambience about this zoo - not entirely sure what it is exactly. Some enclosures are certainly inadequate now, by modern Western zoo standards - wish that could be improved upon. But, there is a lot of good to see.
Nice place . Fine zoo. Lots of animals. Planetarium on the territory of the zoo. Good place to visit if you travel with children. Better of course on a sunny day:)
Nice. It's a zoo. I love zoo's. A nice compact one in the middle of the city! Some things old and some very new. The feel of the place is wonderful. Laid back. Not too busy.

Well worth a family visit!. Decided to visit Artis Zoo during our 'day trip' to Amsterdam during a DFDS mini cruise. Tram 9 from Amsterdam Central station takes you practically to the entrance and a return fare is quite reasonably priced. The entrance fee for the zoo is comparable with any although maybe more expensive than normal just now because of €/£ exchange! We were very lucky though as we approached, a lovely Dutch couple gave us a voucher for free entry for two adults as part of a supermarket special offer! The zoo is flat, easy to walk and easy to navigate and the variety of exhibits is super with all the usual and many that are not. We stopped for a drink and a bit of cake and were pleasantly pleased with the price. The cafés were very clean too! Overall, well worth a family visit!!

Relaxing day.. We didin't plan visiting the zoo, but it was on our way from the hostel, so we decided to have a look. It is beautiful, interesting walk with tea or coffee in a hand, surprised us more than we expected. I was a little bit upset as the planetarium was not in English (maybe I did not find it in English). 5/5. Loved it and would come back.

Best Zoo I have ever seen. This Zoo is amazing. So much to see. It took us 4 hours to go round. Everything was well looked after although the lions were a bit cramped. We missed the jaguar as they were building a new fancy pen. But we will go back someday.

Probable the Best zoo I have been to.. When the kids were younger we used to buy year passes and go at least once a month. Although the kids are older i still return for two special attractions; The aquariums and the Gem sone museum

Great day out with the kids. Absolutely loved our time in the zoo ... so much for the kids (and those that want to be kids) to see and do.The zoo was easy to find, with bus stopping just outside. We purchased our tickets before hand, which made getting in a lot easier. visitors should consider this option, especially on weekends or in busy periods.The zoo has lots of different animals to see, and you get the chance to get really close to some of them.We loved the butterfly display, the underwater scenes and surprisingly (we have 2 girls) the reptile display.Of course the lions & monkeys are always going to be an attraction for the kids as well.
Nice and relaxing. I spent a whole afternoon there. If you are a VU student bring your student ID i you can enter for 4-5 EUR. Really clean zoo with platy of happy animals.

nice day out u can make the visit sas long as u want. whent and spend all most half the day the zoo is rely big and its just nice to walk around and just enjoy looking around the nice thing is that they leave the top of the cages open so its like u get close clear look

Wonderful place.. Went here to get some peace from the busy city and it was enchanting. The zoo is beautiful, it felt like wandering around a garden and there were so many places to explore. I would totally go again.
Brilliant Zoo. This is a truly beautiful zoo. Well laid out with the animals looking comfortable and we'll looked after.

Wide range of animals, small enclosures . This zoo had a wide range of animals including gorillas! The enclosures were quite small, however they did seem to be making a lot of improvements. The day we went was raining very heavily, however this didn't spoil our day as we bought ponchos for just €3.75, and carried on as normal.This zoo isn't too far out of the centre of town, and the tram stops right outside.

Outdated. Im am an Amsterdam, so the Artis Zoo was part of the school curriculum ahah. This zoo is perfect to go to with kids, and yes I am aware that zoo's are usually focussed on marketing.Since my childhood this zoo has stayed the same except for minor changes. There is a huge play ground in to east part of the park including a buffet restaurant which is highly expensive for what you get. In my opinion the zoo is outdated and with the major environmental uprising in the media and in general: the zoo is not very a frontier in making their animals comfortable.I remember Artis having a polar bear (which now they dont have anymore I think) and he was always walking the exact same route over and over again, the tigers and lions to it as well.There are better zoo's in the Netherlands although on distance from Amsterdam. For example Safari Zoo where you can go on a boat trip to see animals, walking, or even in your own car. You also have Apenheul where the monkeys can walk up to you.I must say I am not a supporter of animal captivity for commercial activities or personal collection, especially when it comes to wild animals. Although in some ways it protects them from for example rhino poaching.The time spend here with my friends was very enjoyable and had a lot of fun. The zoo is a great place to go to with young children; thats it really :/

A must in Amsterdam. my daughter and i went there 3 days ago .. it started to rain the minute we got to the zoo- but the place is soo amazing even in purring rain . we usually dont go to the zoo ( feels so sad to see the animals in cages ..)but here the were more free to roam , less fences , and everything seems so peaceful, organized .. and natural as can be in a zoo .. we had the best time ever and im sure that in our next visit to Amsterdam we'll come here again

Loved it!. We got there at 5pm and only had an hour until it shut! We ran around and I think we managed to see all of it. Couldn't find the lions though! Such a wide variety of animals it's a lovely zoo!! ❤️

Amazing zoo!! Must go. This came as a total surprise. Was expecting a basic zoo. Took my one year old son to show him some animals... but this place was just so beautiful. Anyone and everyone must visit. So well maintained and almost all the animals are to be found. The area with the giraffes and zebras are a must. The aquarium is also unusual.

Lovely, clean zoo. I visited here with my family and we enjoyed the day immensely. The zoo, like Amsterdam, has a certain informality about it and while the animals are mainly in their own areas, they feel very closely - in fact the Lemurs were out and about in the crowd and raiding prams and bags for treats (or they did until the staff rounded them back up!) and this added to the fun atmosphere of the place. I genuinely loved it and so did my daughters who are both teenagers and therefore a tough age group to please!I would thoroughly recommend a visit to the zoo to anyone as it is a lovely, relaxed day out, with a wide and varied selection of animals to see.

Amazing day out. One of the biggest zoos I have been to, me and my partner had an amazing day out, we spent around 4/5 hours there as there is so much to see and so many different animals and reptiles to look at! Perfect for a sunny day out.

Great day out. Lots to see and do spend the day take your time and take in the whole exhibit Most of the animals have a decent enclosure with things to keep them amused although I did think that the aquarium was a but small for some of the attendees Check out the lemurs as they free range and sticky beak into your stuff but keep an eye on them as they will pinch something

Lots to see. The zoo was great! We were on our honeymoon and had great fun, we are just like kids anyway hehe. We did the zoo and NEMO the same day as they are close together. With the Iamsterdam card we got in for nothing. It was raining a little but didn't dampen our enjoyment. Went at 1030 which was quiet!
Good but quite small. There are quite a lot of animals to see in Artis but I do think the enclosures are too small. I also think it is a bit overpriced for how long you spend there

A pleasant afternoon. Was in the city attending a conference which ended with a walk. The walk took us through the Red Light district and on to the zoo which was such a surprise as the area still looks fairly residential. The zoo itself was well laid out and the animal enclosures were very natural - common to most zoos these days. It's years since many of us had visited a zoo but it was a very pleasant afternoon spent in the Autumn sunshine.

they are working on it. it is sad to see animals caged waiting until they are fed for the pleasure of humans. Artis zoo is converting its zoo in an living environment for animals, which means you will walk around in their habitat and the animals will be just like in the wild searching their own food while you can admire them

Peaceful and Enjoyable. Artis difinitly does not have the biggest animal collection, but it was one of the most enjoyable zoos for me to visit, from the way they are presenting the animals, you feel they happy and have some space and so do the visitors, in lot of occasions, you meet and observe the animals face to face which was a new and enjoyable experience for me, I thought it should be unforgettable experience for the children too, the butterfly house and sea lions are a must see.

Honestly the best zoo I've been too. This zoo is brilliant, it has really good sized enclosures for the animals with tons of enrichment, they are also expanding some. The buildings on site are beautiful, especially the aquarium building and it's really a whole day out. Lovely variety of animals, and brilliant value entry and the food & drink on site are fairly priced. Can't wait to visit again!
Worth a visit to the Artis. My 20 something son and I visited the Artis in his recent visit to Amsterdam. We enjoyed all the animals and the lovely grounds. The aquarium was an added bonus.

Groovy Zoological Experience. Artis is pretty good for an inner city zoo; loads to see and do including the Micropia Museum. There is a great cafe Plantage - we went there to take drinks away to sit beside the Flamingo lake and it was fantastic! Easy to get to & nice neighborhood to explore on foot too.

Great Zoo!. Amazing zoo and takes a good 3/4 of a day to get around it! Lots of lovely areas - enclosures could be a bit bigger :( Zoos in the UK have big enclosures for the animals which I think is kinder. Food and drink is lovely there!!

Loved it!. Takes the whole day to cover but totally worth it. Great place for the kids of course. Over 60 enclosures all with different animals. Saw some big cats up close Even the White Bengal Tiger couple. The Dolphin and Seal show was also amazing. Great place, lovely memories.

Good but expensive and seems unstructured.. It's look nice but not that many animals and it is quite expensive. Also it seems like there's no reasonable way to get around without double track paths quite a lot if you want to see it all.

Great for families. Unfortunately it was raining went we went to artis, so it was a little tricky to navigate around BUT the animals were loving the weather which was nice.The zoo had many different animals to visit and a couple small enclosures as well. Some of the enclosures need a bit of maintenance, but the zoo seems to be aware of this as the elephants are getting a new and improved enclosure which they need.

oooh great day in zoo. nice great big zoo
you have to visit
see all animals
aquarium , butterflies flying around
nice flowers
marvelous views
Good visit. It is a decent zoo with lots to see. We visited it as it was free with the iamsterdam card and had some time to kill.

A good trip. Thoroughly enjoyed our visit, the price was reasonable €20 each, far cheaper than London! The aquarium was very good as was the bird, / woodland house, where the birds and bats were all around, as well as the butterfly house. Some exhibits were "old fashioned" in that they didn't seem adequate for the animals housed, along with poor opportunities to see the animals, in particular the lions enclosure which was very small, there is work going on to give the elephants greater space, so I assume they'll get round to the lions eventually! The setting is lovely though , with majestic trees providing shade etc, well worth a visit. You can also "escape" with out going through the gift shop, which may appeal to parents!
Variety of animals. Great for all good day out and very reasonably priced, few of the i closures were a tad small. The aquarium was great

Amsterdam visit. We had a great time here. The grounds are beautiful and they had a good variety of animals. It wasn't cheap as it was about $20 a person. It was ok as it was the zoo and need the money. We spent about and hour and a half as there was just the two of us. It's good for families.

Mixed feelings!. I must admit I am not a great lover of zoos. I think the zoo is going through some refurbishment so hopefully that will be better. Some enclosures are too small for their animals. Apart from lots of staff at the entrance I only saw one Keeper as we walked around. The Giraffes were a highlight. No sign of the Gorilla. One of the elephants wanted to go back inside but couldn't and frankly looked distressed waving from side to side by the door and tapping his trunk on it. The Sea Lion cut a lonely figure and the penguins didn't seem to have anywhere to swim properly (more like paddle). Many of the children seemed to be enjoying themselves and the zoo is popular with families but maybe we've been spoilt by Colchester, London and wild life parks where the animals have more room on the whole.
A must-see! So good. Lots of interesting animals to see! Butterfly atrium was great. Very interactive, loved it. Definitley worth the entrance fee.

a nice jungle in the middle of amsterdam. If you have more than 2 days to visit amsterdam, then check out the Zoo Artis, quite a difference scene from the city centre, and surely to spend more than 2 hours if you are an nature lover!
Amazing expirience. The zoo is amazing, very clean, beautiful park inside.Varied animal species, amazing aquarium.Great expirience for kids!
The poor animals . Enclosures too small particularly for the lions who looked distressed Area is too small for an animal friendly zoo. Wouldn't recommend at all.
Great Day Out. Great zoo with large selection of animals. Also allows entry to planetarium, aquarium, butterfly house and Microbia.

Artis zoo. Had a really good afternoon although you wouldn't need any longer than that. Lots of different animals to see. They had a planitarium with shows on throughout the day which costs extra to see and are in Dutch and also a bit about micro-organisms which cost an extra 12 euro to see so we didn't bother. Very clean and good facilities.

Something different to do when in Amsterdam. I visited the zoo for something different to do in Amsterdam. It did not dispooint. The animals all seem to be quite happy in their surroundings, they had plenty of room and their enclosures were all clean as well. Would definitely reccommend a visit to families who are staying in the area.
Family. Zoo is quite small but nice. Very family friendly. I go there twice a month with my son. Advice is to eat af the plantage next to Artis. Very good food and nice scenery.

Worth seeing. We decided to take a break form the normal sites and ventured by tram out to the zoo. We walked back to Central Station and found the walk shorter than we expected. Lots of interesting animals, many not available to see in North America. Very family oriented zoo.

Mixed Feelings. Not really a fan of zoos but appreciate the fact that they do help in conservation. This one is perhaps one of the better zoos and there is so much to see with many interesting exhibits including a brilliant aquarium. There were lots of people visiting when we were there but it never felt crowded and there was always room enough to see the animals mostly at close quarters. I mus admit that when I came out of the zoo I felt very pleased at the conditions in which the animals were kept. It is a very large site but there are plenty of seats around for you to stop and have a rest. We really did not do the zoo justice as we were pushed for time towards the end; you should allow at least four hours to really get the best from your visit.
Zoo . This is a lovely zoo , really pretty , the animals seemed well looked after . A lovely day out in the sunshine ! We used our ' I am Amsterdam ' card because it was free entry with it !

Needs a full day.. Overall a lovely experience, however some exhibits are showing their age and whilst I definitely have no concerns over animal care some spaces are small which is a bit off-putting. There does seem to be a lot of investment in the zoo currently which is addressing these issues. A new jaguar enclosure is almost finished. And the beautiful elephants will soon have a shiny new and more spacious home. Ultimately animals belong in the wild, however the sad truth is that as long as we continue encroaching into these species habitats, zoos will always exist, the best taking part in international breeding programmes to ensure species survival as artis does. Highlights for me were the gorillas, giraffes and elephants. I was also able to get incredibly close to a two toed sloth, some pygmy marmosets and a white faced saki. Being particularly fond of monkeys I was like a kid in a sweet shop.

One of the best zoo's we've visited! . Lovely day out! Animals treated very well. Open enclosures and a variety of different animals in different enclosures i.e giraffes mixed with antelope and zebras! Which we were impressed with. Worth every penny of 20 euro each! 10 minute walk to Amsterdam centre!

A MUST SEE!. Wonderful place to visit is you like animals. It's really up close and personal where you really feel that they are in reach of you even though they are not. The best areas for me were actually walking in the Wallaby enclosure and then seeing the Lemurs sitting on a fence. The Zoo is good value, clean, plenty of space to walk around, peaceful. The Aquarium is worth looking into with the array of waterlife on display. The rest of the zoo is excellent with elephants (one is pregnant at the moment) giraffes, zebra, vultures, seals, penguins, monkeys, chimpanzees and much much more. A great place to take children, educational trips with some nice areas for eating too.

Wonderful . A really good day out for couples, friends or the whole family. We spent 4 hours wandering around and couldn't believe how fast the time had gone.
One of the best zoos I've ever been too, a brilliant day out! Don't forget to explore the aquarium!!

Little zoo. The entrance for the zoo is quite expensive for what you get. It's easy to see that the zooi is old, and not too big.
Ofcourse, for children it's nice to visit, but for an adult it might not be what you're expecting.
Bring the kids!. We travel here once a year and always visit the Artis! They have little wagons for my daughter to ride in and all of the animals are free range and in their natural habitats!

A nice few hours spent. Amazing to have a zoo in the heart of a city. We had the iamsterdam card and this zoo is included in the price which was super. A nice selection of animals and nice green space to walk around.

Lots of great sceneries. Unexpectedly spacious.. How much space can a zoo have in the middle of a city? The Amsterdam Zoo has! They have chosen not to expose many, many animals, but to give proper space to the ones they want to show. So elephants, giraffes, wolves, camels and many more have a spacious area to live in. There are also some areas where one can walk between the animals. Very nice! And then there are the sea lions, from above or under, the aquarium, the reptiles, birds or insects house, etc. The only thing to be improved is that the glass of the cases definitely have to be cleaned of children's finger prints during the day. Sometimes one can't see much of the insects or reptiles anymore later during the day.

NIce Peaceful day at the zoo. I love a good day at the zoo. Red pandas, lions, gorillas, penguins, camels, snakes, spiders, turtles, and alligators just to name a few things I saw. They have a small aquarium and planetarium that some cool things to see as well

Great city zoo! . We come here regularly and my daughter loves it! Note if you're coming more than 3 times in the year it's probably best to get the year card. There are great sections to explore and is good for a sunny or rainy day. The food is priced though and so I always bring a picnic.. Ideal place to come!

Lovely zoo experience. I always feel a little conflicted about zoos because - my passion for animal rights often makes me question how ethical it is to see them in enclosures. However the Artis Zoo is a lovely one with an interesting history. They are making upgrades to enclosures and seem to put animal welfare first, so I did enjoy our visit here. There is a big variety of animals to see and the park itself is lovely to walk through.

Go here as part of your trip. This place is just great. Full of beautiful wildlife from all over the world. The place is stunning to look at and is very well kept. Animals seem well looked after and the staff are friendly and helpful. The place is having some major renovations in parts, but they seem to be really loading money into this place. There are places to eat and drink outside and close to the zoo, just to get out of the hustle bustle of the zoo and relax. When it's busy here, it can be tiring. Enjoy the pics below

Great day out but needs improvements.. We visited Artis Zoo thinking we would get around it in a couple of hours. We were wrong! It is massive and the added aquarium really does take up a whole day.We enjoyed the novelty of being able to walk amongst certain enclosures but it was also alarming to see such small spaces for certain animals. The Lions had no space to roam, neither did the gorillas. The giraffes had no grassy space and were instead all laying on a small pile of sand in their concrete enclosure.I'm sad to type these things as I did think the zoo had massive potential and it was a very educational and interesting day out. I'd recommend spending a whole day there but I hope the zoo expand and are able to give the animals the space they need in these kind of settings.

Small but perfectly formed. My husband and I visit zoos everywhere we go and really enjoyed this one. Although it is quite small everything is arranged perfectly. The enclosures are well thought out and we were very happy to see the fishing cats so active as they were new to us.The food in the restaurant was good too and the service and staff were friendly everywhere we went.The aquarium was a real surprise as once inside the amazing building it's housed in the layout was unique and impressive (this is from my husband as I am terrified of fish). I did enjoy the sharks and the coral though.

Brilliant Zoo. We loved it. Enclosures very well maintained. Lovely features like the dinosaur sculptures that kids can climb on. Lots of open space and lovely gardens (we went in October and there were pumpkins everywhere). Aquarium was great. Baby giraffe lovely!

3 day break. Came here last year and again this year because it is such a wonderful zoo, I'm from Manchester, the only zoo I've been to is Chester and they just don't compare. It is a large zoo, my favourite part was the butterfly house having them flutter by and watching them eat was fascinating. The zoo is very clean and usually fairly busy with no wonder as it's a fantastic spot to visit. There's food, drink, toilets and a shop a great place for solos, couples, friends and families looking for a day out.

Not only for kids !!. If you are a animal-lover this is the place to go. You will see many kinds of animals in very good conditions. And of course there is also a place where you can have a drink en see all the pictures on your camera or mobile phone !!So go there. It is easy by tram from Central sation area !!
Very varied zoo. Many cool and cute animals, minimum distance and borders so keep your kids from jumping to the lions pool :)

Excellent!. Visited this zoo for the first time. Beautiful sunny day. Very quick admission into the zoo, English map given. Well signposted, loads to see and lovely to be able to get quite close to a lot of the animals. Beautiful,clean and well kept zoo. Thoroughly enjoyed it.
Great day. the science meuseum was fascinating. I also loved the aquarium. I went in the summer 2015 so it was very hot in some of the animal houses especially the tropical animals.

Some serious concerns about the lack of space for the animals.. Although the artis park zoo is generally well laid out and simple to navigate the space available for the animals is rather limited and certainly not up to the standards that tend to be set in the UK. I felt particularly concerned for the larger animals such as the lions and the elephants where the space really did seem very inadequate.
Lovely experience. A place that you have to visit if you are travelling to Amsterdam with your kids. The kids will have so much fun and trust me the adults will too.

Great day out . We spent hours here slowly making our way from the planetarium to the aquarium and insect, reptile and bird houses and all the enclosures in-between. Toilets and restaurants are placed at intervals around the park. We dined in the largest restaurant next to the giraffes we got a huge meal for €9 and none of us could finish it, it was delicious. I am glad that they are expanding some of the enclosures because one of the elephants was swaying from side to side. The other enclosures though are very good and most animals looked content. It is a lot of walking but well worth it and they even have pull along buggy things for any smaller children. Good money and if you are into science definitely go to the microbe museum!

Horrible . €20 for this place. It was disappointing. The animals like the zoo looked tired and dated. A world class city deserves something better than this. I did notice some construction on site so maybe they are trying to upgrade it.

Interesting!. I do love a good trip to the zoo. There are a variety of different animals to see here! I do personally believe that the lions area is way too small for them! That I totally do not agree with. As much as I love going to the zoo and seeing all these amazing animals in person, there is this conflict between is it really for the animals or is it just for the public show? I felt that when seeing some of the animals e.g the lions, seals, penguins and alligators. It is however a beautiful zoo and kids would love it. Great outing for the day!

Always a bit irritated with this place . It's a decent zoo, but it stressed me out to see the conditions some of the animals are living in. The jaguars and tigers etc, living in concrete habitats no bigger than my living room with wire fences around them. Years ago there was a polar bear that was black with dirt, living in the smallest most terrible enclosure, I think it's probably since died.

Brilliant !!. You can spend hours here trying to see everything and exploring the beautiful grounds, in which you can lose yourself meandering along, wondering what you are gonna find round the next corner, up those steps, or through the leafy areas. (despite having a map) There is a Reptile house, bird house, butterfly house to mention a few. The enclosures for the animals are spacious and natural. You can even go down under the sea lions water pool and watch them from under the water. Well worth a visit, and the money.

Best zoo I have ever visited!. Definitely one of the best zoos that I have ever visited. There was definitely so much to see and we spent so long here, we weren't interested in the Micropia though. I'd definitely recommend spending a couple of euros on the map because you'll definitely need it! A lot of the animal enclosures are so much closer than we're used to with zoos in the UK so that was a nice surprise. There were definitely a few animals which were lose within the enclosures such as the small monkey house and the lemur walk through. The zoo is absolutely huge, believe me it doesn't look it from the outside. It's a great day for families and couples, would highly recommend!

Fantastic Reptile Collection!. As the zo was at the end of the road to our apartment, it would have been rude to not have gone - also the fact I am a HUGE animal lover.Zoos I am torn about. I hate the fact that these animals are enclosed, especially large animals such a Lions, Giraffes and Elephants. They almost look distressed, the space they have in any zoo is inadequate. So I try my best not to support zoos, however, what would happen if we didn't go, to the animals who are currently held in captivity there.Anyway, enough of my ranting!The zoos was the largest I have been to, lots of things going on, watching the penguins being fed was a highlight, the way the looked at the zookeeper was just adorable.The part I was most surprised with was the reptile house, as a keeper of reptiles I was at awe in what was there, I loved the whole day, the experience.The only thing that let it down was the cost, I found it to be the most expensive thing we did all of our trip, but I am glad that we went.Must see the sealions and penguins!! Fantastic day!

My fav zoo in Holland. If you want to visit a zoo to me this is the best one. I really love this place you get to see so many animals and is huge and entertaining not just for kids but adults too. Definitely moneys worth. You get a wide range from sea to land.
The best zoo i have seen. Never been before in so nice Zoo. Lot things to see, and still long time to walk around. Best for kids and couples.
Best day out in amsterdam. Great variety in the zoo, animals were beautiful particularly enjoyed the butterfly kingdom, made my holiday

Surprisingly complete. Great zoo and easy to get to and walk around. Lots of shade on a hot day. Aquarium, butterfly conservatory and animal displays were much better than anticipated. Would recommend a visit, especially if you have children along

Afternoon visit. We visited prior to leaving for the airport. Again entry was free thanks to the iAmsterdam card!
We enjoyed the zoo, but some of the enclosures were small and we were glad to see the works going on to improve the conditions for the animals.

Great Zoo. This was a really nice zoo with open plan areas for most of the animals to play around. The elephant pen is currently undergoing an extension. The staff went out of their way to enhance the experience. You could easily spend all day here, though we only managed to make it to the zoo for the final 2 hours of the day; the gardens are beautiful and there are plenty of animals so see. Aside from the large animals the butterfly house was brilliant as was the aquarium. There is a planetarium there too but unfortunately we missed out on that. This zoo is 177 years old, not that you’d be able to tell, and is the second oldest in Europe. It is well worth a visit if you have time or children.

Good but... Our visit to the zoo was overall a good experience. They have a wide variety of animals on show, some of which have no barrier between you and the animal which was fun. However some of the enclosures are very small. The entrance fee was crazy expensive for a zoo which is actually quite small in size! We expected to spend all day here but we only spent a couple of hours. When we went there was also a few school trips going on and the kids with no parents present were quite rude! I would recommend the zoo to a friend, but I would warn them about the price etc first!

Convenient location. Plenty to see & do. Entertaining.. We were lucky to get glorious weather and spent hours wandering around. We still managed to miss a couple of things in the middle because we went around the edge. Spend a couple of euros on the map, it really helps.A lot of animals indoors - large aquarium, bird house, butterfly pavilion, forest house (lizards, monkeys etc.), reptile house, insectarium and gorilla house and more.Loads of animals outside too. All the usual ones you expect like giraffes, penguins, lemurs, elephants, vultures, monkeys etc.For a city centre zoo it is fairly large. There is a performing sea lion show and a Punch & Judy show (when do you ever see them now?) for the kids.One criticism: the single lion wasn't in a very natural environment though, poor soul.There is an additional educational attraction called Micropia which has an additional charge to visit (we didn't go there).Good day out.
Omg. Best zoo in the world. I cried when I saw the Sea Lions. It was absolutely amazing and I'm definitely visiting when I come back. It made the trip so great!

interesting. I'm always a bit sceptical about city zoos but you wouldn't know that the Artis is one! The enclosures are very well done for the animals and there was impressive range of animals, birds and insects to see. 100% would recommend!

Worth a visit. This is a lovely place to go, the majority is laid out really well. I loved the part which housed the different variety of small monkeys, they were so cute darting around the place and coming down to eat fruit which you could literally stand right next to and watch them. The lemurs were really cool too, they were roaming around free and were totally relaxed with the people walking around. It's a nice place to go as a couple or as a family with children. The only thing negative I would say is, I don't think they should have the bigger animals there... giraffes, zebras, lions. There on concrete and don't have much space to roam, same for the elephants. I would still visit this place and pay the same money if they did not have these animals there!
Good. Zoo is a good size with a range of animals. We spent a couple hours wondering and overall had a good time.

Excellent zoo in a great location. Really enjoyed our visit to Artis on a beautiful hot day in Amsterdam. Zoo was well laid out though I would recommend getting the map for €2 extra, much easier to find your way around. Lots of different animals, we particularly enjoyed the enclosure where bats, lizards and different types of monkeys were free roaming, you could get really close to them and it wasn't too crowded at all. The aquarium was also good. Easy to reach the zoo from the centre of Amsterdam, just a few stops on the tram. Everywhere was very clean and tidy and it was nice to see evidence that they are continually improving things, they are building a big new enclosure for the elephants at the moment which looks like it will be really good. Overall we really enjoyed our day here, one of the best zoos we have been to.

Much bigger than we thought!. Thinking it was near/in the city centre we thought that it would be smaller than other zoos we had already been to and would be there 2-3 hours but spent nearly 5 hours walking around and some things were missed - Only criticism would be that more information could be in English/second language, everything was in Dutch but maybe 1/3rd had a second language.Good range of animals which are well looked after, excellent activity for all.

Lovely zoo. Lovely zoo with plenty of animals to look at. Very nice day out with the other half.
Good photo opportunities and reasonably well priced good food.

Excellently mapped out. . Very spacious and well mapped. You feel like your in a park with garden walks and benches. The animals have lots of space and roaming areas. You are very close to the animals. It cost €20.50 to get in and was well worth it. We enjoyed 2/3 hours here. Catch the number 9 tram from central to get here. Very easily accessible
Well worth it!. Absolutely loved the zoo - so much to see but it's compact so you never feel you are walking too far. Great view of all the animals and not expensive at all!

Something unexpected in the heart of the a city. Artis Zoo was an absolutely brilliant place to wonder around. Lucky for us it was sunny and warm and the animals didn't seem to mind too much either. The collection of birds and reptiles was amazing as was the aquarium. The vultures were a particular highlight. Sitting having a beer whilst watching the giraffes and zebras was great too. It was not too busy that we had to queue for ages to get in and we were not fighting our way through the crowds to see anything. Definitely worth a visit and makes a change from museums and art.

WOW. Me and my partner love zoo's so this is something we were always going to do while in Amsterdam and it didn't disappoint great selection of animals many interactive things to do and the most beautiful butterfly experience a must for all ages

One of the best. A really beautiful zoo, the enclosures are good and it also has separate buildings for the aquarium, insect house, reptiles and birds. A lovely day out, definitely recommend this zoo.

One of the best zoos I have been too!. This zoo is amazing!! We arrived there around 4ish and it closed at 6 and we hadn't finished it yet!! It is so big with so many different animals to do. I loved the elephant enclosure the most as I haven't seen them in years!!! The zoo has many different interactive areas including a bird area where they roam free and you can walk around in it. They have a reptile zone, insectarium, aquarium, butterfly zone which are indoors. The animal enclosures vary from lions, to monkeys, to llamas and every single area is a sight to see because the animals are so different!
Nice small zoo . It's good for 2-3 hours walk around. There are some very good enclosures and would make a great family day out. The cafe next to the giraffes is really good.
Good climbing frame. There's a really good climbing frame and playground for kids. The monkeys are cute too. Possibly lacks origionality that other zoos hold.

Really feel close to a lot of the animals. The zoo is small and many enclosures compact, but the design is such that you feel very clues to many of the animals. You can walk in with the Lemurs and Wallabys. The chimps coats are in superb condition but I do feel very sad they don't seem to have an outside space. I wish they could extend the space for the a Elephants, Girraffes and Lions. These animals should be in Safari parks where they can run about.

Lovely day out. We visited the zoo today, and had a very happy and enjoyable day. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Especially in the restaurant, there was no problems, making different sandwiches up for my son and myself. The zoo was lovely, the animals all seemed happy, relaxed and had plenty of space. So many different animals, to many to list. The insect house, butterfly house, reptile house and aquarium where really interesting, and allowed you to get up closer to some of the worlds beautiful creatures. The zoo grounds were fantastic, I loved the Japanese garden.

Good zoo . We went on a Monday to the zoo and micropia just as we were looking for something to do. Its a good little zoo for the middle of Dam. Personally I'm south African from London so I can speak of good zoos and this doesn't quite match up. Enclosures are small and its a bit heart breaking seeing their elephant just stand there "dancing" non stop. The animals are pacing the fences and completely oblivious to humans. I know zoos aren't happy places for the animals in the first place but this seems a little less happy. The aquarium is cool though and micropia interesting

Nice zoo. Nothing special here.. A zoo. Animals seem to be well cared for. Some have habitats too small for their size in our opinion (lions). Food and drinks are very expensive so be smart and bring your own!This zoo is nice but definitely not a must at 20.5 euros. Tip: if you do choose to go, spend some shekels on a joint ticket and visit the adjacent Micropia. It is a zoo for bacterias. Very interesting concept and an inspiring implementation. I would recommend this place over the zoo. Mind it is not a big place and the whole thing takes an hour or so.

Well worth the money.. What an amazing time! Despite the gorgeous weather the aquarium (indoors) was a particular highlight with some beautiful corals etc. Worth combining with Micropia and making a full day of it. Good facilities and layout, well maintained and developed throughout: queues weren't outrageous and refreshment selection was delish! Happy animals (maybe with the exception of the elephants) and great variety.

Great day out! . My partner and I recently visited Artis and had a fantastic day out! Great with or without kids! The zoo is not the biggest however there are a fantastic range of animals to see including Chevrotains (Mouse Deer) which we had never seen before! The grounds are beautifully lush and well maintained; with plenty of shaded spots if you're visiting on a particularly hot day. The enclosures are well kept with plenty of enrichment for the animals. Particular highlights are the aquarium; which again has an excellent range of fish and marine life to see and the butterfly house. Some of the enclosures are interactive meaning that you can walk through them with the animals freely roaming around you. We loved walking through the Wallaby enclosure! There's a fantastic park area for children and places to eat; should you choose to take a picnic. Despite limited space, the zoo are currently building new enclosures and we would definitely visit again. I would definitely recommend walking if you're not too far away, there's some beautiful scenery along the way!

Good zoo. The zoo is good and after doing so much walking in the days leading up to the visit, it's good that you don't have to walk too far to encounter all the different animals. We paid extra for the micropia area but I personally didn't find it that interesting.
Wonderful!. Spent a lovely few hours here, lots of different species - elephant calf due to be born on October, had a lovely lunch from the cafe on site, a really wonderful place to visit!

I realized I am still a kid. I have not visited a zoo since ages. It was almost after two decades I was visiting one. And Artis was fun. The charges might be a bit higher for an average tourist and if you do not enjoy this kind of experience. But we had a lot of fun. I like the open structure of the place but it was a bit confusing and the markings were not up to date. The animals seem to be well cared for and the place is really fun. If you wish to let the child in you loose for the day this is a good option. It will take around 4 to 5 hours if you wish to watch and read all information.
😊. Lovely day out, lovely relaxed and intimate zoo environment. Would recommend for a day out and would return. To avoid the queues I'd recommend pre booking tickets online.

Excellent . I would highly recommend a visit to Artis zoo. We decided to visit despite some poor reviews and found it very enjoyable. You are able to walk amongst some of the animals that are just roaming free. There are all types of animals and the zoo is currently being given expanded so I am excited to return once it's completed.
Great day!. I had a really nice day there. There is a lot to see. It´s better to buy the tickets in advance in order to avoid the queue.

Artis zoo . Me and the misses went we thought paying for a map was a bit ridiculous so we didn't get one lol but in the end up we wished we had as we kept getting lost and to be fair the zoo was bigger than expected as it's in the city. All in all was quite a good experience and filled in quote a bit of time

Excellent . A very good place to visit with or without children. Elephants, lions, monkeys, .... Fish, butterflies and insects... They have them all.We had lots of fun there. You can bring your food and eat somewhere in the park or you can enjoy a decent meal in one of the restaurants or cafés.

Fab!. You wouldn't think you were in a city zoo! The setting is like a beautiful park land. There's so much to see you really need to spend the whole day. Book online first and you can skip the queue. The restaurants within are good value and they don't serve rubbish!

Expensive full price for teenage children. The zoo was a pleasant way to spend few hours and the aquarium was a highlight. However at €84 for a family of four this was the most expensive attraction we visited in Amsterdam.

A really nice zoo. Artis zoo is about a 15 min walk from dam square and it's well worth it. Nice place to spend a half day. Lots of animals to see and a really cool butterfly enclosure where you can walk through a rainforest and watch them fly by. Food at the cafe was good also. Nice gift shop and friendly staff

A must. This place is well worth a visit ,very good selection of animals ,but the best bit is this is bang in the city and once u start walking round ,u really do not feel u in a major city, think it was about 22 euros which was very reasonable.There is so much to do in dam ,but if u have half a day or so to play with ,pay it a visit
Brilliant. A lovely zoo that is well kept. The butterflies are so beautiful. We fell in love with the cute gorilla. Easily to get to on public transport.

Great day out . Great day out it is 21.50 into the zoo it's a decent zoo couple of places to eat a tourist centre, plaatirium a really good butterfly house a park for kids and seen two new enclosures being built and takes a good few hours to get around so money well spent! !

Take a look at this zoo even if you have a little time, it worth it. Even if it was a raining day we enjoyed our hour and a half through this zoo between glasshouses full of plants and animals and large lawn where animals stayedWell kept
Unplanned activity . Well worth the visit and would highly recommend. I have not visited a zoo for years and the was a great experience all round.

So much in such a busy city. . This zoo is insane, there are so many different things to look at and so much going on you forget that you're in the centre of Amsterdam. The best!
Go here, worth the money!
great find. What a find, when heard there was a zoo in Amsterdam wasn't sure what to expect but this place is a great place to spend a day.

Amazing! . If you love zoos as much as I do then your love this zoo! I wasn't even aware that there was a zoo until I got on the hop on hop off bus. As soon as I saw it I had to hop off and have a look around! The zoo is very big and has lots of different varieties too see! It did take us nearly 2 hours to complete but I do stop a lot to look and take pictures! I know the zoo may not be the reason most people go to Amsterdam but if your going and you fancy something to do then I do recommend this! It's not badly priced, it's good if your like that type of thing and it's just an overall fun experience

Much better (and longer) than we expected. Teenage kids thought this place might be "okay" so we took a tram and found the way in (at far western end). Thought 75 euros could be steep price to pay for not much but we were proved wrong, loads and loads to see and food/drink of a higher quality than expected. Too much to describe so why not go there yourself and find out!
Fun!. Lemurs and wallabies were my favorite! So much fun, saw so many animals! Maybe takes about 4 hours to walk around...maybe more?
Average Small Zoo. Average Small Zoo, well kept, clean. Great for little kids on a day visit. May not have enough to keep the attention of older children or teens for much more that a morning.
Great experience. Not a conventional zoo. I think they treat the animal's in this zoo with sensitivity and professionalism

Nice zoo, had a good time. We visited the Artis Zoo with a friend and enjoyed strolling around the zoo and catch up with our friend. The zoo is not very extensive or special, it is a nice little zoo and enjoyable with friends. If you have a chance visit the Micropia too.

Large and impressive zoo . Large and impressive zoo, easily accessible from the city. Had many varieties of animals and you will need all day to get around the whole thing! Only thing slightly unimpressed with was the aquarium... Still worth a visit though
Must see. Great attraction that you must visit. We had a lot of fun visiting all the different animals in the zoo.

Great Zoo!. I was traveling myself and decided to go and check out the Zoo. What a surprise! It´s a beautiful zoo and the people working there are passionate about what they do. You don't have to ask about anything they will come to you and show you where the animals are and tell you stories about them. Great service and beautiful animals! Tip: visit Micropia while you are around there.

One of the most gorgeous zoos I've ever seen.. This zoo was fantastic! It is part of a park (I think). The animal habitats were beautiful and well laid out. I was so excited by the wallaby exhibit because you could walk through it with the wallaby's. You weren't allow to approach them, but there they were just up close and personal. We must have hung out in that area taking photos and talking to the docent for 20-30 minutes. They had a large variety of animals that we don't get to see in many zoos. Their giant anteater was a treat for us to see, their lemurs were awesome and there were many other animals that we saw that were so interesting to see (but I can't remember the names of their species). For us, it was one of the most pleasant surprises of our trip. If you are a zoo lover, this is one that you shouldn't miss. They also had beautiful gardens and statues. It was simply beautiful.

Beautiful zoo, with many different and rare animals. The zoo is very big (it will take one day to visit), to do whith a good weather. Many rares animals (Lion, sealion, elephant etc..) and a great collection about butterflies, and a very beautiful aquarium.
Well worthwhile . It costs 20 euros each but we used our I am Amsterdam card. So much to see so allow at least 3 hours for the visit - good for a city zoo

Place of interest . Lovely small ZooAnimal enclosures for some could be bigger but then again not a large area ZooNice to see animals of which most enclosures are not restricted by wire fencing or glass - especially the LionsPlenty to see & do whilst there Lovely Butterfly House & one of best I've been inYou can get close up to and mingle with small wallabies & lemurs which is great for young children
The animals were super cute. Only spent 2 hours here but we had a really good time! The animals looked well looked after and healthy and we loved the wallaby enclosure as you can walk through the it!

Nice Little Zoo. It was a surprisingly good zoo. It was smaller than most of what ive been to, but this is definetly worth going to. Animals are well taken care off and there is even a little aquarium.

Brilliant range of animals . Great range of animals including: elephants, seals, chimps, lions and giraffes! One of the elephants is due to have a baby soon too! We spent the majority of the day here. Two negatives:Some of the enclosures are a bit small. It's sad to see lots of lions all cooped up. The main cafe (there are many) served my boyfriend a burger that was raw inside and refused him a refund! Take a packed lunch!

Artis Royal Zoo Lives Up to its name. This small zoo easily walked to from anywhere in Amsterdam is a gem. I did go stoned, so as able to really bond emotionally with the gorilla, ring tailed lemurs, and Lioness.Don't miss the aquarium, arguably one on the best on the planet.

Brilliant zoo. We visited on a weekday, which was probably best as I think it could get quite busy at a weekend.Relatively expensive to get in, and they charged for a map, which was disappointing. However, it made up for it with a wide range of attractions and animals to see. The enclosures are thoughtfully laid out so it doesn't feel like the animals are trapped, and they're all easy to observe.The highlight is probably the aquarium, which is huge and has a variety of types of fish. The planetarium was also a disappointment, since the chairs don't recline and the show was really more of a video shown on a large screen.Overall, an enjoyable day out and a worthwhile visit, especially so close to the centre of a city.
Beautiful Zoo. One of, if not the most interessting Zoo I've visited. It took me almost a whole day to visit.Beautiful old buildings and a bunch of animals.

Compact but lots of animals. My daughter was delighted with the variety of animals, especially the wolves as she's never seen them in-person before and they're her favourite animal. The sea lions were another highlight and personally I loved seeing the mountain goats bouncing up and down their little mountain. We got there for 10 ish and went straight in thanks to pre-booked tickets (recommended). It was gone 2 by the time we left although we probably could have stretched it out a bit longer. Restaurant was nice although my picky eater stuck to croissants.

Excellent zoo and day out. We had a brilliant day in Artis zoo. There is a huge selection of animals on display with excellent interactive walk through areas together you up close to the animals. A really impressive city zoo.

Wonderful attraction, something for everybody. Wether you just want to wander around in green and peaceful surroundings, learn about animals, or simply eat a good lunch while watching giraffes, this is the place to be. Family friendly, and with a strong emphasis on animal welfare and conservation, this is a very nice zoo. The focus on knowledge and science makes for an interesting visit, and the combination of the zoo, the aquarium and the planitarium ensures that there is something for everyone. Buy tickets at an agecy to skip the lines (no price difference).

Good combo of zoo, marine, reptiles. Located in the east side of Amsterdam (tram 9/14, will get You there quick enough). You wont find species you have not seen before, but its a nice variety and combo of typical zoo, with aquatic life, insects and reptiles, in a very nice park, lots of greenary arround. Prepare to walk quite a bit... And dont forget to visit micropia before (right next to the entrance - combined ticket will save you a couple of euro).

Superb zoo. This is one of if not the best zoo I've been too. I'll never forget being up close to a Sloth, monkeys and lemurs, they're loose in enclosures so you can take photos but are not allowed to feed or stroke for good reasons.The zoo is very well laid out, obviously all flat and easily accessible. We enjoyed the lions who were feeding and also watched people feeding the giraffes with bananas from their mouths! The aquarium is great, my only disappointment was not seeing the anteater and unfortunately the jaguar enclosure wasn't ready.Lastly there's a cafe on site which does a surprisingly good range of savoury and sweet snacks.

Butterflies house!. If you go there you must see the butterflies house! It's an incredible experience ♥ There are lots of animals out of fences so that you can get really close to them I really enjoyed this aspect!

A must see in Amsterdam . The initial plan was to go to Anne Frank house but it was way too busy, so we had to find an alternative to entertain 2 moody teenagers who find everything that doesn't involve a screen utterly uninteresting. Have been living in the Netherlands for 10 years and always avoided zoos as an attraction for family visits because I simply find them boring. I was blown away. It's not great it's outstanding, you can easily spend your day here - a couple of hours wasn't enough to see everything and even the moodiest teens will love it. I'll go back- definitely!
Amazing zoo!!. Absolutely amazing zoo and definitely worth a visit of you are in Amsterdam! Huge selection of animals and all really well cared for! Huge zoo and lots to see and do for everyone

Fantastic. Great day out. I'm not usually a great zoo fan but this one really does seem to give the animals the right homes. Indoor and outdoor sections in case the weather is poor.
Cafe is good too.

Extremely overpriced and disapointing. Positives: Butterfly room was beautiful. I liked that the animals were not in cages, we were able to get closer to them than any other zoo. The museum was a pleasant surprise also.Negatives: It cost 20 euro just to get in and then you have to pay an extra 3 euro for a map! If you want to go to the Microbe expedition, you had to pay extra. Many of the enclosures are tiny, I was shocked at just how little space the lions, elephants and giraffes had.The petting zoo had a few chickens and a goat.

had a great day with the kids. this zoo is huge, so clear a few hours for it. lots to see. the kids had a great time. they charge you 2 euro for a map. a little anoying after paying such high addmition... without it, the zoo is a little confusing..

Great fun. This is a very great and large museum , on the entry you're a little shocked with quiet pricey entrance. But for animal enthusiasts it's worth it. It is quiet big zoo with really fascinating exponents.However to my surprise what was advertised as part of the zoo the microbe place turned out to be totally separate and had to pay absolutely separate admission fee ... highly dissapointing, but it was all worth it ...
Standard zoo. Usual Range of animals and attractions. We loved the llamas!Not much to say really. Was something to do in the city with a small child. We all enjoyed it.

Best thing was the bathroom. This was really disappointing, the bathroom in the aquarium was the highlight. You could download a map but none were given with your ticket you had to buy that in addition. The children's farm area/petting zoo was a very sad area. I guess we were influenced by the petting area at Berlin Zoo which was great. This area had about 8 animals total, the gate was off its hinges and leaning against the entryway, you could not buy food pellets to feed them and they all seemed drowsy and as bored as we were. The snack wagons scattered about were pretty good. There was a definite lack of zoo keeper presence which again I was not used to and there was no play area for children as such. The zoo was not busy which was a plus but it left a lot to be desired. It just was lacklustre all around.

A great afternoon's meander round Artis Zoo. I find myself a surprisingly frequent animal park goer and wasn't expecting this city centre zoo to be half as good as it was. It's big given its location, it's got a wide variety of animals and, although it's difficult to tell, the animals look in very good condition and well cared for - there's nothing worse than paying for an overpriced ticket to watch some poor animal pace its enclosure. I really enjoyed myself and will recommend it. Avoid the shop it's very expensive!

A great zoo for all ages. I was pleasantly surprised at how much there was to see and do at the zoo. Loads of different species to see and plenty of walking to be done! Had a great afternoon even if it was trying to rain!

A good family day out . Overall a lovely zoo. Lots of interesting things along with the lovely animals. Animals are so close and not behind bars or grills which was great to see. Definitely good for a family.

Small, lovely, but overpriced. To make sure we all know what we're talking about: that zoo is SMALL. It's beautiful, I did like it, but I was really annoyed by the place the lions had. It was way too small. No other 'dangerous' animals, only those two lions, not even the elephants. As far as I liked the zoo in general, I don't think it's worth twenty euros per person.

A different day with a lot to see!. Artis Zoo is a relatively small zoo, but so well organized, and with a large collection of animals. There are several sections under roofs, and there are sections where you walk in open air. It rained a little bit when we were there, so we used that time to visit the animals in the roofed sections. There is a restaurant and souvenir shop on site. Visiting Artis Zoo really makes you forget you are in a busy city. We spent over 3 hours there. Enjoy!!!

LOVELY LITTLE ZOO - Small Enclosures! . We really enjoyed our trip to the zoo! A wide range of animals which seemed happy and generally had decent sized enclosures. However the lion enclosure was particularly small, having 4/5 lions together in a very small space leaving no space for them to roam around in. Other than that the zoo was extremely pleasant and enjoyable! Would go again for sure!

Best Zoo Worldwide. My husband and I have now visited this zoo with our children on two occasions. Having a young family, we have frequented zoo's in many places, including Edinburgh and Dublin. Amsterdam zoo is far superior to most. Worth every penny! Immaculately clean and well kept. Plenty to see and do. Lovely outdoor play park. Plenty of seated areas to picnic or rest. Indoor butterfly kingdom, insectarium and museums all fabulous. The on site aquarium is fantastic and access to all these is included in the entry fee. No additional or hidden costs. The area in which the zoo is situated has plenty of quaint coffee shops and gift shops to pass time when zoo trip is finished. Highly recommend this as a family day out! Would not leave Amsterdam without a visit!

A little Gem!. Lovely place to visit. Had some lovely food at the Two Cheetahs cafe. An amazing part was in the rainforest area. This was an enclosed area that you walked through and the animals were everywhere! You felt so close.There was also a bird section afterwards that had some lovely species that needed help in conservation. Great place for all ages. Free with I Amsterdam card but you still have to queue up!
Relaxing afternoon at the Zoo. We had a fantastic time here. Saw lots of animals, learned about them and relaxed while wondering around the place.

Amazing. Amazing collection really. I have been to several zoos arround europe but this one is one of the best. Some animals i've seen for the first time so that was awesome.P.S. GO WHEN IT IS SUNNY because all the animals hide when it's cold and raini :)
Loved the relaxed day I spent here. Beautiful place, lots of different animals, food, seats and toilets are found everywhere.Great place for small children, teens, parents and eldery!

Great day out. Lovely zoo surprisingly in the middle of Amsterdam. Nice open space for a walk around with lots of unique attractions. Took a couple of hours to visit. Would recommend it if you fancy a quieter day away from the centre.
Best Zoo We've Visited. Quick and easy entrance despite long queues. Lovely clean and large walkways leading to well signposted enclosures with well cared for animals.

Fantastic Zoo in the middle of the city centre. This locations is a Zoo, planetarium, 'insectarium', aquarium all in one. You can get up close to most of the animals. Some of them are free roaming. It's very clean and looks old but super well maintained. If you are a student and go during the school year bring your ID for a nice discount.

Beautiful Zoo/Park. If you like animals, this is worth the time. It's a relatively large zoo, plan on 3 hours to see all of it. The exhibits are well laid out, and there is an easy flow to make sure you don't miss any exhibits. -1 star for cost. If you plan on using the public transportation and seeing some of the other Museum's in Amsterdam, you might be better off getting the I Amsterdam card that at the time of this review included entry into the Artis Zoo.
Pleasant stroll. Good variety of animals and display areas.Nicely laid out And signposted.Easy to get to from Hop on Hop off bus or tram.

Old school Zoo. A surprisingly large zoo set in the centre of Amsterdam, easily accessible by tram and bus. Allow at least 3 hours for the trip, with a great range of animals all in decent size enclosures but not too large so you can't see the animals.Welfare facilities on the surface look good and the animals look well treated.

Really fun, expansive, open areas are exciting. We spent a day here with our 8 year old who loved it. Adults seemed to like it too ( I did). Really terrific aquarium. Some exhibits, like the lemurs, let the animals roam freely and in they walk up to you. A lot of nice food options so you can stay a while. A climbing playground. My son wanted to go back.

Excellent and open zoo. Excellent zoo with a good selection of animals. There were a lot of open enclosures where animals weren't behind cages (but were safely restricted!) and lots of areas you could walk through and be in with them so felt quite different to a lot of zoos we have visited. Highly recommended!

Enjoyable zoo with Butterfly house and great display of animals. I really enjoyed this zoo. The lines to get in weren't too long. The staff spoke excellent English. There is an aquarium and butterfly house which are worth seeing. There is a good variety of animals to see. Overall it was a fun experience and well worth the price which was about $20 USD for two people. There is a restaurant and bar located inside the zoo as well as a play area for children. I think this would be a great attraction for families visiting Amsterdam.

Wonderful Zoo. We were very impressed by this zoo. This is a zoo that's small in physical size, but big in variety and enjoyment. They have an amazing variety of species, and many artistic beautiful areas to explore and appreciate. The most wonderful part was that the animals seemed to be happy and well cared for. They were active, engaged, stimulated, and appeared relaxed and content. What better recommendation can a zoo have? (And it's free if you have an "I Amsterdam City Card" for tourists!)P.S. I realize there are some animal-lovers who hate cages and zoos in general (though they kennel their dogs, declaw their indoor cats, and keep their fish in aquariums). Don't forget that well-cared-for zoo animals get free food, free health care, complete safety, and have much better health and longer lifespans than their wild brethren. They have social companionship, guaranteed mates, and a large chance that their offspring will live to adulthood. Zoo animals act as ambassadors for all of the natural world. Seeing real wild animals educates and inspires children and adults to care for the environment, and protect natural habitats and endangered species. Sometimes the species conservation and breeding that is done is zoos is the only hope that endangered species have for survival, and perhaps eventual reintroduction to the wild. So a good zoo is an important and valuable thing.
Gorillas were a highlight. Unexpected highlight of the trip - animals clearly happy and well cared for. A wonderful chance to get up close to gorillas.

Go and bring your kids too.. Well worth the entering ticket. A two-hours long between open air and secured enclosures, where no animal is alone or misplaced. No feeding is avilable, which I think is good- idiots just can mix something in. Separate water life, lush forest and avian pavilions let you see various animals so close, you can actually pet a sloth if it lets you (not recommended, have you seen those claws?) Staff polite and helpful, paths are clean. Good explanation sheets avilable in english. The map is extra-charge, though.
Charming zoo. The zoo is very good. Among rare animals are red panda, wallaby, Lama, vicuña, Aldabra tortoise. I highly recommend to visit the zoo because it is interesting even for adults.

Very good zoo - well designed and well laid out. This is a lovely zoo. Once inside you forget you are in the middle of the city. It really is a tranquil place. That is until you hear the deafening sound of a crane lifting giant metal panels out the ground!! Necessary work for the new elephant enclosure they are planning but spoilt the experience as we sat to have a coffee.Nevertheless, there was a good variety of animals / birds to see. We also were lucky to see Rotterdams zoo which is bigger and offers a large aquarium with its speciies of shark / turtles / stingrays really does take number 1 spot in terms of zoos to visit in the netherlands. Nevertheless I would recommend Artis if you are in Amsterdam and can't get to Rotterdam.

Brilliant worth a trip . €24 to get in €2 for the map you can't go wrong!
