Loads of animals to look at and a very nice clean place to walk around, we found some of the enclosures a little bit small for the amount of animals in the area for example there was 5-6 lions in one area that was very small I think they had a door to another area behind the scenes but that was shut so they were stuck in the small area but they looked happy enough. The best part of the zoo for ourselves was the butterfly greenhouse! It was amazing to see so many beautiful butterfly flying around freely. We stopped at the lil cafe by the butterfly's and had hot dog and a beer then carried on exploring the main down side to the zoo was the planetarium - honestly they shouldn't advertise that they have it!!! It's hardly worth being there! So don't waste your time even looking! But the rest of the zoo was brilliant and worth the trip! We walked from dam square took us about 20mins would be a nice cycle and you can catch a tram there! We caught the tram back to dam square €2.90 to jump on and off for an hr we just did the one trip as it was nice to see different part of the city.

Great zoo - and great family day out. I visited this zoo with my 7 year old son and brother & sister in law whilst we were visiting from New Zealand. We really loved it because we got to see lots of animals that we have never seen before in New Zealand or Australia - including the gorillas, camels, reindeer, sloth, raccoons, wolves and monkeys. We loved the butterfly enclosure where you can see them all flying around very close to you. We had a very special day (took a picnic with us and ate in the middle of the zoo in their beautiful gardens). Would definitely recommend to families and animal lovers - you won't be disappointed.

Lovely zoo in excellent condition. Zoo is very well maintained. Two cheetahs lunch restaurant was excellent. Unfortunately gorillas were in their private rooms and didn't want to show up to visitor while we were there. Other animals, however, were very relaxed with visitors.

Family Holiday in Amsterdam . A good family day out, with a good variety of animals for all ages. Staff were friendly and we're good to pass on their knowledge of the animals. It was a zoo were you can get up close and touch or pets anything from the farm animals to the lizards.
Ok. This zoo is smaller than I expected, still a good day out but expected it to be a lot bigger. Ideal for kids as they tend to enjoy animals etc whatever the size of zoo.

Most open zoo I've been to!. The zoo was great. It felt very open, with the zoo opting to have animals wondering free as much as possible. There were few cages and fences, which really helped with it feeling like it wasn't a zoo. A great range of animals too, and not too spread out.The Planetarium was beautiful, although shows are only in Dutch with no translation available.The ticket price gains you entry to quite a few things in the area, so seemed great value for money. I used my I Amsterdam card for free entry.

One of the best zoos I've visited. Visited on a sunny Monday. Very short queue at the ticket office. First impression was that this was quite an expensive attraction - no family or student discounts; 80 euros for the 4 of us. However, once inside you realise that the price does reflect the quality of the experience. There is so much to see and do. We stayed for 5 hours and still didn't make it to the planetarium or aquarium! My daughters loved the butterfly house - a good attraction in its own right.Generally the animals seemed content and very well looked after. Most enclosures were fairly natural looking but also allowed visitors to get close to the animals. There's a new elephant enclosure being built which will give them a lot more room which is good. The only compound that I was not pleased to see was a sandy patch near the front of the zoo where camels, African cows, donkeys and reindeer were stood motionless in the sun. No grass and nothing to do. Difficult to think this was a suitable and enriching space for the reindeer in particular. Ok if it was just for an hour or two but they were there for the whole of our visit. Felt sorry for them. The only other thing that stopped this being a 5 star attraction was the lack of free drinking water for visitors. Making visitors rely on 3 euro bottles of water comes across as money grabbing.

The butterfly garden is fantastic!. I truly enjoyed the open layout of this zoo and the proximity to the animals. We've lived here for several years and recently went for the first time, I don't know why we waited so long! My favorite exhibits were the giraffes and the butterfly garden by far. It was magical.

Casually Fun Ejoyable Day with Friends. One of the first things I wanted to do when I visited another country for the first time was the zoo. It's a timeless classic and let's you see a different aspect of something that you're used to in your own part of the world. This is a very calming and enjoyable experience smack dab in the middle of a hustling and bustling people-packed city. My friends and I really made a day of it. We enjoyed seeing all of the animals, casually walking without all the main city tourists crowding the walk ways. The animals were in very good condition and you can tell that this zoo really takes care of everything from the animals, the building facilities, and even the landscape. I was throughly pleased. In fact, I have more pictures from the zoo then I do from the entire rest of my 10 day trip to Holland. We stopped for lunch at the café inside the zoo (right near the giraffe’s). It was quite windy so we opted to eat inside rather than outside. They had a great variety of food, snack, beverage and dessert options. The only thing I didn’t like about the restaurant was when my friend loaded our tray with condiments for his food and when we got to the cashier, they said there was a charge per packet. I told him he was crazy and to put them all back except for how many he actually needed. LOL Coincidentally, this is also where I fell in love with Curry Ketchup for the first time. We had an excellent lunch conversing and went back out to enjoy the second half of the zoo. There was really a lot to see here. More than I expected for hearing that it was a small zoo. Aside from the many cafes we visited in the city and the canal ride, (being a lover of animals) this was truly one of the highlights of my trip. If you have time, I recommend going during your trip. We went early to mid-morning and the crowd was just right. We stayed until about an hour or two before it closed. We also really enjoyed the butterfly enclosure. So much fun!

Great day out. Free in with iAmsterdam card, only spent 10 or 15 mins queuing. Spent 3 or 4 hours walking about, plenty to see. Bring a picnic, a blanket and a few drinks. In the centre is a gazebo where there was a band playing and loads of people lying about eating and drinking. There's a small kiosk selling beers and wine.
Awesome !. It was a really nice zoo. Animals seem to be well treated. The zoo is well located and workers are very friendly to customers.

A massive treat.. Having read a mix of reviews myself and my girlfriend decided to take the long walk to Artis zoo and where really pleased we did.The zoo is massive and has a really good mix of animals, although it is obvious that some of the exhibits are a bit long in the tooth, the animals were in fantastic condition and obviously well looked after.All information was in both Dutch and English and, like everywhere else we have visited on our 4 day break the staff were friendly and helpful.4 hours later we left elated at how close to the animals and playful they had been.Thoroughly recommended!
Good morning out. We have booked skip the line tickets, which I recommend. Great morning out, and the animals all looked well looked after. I would recommend anyone staying in Amsterdam for a holiday

Awesome Zoo. Won't have anything bad to say about this zoo, it was a great day out and a lovely lay out. Only issue I had was I felt that some of the animals could do with some more room and that is the only down.Can tell the animals are well looked after, over all really good day out and would definitely recommend the visit if your in Amsterdam!
Fantastic zoo. Amazing zoo with great animals set in a beautiful location. Staff really friendly and helpful. Wasn't too busy when we went.
A fun day out . Artis Zoo offers many animals to see. Its s big zoo so you could eaisly spend the whole day there. There are easy links via tram to the zoo

Amazing!. I can believe how big this zoo is! If you get the iAmsterdam card when travelling you get free entry to a lot of attractions and this is one of them. My local zoo is Colchester Zoo and I thought that was unbeatable as it goes for local zoo's. I didn't manage to walk around the whole thing as it was too much for me and would have taken at least half a day but overall it is extremely clean and the animals look well-looked after. The food they serve is also of a really good standard. If I was to go back to Amsterdam I would love to do a whole day here so I could see the whole place.
Great zoo. It was perfect and differnt species of animalss sea lion. Girraf. Elephant. Lion monkeys birds camels
Lovely zoo . This is a lovely zoo with a lot of birds and spacious enclosures. Easy to navigate however on weekends it is flooded with children and families so if traveling alone go during the week.

Our daughter loves it! And we too. Artis is a great zoo and worth the trip for both young and old.
The past years many new enclosures have been built so you can experience the wildlife in a more natural setting. For instance: walk amongst the lemurs and wallabies.

Excellent Zoo. I was very surprised by the size and the large number of animals in this zoo, making it a very enjoyable day out. As the zoo is so big, it is a whole day activity. This is a must visit for anyone who likes animals, due to the sheer range of species on show, some that i have never seen before!

Surprising and charming. I was not expecting much of a small inner city zoo like this and boy, was I surprised! It had everything nailed down to the last detail. The zoo map was beautifully made with clear illustrations (unfortunately no English but clear enough without) and zoo signs were bilingual so we could understand the main points of info on their various inhabitants. I was not anticipating the sheer range of animals they are looking after - from firm family favourites of big cats, monkeys, etc to my personal favourites (sloth, anteaters, tropical birds). The vulture section is fascinating - do not miss feeding time unless you are with small children as it is a bit gory! Small tots will enjoy the penguin feeding, though the guide will speak in Dutch unless you go to designated English showings. We unfortunately missed the planetarium showings. The zoo have designed their enclosures in such a way that allows the visitors to get as close to the animals as is safely possible without the use of bars. Very clever and really engaging. The cheetah self serve restaurant is a marvel - so many options and the food is top notch. Again, I was expecting simple fare and I came away having had some good wine and a burger cooked fresh in front of me with all the trimmings. My partner sampled some of their extensive pastry offerings. A fantastic lunch! All in all, a wonderful way to spend the whole of our last day in Amsterdam!
Nice zoo. We decide to visit this zoo even if weren't going there. It was worth it. Really nice place to see either with a family or with friends.

So Much To See!. We found this old zoo as we came off a tram looking for the brilliant Resistance Museum.We learned there were 750 types of animal to see along with a stunning aquarium and planetarium.The scary inhabitants like crocs,sharks,vultures have quite an impact but It was great to see giraffes,elephants,zebras,chimps,orangutans,camels and the lovable penguins like Edinburgh Zoo.In the summer there is music at the bandstand with local beer and a pizza.On this occasion we loved the tasty cafe at the end.

Best visit to a zoo I've ever had!. We visited on one of the special late opening Saturdays this summer, and were amazed! A well kept zoo, amazing atmosphere, beautiful animals (and a wide range of them too!) and friendly staff meant a really wonderful visit. The gardens were gorgeous and we only wish we'd had more time to see absolutely everything, and visit the planetarium. Those with I Amsterdam cards, be aware that once you've been to the zoo, you can't come back a different day just to visit the planetarium!
Great Day For The Family. Who doesn't like a zoo, especially when you've got kids? You can spend most of a day here and the kids will love it.

BEAUTIFUL, AMAZING, UNFORGETTABLE!. Like most zoo's you just assume they are all the same, BUT Artis Zoo was by far MORE than what i expected! Another one of my FAVOURITE attractions in Amsterdam and a MUST GO TO when visiting this beautiful city.
small but nice. small but very interesting zoo.you can spend a nice morning or afternoon at the Artis zoo.the animal are in the nature. easy access to disable people.

Defintely worth a visit!. The zoo was immaculate - great range of animals and they all looked so well after. We were surprised at how large the zoo was, given it is quite close to residential areas. Highly recommended - a great day out for all the family as there is so much to see. The Butterfly area had so many varieties. p.s. don't miss the Dutch Apple Pie at the café - it is gorgeous!

A lovely day out. . I am not sure about zoo's usually. I always feel sorry for the animals being cooped up in confined spaces but the animals at Artis were all kept in excellent conditions and looked as if they were being cared for really well. The zoo itself is very pretty and we spent approximately 5 hours walking around and looking at the animals and the gardens.
Fun............ . ..... morning spent here, much enjoyed by me and hubby. Loved the penguins most. I love to visit zoos wherever I am in the world.
Perfect Size. My 12 year old son and I loved this zoo. Lots of variety and appears to be well kept and animals appear to have good enclosures. Aquarium part was beautiful.

A great little Zoo with a touch of history in the museum. We was close enough to walk to the zoo and we paid about 20 euros each but we was there between 3-4 hours and could have stayed longer. Strangely the zoo was not well advertised we thought so our expectations were low but they have many animals and have converted an old building into something of a museum. The scenery and grounds are beautiful and kept well. I think you can get a better deal for families with young ones who would really love this day out. I noticed that there were groups of young ones with schools or clubs who really seemed to have fun here. Well worth a visit.
good . artist zoo is very good .we saw various type of animals hereit is very big some animals are very healthy we enjoyed and saw some new arrangement for comfortable visit.

Great Day to Play. This was a great highlight of our time in Amsterdam. The aquarium itself is worth seeing, and there are lots of great displays of all the other animals. A relatively small zoo, so it's not too hard to make it through all the exhibits and still have energy left to go out for the evening.

Loved it!. Especially the jungle enclosure with bats and sloths and little monkeys. The female chimpanzees were in heat which made their rear ends appear swollen and wounded. It was weird. It is a great zoo!

Beautiful. Most beautiful zoo I've ever been to. Big spacious enclosures for the animals, lovely lay out and a wide range of different species and animals to see. Very educational and best zoo I've ever been to to be honest

Stunning sights!. Nearly any animal you can think of is at this zoo, we were given a map and it took us almost 4 hours to go around the whole of the zoo but we did stop to take in the sights and enjoy the restaurants on the site. We also took an exciting trip to the micropia section of the zoo which was extra money but really interesting which covers all aspects of bacteria and you can enjoy collecting stamps on a card on the way round and looking at different bacteria through telescopes. It is very good fun for everyone.
Include the zoo on your next trip. Amazing animal viewing, beautiful historic buildings. Lovely landscape. If you're an animal lover this zoo is not to be missed.
Visitor friendly. Lovely zoo in the heart of Amsterdam. Pleasant to stroll around and the animals feel like they are in arms reach.
Amazing. Incredible Incredible Zoo! there is so much to see and could have kept us entertained for hours - would definitely visit again!
Amazing Zoo.. My Husband and I throughly enjoyed visiting Artis Zoo. Great display of a variety of animals. Would recommend buying a map, as the zoo is rather large.

great zoo!!. This is a great zoo, giraffes etc, really easy to walk to from downtown, nice place to sit and have a snack or a coffee as well. i would definitely recommend it especially if you ahve childern

A Massive Place That Takes a Full Day. So much to see and do here. I'm not normally a fan of captivity but this zoo does it well and the animals are clearly well looked after. There is a butterfly farm, aquarium, planetarium, monkey island and much, much more. My daughter loved it, We spent all day there and still didn't see everything. This attraction is a must and you won't be disappointed.

Brilliant. We visited on a summer Saturday night. Brilliant idea. The atmosphere was very relaxed and the whole evening was lovely. It wasn't too crowded. The location of the zoo is easy to get to and it was an escape from the city vibe.m

Artis Zoo is BEAUTIFUL!. BEAUTIFUL! This zoo is so lovely! The Gorillas and Chimps are very interactive, Giraffe and elephants also! We also had a good show from the Male lion and his lioness sun bathing. This zoo is a perfect day out for all ages!! Lots of beautiful sites! Will definitely visit again when we return to the beautiful Amsterdam. Staff are also very friendly and helpful!

Enjoyable. Visited the zoo quite late, arrived at around 1. We did also want to visit Micropia but ran out of time!I personally do not visit the zoo that regularly but the friends I was with wanted to visit, and I had a great day!The zoo had everything, including various houses (e.g. butterfly, aquarium, reptile), and each enclosure had multilingual descriptions so we could understand more about the animals.We took our own food and drink so unsure about prices. Gift shop was small but had a lot of choice, good prices on a lot of items as usually they are very expensive. Would recommend this attraction but you need a full day to see everything, especially if you also want to visit Micropia.
Typical, average zoo,. Quite small. Well organized and well maintained. Though, nothing unique here so not worth to go to Amsterdam to see a zoo

very clean habitats and lovely to visit. one of the best zoos ive visited and ive visited a lot of zoos its so clean here puts our london zoo to shame.the animals and setups are brill and the wolf enclosure has a bridge so the wolves run under you great for photos

A must do of you have children . A great day to spend the day with the family. .. expensive but you get every penny back!! This zoo has everything!!! We had a great dag och the climbing part for the kids was just amazing. . Meanwhile you could eat or have a cafe watching the giraffes ... absolutely lovely!

A great way to spend the day. Stayed here all day, kids loved it. Great variety of animals, really clean and well laid out. Great park and coffee shop area too and the gift shop is reasonably priced. Thoroughly enjoyed it.

Amazing time with the kids!. Our family visited the Artis Zoo in July 2016 during our four day stay in Amsterdam. Our daughters, 10 and 12, thoroughly enjoyed seeing all the animals -- many in large, more natural enclosures than cages -- and found the variety to be incredible. You can get there easily enough on public transportation but we chose to walk from Central Station (15 minutes), and it gave us a bit of great sightseeing along the way of canals, shops, and parks. Many of the information displays are in English as well as other languages, and the staff polite. Our favorites were the gorilla house and the most entertaining chimpanzee exhibit. Would definitely go again and it was a relaxing break from the hectic frenzy of the city.

Amazing!. Artis was a beautiful zoo, and I found the animals had better free range enclosures than many I have visited. Every morning of our stay we heard the animals from our hotel right next door and it was beautiful! The baby giraffe was wonderful and interacted with the crowd :) wonderful day out for my birthday! Would definitely visit again :)

Best Zoo in Europe. To be honest we only went to Artis because we ran out of things to do on our last day... and we couldn't believe how good it was! The chimps are hilarious! The zoo is actually huge, better than any zoo we have in England in terms of the huge variety of animals they have. Well worth a visit, whether you're a couple, friends or taking kids.

Good day out in nice weather . Zoo is easy to access by metro and tram, it's huge and has beautiful scenery. The botanical gardens are also very close. Great day out especially in nice weather and great for kids!
Not the best zoo I've been to.. Lovely location but I felt the enclosures are far too small for the animals, actually felt really uncomfortable for them.

Zoo Fun!. I always make my friends and family take me to a zoo any time we travel!This was a different zoo for me! I really enjoyed it! I felt like you could get closer to most of the animals and it was a nice break from the city. We rode our bikes to it! The price was great for all the attractions inside including the aquarium and insectarium! I really enjoyed this zoo. A penguin even brought a leaf to me! It was incredible!

BEAUTFUL ZOO! Bring bathers and a change of clothes - water play inside and outside the zoo. We really enjoyed our morning at the zoo. It was very pretty to walk around in. Did help that it was a beautiful sunny day. We come from Melbourne so we are pretty fussy about zoo's and this one was world class. The lemur island was fantastic - they walk around you. Some got in our pram and tried to eat our daughters packet of sultanas! You could easily take a picnic and eat on some of the grassed area. There was a playground that had water play so I wished I had bought a towel and bathers for my daughter. There was also another water play area immediately outside the exit of the zoo. We didn't find anywhere fantastic for lunch inside the zoo, but there was a nice ice-cream cart and a mini blini cart that were delicious. Cash only for those carts.

Good variety. Spent 3 hours at the zoo. Money well spent. The insectarium and the aquarium were very good. There are plenty of cafes and food outlets. The zoo is close to the city center so biking and walking is easy.

A nice break from the city. A nice break away from the city. Good value at 20.50 euro per head. Lovely lay out of the zoo, quite limited animals compared to other zoos and yes some of the enclosures are a bit small in my opinion but on the whole its a good little zoo.

Really nice zoo. My wife and I love going to zoos, and this one is certainly one that should be visited. It is really spacious, and there are some really neat exhibits and the animals were pretty active. The aquarium was excellent.
It's away from the downtown area, but with public transit, it's quite easily accessible.

One of the best zoos I've ever been too. All zoos have their caveats but this was by far the best I've been to. The range of exhibits and layout. The micro biology exhibition is worth it if you've got an iamsterdam pass. Giant tardigrades are awesome.

Small, beautiful, charming, fun and interesting.. The Artis zoo is over 100 years old and occupies its place in the centre of the city with an ease not usually afforded to Zoos in newer more contemporary cities. Many Amsterdammers enjoy all year round views of some rare and exotic creatures. If the spaces for the animals are smaller than some people would are nowadays happy with, there are no hard pens or concrete bunkers here, the beautifully maintained grounds and wonderful canopy of tall trees make a meandering journey through the zoo on a sunny day, seem like a stroll through the surrounds of Shangri-La! The arts & crafts designed buildings are beautiful in themselves and reflect the Amsterdam School, so worth a visit for anyone with an interest in architecture. Enjoy a meal overlooking a pool with elegant pink flamingos, the restaurant is way better then expected. The Zoo is also a natural history museum, with exhibits to keep children amused and interested all year round, wet or dry. The small size of the Zoo has other benefits too; Its thrilling to be close enough to feel the heat of a Giraffes breath! It's not a cheap family day out, but if you are able to come back, annual tickets are better value. My advice, go early and spend the whole day, get value from the tickets, you won't be disappointed.

SO MUCH. We LOVED this zoo. It has an aquarium, insectarium and planetarium built in with a huge range of animals. You can go in a butterfly house, a forest house where a SLOTH climbed right past me as it wasn't in a cage. Honestly this place is so so good. The food is reasonably priced and there's so many nice drinks and we sat eating lunch watching giraffes and zebras. SO GOOD. :)

A must while in Amsterdam.. A great place to wander about. Should also visit Verzetsmuseum - Dutch Resistance Museum and the Tropenmuseum all covered on the I Amsterdam card. Oosterpark and the Dappermarkt (great kebab) close to the Tropenmuseum.

Nice. Picked a lovely day to visit the zoo- having purchased the IAmsterdam card we got a lot of museums for free- including the zoo. Wouldn't have paid otherwise. The zoo was good- lots of animals and separate parts. The only thing I'd have to say is how badly signposted it is. We spent a good while looking for the elephants/giraffes etc. Like I said, as a big area would be nice to see it better signed

One of the best zoos, we have visited.. You must be ready to spend some time visiting this zoo for there is a aquarium, bird sanctuary, butterfly area, and many more animals from around the world. We have a wonderful day there. It was worth going to and we used our Museumpass as well.

A Day at Artis Zoo. I have visited this zoo a few times - it has a lot of open space for the little ones to run around - all the animals look healthy and well kept - there are talks at various times on the animals but these are in dutch - but this is well worth a visit if you want a relaxed day - plenty of areas for a picnic - as always at zoo's the restaurants are a little pricey.

Modern Zoo, love the giraffes. It isn't too busy here, I was here middle of summer and expected it to be busier, I was very glad it wasn't. Didn't get to see some of the animals as it was so hot. Really nice to walk around on a nice day, and relatively easy to get to.

Old and charming zoo. A relaxing place to visit. Inexpensive.We enjoyed our day strolling around. The grounds are easy to navigate and wheelchair friendly. It is an old zoo, but we knew that and it has great character that has held it's years well. The animals hve great surroundings and are clearly cared for. Will be nice to see the new elephant enclosure when it's finished.

Very pleasant experience.. First time at the zoo. Tons of birds, butterfly house, bugs, aquarium, and lions monkeys giraffes etc. It isn't the most comprehensive zoo just a nice place to spend a day. They try and put you close the the animals which I like. Wonder through the kangaroo pen or get up close to the birds and bats.

Giraffes were imaculately groomed. Best done as part of IAMSTERDAM card if you are concerned about cost , but not a place to be missed.Well laid out and takes a good half day, recommend have a picnic as the space lends it self very well to that Great staff.

Great zoo, with excellent extras too. The zoo itself has a great range of animals, along with engaging things for little ones to enjoy along the way. I also enjoyed the indoor parts which remind me of the Natural History museum in London, very educational. Also there's a planetarium - which is always a great place to go to high...
Excellent. This is definitely worth a visit if in Amsterdam on a nice sunny day. Lots of animals to see in nice surroundings. Walking about with the butterflies was the highlight for me
Modern city zoo. This zoo has a very modern feel to it. The animals appear to have adequate space. The zoo is clean and easy to navigate. My kids had a great time.

Nice zoo and very expensive. Zoo park is very beautiful and meaningful.Excellent to spend a few hours in it, especially if the weather is nice. Bad thing of zoo is expensive ticket.Normal ticket (10+) is 20,50 eur and for the children (3-9) is 17,00 eur.If you go with the family,this is a big cost.

A very good and calm atmosphere!. We were there in the afternoon on a weekday, and it was very quiet and Nice atmosphere. The animals did not seem to be disturbed by the visitors which I found very good. I have seen better and bigger and more modern zoos With more types of animals, but because of the great atmosphere I rate it as a very good zoo. There are a few eating Places in the zoo. During the day there are possibilities to see sealions and other animals beeing fed and get information about the animals.

Lovely zoo!. We really enjoyed the zoo and spent a good few hours there. We thought it was a bit expensive but there is lots to see and do!* The aquarium building itself was very interesting* Lovely cafés to get a bite to eat* Lots to see and lots of information about all of the animals* We loved the Microbes attraction (ticket can be bought along with the zoo ticket) very interesting and interactive!* Lovely little gift shop, bit pricey but I always like to take home a cuddly souvenir when we visit zoos We had a really nice day out, definitely worth a visit!

Great place to visit. Great day out at the zoo, my 16 year old enjoyed it too, well set out and so interesting, great place to spend a day for the whole family, can take your packed lunches, lots of seating and cafes available
Average Zoo. It is a good afternoon excursion for the children. It is not the most modern in teh way of how the animals are exhibited but there are enough interesting exhibits to keep children happy

Super! I love this ZOO. I feel good at this place. Animals in general free of cage, you can see them easily, make good photos, all around green and very well kept. Fantastic aquarium! And I really love the additional museum - micro life - all about viruses and micro organisms. So, better to plan a full day.

Rain kept our visit short. When we emerged from Micropia it looked like rain, so we took a quick walk around the animal exhibits and left. From what we saw, there were a lot of animals, some sharing spaces with other apparently compatible animals. the Dutch do outdoor activities even in the rain, but we adjourned to the new National Holocaust Museum around the corner.

Nice zoo. We enjoyed it for couple of hours with my 23 month and 8 years...
Easy to reach via the tram .
Clean with no smells.

Fun zoo - many animals not in cages. I'm a huge animal lover and am usually opposed to zoos, but most of the animals here were cage free, and healthy and happy. It was a nice treat, and fun to see so many animals. The zoo was wide spread and it was enjoyable to walk the grounds. We got there early, so it wasn't very crowded. Everything was very clean

Typical city zoo. I have been to a few European zoos and this one is good compared to some. It is very easy to walk around and plenty to see. I think there is probably too much packed into the space they have. I thought most of the animals looked happy enough and were interacting with people so not distressed as a lot of comments have been made. There were very small enclosures for some of the larger animals especially the lions, there wasn't enough space for them to run about or have there own space, 4 in a very small enclosures. The male lion appeared to be staring out at something for long time but now I guess he may have just been plain bored as little to occupy them.The overall zoo was very clean, facilities were very good for the visitors with plenty of places to eat or green area to sit with your own picnic. I'm not normally a fan of aquariums but thought this one was well worth the visit, the living corals were beautiful as we're the fish.The grounds and gardens were also well kept. Some of the smaller animals had plenty of space to run free and seemed very happy but I am unsure how they are going to establish big enough enclosures for the large animals. The entrance fee is about right for the zoo, we spent over 3 hours wandering about and didn't visit the reptiles house and some other areas.

Great zoo in the heart of Amsterdam.. The zoo is really central to most places in Amsterdam. Entry was reasonable. The zoo was spotless. The animals looked really healthy. There are some fantastic exhibits where the animals are free to wonder, like the sloth and lemur exhibits. Take you own food in and have a picnic on the lawns or gardens, or buy some there. There are new exhibits or the elephants and jaguars under construction which I would revisit to see. Very enjoyable. The map supplied isnt up to date so be aware if you are looking for a certain exhibit.
Worlds best zoo!. This zoo is excellent, much better than Edinburgh! The animals all look healthy and happy with lots of space and free to move. All the cafe's in it are nice as well.
nice. Nice medium-large size zoo. Contains a playground for children and a very beautiful flower garden. We didn't get to visit Micropia, which I think is part of the zoo.

Classic, modern, and don't forget the Aquarium!. This was the first zoo in Europe I have gone too, and I enjoyed the blend of a carryover as this zoo has transformed exhibits to wonderful living exhibits of habitat, yet retained some of the classic buildings from the zoos early days. The accents and the zoo themed building reliefs on the buildings are classic and are an enjoyment simply for the art of the craft.The zoo is extensive, hosting animals from all over the globe in an enjoyable grounds with wandering paths and well placed areas to rest, snack, and/or simply enjoy a spot for shared conversation or simply meditating on everything around you.The grounds also house an Victorian style aquarium done in the classic Greek style. The exhibits for the aquarium are not huge, though there is plenty to enjoy - about two hours. But do not fail to appreciate the building, its lines and shape, and classic craftsmanship that we seem so pressed to produce nowadays.Great day for family, kids, couple, alone, but I have always loved the zoo so admit my bias.

Unexpected great time. We had one extra day in Amsterdam. I didn't think I could handle one more walk through the shops with my teens. As I was browsing possible attractions I saw this delightful looking zoo. We decided to check it out. It was so different than an American zoo. It's one of the oldest zoos in Europe. The primate house and bird areas have no enclosures. The animals are right there. They come to look at you. It has an aquarium and multiple reasonable food choices. We stayed several hours. It's easily accessible from the tram.

Want to see an elephant????? . What a sad sad sad shame. I was distressed seeing this huge beautiful animal swaying repeatedly for hours because she was bored. These elephants had a poor enclosure, limited space. The zoo it's self was ok. It's a city zoo. So... expect to see just that. It's not a safari park. The cages were small. The sea lions tank was dirty. The apes appeared happy and relaxed. Hardly any staff on hand and limited information given to the public about the animals on display. It was a rainy Monday, few Schools visiting, nice experience but poor show for the animals. However, there was a huge renovation being developed which indicated more space for the poor lions which was welcoming.

Amazing clean well kept zoo great day out . Well this zoo was my favourite part of my trip it's so clean and tidy the staff are friendly and the most important thing the animals look happy. It's a huge zoo and had so many things to see! It took me 2.5 hours in total look at everything which was brilliant never got bored it's brilliant. You can take food and drink and sit on the grass if it's nice and have some lunch it's a great afternoon out and I would recommend anyone to go! It's 20.50 each for adult and 2 euros for a map worth getting. This is one of the best zoos I have ever been to!

Even the inhabitants love being here!. The most enjoyable aspect of Artis is the natural habitat provided for the inhabitants of this zoo. Outside enclosures include camels, ox, pelicans, lions, wolves, vultures, giraffes, zebra, emu, gazelles, penguins, primates, racoon and many many more animals, mainly very photographically accessible and looking very relaxed and comfortable in the reconstruction of their particular environment. Their are indoor pavilions where you can wander among birds, squirrels and lizards freely roaming in their beautifully recreated habitat, offering some dramatic photography opportunities. The watchful eye of staff in the unrestrained exhibits ensures that interaction remains safe and kid-friendly Staff are very qualified and responsive to questions. The aquarium building is architecturally impressive and the exhibits inside quite amazing. The light is very low and the echoing acoustics seemed to encourage some unnecessary noise making by the species on the viewing side of the glass.A half a day (without rain) is needed to cover Artis. With a pair of comfortable walking shoes you won't notice the time go by. You can take a break at the zoo cafe, De Twee Cheetahs, overlooking on one side a very picturesque stretch of the Amstel lined with old barges and, on the other side, an enclosure including zebra, emu and giraffe. The most rewarding part of the experience is the reassurance that the welfare of all the inhabitants is so obviously considered and supported with professional and specialised care.
Not just for kids. They have an aquarium here also. It's well worth seeing. The signs are a little confusing but you figure it out eventually. Good variety of animals.

Beautiful. Absolutely stunning you must visit! It was raining slightly when we visited post lunch at the restaurant next door, but we still enjoyed our experience, such a beautiful venue with so many fascinating creatures and they all had plenty of room to roam around, so glad we managed to visit.

Amazing. This zoo is amazing the lay out is beautiful and the information available about the animals is helpful. The zoo has a wide range of animals and the buildings they are in are beautiful and the aquarium is in a beautiful old building. Would say this is a must see when in Amsterdam

Enjoy one of the oldest zoos in Europe!. It is great for a half a day activity. I am not a big fan of going to the zoos but I still enjoy Artis whenever I visit. The butterfly garden is amazing and seeing giraffes and zebras with old Amsterdam buildings on back is very scenic. It is not too big so it is manageable to see everything in 2-3 hours.

Lovely day out for friends and family. Large Zoo, we walked around for hours. My friends and I really enjoyed the indoor area where a few monkeys, birds and lizards of various types can roam free. Great to see the animals enjoying their own environment as opposed to just being cadged. Some animals had more space than others but overall the feeling was that the animals were cared for. We stopped for a few bottles of water which were quite expensive so a tip would be to bring a packed lunch. Lovely day, friendly staff and a very nice environment.
Great zoo. Visited here with a friend. Very clean and spacious zoo. Great cafe and eats. Lots to see and walk around. Enjoyed it a lot.

So good!. Me and my boyfriend visited the zoo (and micropia) last weekend. It was very easy to get to although we walked from dam square without realising a tram stops right outside (get the tram!).We spent about 4/5 hours here and although it was drizzling most of the day we had a great time. This was the best activity we did in Amsterdam and highly recommend it to all! A new exhibition had opened that week where you can walk through an enclosure of wallabies/small kangaroos. The zoo was still testing this out and I thought it was great being able to get up close to the animals (although we didn't touch them). They were also in the process of building a jaguar enclosure which looked so good, we will definitely be back to see this next time we visit Amsterdam. There was a nice cafe right by the entrance and clean toilets, great for sheltering from the rain, fairly expensive but who cares.Overall a great day out for families, couples and friends.
very good. besides regular animals, there is a whole amazing section for butterflies, some choices to be in when it is rainy.

Zoo in a garden . The Artis Zoo is renovating constantly, it has a nice modern playground for kids near the restaurant, close to the giraffes. Stroll to the end of the park, see a lot and enjoy a lunch before you get back. A walk in Artis is like walking in a lush garden with animals. Quite a few cages allow access and the animals are really free roaming! Nice.

Very authentic zoo!!. Not too big but very authentic zoo. Normally it is open till 6, but in summer it is open till 10. Almost no bad smell as in every zoo, place is also like a big park. Garden with butterflies made me feel like in tale, they were flying all around us. 20.5 euro per person.

Excellent Zoo. Very well laid out. Neat mix of animals. You can eat with the giraffes lazing behind you. The kids loved this place and it took a lot longer than the 2 hours I had allotted to go through it.

Lovely zoo - plenty to see! . We bought our tickets from Tickets & Tours (situated throughout the city) for €19, €20.50 if you buy from the zoos website. We combined our tickets with a canal cruise, which cost €13, instead of €16.We arrived at the zoo around 1.30pm in the pouring rain, expecting it to be empty. There was no queue but there were plenty of other crazy people visiting in the rain. 1st stop was the zoo shop to buy ponchos €3.50 each (you can buy cheaper ones at the Van Gogh museum shop) or pay more in some of the souvenir shops in town (€5). The zoo itself is lovely, however, I did feel that some of the enclosures are very small, particularly the camels, lions, elephants & gorillas. We did enjoy our visit tho, and there are plenty of places that you can hide away from the rain - butterfly house, insectarium, planetarium, aquarium, monkey house, bird house & reptile house. The highlight for me was seeing the baby gorilla. We did not eat at the zoo, as the cafe attached to the butterfly house closed around 4pm, which was strange, as the zoo was open until 6pm. This was only one of the food places, not sure about the others. However, as most people had just enjoyed the Sea lion keeper talk & were sheltering here from the rain, it would have been good to have it open.Make sure that you get a map, we went directly to the person in the gate, as we already had our tickets, we weren't offered one & did miss seeing some of the animals.

Large Zoo with a lot of animals!!. This is my first time come to the zoo in Amsterdam, In the entrance you bought the ticket and i saw a lot of parents with ecstatic children everywhere. You can see a lot of animals. Birds, Reptile even butterfly. The only downside is you can't see all the animals in one day. Perfect to bring your children to this place.

Sad. While some aspects of the zoo were good like the grounds and the insectarium I was sickened by the enclosures. Visited with the iamsterdam card as I would not usually visit a zoo, and hoped this would have better conditions than most. The tigers enclosure was beyond disgusting , many were cramped and empty, and many animals like dears were walking up and down in boredom and distress.
Absolutely fantastic!. I felt like I was strolling through a national park, with every single animal imaginable from Elephants to Ants. Incredible experience, to say the least!
A real gem. Seeing the flamingos from the Tram every day... so we had to stop... what a wonderful place to see and experience.

Must do experience. There are zoos and then there is Artis Zoo! Fabulous and a must see. Some parts are under construction but it does not take away from the enjoyment. Just a great place to visit in a loverly area and only a few tram stops from the flower market.

Good day out. Artis Zoo is a good day out, It has lovely animals that you can tell are looked after very well. We fair enjoyed ourselves and the gift shop is decently priced. Finding your way around the zoo can be quite difficult so i advise to buy a map (the money goes towards the animals enclosures) It has a beautiful seating area within in surrounded by natural, its very nice. Recommended.
Okay. Its big, a lot of animals from different areas. But thats It. Personally i think Amsterdam have so much More interesting things to offer. :)
Best city zoo I've been to. Really great zoo, we ate breakfast overlooking the giraffes and zebras which was really nice. I would definitely recommend this zoo to anyone Visiting amsterdam

Lovely city zoo. This is a wonderful city zoo with many animals that it will be easy to see. Don't miss the active and amusing European marmots or the special exhibit of micro-organismal life just outside the gates, but part of the zoo.

Zoo!! . 10 min walk from out accommodation. Small queue! Enjoyed the visit but not the best zoo I've been too. Easily spend a long time there, we walked around in 3 hours (no kids). Insects, butterfly house and lots of birds to see. Gorilla didn't look very happy. Lion enclosure was too small. Penguin talk was later in the afternoon so we missed it. Overall a lively morning walk around.
Wonderful zoo. Schedule for a full day the visit in the zoo. The park is wonderful. A big variety of animals, wonderfully taken care, in good health. A very nice zoo in the middle of the city.

Worth visiting. Despite living in Manchester and having bigger zoos (eg. Chester Zoo) on my doorstep, I thoroughly enjoyed visiting the Artis Zoo. There's a wide range of animals and the zoo itself is beautifully set out and very clean. Definitely worth visiting if you're in Amsterdam.

Fun trip out for the day!. You'd easily spend hours here in the zoo. It's very large and theres lots to see here. Including its very own aquarium! The animals have lovely enclosures and there have some animals I've definitely never seen in other zoos I've been to. The ant eater was definitely one of my favourites! Their tank for the seals is awesome! Those seals are real show offs so definitely visit them. They'll put on a show for you!! We really enjoyed our visit here. We didn't feel the time pass and had to leave to make it dinner but definitely could have stayed even longer! We also visited Micropia which is located beside the Artis Zoo! (We had both the Zoo and Micropia included on our iAmsterdam Cards). Micropia is definitely another site you need to visit! Overall had a great time at the Artis Royal Park.

Really nice zoo. Great for a stumble about. Has giraffes, lions, gorillas etc. All the main animals you would expect to see. Really nicely laid out. Gardens beautifully maintained and no cages. Animals surrounded by water so feels as if you are closer than you are. Touched a giraffe!

A great day out for the whole family. Artis Zoo is located to the east of Amsterdam's CBD and requires a scenic walk depending on your proximity or a tram ride as an alternative.The grounds offer a huge array of wildlife ranging from African staples such as lions, giraffes and crocodiles through to hugely immersive butterfly enclosures and primate exhibits which allow you to get up and close to the animals. Food and drink are available for the family, and there are plenty of park benches available to eat on.If you wish to see the whole zoo, it takes roughly 4-6 hours dependant on the pace of your family. Standard entrance fees are as follows;Normal (10+) - €20,99Youth (3-9) - €17,00Infant (0-2) - FreeArtis Zoo is the perfect opportunity to change the pace of your trip for both adults and families alike and serves as a break from the sardine-packed nature of Amsterdam as well as an opportunity for budding photographers.
A wonderful amzaing place.. A wonderful amazing place if you enjoy visiting zoos like I do. They have the zoo, aquarium, planetarium all rolled into one.

Amazing! Full day out!. Spent about 5 hours here! Beautiful, open-plan zoo. So much to see and all so natural! Not too big either. There is plenty of indoor animals to see, handy if caught in the rain! As well as a huge aquarium and a planetarium. However, the planetarium shows were only Dutch.Highly highly recommend this!

Excellent zoo to have a good time with your kids. Artis is not only a zoo, it has a nice place ground and some ok restaurant. It is a very well organise place, you can enjoy the aquarium, it is full of small places to sit and enjoy with kids and adults.

Relatively Small but good Zoo. Even though this zoo is relatively small. The animals that it does have seem to be well taken care off. The butterfly garden is really good for children, but they also have a nice play yard in the back next to a Cafe were parents can drink some coffee and have a Snack. No Tigers, let alone Panda's, but there are Elephants and Giraffes.

Awesome experience. Must do when you are in Amsterdam with kids.. Artis is a small Zoo full of wonderful animals, atmosphere and that special amsterdam vibe.. Ps.. Don't forget to bring your picknick basket! Enjoy!

Fun for kids. Super nice Zoo for animals and kids, its very beautiful and clean, You can tell the animals are well care for and its a great place for children to learn about animals , birds and many more.

Fantastic day out.. Family trip to the zoo on a Saturday, arrived around 11am and walked straight in because I've bought tickets online otherwise have to queue for a bit. the zoo was clean and tidy, all animals seems as happy as they can be just like other zoos. would recommend.

better than expected!! More than just lions and zebras. Very interesting zoo, very nice park with lots of green, trees and flowerbeds. Most interesting birds. We loved baby gorilla that sucked on his mothers nipple it was such a relaxing and loving scene. Butterfly pavillion is a must!

Just woww!!. You think it might be small because it's located just a little out of centre, but it has literally all the animals you could want to see, it's definitely not small, it's very well priced, and worth it!! Definitely 100% go and see the animals, so easy to get to..bus or tram, you'll be amazed with the variety of animals and the freedom some of them have (for instance walking with certain ones) just go and check it out!!

Great to visit. They have free pull carts where one kid fits in. You have to have a two euro coin to unlock. But it will be returned when you lock it again.
There is one playground, which is quite new but not that big and crowded on sunny weekend days.
The animals are just great.
Don't forget to visit the butterfly garden!

Great zoo, even in the pouring rain. What a beautiful zoo, set in an area full of greenery which I am sure is a bonus in the sun. A great selection of animals large and small and everything in between. There is a beautiful butterfly house which must not be missed together with an interesting aquarium which almost doubles as a museum. All of the animals looked very well cared for as was the whole surroundings with lovely flower beds dotted about and loads of benches to sit and enjoy the animals. Undoubtedly, the highlight for me was the gorillas. It was a privilege to witness the tight family bond between them all and an added bonus was a five month old baby. The eating facilities are good and there is the obligatory shop. Definitely a must if you are visiting Amsterdam and you like animals.

Lovely historical city zoo . Lovely historical city zoo, with lions and other big cats, elephants, seals, beautiful aquaria etc. Lots of buildings are over a century old, but beautiful and in good shape.
Nice for a couple of hours. Nice to walk around and to have a drink. The caregivers give extra information at certain hours. Very obtainable with the tram.

Close encounters. Like most European zoos, the nearness to the animals is so different from most US zoos and a site to behold, This zoo was one of our favorites and if you have children traveling with you or you are just a child at heart, it is a must see.

Zoo experience. Was so greatful when i found out that this was free with the iamsterdam card. Lovely space. In London zoo i could never see the animals as it is always so busy but in this one i saw them clearly. Amazing experience however was concerned about the amount of poo within the animal cages.

overpriced. over 20 euros each to get in, then they want to charge you 2 euros for a map of the zoo! we didn't purchase the map and found it very difficult to get around, I think we saw one animal 4 times and never got to see half of them as we couldn't find them. The aquarium was good but definitely not worth 40 euros.

Amazing! A must in Amsterdam!. A beautiful zoo with many well cared animals! The way the zoo is made makes it easy to look and feel in contact with all animals even in not the best weather. I spent approximately 4 hours in the zoo to see every animal at a normal pace so you may take that into consideration in your plans. It's really easy to get here by tram and you can enter free with the I Amsterdam city card. You can buy a map, which I found pretty useful, for 10 euros which go to the caring of the animals. If you can, check Micropia!

Great Day Out . Had a great day at the zoo. It wasn't too far a walk from our hotel and we decided on our last day of our holiday to visit. It was easy to get around with the map that we were given at the start.

Excellent for all children (even for kids at heart). Excellent time for all our family- loved butterfly zoo, aquarium and flamingos. Penguins were adorable, we suggest to take some food with you- lot of places to rest.

Marvellous fun! . A lovely little zoo, so close to the centre and with a great selection of animals! Artis provided a great break from the hectic city centre scene! There is so much to see here! We spent hours wandering around. Great for families visiting the city!!

A small timemachine. Artis offers a nice variety of animals in old-fashioned cages to new parklands. It's a nice day out, away from the crowds. A place that is more a park with animals than a zoo. The aquarium is good, so it the museum, butterflyhouse and small mammals. It has enough playgrounds for the little ones and enough cafés and benches for the parents. Compared to other zoo's it may be a relic, but a nice relic which we cherish

Mixed feelings!. The Artis Zoo was nice, it was small and easy to get around, and the staff seemed great with the animals. However lots of the enclosures were far too small. Many of the Animals seemed miserable. It was a nice day out. But could do with being expanded in size.
Go there if you have the time! . This zoo is totally worth it. Great atmosphere, the trees surrounding the zoo make it a special experience.

A good zoo with 'happy ish animals '. I haven't been to a zoo for a very long time as I dislike wild animals being kept in small environments.However Amsterdam zoo wasn't too bad at all.The majority of animals seemed well cared for,relaxed and happy (with the exception of the Ostrich in with the giraffe who was visabley stressed).Some of the animals were pregnant too which is always a good sign of contentment.So happy to see the elephant enclosure being extended too hopefully it will be completed by the time the new 'baby'arrives :)My favourite part was the Lemur walk where these friendly little creatures were within touching distance,so nice to see them having fun and roaming free.All in all a good ish zoo:)

Some great exhibits. Free entry was included on our I Amsterdam City Cards. There are plenty of good animal exhibits but sadly a few that are in need some attention, but there is work being done so hopefully this will be addressed. The Lemur enclosure, which is actually an open space so you can get really close, and the aquarium are particularly special. cafe near the entrance serves great cake!

SMALL BUT PERFECTLY FORMED. PRICE You can get free entrance with an Iamsterdam card or 20.50 per adult (which isn't that bad!) FIRST IMPRESSIONA week earlier I had been to Berlin zoo which is pinned as one of the best in the world, unfortunately I didn't think that for many reasons. I thought this zoo was 1000000X better! The animals are clearly looked after with environments made especially for them, eg the forest and bird houses were unique as was the mountain goat exhibit. I can't wait to come back for the likes of jaguars! The layout was amazing and maps were simple. The aquarium is AMAZING, huge building and very interesting. FOOD AND TOILETSThere are only really two main eateries and they are lacking one in the lower end of the zoo, but all in all one can't complain because the food is healthy and scrumptious! Toilets are dotted about everywhere, so no fear! GIFTSHOP Was a little small and the customer service wasn't great with only one girl on till, with a queue of 10+, who didn't seem to have a clue what she was doing. That won't stop me from giving it 5*!

A full day out. There is plenty to keep you occupied for a whole day here. There are lots of different animals outdoors, plus a large aquarium and a butterfly house. There is also a children's playground. Money well spent.
Nice to walk around, peaceful. Good zoo, very pleasant to walk around and discover what animals are around the corner. Nice way to spend a couple of hours.

A nice day out with the kids. I am not a huge fan of Zoo's in general, this is one of the nicer ones I have been to. Clean and well maintained and thought out. The kids had a great day and we got to see a lot of animals. Enclosures were well kept and well laid out. Facilities were clean with enough spots to sit and rest and refreshments available in same vicinity. Parking isnt great and expensive, but its the same everywhere in Amsterdam.

It's a Gem!. We didn't plan to visit the zoo. We have been to many zoos around the world and thought the kids would be more keen in the science centre. However, we made our way there when we found out the Nemo was closed. After the visit, the family including the children agreed that it's a blessing in disguise as the zoo had many animals we have not seen before and we were able to get really close to them. Don't leave out the indoor sections as small animals move freely in them and very near you. The kids were delighted! Definitely a fun day out for the family in Amsterdam.

A Lot to See. ARTIS is more than just a zoo, there is an aquarium, planetarium and museum all in the one location. This is the oldest zoo in Europe, and is one with an amazing range of exhibits to see. The zoo covers a reasonable expanse, but can easily be seen in one day. The other attractions only add to the experience. Note that the planetarium in only in Dutch. There is also a nice restaurant to take a break, relax with a light meal or just some ice cream.

A good day out, but improvements for some animals necessary. Our second time visiting this zoo and the highlight is by far the aquarium, with stunning views and ceiling high tanks to enable the best viewing opportunity possible. There's a wide selection of animals at the zoo, it's a full day for a family and can be done in a few hours if you have a strict itinerary. Some of the animals were in cages or enclosures that were clearly too small for them and not well looked after. The zoo is making improvements to some enclosures e.g. elephants, which are much needed and I look forward to seeing them when we return to Amsterdam.

Great Day Out in beautiful surroundings. Wherever we go in the world we try to find a zoo. We picked a lovely warm sunny day to go round this one. It was very well laid out, landscaped with plenty of seating, toilets and refreshments. There was a great range of animals to see. We started in the forest house and it was great having monkeys leaping about over your head. Just remember not to stand still for too long!We covered the whole site in about 4 hours including a short break in a cafe overlooking the canal. If you have children aged about 11 or below there was a fabulous playground nearby that had water and sand as well as play equipment and they were all having a great time. There is a super aquarium and museum too. The planetarium was only doing shows in Dutch so we didn't go in there. A great family day out with something for everyone. The landscaping included vegetables which I was very impressed with being a keen gardner.

Best room for me so far!. Fantastic zoo, lots of open enclosures & the aquarium centre is amazing! Booked tickets online and got a great discount so make sure you shop about before going. Had a lovely sunny day when we visited and was perfect to walk around at our own pace and see everything. Think we where there 6 or 7 hours in the end :)
Nice zoo. Very nice zoo, the animals seem to have lost og space and healthy enviroment. Losts of animals to see. Nice food in the restaurant by the giraffes.

On a clear day. The visit to the artis Zoo should be planned on a clear preferably sunny day. There is a variety of animals and the most attractive are the gorillas and the Meerkats (so sweet). The place is very clean and great for children. The price is a bit high but affordable.

Love this Zoo. Every time I travel I try to get to the location's zoo. This is one of the better zoos that I have been to. The day we went, it was bright and sunny out. All of the animals were out and up close. They have an excellent assortment of animals to see. There is an aquarium and planetarium on sight. The planetarium shows that day were all in Dutch, so we didn't go in to watch. We did go to the aquarium. It was lovely and not too big.

Great zoo. I love animals and i adore going to the zoo. It was amazing and i wish we had the kids with us. It was very hot outside when we visited and the animals were also obviously pretty hot. You get a map with your ticket snd that was very helpful.
A. Really great day out. A little expensive but the aquirium was amazing and you can go into a green room with monkeys.

Nice Zoo, Great for Families. We made the trek to the zoo with our two year old. There were many animals and exhibits and the information provided was in English and Dutch. There were lots of play places for kids and great viewing site lines for the younger ones. I was hoping for a bit more interactive exhibits for kids. Note: the cost is quite high - 20.50€ per adult in June 2016. If you have kids I would definitely recommend making a trip to the zoo.

Lots to see. For €21 euros you get to see so much different species, it's great. Only problems was the size of some of the enclosures (especially lions and elephants) and the sea lion/penguin tank was filthy Other than that, it was an awesome day out!

Artis Zoo. I had a great time going to the zoo with my dad. We went to the royal zoo and also Micropia. Micropia is definitely a must if you're going to the Artis Zoo. The food at the small zoo cafe had good food and a nice selection of drinks. I recommend this Amsterdam attraction though it was a far walk from our hotel.
Good collection of Species. Good collection of flora and fauna in Artis Zoo. Some of the sections are under renovation/addition. Children would like it.

A great afternoon with family visitors. Although is was raining lightly we had a great afternoon. Several indoor displays such as the butterflies and the reptiles and the seals are very enjoyable. I have been wanting to do this for years and glad I finally did.
Loved the Artis Zoo! . We were so impressed with the amount of animals and exhibits that were represented in this zoo. Definitely one of the best zoos I have ever been to!

Great day out. We were 5 adults going round the zoo and it was still a very lovely day out. The weather wasn't great but there were indoor bits where people can take shade. It is a well-kept and well-maintained zoo. I'm sure kids will thoroughly enjoy this place. Very convenient to get to.

Awesome, can't wait to go again. We only had 3 days in Amsterdam and going to the zoo was one of the best things we did, value for money is great, all the animals look healthy which was a massive concern as I'd heard bad thing about zoos in mainland Europe and the fact they have a mini aquarium as well sealed the deal for me :)So easy to get too and we were so close I the giraffes you could feed them if you wanted (not that we did), food and drink is expensive but that's to be expected so I would suggest taking your own, there's loads of places to sit and have a picnic!
Excellent day out. Went there in may 2015 had a brilliant time was going to go back in feb but was way to cold big zoo considering its in the middle of a major european city
Lovely big zoo. We loved the zoo it was a good price around €43 for 2 with a guide. Very big to walk around all sign posted. Lovely eating places inside

Fabulous day out!. The zoo and aquarium were a fantastic addition to our holiday. Big enclosures and great views of the animals with plenty of walk-through areas as well. Quite expensive, however I recommend the Iamsterdam card to get in for free! :)

So close to animals . This has to be one of the best zoos I have ever been to. I particularly enjoyed the exhibit where the animals are freely walking and climbing around. I could not believe that a sloth was millimetres away from me and that a monkey was situated right beside me. Well worth the visit.

Wow! Great Zoo!. We have been to zoos around the world, and this was one of the better zoos. We saw several animals we had never seen before (and it has been years since that happened), and most were well cared for.The elephant enclosure is currently (June 2016) being massively expanded, and looks like it will be a much better environment. Right now, they are in a more typical smallish zoo enclosure.Excellent areas for children to explore, and the place was overrun by kids clearly enjoying themselves.

Cute Day Out. Leaving on a Sunday evening in April, me and my friend thought we would go and spend the day at the Zoo would be cute. Considering my friend is a student and we made a budget for the weekend, it wasnt too bad, but a little bit expensive.But - you can see where the money goes.The grounds are so clean! So well maintained! Really refreshing to see considering we live in London and witness nothing of the sort.The butterfly house was really fun - although my friend freaked out!You have to pay for a map, which I think is ridiculous.They didnt have any "talks" or "feeding times" like Colechester or London Zoo, but it was still an enjoyable experience in the sunshine.They had an Aquarium and a good number of various animals, even wolves which we loved!!I would recommend simply because its nice to get away from the Red Light District and stroll around and make a day of it.
A LITTLE BIT EXPENSIVE. Place is good, but they don´t have so much animals so is so expensive for what they offer. I had gone to other zoos and this is really basic and the most expensive.

Brilliant Zoo. Spent a good 4 hours or so looking around the zoo. Alot of different species of animals and spread out nicely. Worth a visit if you ste im the area. Also a nice cafe opposite the entrance that do lovely croissants and smoothies if you fancy a nice breakfast before the zoo.

Brilliant brilliant brilliant. Probably the best zoo we've ever been in. 92 euro for 2 adults, three kids under 10 and a baby so not cheap. Worth every penny! Animal enclosures really natural and animal friendly. Visit if in Amsterdam with kids.
Meh. The Zoo was a nice day out, but a lot of the enclosures were far too small for the animals. Also very overpriced. Not sure if I'd recommend going!

A nice way to spend a morning. This is a lovely old zoo and botanical garden laid out in a park if you have kids they will love it also has some play areas for young ones. Aquarium and the butterfly house were my favourites.

Beautiful Zoo. It is only roughly 15 minutes from Dam Square by tram. Stops right outside the entrance of the zoo. Reasonably priced and it is a big area with a lot to offer. Lion enclosure was a highlight for me seeing such beautiful animals from up close. Spent almost 3 hours there with plenty to see. The area outside is lovely with plenty of restaurants and cafes surrounding the zoo to go to before heading back into the city!
Wonderful. Love this place. Best to visit later in the day when there are less people. We almost have some places for ourselves. My kid had the best time.

City Break . Spent an afternoon here and was impressed with the place, it is a small zoo compared with Chester zoo however that does mean that unfortunately the animals do not have as much room to run around, Looking at the animals it does seem that they have enough though as they look well looked after, this also means that you can get closer to them which is great for photos. If you like zoos the this is a must.
Great day out. Large zoo with half decent sized enclosures however the animals seem happy enough, would reccomend visiting.
Loved it. This was awesome, you are so close to the lions it's crazy. Lots of animals and entry was reasonably priced. Couple pics attached.

Brilliant - great landscaping. This is a fabulous attraction. The layout was very attractive and allowed good views of the animals who all seemed to have enclosures that met their needs - with the sad exception of the elephants although there is a new large. landscaped enclosure underway. There was an opportunity in one indoor space to come face to face with some of the monkeys, newts and other small animals. The café served a good range of food which looked wholesome and well cooked. It was a fun start to our holiday in The Netherlands and was enjoyed by the whole party.
Great afternoon . Lovely zoo! We wondered round on a Sunday day, huge variety of animals and you can get closer than you can at UK zoo's! Probably took us a couple of hours to fully explore :)
Small and old. Not worth it. If you want to see a zoo in the Netherlands visit the one in Rotterdam. Artis is very pricey and the animal cages are too small.

Must see!!. Such a great zoo, probably one of the best zoo's I've been to. Loads of animals to see which is amazing but make sure you rest the day before you do this, after 5 hours of walking around it can get a bit tiring haha. Me and my girlfriend got some amazing photos, I was a but disappointed in the lions as they were pretty much asleep the whole time we were there and they were the ones we were looking forward to seeing the most. Overall though it was brilliant!!

Nice. Clean tidy and nice place. Our little princess liked it a lot. Maybe the shop can be improved a little. Generally the gardens and the trees are great and well kept. After the arrival of the leopard we may visit again.
You must visit this Zoo!. Just loved this zoo! Saw so many different species I had no idea existed, it was a great experience.
Very good day out. Best zoo I have ever been to, very large with a lot of variety - bring your walking shoes, it is easily a whole day out. Great for wearing children out
I LOVE ANIMALS. I love animals which is why I wanted to visit the zoo. So many animals and I had a great time. So much to do and see as well as being at a reasonable price, would definitely go back

So much to see . I've been visiting artis since I was born every time I've visited amsterdam, and it never fails to disappoint. The lemur walk through was our favourite part, where you can get very close to the lemurs (not allowed to touch them though!) The butterfly house is gorgeous, feels like you're in a jungle dream. Glad to see that the elephant enclosure is finally being made bigger, would like to see the big cat enclosure made a little bigger though.

Good over all zoo. Some parts of the zoo I though are great, like the open rooms that the birds and small monkeys had access to fly and wander around together in. But there was some that had what I feel to small enclosures or needed to be well cleaned. Most of the animals seemed to be content though so that is what is truly important.

Family visit. Visited as part of our city break to Amsterdam with a nearly 7 year old. For a small zoo they have packed a lot in so there is plenty to see so a visit here can easily occupy a half day of anyone's schedule. Only 2 criticisms: 1. some of the information boards are lacking in English explanations; 2. I'm no expert but the Lion enclosure did seem rather small. Other than that a good visit and enjoyable for all with a good variety of animals to see and learn about.
Excellent place to visit. Nice zoo Spent a a good few hours here. Excellent little gem.All sorts animals to look at well worth a visit.a little expensive

What an enjoyable zoo for the kids and even for the oldies to enjoy. Arrived just after opening, with entry included in an iAmsterdam Pass. Spent hours wandering around, looking at some animals we had never seen before. Lots of families with children also enjoying the warmish spring day. Definitely not a place to miss visiting. The cafe inside the zoo is modern with plenty of seating inside and out.
Great Day Out!. Fantastic day trip and there was some interesting exhibits. Whilst the aquarium wasn't for me, I'd recommend the walk through animal houses. Amazing

Lovely place in the city . I love zoos they are always a lot of fun. They have a lot of animals and they have a great indoor aquarium type section. Lots of lovely plants and flowers etc. However I gave it 4 stars because it's pretty expensive.. But as far as I know Mon-Fri is cheaper! And also because there were 2 or 3 animal groups that just didn't have a lot of space. The lions in particular looked way too cramped.. For animals that are supposed to be the Kings of the jungle ... It was kind of sad to see.. But I guess that's hard to see in all zoos! Highlight for sure was the butterfly place. It was like being in the jungle or something, it was so warm and butterflies were everywhere, it was really great.

Most memorable zoo in my life. It's definitely worth visiting especially if you're coming with children. A lot to sea. I admired mostly the lions, giraffes and seals. Of course, I was impressed by the crocodile, turtles and butterflies' garden. You can visit Micro-pea world right next to it as well if you're not tired after a long walk around the zoo.
On my way to Uganda. Near to city, a little bit old-stylish, but that is benefit. Very good for adults and not to scientific, hagenbeck-rules. Insects very nice

Awesome. Though I would have wanted to see more animals.. the entire thick forest like zoo seems to have been setup by putting the freedom of animals more preference.
Felt like animals r given care and are well maintained. Expect to enjoy lions ,seals,penguins, exotic birds,giraffe

Classic zoo in the city . The zoo is surprisingly big and has many animals. Some of the enclosures are too small, especially the lions have too little space to live in my opinion. The savannah area is nice.

A great day out. I've been to a large number of zoos, I would have to say Artis Zoo would rank highly on my list. The zoo is well laid out and has many indoor exhibits, the jungle house is a particular highlight with monkeys and birds free roaming around you. The zoo has invested in many new exhibits recently, with elephant and jaguar enclosures currently being built. A good place to escape from the busy city.
Beautifull zoo. It's an enormes zoo that containes a big variety of animals. They have here from cocodiles to elephants and sharks. They also have a beautifull chamber filled with live butterflies
Lovely place. Go to butterfly room,which is unbelievable . This zoo offer many attractions. For example it has planetarium where the shows are very hour.

A different thing to do in Amsterdam . I enjoyed my time in the zoo! They have many exotic animals which was nice to see, however I don't think €20.50 was worth it, too expensive. But overall we had a good day here! Loved the butterfly house!

Zoo close to the city centre. The Artis Royal Zoo is located a short tram ride away from Central Station or Dam Square. Entry cost is €20.50 for an adult, plus an additional €2.00 if you want a paper map of the zoo’s layout.The zoo is a small one, but easy to walk around on the well-maintained paths. The garden beds at the time of my visit were filled with lovely Spring flowers.From a landscaping point of view some of the exhibits were a bit ordinary. For example the first exhibit a visitor sees consists of Bactrian Camels, a couple of Watusi cattle, a solitary Reindeer and some donkeys all standing rather forlornly on sandy-looking bare earth. There were, however, some great surprises: South American Giant Anteaters and the seldom seen Grévy’s Zebra were just two of these.The best exhibits, however, are those kept behind glass, probably as much for their own protection as that as that of their badly-behaved human onlookers. I witnessed several kids banging on the glass while their parents gazed at them indulgently. Meanwhile, outside, other kids were ripping leaves off a camellia and then standing on a fence throwing them at a group of Sulawesi Crested Macaques. Their parents did nothing to prevent this behavior.The best part of the glassed exhibits included the Gorilla family, the excellent aquarium, the reptile house and the small animal exhibit.The Butterfly house was really good, consisting of hundreds of free-flying butterflies in a humid, tropical atmosphere with plenty of warm climate plants. It was a significant challenge to capture photos of the butterflies as they were flying, rather than resting, the majority of the time.Although I didn’t use any of them there were half a dozen food outlets at the zoo. They seemed to be well patronized.The entry price was rather steep, but I enjoyed my zoo visit and would recommend it.

Good for children. There is nothing to say about a zoo. Only thing is that they have an interesting butterflies section where you can look at them around you. Feeding the animals is not allowed,let because they have a special diet. If the zoo sold food so children could feed the animals, it would solve that issue.

Excellent place for specially children.. I have visited a lot of Zoo's but never seen like this one. It is not like a zoo it is like a safari at wild. You are with butterflies and monkeys around you, excellent place, strongly suggested.
