Nice zoo. This is a nice zoo. Wasn't crowded either. There is a wonderful bird rainforest sanctuary. Plenty of animals with nice habitats. We spent a few hours here.

Great zoo!. This is an unexpected pleasure in the heart of Amsterdam. I found the exhibition of 'fish to be found in the Amsterdam canals' to be the most interesting part, having spent several days floating around in canal boats.

Great Zoo... Take Water. Zoo was great and looked like they are trying to improve bits and give animals larger enclosures. Butterfly bit was amazing. I would advice to take plenty of water as a small bottle is 3Euro with no where to fill up.

Great zoo in most parts, depressing in others.... Me and my partner had a fantastic time at this zoo, the lemurs were definitely a highlight and we're glad the elephants are getting a new enclosure! The lions enclosure looked very small for creatures that love to hunt and roam, very grey and slightly depressing. Also the bird cages seemed small and sad to see. Hopefully the more money this zoo makes the better quality of life for the animals it contains - it is a very good zoo and you feel very involved with some of the exhibits you're able to walk through! Hopefully the enclosures mentioned will have improved by our next visit :)
Lovely. It's a simply lovely zoo. The reptile house & aquarium were great, the only downside to the zoo is that it's a little small compared to others I've been to. Definitely a fun day out though!

Is in need for some enhancements. I find the location of this Zoo really nice. It's in the middle of the centre of Amsterdam, in the middle of the chaos, in the middle of all the traffic and noises, and yet... When you enter the zoo, you won't notice any of it. Except for when you reach the savannah, which looks over some houses. Pretty amazing for the people living there. Who can actually say they have a zebra in their backyard? The parc itself is OK, nothing special, looking like a average Zoo. Although they have a pretty cool theatre featuring a movie about the planet. And a exhibition called: Micropia. The animal cages could use some enhancements, especially the cages from the cat-type animals. I don't know the correct word for that. Also the snake aquarium is pretty sad. As if a snake is always rolled up like that. It needs space, and a lot of it. Wake up, Amsterdam Artis. The food and drinks (think of fries, sandwiches, fried snacks) are a bit expensive, comparable to most of the touristic places in Amsterdam. So better bring your lunch package with you.

Many animals. . This zoo it pretty good among most. Animals have plenty of space for visitor viewing and for the animals own privacy. The gardens are amazing especially the butterfly house and insect. Diverse range of creatures.
nice zoo, good location. Great zoo to visit on an sunny afternoon in amsterdam.Nice variety of animals, very clean.Pretty small zoo though, an no "themes", all seemed very samey.

Must see. The entrance is around 20EUR for adults but you get in for free if you have the iamsterdam card. The zoo is very big hosting a large variety of animals. There are nice green areas to take a break(even a japanese garden) and naturally cafes and a couple of restaurants. The animals seem to be well kept and the zoo is well maintained. It also includes an aquarium. One can buy a map to navigate through the zoo for 2EUR.

A must see in Amsterdam!. Quite pricey to get in if you don't have the Amsterdam card but defiantly worth it. Wide array of animals and wildlife to be scene and beautiful scenery also. There is a large restaurant which had a good choice of food and drink available. You would spend hours walking around and not even notice it!
Cozy zoo. I recommend a map since the small walkways and parks can get rather confusing. We almost missed the lamas 😳 plan a visit to micropia on the same day. It's the best!

Great place to visit.. This place was absolutely amazing. Had something for everybody. One of the few things in Amsterdam with a reasonable price for what you get. Spent hours walking around making sure we hadn't missed anything. Really easy to get to from anywhere in the city. Would highly recommend.

Better for families than couples. My partner and I visited Amsterdam Zoo on a chilly afternoon in May 2016. It can be easily accessed by tram, jump on the number 9 from outside the Central Station and jump off at Artis. It's 20.50 Euros per adult, plus 2 Euros a map [just download onto your phone instead].We've visited many zoos and I'd say this is deceptively larger than others, especially considering its city centre location. You could circuit it in 3 hours, or take all day as there is lots to see. The exhibits closest to the entrance were packed with groups of children. We were surrounded by very noisy uncontrolled kids, pushing past us to get a view of seemingly anything we looked at. They then lost interest very quickly, as such were their teachers who thought nothing of their pupils picking sand out of the drain! I see other reviewers had a similar experience.It quietened later and we took a leisurely stroll around the aquarium, large and small mammals, insects, birds... There's something lacking though, there's no energy, maybe down to minimal staff presence. We couldn't put our finger on it!?What's strange is some of the enclosures are lovingly made and the animals seem content. Then in other areas, enclosures looked shabby with no imagination e.g. the seals were contained in an old bowl-like pool. The gorillas were extremely active at feeding time. The silverback is huge, but seemed distressed, running around and skidding in the indoor enclosure. The younger ones were beating their chests and bashing the windows. Perhaps this is normal, but it saddened me!In summary, families with kids will love the huge play area and may see through the dullness of some enclosures. I'm pleased to tick it off my list. But won't be returning anytime soon.
Great place. My first visit to Amsterdam we brought the I love Amsterdam card which gave us free access to this zoo. Well worth a visit great day out for everyone.
zoo. We as a family with kids need to visit the zoo cos was a great chance for making nice pictures with animals and for kids was wonderful experience

a-a-amazing. The Zoo was 15 minutes away from Dam Square on the tram. It was well worth the short travel time as it was an amazing afternoon. The zoo is clean and well kept with a range of animals that look extremely happy.

Animals everywhere.. Even though it was raining when we went, there were a lot of animals. It was awesome. It was also nice when people are able to go to the actual habitat, and observe animals. Some animals may come right next to you. Very awesome.

Great day Out. Such a pretty zoo ..very large too got lost a couple of times hahaWide variety of animals took us a while to go see everything then we stopped for lunch in the zoos cafe wich was nice and relaxed inside, food was average tho

Nice to spend a whole day. We spent 9 hours in this Zoo. It is spacious, with lot of different animals, that are treated very well. There is also a tropical garden, where we were surrounded by a lot of different butterflies flying around us.

Well kept creatures. We visited on a rather damp morning, but there was plenty to keep us occupied. The animals looked well-cared for with play opportunities and scope for natural behaviour, though the penguins were having a water change and clean out in their enclosure and looked a bit indignant. There were places to duck into to keep dry. An enjoyable couple of hours, and free with the Amsterdam card.

Genuine review of artis zoo!. Visited artis zoo on a sunny afternoon in earley September and what can I say apart from wow!I currently live 1 mile from the number 1 zoo in the uk and have family who work there so I visit regularly and Dident think anything could compare to it but I was wrong!Artis zoo is absaloutly fantastic The lay out is brilliant the selection of animals is brilliant the enclosures are brilliant!1000% worth a visit for young or old!Don't forget to check out the white building on the left of the zoo where you step inside the enclosure with a range of monkeys sloths and lizards all running freeYou can get real close to them and get some real good photos!Definately visit again!!!

Underwhelming zoo, spoilt by uncontrolled children. We went on a Friday in April and had been really looking forward to going. Having seen other reviews and talk of the size of the zoo I'd say we were both rather underwhelmed by it all. The zoo itself is indeed of a good size and has a decent layout with animals in large enough and interesting enclosures. The animals were varied enough and the aquarium was not at all bad as part of a zoo. However, there wasn't any 'wow' factor of anything unique and different from so many other zoos we've been to. There was some mention of conservation but nothing significant enough for my liking. We also resented having to pay extra for a map of the zoo, so instead just downloaded a map from their own websiteWhat really did spoil our journey around the first half of the zoo were the visiting parties of children. I'm not sure if it was a particularly bad day or a full moon but the children were rotten and so poorly behaved; children tried to barge in front when viewing, they were sat on the information boards in the aquarium playing with toys and not looking at the animals and we saw one child throwing clumps of wet sand at ducklings with nobody supervising.

A zoo in the city center. A nice and very clean zoo. They have a very large variety of species and a lot of birds are free and walking on the alley.Special show with lemurians!!!Good for kids...but even for adults...
great day out.. lovely zoo a lot bigger than expected and soon to be bigger as they're expanding on their elephant enclosure

Awesome zoo!. Over all the zoos within The Netherlands, I prefer this one. It is a wonderful place with great architecture, nice respectful exhibits and it is huge! Plan to spend a couple of hours when you go in here.

Not too big. Not too small.. We very much enjoyed visiting this zoo. It was just the right size to spend a couple of hours walking around. We found it to be well laid out, with attractive flowerbeds and benches to sit down on to rest or watch the animals. We were most impressed with the zoo worker who was feeding the penguins. He seemed to enjoy his job and when a number of people who had been watching him, asked him questions, he answered and conversed further with those who wanted to know yet more.
Wonderful fun in the sun. We absolutely loved the zoo, spend a beautiful sunny day wandering it's beautiful garden party's and well kept animal attractions.

A very nice place to spend a day with the kids. Took my kids here to spend a day. Had a wee bit of trouble finding it (we took the tram) but a friendly local pointed us in the right direction. A big sign or something at the tram stop would be nice!Anyway, we had a really nice time. There is a really good selection of animals to view and the whole zoo is set up like a park. There are areas of construction, but that didn't take away from our enjoyment.I am generally not a fan of zoos and believe that animals should be left in the wild. That being said, I felt that they actually try to treat the animals as well as they can.But if you decide to go, get there early. When we arrived there was already a huge line and we had to wait about 35-40 minutes to get in.

Amsterdam. The zoo was a great way to spend the afternoon, we were impressed by the size of the zoo and the variety of different animals to learn about. Well worth the money. It was cold and rainy the day we visited, but with an umbrella it would be great!

Wildlife in the centre (well nearly) of Town. Much bigger in area than I had imagined, some enclosures are quite small but overall well laid out and worth a visit, highlights were the aquarium and the butterfly house. A lot of development was going on in the park area for new elephant house. a nice place and an enjoyable visit to something different in Amsterdam.

Zoo in a beautiful Garden.. 75 Euro for a family ticket. I asked the young man at the kiosk that they'd need to have Dodos for that. No Dodos but we weren't disappointed. The Aquarium was fantastic and enchanting for our young children. The Planitarium was in Dutch and our children were transfixed by the World as we travelled away from it.The Restaurants were all calm and good value.A great family day out in a beautiful city.
very well laid out zoo. was there on a sunday so lots of families great cos very sunny and butterfly bit very colourful and peaceful

The best zoo. I've been here many times, pretty much on every Amsterdam visit. It is not the largest zoo in the world, but it is well situated and planned out and their collection has it all, including a nice little aquarium. Usually when you visit a zoo, a food rating is not possible because the food pretty much sucks. Not at Artis, in addition to having a place to eat right by the main entrance, there is also a new modern building by the zebras and giraffes in the back that serves some rather good food and beer. You can sit inside, or outside and enjoy your meal. I'm not at all surprised by the rating here, it is well deserved. I wish someone from my local zoo would travel here to see this, they could learn a lot from this place.

Nice Zoo, beautiful grounds. While I am not a fan of seeing animals in captivity, we went to this zoo because my daughter wanted to go. The grounds are incredibly beautiful and most of the animal enclosures are indicative of their natural habitats. The butterfly sanctuary was amazing but I was concerned about the seals. I did not see any evidence of this being a rehabilitative zoo so for that reason I will not return.

Wonderful zoo. Having not planned to visit a zoo on our Amsterdam trip,we were more than pleasantly surprised to find it having taken tram 9 to the plantage area. What with the mature trees, old buildings,some of which housed the animals, the aquarium,forest house,butterfly house,etc,not to mention every other creature,which I must say all looked happy in their environment,we were very impressed with this lovely zoo.

Review of the Artists Zoo. The zoo is easy to find and tickets are bought outside for just under €21. A map is offered for an extra €2. I would have thought that the map would be included for that price! I just meandered my way through the zoo. There is at the very least an hour of walking just to see everything. The parts I enjoyed most were the lions, elephants and WOLVES! It had all sorts of animals including myself.Some of the displays were needlessly underwhelming which I found to be disappointing. It was a shame to see some intelligent creatures in cages no matter how well looked after. But there isn't much option to see these animals otherwise. I hope the zoo sponsors wildlife around the world from its profits. Even while it is expensive for the individual and moreso for a family I would recommend the experience for everyone.

Great zoo !. Very clean zoo with lots to see. Some cages do look a little on the small side however all seem to look great. Lots of things for the kifs to do play parks etc. Cafe we only got a drink but didnt seem that expensive. We would go again and the price is good too very wide selection of animals .
Nice zoo for a day out. Zoo was nice, but very expensive for what you get/see versus other European zoos. Not very informative, but lovely place to walk around in and great on a sunny day.

the wild life clos to your eyes. the variety of animals and the structure of the zoo make this visit very nice. the buterflyes room made my day very pleasant. the animal are kept in good shape and you feel like in the middle of the wilderness. is good if you can take the kids here, they will enjoy the visit.

A perfect Zoo. It's maintained very well with not only a large variety of animals, but also various plants, flowers and restaurants. It's located quite centrally and right beside the Micropia museum. It's quite cute to see cranes and similar birds move around freely rather than being caged. The butterfly garden is worth a visit with beautiful sights.
great zoo. we visted on a sunday morning on a hot and sunny day the zoo is well maintained and the animals looked well looked after.

Amazing day out! . This was the best day we had of our visit, all the animals are amazing and the cafe that is near the centre was very nice and had lots of choice. The only thing we struggled with was we couldn't find a map that was in English but we made do with the pictures

A must do / see on a warm sunny day!. Lovely zoo with all the usual animals that you would expect. There is a butterfly room which I have never experienced before until now! best to go first thing in the morning as when you go round everything it is then lunch time and by then the zoo is very busy

Beautoful. As a massive lover of all animals I fall in love at every zoo! This one in particular would attract me back in a heart beat! A really beautiful place with some stunning animals! Unfortunately like every zoo I just wish they had more room! Lions are a must see!

This zoo is quality. lions,monkeys,lamas,fish,spiders,giraffes,zebras,boars,bears.
basicly every animal you would like to see all kicking about for you to point at ....did i mention wolves.....................................................................................................................................

A fantastic zoo... Love it!. This zoo is awesome and 17 Euro entry fee isn't to expensive either. There are so many animals to see that I can't even begin to explain! There are plenty places to eat and drink as you travel around the zoo and lots of seating areas too. Definitely worth a visit on a nice day and it's not far to walk from the centre.

Lovely day out!! . Had an amazing time at the zoo when we visited Amsterdam in February. We bought the iAmsterdam card for our 5 day break and used it loads on the trams. The zoo was much bigger than expected and it made for a great day out. The cafe was really pretty in a very modern building. The animals were really close to us and the Penguins came that close I could have touched if I wanted! Definitely recommend and it was only a tram ride away from the centre.
Great Place. A good place to spend the day with the family. it contains a very good variety of animals. the place is clean and very organized with some human friendly animals lose in the zoo.
One of the best ZOO in the world!. Beautiful, clean and well organize Zoo. A must visit. They have a lot of animals and sea life. I love the aquarium with see life and a lot of corals.

Any day all weather joy . Well laid out with a lot of care taken to ensuring maximum space for the creatures it is responsible for, Artists Zoo is my favourite zoo ever. Always changing to improve conditions I loved the new shared area for monkeys, squirrels and bats you can wander through. New butterfly enclosure is very in keeping with trends and one of the biggest I've seen. Kids play area was extremely popular and selfishly seemed to keep most kids occupied away from the rest of us! Planting was lovely with spring bulbs.

Great Way To Pass Time. Using the IamSterdam card we had a free pass to the zoo. Great variety of animals, insects, reptilians and sea creatures. Very exciting rooms in which you can enter and experience animals from up close, without barriers. I actually had a monkey drop its food on my head, good thing I wore a hat. Butterfly room was very interesting with butterflies of different sizes flying all around you. Insectorium that paraded some interesting insects, very gross but exciting. Aquarium is a very beautiful structure with great amount of different sea species. Animals in the zoo are kept in great conditions, the zoo itself is very beautifully decorated that makes it like a very nice stroll in the park.

A nice place. It is a large and well organize zoo. You may watch a lot of animals in their normal environment. It is clean, there are places for food and drink. You need at least 4 hours to visit all the animals.

Try Something Else on a Sunny Day. We visited the park on a holiday, with perfect weather; resulting in a very busy park. Nevertheless, there was enough space to walk around and enjoy the animals and nature. Our favorite was the Aquarium which is a multi-level building so be sure to take enough time for that. The park hold many eating facilities with many healthy and organic options, another plus!!!

A must see!. Fantastic zoo with great attractions. The weather was fine on the day of our visit so got lots of pix of very relaxed lions, lemurs, gorillas and a really huge crocodile. The butterfly house was amazing-I'm not the greatest insect fan, especially flying ones but to be surrounded by hundreds of species flying around just millimetres away was an experience and a half!

An excellent zoo. Although the price of admition is relatively high here, this beatiful zoo is definitely worth a visit. Or a few visits, if you have the time. If you do plan on coming here more than once, look into buying a yearly pass, which you can get at about the price of three regular tickets.

Amazing!. This is such a beautiful zoo! The animals are gorgeous and are kept in spacious places, the zoo doesn't have a caged off feel to it everything is very open. The staff were so helpful with any question myself and my friend had. You're allowed to smoke weed around the zoo as long as you don't blow it in the faces of animals or other customers as we were told by the person we got our maps off :) your visit to the Artis Royal Zoo is free of charge with the IAmsterdam city card, which in my opinion is excellent value for money. There's a beautiful area called the Japanese gardens with a giant Buddha statue, a small bench, some gorgeous flowers and a very peaceful feel to it :) Will definitely visit again!

Small city zoo. It is nice but to expensive for what it is. It is a city zoo in the center of Amsterdam. I like the place because I am coming here for a long time, but it not the best zoo of Holland!!! Just for the midday it is really fine.

The oldest Dutch zoo. Very nice zoo close to the center of Amsterdam. Easy to reach by tram nr 9 but more difficult by car. The zoo is designed as a beautiful city park and shows all the typical zoo animals. But very special are the butterfly hall and the reptile hall. For the children there is a nice planetarium with many demonstrations. The zoo has a long history and the main buildings have a beautiful design. Next to the zoo is the small museum Microbia. Also nice to visit.

The Butterfly house is amazing. Artis zoo was a nice day out, it opens until 6pm so you have plenty of time to see everything. Some of the animals are a little tired looking but overall the zoo looks to be well run and the animals well cared for. Our favourites were the seal display with the cheeky penguins getting in on the act as best they could and the butterfly house. Great place for children and adults, lots to see.
Fantastic. The zoo is one of the most beautiful zoo in Europe. So many animals and so musch green inside.The price is very cheap for that you expected to see. You must go

Great outdoor place 4 children; if you go alone there's no much time to spend; in rainy days are closed some attractions. That's one of the best places for children in town; if you go alone, I don't recommend to spend more than an hour to visit, unless you're studying animals. It's a "must" if you've never been there; if you wanna visit in a rainy day it could be possible being closed some attraction of it, or closed all zoo.

Compact and Beautiful Zoo. This Zoo used to be privately owned, but was donated to the city upon the death of the patriarch. This zoo has it all, but the most wonderful attraction in my opinion is the butterfly house. So peaceful and colourful, if you are lucky, the butterflies will land on you.
Nice zoo in the middle of the city. a very old zoo in the centre of Amsterdam. I believe its more than 100 years old and it has recently be renovated which brings You closer to the animals

Nice Zoo i guess like all others. I've been to various Zoo's and really there's nothing special. Its great for families to take their kids and everything but i didn't find anything special about this Zoo i have been to other Zoo's where they have like dolphin show and sealion show and this one doesn't have anything like that. The day we went was raining every half an hour so most of the animals were in their shelter. The food in the Zoo is really nothing special a few sandwiches and drinks and thats it. They should have a nice restaurant where you can sit with your family to have a proper meal. Overall it's a nice zoo.

Nice zoo not really great animal welfare. The zoo is clean and well maintained but the lions has less space than the penguins and alot of the enclosures were dirty while the bits the public were in were spotless. Saw a good variety of animals. Nice gernally

fantastic family day out. We have visited Artis Zoo twice. once in 2013 with 3yr and 20mth boys. They loved it and therefore so did we. however visiting again in 2015 when the boys were 3 aqnd 5 our experience was simply magical as the boys were fascinated. on both occassions there seemed to be somes ort of deal to bring down the cost and im sure the attraction is free for under 4s ( as are many Amsterdam attractions) as we used I Amsterdam cards admission was free for the adults. The zoo its self it so beautiful with lovely gardens and pathways. It seems huge and i'm sure we probably didn't see everything. there is options to get refreshments and something to eat and i would say that it was wide in choice and very nice also reasonable. there is a huge park for the children too.the second time we went we were in the car and were able to park just outside the zoo free of charge. However the boys liked the trams better ( again the cost covered with the I Amsterdam card)couldn't fault it and would defiantly return to Amsterdam and the zoo with the children.

Fantastic . Visited this zoo with my 2 year old. Thoroughly enjoyed it. You feel very close to the animals and they are currently in the process of extending a lot of enclosures. Visiting on a sunny day in May we saw it at its best with flowers blooming and blossom on the trees. Tip - get there early there is lots to do and the queue can build up after 10am. Take food with you the cafe do not have much choice and is expensive

Great zoo especially if you like monkeys!. Really good zoo, very big with lots of different animals.The monkey enclosure is great with monkeys roaming around freely. We got there at 11.30 and there wasn't much of a queue but we left around 2.30 and there was a much bigger queue so go early. You could easily spend an entire day there in good weather as there are lots of areas to sit and enjoy the sun.

Must visit . The artis zoo can be reached by tram 9. Around 15 minutes from central station. There is also an aquarium, insectarium, planetarium, butterfly garden. You can see different types of birds, animals like lion, reindeer, red pandas, giraffes, chimpanzees etc. Penguins watch and sea lion shows are good. It's a relaxing place with lovely old trees and benches to sit. There is also a small farm where children can pet calves and hen. You must visit if you have kids with you

Love Nature. is incredible all nature that has this zoo, in this time of spring this spectacular all flowers and flowering trees, the animals are well cared for, and the site offers a restaurant with several options, in a very nice place to visit any company.
Ok ok. There are more beautifull zoo's in the word then Artis in Amsterdam. It is ok and has a lot of different animals. But in really small cages and they do not have a lot of space.

Gotta see the Monkeys!. My husband and I visited Artis Zoo on our short trip to Amsterdam. We enjoyed it so much I want to take a trip with the kids. It wasn't expensive and even though it was a little chilly, we didn't feel it as there was so much to see. Definately worth a visit while on your holiday in Amsterdam.

A great visit. The zoo is a great place to spend a few hours it is in the process of being updated with some new enclosures and old there are some beautiful buildings on site and the aquarium museum is beautiful well worth it

Amazing!. Went to the zoo on the first day of the of the holiday and what a wise choice it was! The staff all spoke good English and were friendly to help, the price was a little on the steep side but then so is the all the city attractions. The range of of animals is astounding, it's like a zoo/aquarium/natural animal history museum all in one! One downfall I will have to point out is that some of the larger animals have a rather small enclosure compared to most other British zoo's especially the lions, beware though, the gorilla house absolutely pongs!! All in all, it was a great day out and would happily go again when I visit Amsterdam next.

Not too big but many kinds of animals. My family with 3-year old kid spent about 3,5 hour in the zoo and my son really liked it a lot. The zoo is well-organized and not too big so we can see every animals and we didn't get tired after such hours there. There are some playgrounds for kid so that we can even hang out in the zoo entire day because there are some restaurants as well. This is even attractive for grow-ups also, I think. Should try while you are in Amsterdam.

Restorative walk among the animals. This zoo is quite old, judging by the dates on some buildings. As we wandered, we encountered brown and black monkeys hanging around in trees, uncaged. Signage was good to point the way to my favorite, the giraffes. That savannah exhibit was wonderful, with the eight giraffes eating and moving, as well as zebras and more just a short distance away. Nearby is a building with food for purchase as well as tables for viewing.
Day out in Amsterdam. Located very near Amsterdam city centre, I was surprised how large the zoo was, apart from a great selection of animals the grounds and buildings were also fantastic.

So fun!. Best zoo I've ever been too, in any city in the world! So many different animals and the aquarium and the butterfly house are definitely bonuses. Full day activity, mostly outside other than the aquarium and butterfly house so dress for the weather. Good for all ages!

Fantastic zoo, great day out for us two in our 30s. Had a great time here.Had some time to waste, the weather was good and the ticket free with our I Amsterdam cards purchased online. Got theatres from the centre again free with the card. Really good zoo with loads to see. We were surprised and had a good fun day out.
Great visit on a sunny day. The zoo has a great variety of animals. It's not too big so a couple of hours is enough for a visit. The zoo is mostly outside so go on a warm sunny day.

Picturesque . Artis may not be a giant zoo, but it's the oldest city zoo in the Netherlands. The neo classicism architecture creates a quaint atmosphere, ideal for a half day activity. The zoo is centrally located, two tramstops from Rembrandtplein (line 9) and has a small selection of our favorite wild life animals. Cesar the king lion and his three females (two are his daughters) live close to the entrance. Don't visit them on Thursdays as it is their lazy day since they aren't being fed on those days. Wild dogs, giraffes, elephants are amongst Artis inhabitants. The insectarium, the aquarium, the butterfly garden, the indoor small animal area and the reptile house make Artis ideal for rainy days.There's a small children's farm and a playground as well.Artis is small, but cosy and educational. A bit pricey, but hey this is Amsterdam!
Great zoo. Great zoo which offered a great variety of animals. Above all, I Iiked the butterfly section, which resembled a paradise lost and offered peace and tranquility at a time.

Great zoo!. We had an amazing time in Artis Zoo. We bought the Amsterdam City Cards and the zoo was one of the attractions which you can gain entry to with the city card.The day we went to the zoo the weather was very mixed with some showers and sunshine, the zoo had both indoor and outdoor attractions which meant we were never bored when it rained!My favourite part was the fact that some enclosures were "people friendly" and you could go into where the animals were kept. Getting to see lemurs and monkeys up close was really exciting.Would recommend for children, adults, or couples.

Lovely peaceful day. The Artis Zoo is a great day out for all ages, but especially if you are with children. Beautifully kept, with great views of all the animals plus a great play area for kids and lovely cafes. Adults might also like to visit the Hortus Botanic Garden just up the road

Amazing. I've been to this zoo twice now and it is brilliant. so many types of animals and a great underwater section too.By far the best though was the butterfly house,incredible heated greenhouse you can stroll around with butterflies flying around you.

Some animals share their cages with visitors. Monkeys and lizards and sloths live in a conservatory where people can walk among them.Otherwise it is a traditional zoo and they are busy enlarging the spaces for lions and elephants. It is well-run and clean, with an excellent restaurant (Plantage)

Good if you need a zoo fix. If you're like us, and you don't live near a zoo, then perhaps you'll want to make this zoo a stop during your time in Amsterdam. It's not inexpensive, but it's got some lovely spots to sit, learn about animals, and think about zoos and their pros and cons.
Must visit. We visited many zoos all over the world but this is probably the best ever! I think it should be one of 10 best things to do in Amsterdam!

Lovely City Zoo. Artis is a lovely, smaller sized city zoo. It's manageable size make it easy for a day visit and perfect for small children. Animals are kept in smaller sized enclosures which pretty much guarantees visibility which is always nice. The grounds are well kept. Food was typical Dutch cafe style fare.

beautiful zoo thank you. I am from Latvia. I can not write in Latvian because not allowed from Tripadvisor. I have to write in English. Excuse me for my wrong words maybe.Artis is very place. The zoo has a lot of animals. very special: in one home the monkeys are free. they walk around. You can take fotos with monkeys. Cool! I liked it. I recommend this place.

Got me thinking. Not too impressed by Artis zoo, the ticket prices are quite expensive, and it made me wonder where the money was actually going. A lot of the animal enclosures are too small, the large cats and monkeys deserve more space, and those are just two examples. The food is overpriced, yet the chef was very friendly and helpful. More could be done for the wellbeing of the animals.

The favourite part of my trip. A large and beautiful zoo with lots of different animals and gorgeous grounds to wander around. A fantastic price for how much there was to see, you'll definitely need half a day. The enclosures for the animals were definitely better than other zoos I have been to though the elephants space seemed small however they appear to be building something new for them at the moment.

Great place to see the nature. It is really great place to spend time with your friends or family. It has many interesting things for children. You can see animals without any cages and they seems not so poor as in some other zoos.. :)

Lovely seeing the animals. Only zoo I can say that I've been to with a planetarium, microtopia and an aquarium. Beautiful zoo. First impressions were of the camels, buffalo, reindeer & others all squashed into a small patch of land. They all seemed to get along but was strange to see.Couldn't get over the open aviary with the herons flapping around like pterodactyls and the pelicans. The reptile house was extraordinary, had never seen a snake-headed turtle, komodo dragons, snapping turtle or a crocodile in real life before, although the croc didn't have a sufficient enclosure. The lions who were great to see up close, were in a very small enclosure and sounded distressed. They came out eating chickens as well almost like they were performing for us which made me sad. The café overlooking the giraffe enclosure is fantastic. The range of food is extensive and reasonably priced. Only zoo I've been to that sells alcohol. Had my first cone of chips here too. The butterfly farm was extraordinary like a taste of Costa Rica. We were fortunate to get a great day weather wise and it was busy enough for a Tues. I would recommend this to travellers.

not best. I gave 5 stars for this zoo, but I expected more. This is typical zoo, nothing more. I am from Tbilisi, Georgia and I had a hope to see much better zoo, than in Tbilisi but may be every zoo is almost same.

A 3 hour trip in April 2016. Very good Zoo plenty of animals to see. Animals seemed to be kept in pretty good conditions, of course all animals are best left in the wild. Good idea to book and you go straight in without having to queue.

A lot of animals. The zoo is located very close to the central part of the city and is therefore very easy to reach. As a big zoo fan I enojyed this zoo! I was impressed a lot by the tropical house they have there. It is quite large and you can walk there freely observing beautiful big butterflies flying all over the place! I thought that the sea lion tank was a little bit too small though. There are a lot of animals to see, and in fact we had to hurry up a little to be able to have a look at more or less everything. I think it's good to allow a few hours for visiting this place!

Spacious city centre zoo with plenty to see for all the family. This in many ways is traditional zoo but no worse for it. The enclosures seem to be well matched to the size of the animals and the grounds are well kept and well laid out. We spent a couple of hours and found plenty to amuse us. Lots of the animals are easy to see at relatively close quarters. We particularly enjoyed the butterflies and penguins. There is information on most of the animals in English although some of the presentation could be more engaging. There are are a few older areas in need of improvement but in the main the zoo is well presented and a good day out.

Perfect visit + bonus adventure. Amsterdam Zoo is a great place to visit with your children. Although it's located in the very center of Amsterdam, the territory is pretty big - may be even too big for a single visit. What is unusual for the city zoo (opposite to safari parks) is the proximity to animals. There is a number of pavilions where you can go inside and observe some species without any barrier.Afterwards you can arrange a picnic at the riverside next to the zoo. Buy some sandwiches, feed birds (ans yourselves as well), and enjoy the proximity to the nature.

Brilliant zoo, deceptively large, had a great time! . We had a great few hours at the zoo. Loads of outdoor enclosures with plenty to see, as well as indoor tropical houses (where some animals roam free: we saw a three toed sloth, a few small monkeys, roosting bats, and more), an excellent indoor aquarium and a reptile house. We had a great experience and we're happy that we purchased a map, not only to help us ensure we didn't miss anything, but also as the proceeds from the sale of the maps go towards building a larger enclosure for the elephants.

This is a great zoo. This zoo is an experience not to be missed. We brought are own lunch and sat watching beautiful butterflies. The zoo animals are not in cages but in a somewhat natural surroundings . We allowed 2 hours and we were there for 4.

A great zoo oldest in the netherlands. This is a wonderful experience. Of course I am partial to zoos. My favorite is of course the close encounter with the lemurs my favorite as they are uncaged and although you can't touch you can get close and observe free from walls and fences. Plan to spend time enjoying the total experience

Amazing!. I went whilst in Amsterdam with my partner, my brother and his fiancé and a couple of friends and we had an amazing time! There are so many animals you can actually get up close to and take pictures of (we got an actual selfie with a sloth- which may I add personally thought it loved the camera!)The enclosures could be a tiny bit bigger but a lot of the animals can roam around.Relatively cheap and something different to do as it's not like the zoos I've been to in the UK as there are more/different types of animals than you would see here. Even if you only go to see the gorillas then I would highly recommend going! I think they needed a lot more room than they got however they seemed happy and it was absolutely jaw dropping to see them especially the one with the baby who was rocking her baby to sleep.It's really strange how the zoo is in the middle of a city! Would highly recommend visiting.

Beautiful zoo. Iv been to many zoo's and safari parks and really enjoyed this one, they have so much species of animals and you can spend all day in here, there is also toilets and restaurants so it has everything for everyone :) you can even rent little bike like things to pull the kids around in and wheel chairs for people who can't walk far

Well-priced for Students!. The Zoo is very well priced for students (only 3 euro) but if it was more expensive, we wouldn't go. Some of the enclosures are quite small, especially the elephants (although I am aware they are building a new, bigger one now) and the lions. Good array of animals though!

Nice zoo in central Amsterdam. Artis remains one of my favorite zoo's in The Netherlands, it's not that big, what makes it perfect for an afternoon. The zoo is clean, and well kept. Many different animals, including lions, elephants and giraffes. But I especially like Artis for the smaller animals, like the alpine marmots and the pygmy marmosets (the smallest monkeys, too cute and funny).

Typical European zoo. I love visiting zoos and I'm very interested in animal welfare and behaviour.This zoo is a very typical European zoo with some beautiful enclosures and some room for improvement which it looks like they are taking steps towards and would be interested to see the new elephant enclosure once it has developed.the aquarium was lovely and not to be overlooked!

Sunday afternoon . We visited the zoo on Sunday 18th April. We decided to visit to escape for the busy and mad life in amsterdam. It is a small zoo but it has a lot of greenery and beautiful flowers beds that give you a nice calm feeling. We were amazed at how close you get too the animals. The highlight for us was the aquarium and the butterfly room which had the most amazing colourful and varied collection of butterfly's you get so close to. They are doing some improvements at the moment but this did not take away from a lovely afternoon in a serene space
Average zoo. This was a pleasant enough place and there were plenty of opportunities for refreshments, Nothing really wrong with it, but I have been to better zoos.

Just an amazing place. Thought the zoo was amazing. The enclosures are large and the animals well cared for. In some of the houses you get so close to the animals - I stood right next to a sloth and a lemur. So much to see and a great price - a good place to go if the weather isn't great.
A lovely day out. We always visit zoos when we travel and this one was very pleasant. Well organised with good facilities. Easy to find using the tram

especially nice on a summer day. The zoo itself is not great, but you will have a wonderful day. While the busy city is around you, it's a nice lay-back attrtaction. Really worthwhile if you have a few days to spend in the city and you want to do 'something else'. Great for children and teenagers.
A great day out. What a great experience, very good value for money. The whole family had a great day out here and made even more special by the Red Pandas.

Butterfly room was magical!. We visited the zoo in March 2016. It was a truly amazing experience. The butterfly room was definitely the best, and if we went back to Amsterdam we would go back. Don't go on a rainy day, as the majority of everything is outside.
Excellent Zoo. Well worth a visit. The butterfly house is a highlight but the rest of the zoo is also great. Spent 3 hours walking round so that gives you some idea of the size.

My child loved it. So did I. Children's rating 4.5/5. It is easily accesible walking from downtown (just like everything else in Amsterdam). Prices are a bit on the hig side (20,50 eur for an adult or children over 10 and 17 for children under 9) but it is worth it. It is not too small or too big, fair size to be in the middle of the city. It took us 3hs to walk it all. There's a couple of places you can have a snack or a proper meal at. I have to say it was not too bad for a zoo restaurant either (including children's menus). There was also a children's playground next to the restaurant. When it comes to animals, the fish area was very interesting, the sea lions were gorgeous and so was the butterflies' house. Loved the fact that they were in open spaces and you could almost touch them and in some cases, they were wandering around you. Our daughter loved it.There is toilets easily accesible and they have small pushchairs for children if you don't have one and your child gets tired. Overall a great fun day with kids.

Great place. Went after spending a couple of hours at a museum thinking we would just spend a hour to finish the day .So much to see we spent at least 2 hours .Not as large as the zoo near where we live but in a way that was better as you can get closer views of the animals.Staff were friendly and informative .Love sloths and in the aviary they were walking above your head !!Animals look well cared for ,highlight of the day was a lemur taking a banana from underneath a pram and the keeper asking did the man want it back
Fantastic Zoo. We had a ball here, spent four hours wandering around and one of our daughters must have taken 300 pictures. A thoroughly enjoyable experience

Beautiful Flowers. I went because my granddaughter wanted to go there, and then Micropia. The zoo was okay as far as zoos go. It is the oldest in Europe, and the gardens are magnificent. The butterfly house is wonderful and the playground is large. It is worth it for these things alone.

Stunning. This zoo left me speechless in a good way. There is so much to see and so much to do, you will end up staying the whole day! We spent 5hrs there and still didn't see everything! Defiantly a must see while in Amsterdam.

Great Fun. Visited the zoo on a sunny day. Plenty to see and do. Visited the Lemurs which you could get extremely close to and take a selfie with them! haha they were all out basking in the sun. They are currently in the middle of building a larger Elephant enclosure which you can help towards by buying an English map.

Surprisingly loved the zoo. My wife and I attended on a drizzly day. There was plenty to do inside and outside. Highlights were the gorillas, butterfly garden, lizard house including crocodiles and the open monkey house. Worth a visit if you have a spare day or afternoon. Not something we would normally do on a city break but we really enjoyed it :)
Small but very nice. A very small but cute zoo. There are different sections where you can also admire insects and fishes.

alright for some. I love zoos and I understand that this is an old zoo, however I couldn't help but feel sorry for the animals. I've been to many zoos and always enjoyed it but all the animals had so little space and were cramped, it made the experience unpleasant. If you can get around this then you'd probably enjoy it and it would be good for kids. Some very pretty areas however!

fabulous day out. had a lovely outing on a sunny day. Kids loved it, the zoo has a wide variety of animals.It is quite tiring though and would recommend at least half a day, if not longer, to fully enjoy. The map is sold separately but still a bit difficult to navigate around due to poor signage within the park.

Not sure about Artis Zoo.... I'm always a little nervous about zoos in this day and age, whilst I realise they play their part in breeding projects it still makes me feel sad that we have the need for such places. With a 13 year old I do try to keep an open mind but Artis didn't make me feel any differently. Although they are doing a lot of work here to improve the enclosures I didn't like the elephants in a small space or the small enclosure for the lion/tigers. The butterfly house on the other hand is lovely. Be prepared for school children on day visits too that didn't seem to be accompanied by an adult but were left to run about, at one point I watched a young man lean over a barrier and put his hand through the enclosure for the wolves, had the beautiful wolf watching him decided it was lunchtime I know who's side I would have been on! I've been & seen but I wouldn't go again.

A must do. You must visit the monkey island - the monkeys sit next to you on a fence - and the forest house is another must - you are inches away from the animals. The elephants were playing football when we visited. Work is being done to enlarge some enclosures. Good value for money.

Nice relaxing way to start a day. We went for a walk around these botanical gardens after a heavy night and it totally relaxed us and was a pleasent way to start the day. The dome there has several different environments to alk around from Desert, tropical and rain Forrest. the butterfly house is pretty great too! We managed to walk around this in a little under three hours.7 euros each... Go, do it!
Very nice day. A lots of animals to see. You need around 4-5 hours to see all of them. Nicely done zoo. Worth seeing.

Surprised by Artis Zoo. We didn't imagine that there can be a zoo of this size within the central Amsterdam. There was a wide range of animals though some cages were empty. Extension work was going on. Very fascinated by the butterfly house.

nice little zoo. It was a showery day when we visited Artis zoo. It didn't matter as there are plenty of things to see indoors, such as the aquarium, butterflies and small animals. We had a good time looking around the zoo. The wolves got very vocal, howling to each other. The cafe had a lovely view of the giraffe enclosure, and a nice selection of food on offer.It was good to see they are continually making improvements to the zoo. It would be nice if the lions could have a larger enclosure than the one we saw. I really liked seeing the binturong as they are so unusual in zoos and they were very active! There was plenty to see there and we visited the zoo for a good few hours.

Extremely family friendly zoo!. The food was fresh , healthy, and reasonably priced for families. The park itself was well maintained and the exhibits were wonderful, including an awesome playground for the kids One of my favorite zoo visits in a long time, and we've been to many!

Family Day Out . Visited this zoo in the city centre during a short trip to Amsterdam. An expensive visit but the zoo itself is very pleasant surroundings and is undergoing refurbishment, we all enjoyed a great day seeing the big cats, giraffes, gorillas, except for one sight that saddened us all which was the elephants stuck in a very small enclosure one of these lovely huge creatures did a repetitive dance like motion with its front feet from the time we entered until we left. The animal was clearly demented/distressed living in this small area, a sorry sight we will not forget anytime soon.

Average place. We went there with 1 yr old kid .It started raining and most of the animals went inside.So we didnot enjoy much.Only thing we liked seeing there were giraffe apart from that overall experience was not that good.

Small but enjoyable. We went here on a Saturday afternoon about 3pm. Quite small and enclosed but enough animals to see for a couple of hours. We wanted to see a film in the Planetarium as well but they were all in Dutch so we didn't bother. Aquarium was ok but not a huge variety of fish in it. Was ok for entertaining the kids for a couple of hours.

Great zoo. Who knew Amsterdam had a zoo? We had an extra day to do something and figured why not. Glad we did. The zoo was excellent - great for kids and adults. So many different type of animals all over the world. The butterfly exhibit was so much fun with many of them landing on us. The place is well designed and easy to navigate. Even the restaurant was very tasty. All in all, it was a great way to spend a few hours away from the crowds.

Brilliant Zoo to visit, even on a drizzly day!. Artis was a lovely place to visit, so much to see- even had an aquarium. Beautifully presented gardens and layout, animals had nice sized enclosures compared so some other zoos. Some indoor areas for if you get rained on/chilly. Highly recommended. Got in free with I Amsterdam City card, but felt I would have got value for money paying the ticket price.
Something unexpected . We visited the Zoo as it was too sunny for a museum. And we were pleasantly surprised. All the animals you want to see plus some extras.

A nice break for the kids. Traveling with our 8 and 12 year old sons, we love to stop into zoos and parks to give them a break from art and history! Both of them enjoyed this zoo and it's unusual animals and habitats--a great way to pass a few hours in Amsterdam!

Zoo's suck, but it's a nice day out. Unfortunately it's a zoo so you can;t say much postitive things about it. However, it's a beautifully constructed zoo, looks very nice in architecture and layout and the butterfly garden is awesome! The seal compound and lions look quite sad and small though..

Great way to spend an afternoon. On a really warm, sunny afternoon me and my boyfriend decided to walk to Artis as it would be a lovely way to spend the afternoon outside in the sunshine.There are a lot of animals to see and it wasn't too crowded walking around.If you can pre-book tickets in advance I would advise it, the queue was quite long on a Sunday around lunchtime.There is a great cafe too to grab some food/drinks. They were offering paninis, sandwiches, soup, pastries and smoothies.There is some refurbishment being done in parts of the zoo, however it didn't effect our visit in the slightest.
Nice zoo. A nice zoo, easy access. Loads of different animals that look well kept. A bit pricey. We spent almost a full day there.

Really nice old zoo. A lovely sunny day at this zoo, they have a good variety of animals and a few houses to walk through with free roaming animals which I'd never seen before. Good keeper shows as well at the lions, penguins and sea lions although only spoken in Dutch (still fun to watch). The aquarium was a bit more dull and not so many information signs in English as the rest of the enclosures are. The butterfly he was amazing to walk around and get landed on. More than worth the entry fee - maybe not if it's really rainy though as lots is outside
Nice zoo. A nice zoo, easy access with stroller. A lot of different animals. Most animals look like they are treated well.A tram stops just outside the zoo.

Been to better Zoos. My fiancé and I decided we would visit Artis while in Amsterdam, and I for one was fairly disappointed. I felt that there were some animals that definitely didn't have an appropriate sized enclosure. It was quite well set out with good directions given for walking around, and for the most part information was given in several languages. There was a large school group there when we were in who seemed to take over the entire aquarium, which made it hard to look around.

Museumkarte is not Valid Here. Although the information given to you if you purchase a Museumkarte says to the contrary, this card is NOT valid for the zoo. Fortunately Micropia does now accept it and is well worth a visit if you like 'poo bugs' et al.

Working being conducted . Work is being done to expand the zoo, I hope it's for the animal enclosures. A lot bigger than it looks on the map, but I felt very sorry for the lions as their enclosure looked really small!! No space to roam around at all. As did the poor sea lion tank.

Small City Zoo. Lovely little zoo. Good selection of animals who all seemed to have good enclosures. All the animals were easy to see. Not all the information boards were bilingual. Not a problem if you're Dutch!

Animals shouldnt be in cages. Thank god the facilities are more decent then other zoos in other countries but its still stressed out animals in cages. 'Born in captivity' doesn't make it any better, its against nature! Children should be educated about that and adults shouldn't be ignorant!

A fun way to spend an afternoon with the family. I have visited many zoos around the world in our travels.I like zoos, especially those that go out of their way to treat their animals as best they possibly can in captivity. The Western Plains and Sydney zoos in Australia come to mind. Our worst experience was visiting the Beijing zoo where even the pandas looked miserable.Artis has well designed enclosures and really go out of their way to look after their animals.The park is big with many interesting species from all around the world. We were particularly captivated by the lemurs area. They are not kept in an enclosure but rather an area where you encounter the lemurs as you walk along. We were told that they stay in this one place because they feel comfortable there. You can get close enough to almost pat them!Their giraffe breeding program is a great success and it was delightful for the young children to see so many baby giraffes.All in all an interesting and fun day in the heart of Amsterdam.

Zoo is an oasis in a busy city!. We were skeptical about visiting the zoo. We are members of a great zoo at home but locals recommended it. After a morning of strolling through shops for me, we jumped on the s-bahn and headed to the zoo. I was impressed from the second we stepped into the zoo. The camels great you as you step in. All the exhibits are very open and you feel vey close to the animals. We walked into the aviary expecting birds, but we found a tropical house with monkeys swinging just over our heads, bats stretching their wings, a very large iguana scattering along a brand just overhead and shrews running right in front of us. Even the Sloth was moving about. The animal information was in English and other languages. Zookeepers were also in the rooms to help with more info. We spent a lot of time in just this room taking in everything. It was also nice and warm in there for a cold day outside. You can walk right up to the Lemurs. The new Jaguar exhibit looks like it will be really great. We walked amongst the wolves who were singing for each other in between chewing on their dinner bones. And there was a large play area for kids to climb and play outside the cafeteria style restaurant. We didn't even see all the exhibits. We were lucky to be there around 3 pm which seemed to be feeding time so the animals were very active. If you are traveling with kids, I recommend the Artis.
World Class. The Artis Zoo and Aquarium have been a crown jewel of Amsterdam for many many years. We loved our visit and recommend it highly.

Good selection of animals.. Out in the east side of amsterdam, i recommend getting the tram if your hotel is in centrum, leidseplein, jordaan or de pijp areas. The zoo is laid out quite well, mostly in a circle, couple of refreshment options along the way, plenty of spaces for children to play too and pathways are generally suitable for pushchairs/buggies. In the zoo you'll see lots of birds, reptiles, small mammals, gorillas and monkeys, seals, giraffes, wolfs, elephant and lions. Nice day out for the family, or filler activity if your solo.

Great even as it rained. I always visit zoo when i go aboard at present they are Building the new elephant house, mist of the animals were out and kook happy the lion had caught a bird and was happily eating it
Loved this place. Great zoo, great value! Loved it! Would recommend to all ages! Beautiful animals and the aquarium is

Nice day out. Nice day out with my partner and friends. Some of the enclosures could be bigger for the animals sake eg the lions enclosure didn't seem big enough to me but apart from that i had no issues with the zoo, it was lovely

Lovely Zoo. The zoo is quite large and has many different animals to see. There was a fair amount of refurbishment and new enclosures being built so some sections were a bit empty. There is a petting zoo which is nice where you can actually go in with the animals. The food in the restuarants were reasonably priced and good value for money. The entrance fee for the attraction was value for money for the amount that the zoo offer. We would have liked to have watched some feeds or demonstrations however it did not mention any of these on the map so we were unsure whether they actually took place. A nice zoo in the city centre so very easy to get to, would visit again.

Hidden Gem.. Lovely place hidden in the middle of a busy city. Had the amazing pleasure of witnessing a live birth! Quite a lot of building work underway with new things 'coming soon'but this did not ruin the enjoyment of the Zoo. We had a teenager and an 8 yr old with us - both enjoyed it greatly. A few places to eat and drink, but also fine to take along picnics. Tonnes to do, need a full day realistically - we only had an afternoon and it wasn't enough! To save time, ask at the station 'Iamsterdam' stand for directions and buy tickets too.
Best zoo!. Well this is the best zoo we have been to! It is a lovely zoo,lovely well kept grounds and so much to see! Nice flat walking areas.The aquarium is fab and the museum area. Don't miss out!

It is a city zoo...... Yes, children like zoo's. Yes a zoo is a prison for -originally - 'wild' animals. Yes, animals are the same as people, in the end most prefer comfort (food & no threats) over speed.....But do not pretend it is normal to look at locked up animals for fun. I myself would prefer a short and happy life over forever in the zoo.But apart from these idiotic - and not to the point - ramifications: arris is quite an nice little zoo where children will enjoy themselves. They have replaced most 19th. Century cages with modern dwellings for the animals. And there are a few retaurants around that can supply human beings with decent food.Have fun!
Needs to be finished . There was a lot of work being undertaken when we went in March 2016 so a lot of animals were 'coming soon' however what was there was good to see anyway.
Good food!!. Beautiful environment, friendly staff. Nice atmosphere. Really liked the restaurant. Did not visit anything else than their restaurant n

Great zoo!. We are huge zoo fans, and Amsterdam zoo didn't disappoint. Much bigger than expected, with a big range of animals. Only criticism is perhaps it could be a bit better sign posted - we didn't get a map, but felt sure we'd missed a load of stuff as kept seeing different signs (maybe we should have just bought a map!) Unfortunately didn't get time to visit the Planetarium but would definitely factor in a bit more time on our next visit!
A good European zoo. For a European zoo, Artis was very good! Some enclosures needed to be improved (which by the looks of the website, is happening), but other than that we couldn't fault it.

Zoo.... Artis is a fun place to visit, especially with small children, they have everything! Reptiles, a childrens farm, African animals etc. I didn't rate this place 5 stars because it wasn't really an extraordinary experience for me, just your basic (but cool) zoo. PS: bring your own food!

Good range of animals . Good range of different animals and some good talks Lots of interactive element for the kids and can get fairly close to the animals to get good pics There are elements of the park that are pretty tired looking but if you purchase a map at the door you are contributing toward the new elephant enclosure. No wifi covering the area though

Great zoo. This is one of the great zoo we have visited ever. You can see a different animals. They are still improving the zoo. The mammal house, butterfly houses are fantastic. My daughter really enjoyed it.

Omg just visit. Where else can you see an astronaut,baby gorrilas,chimps,butterflies,snakes,lions so close you could almost touch them and penguins?Go to Artis Zoo it was a fabulous way to spend a couple of hours and was full of surprises around every corner including an alligator.....The restaurant was reasonably priced but requires more staff as was very busy...Would visit again on our next visit to the Netherlands.
Really nice zoo. the zoo is quite a nice place to visit but some of the enclosure seem a bit on the small side. The zoo is working on improving this but it still feels a little bit cruel.

The best zoo yet! . Absolutely amazing day out! Was there for a good 5 hours, made the fatal error of not wearing comfortable shoes though. The animals are well kept, loads of knowledge boards about and a good variety of everything. Easily accessible as its in the city centre to just a quick tram ride and you're there. Having come from Colchester where we also have an amazing zoo, I have to say it's a very close contest between them. I would 100% recommend this to anyone! Great for those with kids, couples or individuals. Would 100% come again!!

Best city zoo i have visited.. This place should be definately in your visit list.
I loved the zoo because all the animals where shown and there were so many. With family you should think spending about 4 hours there. Dont forget theres also micropia over there which takes also about 2-3 hours. It all depends actually how you roam.

Highlight of the trip. Whether you are a family, group of friends, couple or on your own this is a wondrous place to visit with a wide array of animals from all environments in the world. Very interactive and all the staff were both very friendly and informative.

The Amsterdam Royal Zoo Artis, experience nature right in the city centre.. THE AMSTEDAM ROYAL ZOO ARTIS The Amsterdam Royal Zoo ARTIS, in full: “Natura Artis Magistra” a National Institute with a city park where people, animals, Microbes, trees, plants, stars, museums, arts and heritage come together and where they get inspired, wonder and learning about nature and themselves. Stroll among the shady trees, admire the diversity of plants and animals, travel to the stars, enjoy our heritage. Visit the new opened Micropia at the ARTIS Royal Zoo and experience nature right in the Amsterdam City Centre.ARTIS Zoo is located on the Plantage Kerklaan 38-40 in the beautiful Plantage (Plantation) part of Amsterdam.

Definately worth visiting. We visited the park on a nice sunny day and it was more fun than we expected. There was a long que outside, but moves fast. Even if you have the "I Amsterdam City Card", u still have to que and get a ticket. Location is great as it's a walking distance from anywhere around central Amsterdam. There's a wide variety of animals and exotic creatures. The zoo is not huge, but I can't say it's small. It took us 3 hrs to go around, but it if you take it slow it you can spend 4-5 hrs there. Definately worth visiting, whether adults or children you'll enjoy.

Worth an afternoon trip, but still a lot of development. 2 tickets and a map was 45eu and it was a good trip for a couple of hours in an afternoon. However, there were a lot of enclosure developments being made so felt a little empty.

Beautiful day out. Me and my partner visited this zoo on our weekend trip in Amsterdam. It was a lovely day and a very clean little zoo. I was impressed by the reptile house , as a reptile owner myself I find zoo's often don't have up to standard reptile housing but these were some of the best I've ever seen! Animals all seemed happy, I thought maybe a couple of the enclosures were a tad too small but I'm no zoo animal expert! The butterfly house was absolutely beautiful too ! With a nice little cafe in it where you can look over the whole butterfly house ! Defiantly recommend for couples and family's !

Good zoo. Had a great day here with the family walking around for a good few hours. There is plenty to see and a super selection for everyone. The gorillas were mostly inside which was a let down and a Good bit under construction but cool for few hours
Great old structures, great for kids. Always special, an ancient zoo in the middle of the city. Although it's mostly for kids, adults can have a good laugh also. Enjoy the burgers at end of the park.

Great day for Couples. My partner and I found this zoo with ease while staying in Amsterdam. We made good use of the trams and the next street is one of the main routes that take you back to Amsterdam Square.The zoo had animals that I have not seen in Zoos at home such as crocodiles, wolves and the opportunity to see tiny penguins up close.The price was value for money.The only downside was that at the time they were rebuilding the elephant inclosure so we didn't get to see the elephants however we took great pictures of the lions and the giraffes.The zoo is well maintained and quite a beautiful walk. I would definitely recommend to those who have children.

A great few hours.... Visited with low expectations.. but we loved it, the animals are clean and appear to to be well cared for. The Butterfly house is gorgeous. There are plenty of cafe areas for families and outside seating. The Aquarium area is good, start upstairs and work your way down. Well worth a visit.

Always fun. Practically right in the centre of Amsterdam, this is a zoo that is also a wonderful park. There is plenty to see and do and even places to get in out of the cold or rain. In spring 2016, a lot of the pens and spaces are undergoing renovation, but it should all be up and running by summer. Well worth a half a day or more.

Great zoo. Read a couple of mixed reviews before coming, but was not disappointed, we have visited zoos around the tworld, and thus one was wonderfully kept, the inside displays, reptile house etc were immaculate, and the animals were in amazing condition, good variety of animals

Good day out. This is a good zoo which has many cool animals. The zoo offers hours of entertainment with good facilities for all the family. Witnessed the alligator eating which was a great experience. I would recommend this for family's with children.

The zoooo. The zoo is lovely. You can get close to the animals, who I admit look a little sad but the place is well maintained with lots of different animals to see. Good with families with children big or small.
Charming zoo. Loved the aquarium. The zoo had several animals I hadn't seen before. Got to see the hyenas and lions being fed which was fun. The butterflies were amazing! Overall, enjoyed the zoo :)

A really fantastic zoo!. Lots of different species of animals here, more than I have ever seen in a zoo before. The zoo was surprisingly large considering its location. The price for entry is reasonable; we spent around 3 hours there. Quite a few enclosures under construction but this did not really affect our experience. Would recommend and return to this zoo!
Best zoo ever. It really fancy zoo you can be there all day if you like and take it slow.It seem they are expanding so I would go there again to see what new and enjoy the experience once again.
a heaven of peace and beauty. Ideal with Children especially for thee butterflies house . take a cup of tea in the garden and take a rest from the Amsterdam noise .Enjoy the beauty of the nature.

All time favorite!. Our kids love to go to Artis all year round. We have a 1 year old twin and a 3 year old son. It's always pleasant to walk trough the beautiful park. Relaxing for parents as well. The park is large enough with different play grounds to do different walks on every visit. We have a family membership, we can recommend this if you live in Amsterdam with children!
Up close and personal . A well laid out space, with plenty of opportunities to get close to the animals. Kids really enjoyed themselves- though my feet ached by the end.
No, just no. The Zoo had very nice tulpis but thats all! A lot of the animals were in very small cages and looked depressed and sad. I wont go there again

So cruel. Decided to visit Amsterdam Zoo today with the missus as we had a bit of sunshine. From the outside it looks great and just inside it was ok. Camels where very dirty looking and scruffy. We walked around to the reptile house where there was a full size crocodile/alligator in a pool no bigger than double its body length, absolutely shocking. Outside the reptile house we had the unfortunate experience of seeing the lion enclosure. 4 lions in a tiny corner surrounded by water, they never moved the whole time we was watching. Clearly unhappy and maybe looking depressed? These cats should be running round playing and excersizing.We then got to the sea lions stayed for 5/10 minutes but had to walk away as it was too sad. Four sea lions in a tiny pool the poor things just swam from one wall to another the whole time. Two very large elephants also in an enclosure that is far too small surrounded by water.We also witnessed 8/9 Silverback Gorillas in a small cage which would be suitable for around 3 Chimpanzees!!!! Looking very depressed.All in all this place good be great, like Amsterdam City. It needs expanding or relocating, those animals need sufficient space to live. Such a shame, Sort it out ARTIS AMSTERDAM ZOO!!

Wow!. Weren't expecting much from a zoo situated in the centre of Amsterdam which looked tiny on the map. What a surprise we had! Lovely place so many different animals to see and you can tell the workers work very hard to keep it all well maintained and gorgeous! Really glad we went, 20.50 euro each for entry, not bad we spent about 5 hours there walking around and came away very impressed :-)
visit to artis zoo. excellent zoo aquarium amazing apple turnover in café great highly recommend wee bit disappointed no big cats

Average zoo. For two people, the entry was reasonable priced but would be pricey for a family. We enjoyed our day out here, however some of the animals looked very miserable. The lions were in such a small enclosure that i felt sorry for them, it is not nice for animal lovers to see this. Compared to zoo's i am used to the enclosures were small for the animals and there wasn't as many types of animals. It was enjoyable, but i expected more from here.

Beautiful zoo in need of funds . Upon entry to artis zoo we were amazed at how lovely and quiet it was. Nice easy layout. A nice cafe beside the planetarium where we had a lovely lunch. Butterfly house is a must see along with a small house that has little monkeys and lizards right in view. Reptile house had lots of variety of really cool animals and the aquarium was out of this world!! Lemur enclosure had a little door so the lemurs can roam around as they see fit and if the CHOOSE to touch you- lucky you! Some of the other animals are within a reachable distance but your not supposed to touch the animals (obviously). It's lovely to have that little bit of freedom to see them with a fence.The only downfalls were the very very small lion, elephant and gorilla enclosures.At the moment renovations are being made to new exhibitiona and there is some sort of fundraising going on to purchase a proposed car park for a new elephant enclosure. For now though...Gorillas only had access it seemed to an indoor house and all looked very depressed but looked healthy and we'll cared for. I would visit again but I would hope to see the renovations processing as quick as financialy possible.

Brilliant. I always visit a zoo in new destinations with the kids, i dont personally like zoos but this one is top of my list.The tram left us just outside well near enough, the queue moved very quickly. The first impression was clean, no zoo smell and surprisingly happy animals, well planned, and staff within any distance to ask questions which they are more than happy to answer. When we were about 2 hours in, called at cafe for a cuppa looked at the map realised still had at least another third slightly more to see. It really is worth a visit. Its is for all walks of life no matter what age. We also went to the microphia beside it. That was cool, thats about an hour.

Great zoo in the city centre. This was a lovely place to visit. Some interesting combinations of animals together in the enclosures, think donkey, camel, goat and big water buffalo thingy with huge horns! There's a wide range of animals here in beautiful parkland. Worth a visit. Try the Plantage next door for lunch.

Best way to escape in the heart of the city!. Personally I was a bit apprehensive when I heard of the Zoo. I thought city zoo meant tiny enclosures and I'm so glad I decided to give it a chance! All of the animals have plenty of room and all seem perfectly content with life in the zoo. Didn't see much staff so it was quite nice that way, almost like they take more of a backseat approach. Not sure if that's the case but it was nice to see a zoo without keepers constantly pestering the animals to be in view for customers. There are so many different areas and you could easily spend all day here, although, the food areas we found were crowded, and I imagine quite expensive.I would make a point of visiting the aquarium which is in a building in the middle of the zoo. There's a walk through building too where you are literally surrounded by animals; bats, sloths, and small monkeys and lizards. It's amazing and there are keepers in the room with the animals who will happily explain what all of the animals are etc! And, there's an insect house too with the usual creepie crawlies with lots of interactive bits for kids.I could go on for days about how wonderful it was and how much there was to see.Entry to the zoo was around €16.50 for an adult, although when we got to the queue a few friendly locals offered us supermarket coupons which meant we could get in for free. It was my birthday the day we went so it was a lovely bonus. One of my favourite things about Amsterdam are the wonderful local people. Always so welcoming and happy to help. I loved this zoo so much and would happily visit every time I visit Amsterdam!
Open and free. Had a blast at the zoo, all open and you can see they care about the animals. The butterfly's are beautiful.
Amazing variety of animals. Best zoo I've been to. Wasn't cheap but was there for about 2 hours exploring the zoo, loads of animals that I'd never seen before. Worth a visit!
BEST OF ZOO. this zoo has many kinds of animals from elephant lions birds pigeons and many more the zoo is well designed and has restaurant to chill during the visit

Ok, but needs improvements to be completed. We came here only to kill some time before our flight later in the day and we had the IAmsterdam card so it didn't cost us anything, thankfully. Compared to other zoos we have been to, we were surprised at the combination of some animals in together and the size of some of the enclosures, though we do understand that improvements are currently underway to enlarge some of these.
