There was one animal in a cage that was trying to pull up the drain cover that was in there and was generally pacing around looking quite agitated. Another concerning sight was a large bird walking around it's cage with a dead mouse that it seemed perplexed as to what to do with (it was definitely not it's normal food!). I don't wish to be completely negative about the place, as the butterfly enclosure was fascinating to be in and the member of staff inside was very informative about the different species. Overall, probably not somewhere I would rush to return to until improvements to the relevant enclosures have been made.

Great animal and visitor welfare at this small but perfectly formed zoo. Visiting with my zookeeper son was eye opening, with me learning all kinds of facts about this zoo that I would not otherwise have noticed. The clever mix of species and the lack of bars was, apparently, excellent for animal enrichment. Every exhibit was spotlessly clean with great access. Artificial rainstorms indoors in the rainforest scenarios was also clever and great for the animals. Informative and friendly staff, great exhibits and commendable animal welfare means we can recommend Artis zoo to anyone. well done !

Fantastic . Was really pleased we went here! Walked from the centre of Amsterdam which was about 20 minutes. It was well worth it. Lots to see and do. You will not be disappointed. Best zoo I have been to in a long time

Great zoo, had everything I wanted to see. Honestly I don't really like zoos but this one is great!There are pinguins, seals, lions, giraffes, chimpanzee and many other animals. A great attraction, costs around 18 euros.

Some good, some not so.... This is supposed to be one of the largest zoos in the world,but it didn't feel it (maybe because a section was out of action due to rebuilding works). No sign of several animals you might expect to see in a large zoo - big cats (apart from a three lions in a far too small enclosure), hippos, rhinos, most deer species... On the other hand, you might rejoice that such creatures are not being confined in a zoo. Best part for me was the large/wading bird compound/lake. Presumably built for the pelicans, but several wild herons, egrets and storks have taken up residence in the surrounding trees as well, to make the most of the free food!
We were able to feed the sea lions!!. very nice zoo, animals had plenty of space and they were currently building bigger areas for the elephants, jaguars and sea lions

Disgusting. We visited using the Iamsterdam card and found a severe lack of animal welfare. The noise of the ongoing construction was clearly stressing the elephant (and other animals) who looked as if he was going to jump out of his skin every time the banging started. There was a monkey who was clearly injured and in distress - we couldnt find a member of staff to report this too so reported at the entrance to be met with a lack of concern!

wonderful experience. From the outside, I didn't think there would be much to see, but I was wrong! This zoo is not like any other you would see in the UK. There were many different species that I hadn't even heard of before and there was so much to see. You can easily spend half a day here. I was particularly impressed with the butterfly house and the huge aquarium. It is definitely worth a visit to Artis zoo!

Best zoo I've been to. . Really enjoyed our visit here, the staff were lovely for a start as we were flying home later that day, they allowed us to store our bags in their office. Then the zoo itself is much bigger than it appears on the map or from the outside, with fantastic enclosures. I particularly liked the tropical area where various animals were freely walking about or chilling in the trees. There is lots of information about habitats etc, and all the animals look really well cared for. Although there was quite a lot of construction going on during our visit, it looked close to completion and didn't spoil the visit. I will definitely be going back to see it when it's all finished. There is also a new part to the zoo called Microbia (extra ticket required) which finished our day off brilliantly, and I would definitely recommend doing them both. Thanks for a great day.
March 2016. Fantastic zoo. One of the best I have been to and very reasonably priced. U can get good and close up to most of the animals unlike other zoos I have been to
Brilliant. . This place is fantastic, we spent ours wandering around looking at the massive amount of animals on show. It's reasonably priced and a lovely day out.

Lovely zoo . Really nice , very big so could take up half a day easily . Includes an aquarium and a huge butterfly house which is really interesting . Only problem was that a lot of animals are getting new enclosures so you couldn't see some , and the Penguins kept in a small pen ( very very small ) whilst there new enclosure was built . Will be amazing when all the works done

REALLY GOOD ZOO!. Spent the best part of the day here, really fun to see all the animals - big, small and an aquarium too! Also has some nice cafés around the place for when you get tired. 5/5 would recommend.
Very good experience. Zoo was better than we excepted. Area is big and nice for walking. So many animals and nice atmosphere.
Lush. Such a nice little zoo. Plenty of space for the animals to do what they like! And thats whats important
Best zoo I've ever been to! . Amazing zoo! Large variety of animals in lovely areas to live in! An aquarium and reptile house inside too. This is not to miss!

Good zoo. Artis is the oldest zoo in the Netherlands. It still has many beautiful monumental buildings. Over time, the way the animals are kept have changed. They are no longer in tiny cages, but have lots of room to move about. Artis also has a very nice butterfly garden.

Beautiful little zoo. It's like walking round a park. Its cheap and all the animals look healthy and well stimulated however some of the enclosures are far too small. There was ALOT of building work going on which was distracting but certainly didn't take away from the experience. Hopefully they're making more suitable enclosures rather than adding more animals.All in all a lovely day
City Zoo . A first for us, zoo in city. V close to animals, clean and well presented. Could be better, would be increase in varieties and kids corner with pony rides.

Best zoo in europe. this place is amazing. It felt small to begin with but soon you start finding the winding paths to new places and find animals you dident know where there. there was some construction but it has to be done and there was so much it dident mater that a section was closed off.
What a beautiful place!. What a beautiful place to visit in amsterdam!! You have a lot to see their ! Amazing and brilliant place to visit to all ages !

My wife wants to adopt a pelican now.... Expansive zoo, not quite as big as Twycross, but definitely worth a visit. Has everything you'd expect in a zoo, the chimps and gorillas are incredible to see. You can get really close to some of the animals-the pelicans are particularly memorable.

An accident. We found ourselves with a few hours to kill before our flight so visited the zoo on a damp sunday morning. Good way to spend a few hours. The Zoo is quite small and is undergoing some renovation, This mainly to enlarge the enclosures for the Elephants. I am slightly concerned at the lion enclosure and hope they also get a larger enclosure. Many interesting animals on display. The aquarium is great. Thought the wild dogs were fantastic. Vey good vibe at the zoo we arrived early and as the weather improved the place filled up and it was not just enjoying the patronage of tourists but a large proportion were locals .

Very cool Zoo.. The Butterfly house is a must-see!. I am not very much into seeing animals locked in jails.. But still... it is the way human kind has found to admire nature in big cities.. it is a very organised and clean zoo.. with beautiful animals... it would be absolutely more beautiful if they could be there in a little forest without jails and glass houses... still one of the neatest Zoo's I have been. If you like Zoo's, surely worth a visit.

Best City Zoo we have ever visited. What a great place! We have been to many city Zoo's including NYC, London and Bristol but in all honesty this is the best so far! You can really get up close a personal with many of the animals! It is clean, easy to navigate and plentiful. This is a must visit for couples, families or groups.

A good Zoo. It's a city Zoo and you get what comes with that title. Smaller enclosures, less variety of animals and constant city noise. Having said that, I think this zoo was well presented, clean and tidy. The animals seemed happy and were entertained well by the activities given to them. There was a lot of construction work, which isn't a problem but they should avoid letting the construction dirt and dust get everywhere by getting street cleaners out. We enjoyed the Penguins, sea lions, wild dogs, lions, gorillas and of course the small mammal enclosure.Well prices but it's a shame the micro-zoo was so expensive.

Amazingly good. I'm not a great zoo lover but when our family plans changed and our child had to come away with us, I thought the zoo was a good way to while away time. Well, I was pleasantly surprised. A select number of animals in big enough pens and good explanations in English. Staff who were helpful and knowledgeable. Good value for money and such a big park. Only issue: while the cafes were good, could have done with a more comprehensive restaurant.

Fab Day!. What a great zoo! We love visiting zoo's and didn't think this one would be very big/have much to offer due to it's central location but how wrong were we! We were there pretty much for a full day,it's very pretty and has lots to see. I've never seen so many fish in one aquarium either! Great walk through experience too at the beginning! Totally worth a visit!

Lovely zoo!. We didn't really think it would be worth going at first as you can are animals at home and we have zoos in England but we chose to go as we could get it free on the iamsterdam cards we purchased at the beginning of the week and so glad we did very good zoo with a large variety of animals and the baby gorilla was a added suprise very cute!

Day at the zoo . Visited Artis zoo as it was free entry as part of our Iamsterdam discount cards. If the weather is nice I would recommend this zoo as there is plenty to see with a good range of different animals and species. You can pay €2 extra for a map, but all the proceeds go towards building the elephants a bigger and better shelter which is definitely worth it. This is a very spacious zoo so I do feel that some of the animals, such as the lions and giraffes, could of had much more room to roam. The park is currently under construction though so I hope this is an issue that is being addressed. Overall, a very good day out, but is definitely weather dependant.

An amazing experience, definitely worth going!. SO MANY ANIMALS. You need a good 3 or 4 hours to get around it all, but it is so worth it. The gift shop has a massive selection and is definitely the cheapest I have come across in terms of attractions. The animals are all wild but they seem so relaxed around you, so you can get really close (99% of the time). If you can handle the smells and the tropical heat (in some of the exhibitions) then you're laughing. The only disappointment was the planetarium, it was a little childish and nobody was in there really. I would definitely go there again!

Closer Feeling Zoo. What struck me was how close you can get to some of the animals. This was mainly possible due to the walk through buildings full of animals just moving through the indoor areas that have been acclimatised to the animals. A great zoo with an additional Microscopic life exhibition known as Micropia which you need additional ticket for.

Surprisingly great!. Considering Artis Zoo was in the city centre of Amsterdam, I was quite surprised with the large range of animals the zoo contains.The zoo is very well kept and animals seem to be well looked after. I was impressed with seeing the large crocodile contained in the reptile zone as I have never seen one in a zoo before.The elephants enclosure is rather small but it is to be extended using the old car park which will be much better on completion. There is also a new Jaguar enclosure in the process of being built.The zoo has a luxurious aquarium on offer that is located in a lovely building. The aquarium has a very large range of fish.

40 euros are you taking the mick??. This was terrible. So not worth 20 euros each. I'd say 10 euros tops, more like. There were very limited attractions. There was no petting zoo, no bears and very small amounts of monkeys. Where were the tigers? Where were the orangutangs? Nowhere to be seen. It's a little bit further out from the centre of Amsterdam, so we had to get a tram there, which was a big waste of our time and money. We thought it would be a good laugh but it just wasn't what we expected.There were construction sites everywhere and basically none of the enclosures were close enough to see. No feeding times. No fun.So for anyone who wants to try going to the zoo, don't bother. It's probably okay for kids.

Unique and Interesting. I live in a city with an amazing zoo, but being in Amsterdam we decided to check it out! They had very unique animals, and it was fun to see something different. It wasn't large, but the what they had was worth the visit.

Good zoo. Zoo was a good day out, spent a good few hours here, good range of animals but there were no petting zoo or feedings available. The main downside to the zoo was the price, very expensive, over 70euro for 2 people then you pay 3 euro for a bottle of water inside. Not good for a rainy day.

Good attraction. Artis Zoo provides a different experience for people in Amsterdam. It has been known to be great to visit while 'high' and I can vouch for that, seeing the endless teenagers giggling at the baboons' bottoms. The attraction does not offer a free map, but you can purchase one at the kiosk with your ticket for €2, but it is not essential. It was a disappointment to see the majority of exhibits being in progress to be built and the zoo fishing for funding from the public for the elephant habitat. The aquarium does not have many species, which dampened our experience. I'd recommend people visiting on a sunny day as the animals are friendly (especially in the petting zoo) and they are not by any means camera shy (unless they are eating).

Wow - great zoo. I love zoo and this is one of the bests I ever visited. Even march is poor time to visit zoo we enjoyed day spent here. Pay special attention to first pavilion after entering (to the left of the gate) – a lot of creatures free moving in bushes… Nice experience… You can easilly spent here even rainy day.

Not worth the money . Zoo was large but not a huge variety of animals. The queue for tickets was quite big and there was a lot of construction work going on. No petting zoo and no feeding times. The map itself was an extra 2.50 on top of the 20.50 entrance fee.The zoo itself was a way out of amsterdam so you needed to get the trams or metro there. All in all I would like to say that the zoo was.... boring.

exciting~. It haven't been a zoo nowadays, so I had really fun there to see various lovely and amazing creatures. It's open space and huge so, when you are tired of being surrounded by hectic people in the city, this is the place to give you a fresh look. however it is still in the middle of the city and very east to approach. don't forget to visit the planetarium which shows short films which I loved a lot.
loved it. very easy to get to the tram takes you from central station straight to the zoo.there is so much to see and the butterfly enclosure is a must a great day out .

Loved it . Really nice zoo, they had so many different species of animals. It's very big so be prepared to do a lot of walking! Some of the animals had small enclosures: the lions and the elephants, which was a little sad to see. Very good value for money!

Make sure you go!. LOVED this zoo! We had such a great time. The zoo itself was really good and we spent half a day there walking around :) It wasn't too expensive either which was fab! We ate in the huge cafe whilst we were there which served amazing food at reasonable prices so make sure you check it out :)

Lots of animals we haven't seen before!. We visited this zoo and we were really impressed by the variety of animals there!The cafés are surprisingly cheap for lunch and drinks as well, although if you sit outside you may get your food stolen from the seagulls!The only thing I was disappointed with was the size of the lion enclosure, it seemed way too small for the lions.
Zoo zoo. As far as zoo's go this was a pretty decent one. There was a lot of construction going on which was disappointing, the constant bagging in the background.... But it was very interesting.
animal lovers. To go with children is a day with great fun (if they want to),Take some lunch and eat it somewhere in the park,Nothing better than children try to eat like some animals

Much better than our local zoo. Much bigger than our local zoo with lots of animals to see. Could get close to a lot of the animals with unrestricted views due to the minimalist fencing. Great value for money.

Not exactly world class. It's a good Zoo. But for the price it's not competitive with the Zoos in major US cities for breadth and depth of exhibits and species. If your visiting the city for less than 5 days there are many better options for your time and money.

Awesome!. Most animals are able to run pretty free, the birds especially! Was amazing to be able to interact with the animals like that. They also have a really good selection of animals including chimpanzees which I loved!!!

Bigger than expected. We chose to visit the zoo with out I amsterdam cards to try and get as much value out of them as possible.We headed over early, arriving shortly after the opening time, grabbing a quick bite to eat/breakfast in the cafe. We weren't expecting there to be as many animals with the zoo being in the city, and were surprised with the range of animals there. It was nice to be able to see the animals at eye level without many fences (they use moats to prevent the animals getting too close) we spent a good few hours here, and could have spent longer but we didn't have much time left in Amsterdam after this.My own personal concern is that the animals (especially the lions) didn't seem to have much of an outside enclosure to run around in, compared to the Yorkshire Wildlife park (when the 13 lions arrived here, they had 1 acre each) I know space is an issue, but it was nice to see the expansion works, so maybe there is something in the pipeline to give the big cats some more space.

Good place to visit, near the City. An old zoo, so the animals do not have enough space to live, but you can see the animals very well. Easy to come by walking from the city, but I did not see a parking place, if you are travelling by car.

Great historic city zoo. Not being in Artis for 15 years pleasantly surprised me!Great restored historic buildings with great exhibitions. And what an exciting world are they showing in the new Microbia; visualizing the macro world of bacteria in and around us! Superb and worth the additional entrance fee!

Excellent.. One of best zoo's I've ever been too. I was sceptical because it looks quite small but I was really impressed with how well all the animals were kept. The old buildings incorporated into the zoo is awesome. Loved walking through the monkeys. I couldn't believe they have vultures and eagles. Spent all afternoon there and would definitely go back.

Best Zoo I've Been To!. This is a great zoo! It is quite small, but has lots to see. There are some great historical buildings incorporated into the zoo, and the habitats for the animals are well thought out. The Zoo was clean, and the animals looked happy and healthy. There is even an interactive area of the Zoo where you can hang out with monkeys! This place is easy to get to and to get around. Definitely a must when in Amsterdam!

Lovely zoo. Excellent selection of animals in a very well kept zoo. Easy to pass a few hours away here and you can get closer to the animals then you can in a lot of zoo's. Only thing I didn't like was in some animals enclosures there are dead mice rabbits and chicks, can't be nice for the children to see either.

A must see zoo for kids!. My children (ages 3, 2, & 6mo) love visiting the zoo & Artis Zoo did not disappoint! We found it clean, well organized, and the exhibits allowed you to get close to the animals. Animal highlights: 2 giraffe calves, a 3 week old infant gorilla, beautiful lions, insectarium, plethora of gorgeous birds, vultures, fun mountain goat exhibit. There were also fun play areas and beautiful landscaping. We did not check out the planetarium. Admission price was slightly expensive (when compared to local museum admission, but on par with other European Zoos). You also had to pay an additional 3 euros for a map, but the money was donated towards the elephants' new exhibit.I would highly recommend and allow at least 90min.

Great Zoo. I was skeptical about visiting a zoo. I mean, seen one, seen em all. But this zoo was different. The animals looked very healthy. We arrived around feeding time and we got to see the lions being fed. Most of the animals were out and about which was lovely to see. They have a lemur land where the lemurs are free to roam. It was so cool being up close and personal. There was also a small aquarium in the zoo which was fun (and a break from the cold). The penguins were so cute and interacted with us the wolves were howling which was eerily beautiful. The zoo and animal areas were clean and well maintained. All in all a fabulous visit.

Something for everyone. Best zoo I've ever been to! So much to see. So many different types of money's including gorillas. You can also walk through one bit where the monkeys, sloths etc are swinging above your head, as well as a butterfly one you could walk through!

Worth a visit. Artis is an intersting place; it's a zoo that doesn't feel big but seems to cram a lot in. It feels spacious but at times certain bit seemed hidden away.A zoo is a zoo is a zoo in some ways and a lot of them are doing the same as ones elsewhere but with a different order but I quite liked Artis. It initially felt very enclosed but actually it was more just the layout of the place. The animals have plenty of space to live and the place seemed well kept and looked after.Had the opportunity to see the sealions being fed which was a fun if slightly wet affair as well as get to see some penguins which my wife loves.If you like such places then go, you won't be disappointed.
Best zoo ever. Great selection of animals. I loved being able to be in the room with the monkeys. Beautiful place, can't wait to go again.

Great Zoo. We got into the zoo for free with our IAmsterdam card and we arrived at 14:00 and spent 3 hours there which was plenty of time. Unlike English zoo's you can get really close to the animals which is great for photographs, there are also a large variety of different animals and an aquarium so you don't get bored! The only concerns we had were that on walking past the lion enclosure the male lion was clawing at the door trying to get back inside as the lions had been shut outside, they had been shut out so the zoo keeper could do a talk, the talk was in dutch so I'm not sure what they were saying but it seemed a bit unfair that the lions clearly wanted to get back in but were being kept out. Other than that the visit was very enjoyable.

Perfect Zoo for the whole Family!. Artis Zoo is one of the best Zoo's I have ever visited, it is huge! You don't feel cramped at all because there is SO much to see. The inside enclosure of the little monkeys, where you are literally a foot away from them, is definitely one of the best parts. The lions are great too, they are not inside any sort of barrier apart from a small stream and a wall, which is again incredible! The giraffe's and elephants are also gorgeous and given a lot of space to live/socialise in, which is always good about a zoo. Overall, would recommend to people who are visiting Amsterdam (it is just a short walk from Waterlooplein Metro Station if you need directions!) and is definitely worth the €20 entry price.

Ok. Visit to the zoo, lots of work seemed to be undertaking when we visited, some of the animals eg lions and elephants looked rather sad and the outdoor enclosure for the lions seemed rather small, watching the gorillas in their indoor enclosure was mesmerising.

Loved the zoo!!. We planned to visit Amsterdam Zoo and so glad we did, the zoo is just outside of main town about a 20 minute walk. We found the ticket price very reasonable. The zoo is very upclose and like the other reviews I have to agree that the cages seem a bit small but it did mean you can get close to the animals. We spent a good 4 hours at the Zoo and had lunch in the cafe which was very well priced and saved going out into town. Would definatly recommend the zoo.

Best zoo I've ever been to!. Artis Zoo is a fairly small but well designed zoo in a very picturesque area of Amsterdam. Entrance is included in an iAmsterdam card. The animals are kept in well designed and open enclosures and everything was very clean. The animals looked well kept and happy and there is a large variety of different types of animals to see. We really enjoyed our visit to the zoo and it was one of the highlights of our trip!

A bit upsetting . Was very concerned with the space the animals have to live in. The poor lions looked extremely bored and cramped in their tiny enclosure. Some of the the monkeys only had a stone climbing frame in the middle of a busy path surrounded by water which didn't give them much space to move around in. The zoo did look like it was making new enclosures though which hopefully will provide the animals with more space! Overall quite a disappointing trip.

Great fun with the family. Really lovely Victorian zoo, you can get very close to the animals. My two children were absolutely in their element and loved being so close to the animals. I'm sure once the continued improvements to some of the enclosures are complete it will be even better. Note common sense is required - if the sign says that the occupant bites don't stick your fingers through the fence!
A day at the zoo. We went to the zoo with our small daughter. Lot of things were under construction and the aquarium was quite disappointing.Also the entrance fee was quite expensive.

Great day out for all ages. Really enjoyed the zoo! Spent around 4 hours just walking around seeing everything! You can get really close to the animals and if you pick up the free leaflet on your way in it gives you the feeding times of some of the animals at the zoo! We managed to catch the lion feeding which is definitely worth a watch. The grounds of the zoo are also lovely to look around and the zoo is very well kept! For a small price of 2 euros you can purchase a map of the zoo which makes things easier to find and the cost goes towards the building of the new elephant enclosure. Although there is some construction this didn't ruin the day at all as still plenty to see.

Nice zoo . I enjoyed our trip to the zoo. Lots to see and some lovely animals. There were some nice designs for some of the enclosures. The only thing I was worried about is if some of the animals have enough space. I see that they are in the middle of renovations and are creating more space for the elephants which is good. The lions seemed to have a very small enclosure, unless there was more space at the back that I was unaware of?Loved the red pandas and gibbons :-)

A nice morning. We spent a nice morning here, and it helped that the weather was nice. It was quite expensive if you've visited better and cheaper zoos as we had, and I'm not sure it was value for money - perhaps take into account there is building work being done and reflect this in the price?Not a bad day out though, and definitely nice for the family

Awful conditions - worst part of my visit to Amsterdam . As others have said, the conditions the larger animals are kept in are just terrible. The lions were on a tiny patch of dirt surrounded by water, the elephants were clearly distressed and trying to go back inside (the large metal doors had been closed to keep them in their tiny outdoor enclosure), and the primates were in small cages with very little room. All of this wasn't helped by the behaviour of the visitors - everywhere I went there seemed to be groups of kids (and sometimes adults) banging on the walls of the cages and shouting at the animals to try to get a reaction. This place should be shut down - I honestly don't understand how it has such a good rating on here.

A good day out with the kids. The Artis Zoo is a good place to spend a couple of hours with the kids and easily accessible by a short tram or bike ride from the center. They are doing a lot of refurbishments at present so the only animal we could not see were the zebras but otherwise it is a good zoo, there is also a good café and children play area to stop by at half way through the visit.
Lovely zoo. Artis is a very old city zoo and I come there since the 60's. Now we take our kids there and the zoo is still very nice. We personally love the pinquins but there is really a lot to see.

Very good zoo, worth a visit. We visited the zoo in Feb 2016 as we love the zoo and always go to a zoo if there is one when we are away. It was much bigger than we expected with a good variety of animals. There was a lot of renovation work going on when we were there but the only thing that we couldn't see was the Jaguars. The place was very clean and tidy and the staff were very helpful and passionate about the animals and there job. The cafe was very good and a very striking building. If we went again we would get a tram from the center as it was a longer walk than we expected. The only downside was that some of the cages did seem a bit small for some of the animals but this was what the renovation work was for so they are addressing the issues. Also not a bad price at all for the amount you can get out of it.

Highlight of our trip!. Our children nagged us to go here and we are so pleased we did! It is really an amazing little zoo - the baby Gorilla (3 weeks old) ws an unexpected and delightful bonus and was amazing to see something so precious just a few centimetres away from us! The Forest House, where you walk through a glass house with Marmosets and iguanas roaming freely around as you wander, as well as the lemurs who are happy to pose outside next to you, really added to the excitement. The 2 cheetahs restaurant was surprisingly good value and the toasties were tasty and made to order. There is also a new children's adventure playground which was a big hit. Some of the buildings are of architectural interest and all of the animals looked well cared for and there were quite a few baby animals around, which was a treat! There is some construction work going on at the moment, so no jaguars at the moment (but the lions were v impressive!) but that didn't detract from our enjoyment. Would highly recommend a visit. It is close to the Resistance Museum, Micropia and Botanic gardens if you want to visit 3 more great attractions in the same area!
great trip. Was the best thing we did all holiday very fun trip to the zoo, do not miss out!! not a bad price either for what you get!

Money well spent! Definitely recommended . Amsterdam Zoo is awesome. You're able to get up close and personal with the animals. instead of cages, most enclosures just have a moat and wall separating the animals from visitors so it feels a lot more natural. Then there's the monkey house with monkeys jumping about above your head and alligators chilling a few feet away from you. And the best bit is the lemurs. They roam free. It was so sunny when we went and they were just lounging about sunbathing beside us. Perfect trip for anybody visiting Amsterdam, families, couples, mates, anyone. Not expensive at all for such an amazing day out :)

Amazing . This zoo was amazing, the variety of animals and the type of interactive enclosures is excellent, there were members of staff everywhere that were extremely passionate about the animals in their care and would openly explain and talk to us about anything we were interested in. I would definitely recommend coming here at any age as it really is just a fun day for all the family and is definitely one of the best zoos I have ever been to, the cafe had a range of fresh food and the hot chocolate was amazing. You can catch the 9 tram from central station and get out at Artis, the zoo is only a 2 minute walk from there.

Artis Zoo, Amsterdam. We went to the Artis Zoo with high hopes. Unfortunately there was a lot of renovation going on and there were no Jaguars (although it says there are on the guide). Also, the Savannah was unfinished and the Lions were kept in a enclosure that seemed too small. The Planetarium is not worth going to unless you understand Dutch as this is the only language that the show is available in. The high points for us were the Butterfly Pavilion, the Sea Lions, The African Hunting Dogs & the Penguins. Overall this Zoo is not the best one we have ever been to but is okay for a day out if you don't expect too much.

Noah's Arch. Though the Rotterdam zoo seemed more interesting for me,Artis zoo is very nice,for sure.Lot of animals,some interesting pavilions accommodating reptiles and other exotic creatures,butterflies flying over your head through luxuriant vegetation,an aquarium and more.You can easily spend here a half a day.At the entrance you can find Micropia and across the street Verzetsmuseum(resistance museum).All of them are free with I Amsterdam Card.

More than was expected!. We like a zoo so it's not unusual to pay the local one a visit when in a new city, so I've seen a few and Artis is right up there. It doesn't appear to be that big but don't be deceived. It's a really good mix of old and new with some clever use of old architecture and lots of new building going on. Facilities were great and we could have easily spent the whole day here. Highly recommended in rain or shine if you have a day to spare in Amsterdam.
Lovely . Lovely zoo all animals looked really happy and healthy, architecture was a bonus too. Nice cafes and all very clean and tidy.
Very good day trip!. I really enjoyed this zoo, not so big but it was really good because you could get quite close to all of the animals so that was nice!

City Break. Visited the Zoo with my girlfriend on our first day of our break away.The Zoo is really big and is great value for the money paid in. We spent 4 hours in total here. The Aquarium is a must see and its amazing with all the different types of fish. Animals were so close to you and very easy to get some nice pictures. Would certainly return.

Lovely site but extensive building work being carried out. My husband and I visited the zoo in February and despite it undergoing extensive redesigning we thoroughly enjoyed our visit. Some of the animals have been temporarily rehoused but there is still enough to see to make this a good day out. Our favourite exhibition was where the miniature monkeys, flying foxes and a selection of birds were able to roam freely. Once the building work has finished this will be an even better place to visit.

Pleasantly surprised!. Despite deciding against the zoo when booking our micropia tickets, we thought we'd give it a whirl when we got there anyway. The man at the desk kindly discounted our tickets as they would have been online with our other booking.There is some renovation work being undertaken for expansion of the elephant enclosure, though this didn't affect the overall running of the park. It seemed as though there were a few empties when we were walking around, but as it happened, many of the outdoor enclosures were linked to indoor enclosures and we saw the vast majority of the animals that were advertised.As well as the large animal enclosures, there are several houses including insects, reptiles, small mammals, birds and butterflies. Many of these have free roaming animals which really adds to the experience! We also popped into the cheetahs restaurant which sold reasonably good food at a relatively good price.Overall, a good day out. Well worth a visit if you have a few hours to spare!

Amazing!. We were really shocked about how many animals there were here! A full aquarium, reptiles, insects, sea lions, penguins, lions, monkeys, kangaroos... The list is endless!! Great day trip whilst in Amsterdam:)

Artis the zoo of Amsterdam. One of the oldest city zoo's in the world. This zoo is soo special I love it and really think you have to visit it because it had a nice history.
Try to go monday till friday not so crowded.
Lovely animals in a lovely setting. Zoo is free with the I Amsterdam card. Very close to the tram stop. Lovely setting with a variety of animals. Zoo is currently being upgraded.
Fabulous. We spent a fun morning in Artis almost by accident and really enjoyed the whole visit. Watching the elephant get a pedicure was a memorable experience.

Big zoo... Few animals.. This "zoo" was a bit of a let down. Granted we came in February and there were some renovations taking place, however we actually saw very little. If you like birds and reptiles than this would be excellent for you to visit. However, other than these animals we saw very little. My wife and I walked around for hours and each time we got to an enclosure it was empty and I felt like it was a waste.Such a shame as we had visited "Micropia" which I thought was excellent, and I would highly recommend this part of the zoo.
Super cool. To be honest my first time in Zoo and I was soooo happy that we choose this one. We spend there around 4 h exploring everything what Artis Zoo can give us.

Wonderful zoo!. Arrived fresh off the plane and straight onto a train then a tram to Artis zoo.Stopped at the cafe at the entrance for 4 cheese rolls,2 tea and 1 water €15.Then off round the zoo, very relaxing with lots of animals to see.The monkeys were funny, the seals adorable and we loved the wolves howling at the sky.Nice little kids playground in the middle allowing mums and dad's feet a rest.Made our way to the planatarium, watched a show in Dutch which all though we hadn't a clue what was said we enjoyed very much. It was so relaxing we nodded of. (Well it was an early flight!)Really enjoyed the zoo, used our I amsterdam card do can't comment on price but was very pleased with our visit.

Unique zoo. My boyfriend and I visited the zoo on a city break to the city of Amsterdam. We loved every moment, great view of all the animals. The monkey house was our favorite as they are left to roam free swinging through the trees as you walk through the plantation. There were also sloths here. Cannot wait to visit again in Easter maybe.

AMAZING!!. We came here after we checked out of our rooms, the lovely ladies behind the payment counter took our suitcases so we could comfortably walk around and enjoy our time. There are rooms where you can go in where tiny monkeys are roaming free and so are huge lizards (cant remember what they were aha) and then there are bird rooms and butterfly rooms! Other than that there are lions which were very active, some hilarious gorillas which we must have been watching for 30 minutes and many many more beautiful animals! We only spent 3 hours here and could have honestly done with so much more time, but it was amazing to visit on our last day before our flight!

Loved it. Every animal you could ever imagine is here! And you can walk around with some monkeys, spent about 4 hours here, the first bit where you can go in with loads of animals including a sloth/Owls/lizards/monkeys/birds is really amazing

One of the most Excellent Zoos I have ever visited. An excellent Zoo. One of the best I have visited. Great range of animals, not in cages and all open air. If you love zoos then this is a must when visiting Amsterdam.

Good day out for all ages!. Went with my boyfriend on our first trip to Amsterdam. It wasn't anywhere near as Rotterdam zoo but its still a great place, a variety of animals and a cafe there that sells pretty nice snacks too! Tickets were good value for money and I'd definitely go again!

Surprising . We visited on the 11th February and on first impressions it looks rather small but don't let that fool you.Whilst we was there a lot of construction work was in progress but that didn't stop us from enjoying our visit. The zoo is very well laid out and clean. The animals look happy enough. I must say it's the first time I've visited a zoo were the lions don't have a wire fence all around the enclosure, so some good photo opportunities. (Chest high wall and moat instead) We visited the restaurant in the middle of the zoo and decided to have a burger and fries because they looked good, unfortunately because we had waited 15mins and the queue hadn't moved we just left. But it did look good! So be prepared to wait for burgers they cook them fresh for you.Staff are friendly as I've found all the Dutch people are, the staff here look happy and proud.Facilities are good, well worth a visit!

For animal lovers. It is the oldest zoo in Netherlands, I spent a full day in the zoo, it is huge and there is a whole a bunch of animals, I loved the place and once I have kids I will take them there.

Excellent way to spend a day. We really enjoyed the zoo. At first we thought it seemed pretty small but it took us a few hours to get round everything. There was a lot of construction taking place and therefore a couple of animals were missing (which we were not warned about before we bought tickets or entered) but overall I still really enjoyed it.One thing that we did not like however was that the aquarium closes at 4pm, 1 hour before the zoo closes. Another visitor complained and was simply told it closes earlier to allow staff time to clean the floors. Again we were not advised of this, had we known this we would have tackled the aquarium first. Visitors should be warned of this to allow them to take this into account. This ruined the trip for us because my other half was very excited about seeing the aquarium.Overall it was good. They should consider improving their communication and warning customers when they are buying tickets regarding missing animals, parts of the zoo that close earlier etc.

Fairly disappointing experience due to how much maintenance was going on. As soon as we entered the zoo we noticed how much maintenance was going on, with over half the animals not on display due to their enclosures being renovated. In my opinion the Zoo should be closed at this time of year if they want to close off half the zoo to do refurbishments as it was a waste of money. We weren't able to see any of the main animal attractions (Lions/elephants) which was disappointing. Staff in the cafe were very rude and unhelpful. Probably a better place to visit in the summer when all the attractions are open.

Big zoo with lots to see and new attractions coming. We had a good time at the zoo. It's pretty big and it's nice to see that some of the animals aren't caged like in America. Rather, they have motes around their 'enclosures' and it feels more wild, I guess you could say. The butterfly house was the biggest, coolest and most exhilarating one of its kind that I have been to anywhere. I loved it. I could have stayed there all day. Everything was really clean and the employees were all really nice. $20 per person was a bit more than I've paid anywhere else to get into a zoo, but it was worth it. Also, if you get the 'I AMSTERDAM' card, you get in here for free. It's interesting that this amazing zoo is in the middle of the city. You don't feel like it. And I can't wait to come back for the 'big cat' (cheetah?) exhibit they are building.
small and cute. loved going there for my birthday, great animals, very clean and very nice atmosphere. I particularly liked the butterflies section.

Loved it. This is my opinion, i come from a very small island so this zoo was fascinating for me! I loved every second of it! So many animals took us 3 hours to see them all, very very clean place! And allows you to take photos! Would recommand for family and couple trips
Relax in an zoo with atmosphere still from the 1870"s.. Artas is an old zoo but constantly improving and redecorating. Fun for children and adults alike. The aquarium is worth a separate visit.
VISIT ARTIS. It is the oldest Zoo of The |Netherlands and very nice for childeren and also for grown ups.In the summer the Zoo is also available to visit in the evening.

An Average Zoo, With Potential to be Good-ish. A large zoo that is definitely worth a visit due to its huge aquarium and large array of wildlife. The problem I have with the zoo is with its inconsistency in regards to the care of its wildlife. Some enclosures were very well put together and seemed to satisfy all the needs of the animal(s) in question. However many of the enclosures were terribly small, for the example the Lion, Jaguar and Elephant enclosures.

Great Zoo. Loved the zoo so much. Our zoo at home doesn't offer much, so to be able to see things like elephants, giraffes and wolves in real life was unbelievable. Loved every second, the only thing is it some of the enclosures are rather small, so was a little sad to see. Great day out for animal lovers

Not big, but much to offer.. The Amsterdam Artis Zoo is definitely not the biggest zoo you'll visit. But despite it's size it has a wide range of animals in quite good conditions. Also the fact this zoo is in the centre of Amsterdam is a huge benefit. Drinks and food can be a bit expensive, but reasonable.

Good variety of animals to see. Very small space to move around for certain animals like elephants. But apart from that there was a really good variety of interesting and beautiful animals. The reptile room was cool especially. Easily accesible by tram. Good neighbourhood
Best zoo ever. Great zoo. Arrived there in a canal boat. Plenty of attractions in side. Loved the butterfly house- felt I was in an animation..

Amazing and built in middle of city. We took the kids here in july when we visited . Lots of animals to see and feeling of being away from the bustle of the city was nice for couple of hours. The highlight was the gigantic alligator biggest ive ever seen could easily spend a full day here with the kids restuarants throughout the zoo too. worth a visit

Cute . Zoo was super cute. I have a fascination with zoo's and seeing animals so me and my boyfriend try to visit one wherever we go! Tonnes of animals and you get great views of them. Only thing is that I was disappointed I didn't get to see the sloth, but that can't be helped!

Great zoo. Lovely zoo, a lot of it was closed off when we went due to maintenance work (which is totally understandable and obviously needed) however it would have been nice to have been informed before this. The animals are well looked after the butterfly house is fantastic as is the aquarium. A nice respite from the city.

Lots of things to see!. Visited on a miserable, rainy day but still had a lovely visit, especially considering there are quite a few buildings to go inside with animals and other creatures living in them, the aquarium was great! I loved the butterfly enclosure as well. There are a lot of different animals to look at and they all look very well looked after. Definitely visit this zoo if you can while in Amsterdam!It is easy to get to, it was on the same tram we used to get to our hotel (Tram 9). It cost 40 euros for 2 adults and I think that's okay value! I imagine it's even better in the summer, especially as they are doing renovations at the moment. Would love to go again some time in future!

Value for money.. Lovely day out, and for €20 pp, not badly priced. Lots of animals to see up close and personaly. There are buildings dotted about one of them has an aquarium inside, it's amazing, so many different fish and the building its self is beautiful. Well worth a visit.

Fun day had . Really enjoyed the majority of this zoo. There are renovations going on so it's nice to see further improvements in enclosures for the animals. The lions had a tiny enclosure though which was sad. Lots of species here to see. We got to see a 6 day old baby gorilla which was amazing. There was a really smelly indoor enclosure where you see squirrels and little monkeys and they may jump on you, but didn't stay long as the smell made me want to be sick. The aquarium is in the most amazing building, so beautiful. There is also some pieces there which are more like museum items & a giant whale skeleton. Lots of good things to see here. Didn't eat so can't comment on the food. The gift shop was lacking a little. Good price for what you get to see and the time you will spend here. I must have been there approximately 3 hours. Really enjoyed my visit.
Nice little zoo. If you spend more than 2 days in Amsterdam, this is a nice place to visit, especially the aquarium is beautiful. Some cages are rather small.

Nice zoo, bit outdated. We went here with our family and daughter. Nice zoo for kids, some animal places have been updated, but there are also still quite a few animal places from the old days. Looks a bit sad at some times.

poor animals. I felt so sorry for the animals in small enclosures, the lions were in a very small space. The cafe is well done and clean (good hot chocolate) nothing to tell you about individuals animals i.e. in here we have bob and lisa etc' . If it wasn't on our package deal I would have felt cheated!

Good but Rotterdam's is much better. Well, there are a lot of animals. Best part is that some animals run around you freely. They are not dangerous, and there is a guard. They are also situated in one position so if you don't like that, don't go there. But, if you are near, go to Rotterdam's zoo, it's much better.

Very nice zoo, excellent aquarium. Artis Zoo is a good, interesting zoo. On a chilly, damp day in January, it was not busy and some areas of the zoo were getting winter maintenance, but it was still worth the visit. It is a very old zoo, and the Victorian vintage structures are fascinating. Animals are well cared for, and there are obvious efforts to keep the animals healthy and happy. The real treat is the aquarium, but perhaps that was because it was a place to warm up. It is worth a visit, too.

Great selection of animals but lots of renovations going on. It really is a lovely zoo with a great range of different animals and lots to explore especially for a city zoo. We spent a good few hours wandering round there's lots of inside enclosures so you can warm up for a bit on a cold January day. However what I would say is that there is a lot of renovations going on at the moment and I do think that this should be reflected in the price of a ticket with a possible reduction. But overall a great zoo (especially when all the renovations are done).
Renovation going on. Nice zoo. Pity that some enclosures are undergoing major renovation at this moment. The butterfly exhibit is spectacular and a must see, even if it's way at back of the zoo.
A must see. Went here on a rainy Sunday, the aquarium is fantastic, lots of other animals and the elephants and giraffes were good aswell.Great reptile house and knowledgeable staff.

Lovely. It was abit difficult to find the zoo as we are not from amsterdam but it was accessible by using a tram. The zoo as very big and we spend there almost 3 hours. The zoo includes aquariums. Definitely good place to visit with children.

Lovely zoo. We spent a few hours in the zoo in January and it was a lovely way to spend the day. Lots of animals and a few walk through enclosures that allow you to get closer. We used our iamsterdam card that allowed us in for free. Would recommend a visit for kids and adults.
Fun time. A wonderful zoo with many animal exhibits. Kids loved being there and a great way to break up our trip from not doing adult type activities

Great day out. Went here with a group of 5 and really enjoyed the wide range of animals, the aquarium is top notch and we spent an hour in there alone, was really close to our hotel but has easy access to trams direct to central station. Worth a visit
A Couple of Hours at the Artis Zoo. Plenty of different animals to see..a pleasant place to walk around..a little expensive to get in but overall worth a visit.

Very nice. Old-style zoo : means, maybe not be the best for animals (athough it is very well managed and maintained) but great for visitors as you can see the animals from very close.
The butterfly green house is very very nice.
Expensive parking ....

Childhood memories. I Love Artis. I have been coming to this zoo ever since i was a child. The enclosures are well kept and there are a wide variety of animals. If you visit in the spring the animals are most active. In the morning the number of visitors isn't too high. great fun for a couple of hours! Make sure to take your student card. it brings down the ticket price considerably (only 3 euros!!). Dont forget your camera! ;)

Great zoo.. very interactive . I visited this zoo in early January with my husband. We had a great time and liked the fact the zoo was very open. Although it was very cold there are lots of indoor enclosures throughout which makes it a great place to visit all year round. I'd love to come back when it's warmer. Only issue we had was a waiting time of around 30 minutes to buy tickets as there was only one person serving.
Nice zoo, very clean and good variety of animals. We spent a few hours walking around this zoo. The aquarium was really good and the adjoining micropia is definitely worth a visit
thoroughly enjoyable. We visited the zoo one morning,it wasn't too busy, and there were some amazing things to see! a very fun way to pass a few hours.

Lovely day out. I loved this zoo. For a city zoo there is so much to see! I spent a full day here and enjoyed every part! The only reason I haven't rated it 5* is some of the sizes of enclosure seem smaller than I expected. Although it seems improvements are being made. During my visit they were under taking development of new enclosures. One of those being for the elephants, which I think is required.

Loads of animals and very nice day out. Loads of animals to see, all of the info was in English so we could read and understand it. Very clean and well planned out so we could see everything. New places where under construction while we visited so it seems that more animals will be there soon as well. Defo worth a visit

We had alot of fun. Really nice zoo
Place is great for kids
Very well organized
I went in winter so some animals were hiding inside there houses
Also I believe because this was a dead season that some parts were under maintainance
We couldn't see the tigers or the lions
The butterfly section and aquaria were good.
Lovely Afternoon. Me and my boyfriend went to Artis Zoo to fill in an empty afternoon for our getaway. We had a really great time especially watching the young giraffes playing and running around.
Worth the trip. Visited this zoo twice now and will definitely be visiting again, lots of interesting things to see and do

Such a good zoo!!. We went on our last day to fill in our time before our flight and I'm so glad we did. I was a little sceptical because you see so many zoos and it can get very repetitive but this zoo is very good. I loved how some of the animals were out in the open. You don't get a lot of that in some of the other zoos I have been to!

Loads to do. This place is great for a day out as there it's lots to see and lots to do. There is also cafes and restaurants on site but they are very expensive / over priced. The enclosures in the zoo were quite small in some cases and some animals looked very unhappy so this was quite upsetting. It is still a nice place with a lovely setting.

If you're in staying in Amsterdam, visit here!. I've recently returned from a 4 day break in Amsterdam, we didn't plan on visiting the zoo initially but we're both so glad that we have. It was easy to find with the tram service and the help of Google Maps, one thing I will say is don't let the initial look/size of the zoo put you off, it may look small but we spent almost 5 hours here, it was a full afternoon out! I would recommend buying tickets from the tours and tickets shops (which can be found all over the city), if you buy more than one excursion they're very happy to discount the tickets. Overall, highly recommend and should I be in Amsterdam again, I'll definitely be back!

A couple of hours of interest. Not bad for a small city zoo, however we are more used to wildlife parks which concentrate much more on the comfort of the animals. It felt a bit cramped and to be honest, a bit old fashioned
Great little zoo. Great little zoo, just the right size for Amsterdam. Definitely worth a visit & worth the money!! Plenty of animals to see and a fab cafe too.

Lots to see!. I visited in August and it was a really pleasant experience as the sun was shining and it made the grounds look beautiful. There was so much to see, a very wide range of animals on display! I particularly enjoyed watching the baby gorilla's playing and the seals and penguins. They even had a reptile building and an aquarium. The elephants were interesting too but I couldn't help feeling that their area was a little small for such big animals. We also visited the theatre there and watched a show on space. Overall I enjoyed it and would go back again to see anything that I had missed!

Nice place.. The zoo is a little out of the way and doesn't look very big but once you're inside you can see they used the space very very well. They have a very wide variety of animals but little amenities which is a shame. It was bucketing it down when we visited but still managed to get around and see some nice exhibitions. In some of the exhibits you can get real close to the animals, my partner actually fed an animal over its wall (just leaves off the tree!) That's how close they were!

Excellent . Really loved my visit with my boyfriend, such beautiful animals present and a lot to see. It is definitely worth the money, you will not get bored as i was there for over two hours! I also took so so many photos as i was mesmerised, i loved the experience!
Nice and Big. A lot to see at this museum, its a good size and its not out the way either, they do some pretty cool things with the seals and the sloths are definitely worth seeing

Compact and fun . I like to visit the zoo when I see a city, got in free with the I Amsterdam ticket. It's a pleasant zoo and we saw the majority of our way around it in around 2 hours without feeling rushed or like we've missed out on loads. You can get up close to a lot of the animals, like almost touching penguins :) Filled with screaming kids but what's new, eh? A great day out.
Lovely Zoo :). Had a great day at the Zoo, there were lots of animals to see. not a big fan of Zoo's in general, but this was one of the best I've been too.

One of the best zoos I've been to. Zoos are a big thing for me. I go to a zoo wherever I can. This one was one of the best I ever visited. Positively a 5* experience. I went there twice in 2 years.A huge selection of animals, exhibits, and an awesome butterfly farm.Highly recommended, better in the summer.

MAYOR RENOVATIONS FOR 2016. In typical dutch fashion the Zoo is constantly changed and renovated.I hope the "metzelaarkas" tropical hothouse will open again after years of closure.Even on a dull january day ARTIS still is interesting with it,s aquarium and butterfly garden were winter seems more colorful.The wisent buffalo enclosure will be made into a wallabi-kangarou area.A new spacious jaguar cage has been build.The old 19th century large cat cages have been demolished and a large new area for asian elephants will be build here.But enough space is still left as it is.
Wonderful little zoo. Great little zoo lots of nice animals some very close encounters very enjoyable afternoon exceptional tortoise exhibitWorth the walk

A very interesting and educational place to visit. I am not a great lover of zoos, but one fine day in our week was spent at the Artis Zoo. It is very much a traditional zoo, which is currently being expanded to accommodate the animals better. Highlights were the lions, elephants and the sea-lions - whilst many other animals proved very interesting and watchable. I must admit the insect house was a little "find the exhibit" due to natures way of camouflaging - but even this was fun. The zoo was not busy on the day and we had a very reasonable and tasty meal in the cafe. A very good day out in all, but not in my top ten places to visit in Amsterdam.

Visited on a cold, wet, miserable day. We visited this attraction, mainly because it was free entry with our IAmsterdam Card. It is in quite a strange location, not where you would normally expect a zoo to be and the entrance was not very well signposted (unless we were just being a bit thick) However, the zoo itself was clean and tidy, or as much as it could be in the pouring rain in the middle of winter.....The animals looked to be well cared for and there was signs of improvement going on right around the zoo - building new enclosures for various animals. The reptile house was fab, not to mention a welcome break from the rain, as was the aquarium. All in all, I enjoyed our visit, even though it didn't stop raining, but hey ho, us Brits are used to that!!

My favourite . We visited the zoo on the 5th Jan and loved it. Although it was overcast and very chilly it did not put us off or the animals! Some enclosures were questionable due to their size (some also in construction) but overall was very impressed. Like Berlin zoo it is very surreal to hear elephants and lions in the middle of the city but we enjoyed it very much. Due to the fact we bought an Iamsterdam card we got into the zoo free as well as their exhibition Micropia (which was also very good).

Great zoo!. Although we visited on a cold January day, we were surprised to see the animals were out and about and we clearly had the place to ourselves! What a great and large zoo with a stunning variety of species. We thoroughly enjoyed it.

A hidden gem. We had a few hours spare before leaving for the airport so thought we'd have a look around the zoo which was opposite our hotel. We thought it was going to be quite small and were amazed at the size of the place. There was an aquarium, monkey house and numerous animal enclosures. The zoo is laid out in such a way that it looks very attractive and we wished we had more time there as we could not get to see everything. The cost was approx £15 per person when we went in January 2016 but you could pay extra for a map and to enter the micro exhibits. Definitely worth a visit if you want a leisurely stroll away from the hustle and bustle of the main tourist areas.

Great zoo but some questionable enclosures. Spent a good few hours walking around the zoo, felt sorry for some animals as it seems quite a concrete zoo, many hard surfaces. The lion enclosure was far too small and the male lion was pacing for a good 20 minutes back and forth. All animals seemed happy enough but more foliage and softer ground for the animals would be nice to see. big zoo and helpful staff. Loved the sloth!
So much fun. Was such a blast this zoo we enjoyed it big time. From animals to everything was just perfection!!!!

Flaming grill !. hELLO AgAiN !$ I rocked up to the zoo with my new sketchers, i then went to the butterfly sanctuary and didnt see a butterfly. we then moved on to see the baby sanctuary but they were sold out i was gutted I couldnt take one home. so went then went and found a sketchers stool and bought a new pair!!! it was wicked & epic !!!!!!! I TOOK home a leaflet to grill.thanks againtasted awesome bro !!! i dont reccomned this country --- COME @ me !!!!!

Cold, less people and lots to see. Great installations, some animals are not really good to see at this time of the year, but there are lots of animals still to see, the aquarium, the butterflies, and reptiles....the good thing of this time of the year: no queues and free views

Amazing quality of life for the animals. Artis zoo is the best zoo I have ever visited in my life. The animals look so happy and well looked after and it was so clean and very well facilitated. The staff were kind enough to hold our suitcases free of charge for us while we wondered the park (it was our last day and we had just checked out of the apartment so had everything with us)! The cafe offered a wide variety of cheeses and lovely coffee. Many of the enclosures didn't have cages; just water separating the animals from the people which I thought was really nice as it made them seem more free. There was a huge variety of animals including elephants, lions, wolves and giraffes! We visited the aquarium and the zen garden. It was a great way to spend our last day in Amsterdam!

Nice zoo with many specie. For the price (20,50€) it is a very very nice zoo, we visited this zoo in January and we spent 3 hours in it.In summer I guess that you can stay easily 5hours, there is an aquarium, insectorium and so on.Very very nice zoo I would recommend it for everybody

The BEST Zoo. I'm fairly lucky to have been to a few different zoos in my life but this one really was my favourite I've ever been to! It wasn't too hard to locate, the queues were minimal and with the iAmsterdam card you had free entry. Besides this the animals were incredible and you really could spend all day here. I hope I'll get back one day!

Health & safety concerns. Reasonable price to access the zoo.
More for families with young children.
Slightly concerned for the welfare of some of the animals - the enclosures looked dirty and dangerously small for the size of the animals. In particular, there was this monkey that was being kept on a small island surrounded by water (see pictures.)

Fun day out. This zoo is amazing! it has so many unique animals. This would be a fun day out for kids and family's. I visited Artis Zoo in winter and it wasn't really busy at all. the rain didn't really ruin the day because there is a lot of inside parts to the zoo. my favourite part is the topical butterfly house.

Great for our toddler. Came here on a family trip as an attraction which would appeal to our 15 month old daughter and for this it did not disappoint. She especially enjoyed riding round in one of the little carts which are available. There is a good range of animals in the zoo and there is a good close view of most of them. However this is partly because many of the enclosures seem far too small so we did have some reservations about the place.
Lots of animails. A lot of animails in that zoo. You can see them all and even interact with some of them. Excelent experience to have on a sunny day

Great escape. The location of the zoo is great for a escape from the ordinary and connecting with the nature. They have a good collection, lions, elephants, giraffes and.. What I really disliked about my experience was that on top of the 20.5 euros admission you had to pay an extra 2.5 euros for the map of the zoo!

Great variety on animals but the zoo can be improved. We booked this on a whim and were pleasantly surprised by the amount and variety of animals in the zoo. Appearance from the outside makes it seem small but don't be fooled as there is lots to see and do! As previous reviews have mentioned you can get quite close to animals. However, the zoo seems very dated in parts and some of the enclosures (in particular I remember the wolves and the lions enclosures) were clearly far too small for such magnificent creatures. Additionally some of the cages had clearly not been cleaned in a while and really did smell so awful I could not go near them. The staff there were lovely and lots of them are around to give you information and point you towards where you wanted to go next. I would suggest going in the morning as there were no queues and lots of the animals were being fed which was interesting to see. It is good value for money but I just hope they do something to improve the spaces for some of the larger animals. Oh and I saw a baby giraffe which was adorable so kudos to the zoo for their successful breeding programme!!

Great way to spend the afternoon . We got our tickets down the road at a corner shop for €18 each so we went straight in with no waiting. The zoo itself is nicely spaced out and most of the animals had a decent amount of room, which made a welcome change after visiting Berlin zoo in the summer. We spent about 4 hours here and had a few coffees and hot chocolates which were fairly priced. There was lots to see and a variety of animals. Highly recommend for families and couples of all ages.
Great zoo. We visited the zoo over the summer. All of the animals were pretty active and their cages seemed pretty accommodating. Plenty of variety, and overall a decent experience.
Lovely Zoo. This is a great zoo, it has a lot of very varies animals. It's good value for money and even when busy there is a large area so most of the time it's not too congested.

Amazing!! . Came here Boxing Day with my partner, one of the greatest zoos we have ever been to, by far the best!It is a little pricey however this experience was greatGreat for families, friends and couplesIf I came to Amsterdam again I would go againMaps are €2 each, we didn't bother as we thought we would get around good, big mistake! I would get a map!

Varied Zoo. This zoo was much bigger than any I have been to in the UK. The giraffes and lemurs were the most interesting to watch. I agree with the others about the cramped conditions.Also the queuing system is so bad. You queue up to get your tickets then have to go back and join the end of a queue to actually get in. People just wander about pushing in front.

A positive surprise. We had read very mixed reviews about this zoo and were pretty reserved when going, but left with a smile on our face. The zoo is pretty small by overall size, but it has many different things to see and spend time with. The animals are very close to you and there are almost no cages and bars or any obsticles, so you get a good view from every angle. Hope to come back in summertime next time!

Good day out. We walked from Leidseplein and it took about 25mins, was busy but still got to see everything, lots of different animals to see and you can get close to a lot of them, would recommend it for a nice day out

Recommended for animal lovers. Originally, we weren't so sure about visiting another zoo but we took advantage of a sunny day and decided to use one of our HollandPass tickets Looked up the map and figured out which tram to ride, it drops you off just 2 blocks away from the entrance. Also, if I remember correctly, you can go straight to the entrance and they will accept the HollandPass tickets - no need to use them to get an actual zoo ticket (we probably wasted 20 mins in line). This zoo is a bit different in that you can get really quite close up to some of the animals. We enjoyed our visit more than we expected to, we must have spent about 2.5 hours there (we were in a hurry).

The best with small kids. In Amsterdam city you will find this lovely small city zoo. Charming setup with lovely ambiance auch as the historic buildings and nice garden arrangements. We go quite often and never get bored. Don't miss lemur island, sealions, aquarium, small mamals, elephant indoor housing, monkey/iguana housing left to monkey rick at entrance. Skip all the family buffet restaurants and eat outside the zoo at the plantage restaurant.

Good day out. Planetarium included in price,fun and relaxing although in Dutch.lemurs roaming free,amazing vultures,well set up.can spend several hours there,lots of space with seats and tables for picnics.

Nice zoo to visit. If you have time this perfect organised zoo in Amsterdam it's a place to visit.Hopefully you'll find good weather and warm temperature.It's a good way to relax yourself and to spend a couple of hours.

Enjoyable Visit. My wife ,two year old and I visited here on Christmas Day, definitely something different to do on this day. It's a nice sized zoo that's very manageable to get around. You really get to see all the animals up close and our child really loved the sea lions. The restaurants are average. Only thing I would disagree with is paying for a map of the zoo, I think this should be free as you pay enough to get in.

Romantic trip to zoo . We had a great time here and for 20 euros each was good value for money as we spent hours walking around. We went in December which was good as the crowds weren't too big. Would go again

Fun, Clean, Beautiful. My family of 5 to include 3 children ( 18, 10, 12) really enjoyed this zoo. It is easy to navigate around, was a nice size ( we did the whole zoo in 3 hours to include lunch) and clean. The restaurant was pretty nice ( sandwiches, burgers, fries). The aquarium is in a really neat building. We walked from central station in about 20 minutes.

Wow, what a surprise!. This zoo was amazing! There was a huge variety of animals that were easy to see. They appeared happy and they had room to move about. There was a new baby giraffe to see along with 5 other giraffes. Along with the animals there was an aquarium, an insect house, reptiles and a butterfly house. There was also a planetarium that held viewings in Dutch every hour.There were places to buy food and areas to picnic.We spent a whole day there.
Expected more care with the animals. It's a good zoo, with a big variety of animals. But the down point for me was seeing many dead birds in one of the birds cage. Pretty much ruined it for me.

The best zoo I have ever seen my whole life. I recommend visiting This zoo It's one of the best zoo I have visited my whole life It's really amazing You can see all kinds of animals and there are also different kinds of butterflies.And you need half a day (or less than half a day) to see everything and take some pictures also It's simply worth-visiting

Fabulous zoo! . The zoo is a short tram ride away from the centre of Amsterdam and cost us about 2.50 euros each to get there! It was simple to find! The zoo itself is brilliant with live shows and displays at intervals throughout the day! What a lovely zoo!

zoo fun. Interesting zoo, some animals like lions and forthcoming cheetahs don't have enough room but that's city zoos for you. Butterfly enclosure brilliant, as was bird house with stuff flying around your head and scuttling round your feet. open lemur area well cute. planetarium good. micropia worth the visit.

Great visit! . Going to the zoo has always been one of my favourite outings as I love animals, and so does my boyfriend. Coming to Amsterdam and hearing good things about the zoo meant we couldn't give it a missFirstly, the zoo is a reasonable price about €20... What you would expect from any zoo in the UKHowever, the zoo was fantastic!! We spent 5 hours walking round... There is an aquarium, reptile centre, insect centre and lots of fantastic animals including lions giraffes and elephants. What I most loved about the zoo is that not everything is fenced up like in England. It is a lot more open and it's easier to see and take photos of the animals. It was a brilliant day out :) Location is pretty easy to find, just take a tram into the centre then get on tram 9 to take you to Artis zoo

Peaceful and beautiful . This is by far one of the most tranquil zoo experiences ive ever had. A far cry from the screaming child insanity of American zoos, the artis is a study in peaceful interaction with some very well-kept animals in a gorgeous setting.

Loved it . I recommend for family with children and for romantic couples and elderly couples , they sell phone you can feed the animals and also I recommend of charging the camera and getting an extra memory card.

Amazing zoo :) best day. My fiance and I had the iamsterdam cards which included a free visit to the zoo We got the tram straight from the Anne Frank house feeling a bit down after an emotional experience there..The zoo cheered us right up. So many animals..some very up close.. Massive zoo .. we stayed around 2 hours but you could easily take your time and stay alot longer.. definitely recommend for everyone.

a great zoo, wonderful for kids. you can spend a whole day at this beautiful zoo. it's not best I have seen, it's not the most organized. but for a family it's great with lots and lots animals to see. it's just the right size and has just the right amount of different attractions. the only thing I didn't like is the too few explanations.

Very pleasant. There are expanding the zoo to give the animals more space so there was some construction traffic and paths blocked off when we visited, so be prepared not to go round in the order you originally intended.

One of the best Zoos. This zoo is great. It's different to the other zoos I've been to in the UK. It's actually much bigger than we expected and it's designed really well. We did miss a few animals wandering around, but double back to find them. The elephants were playing football and sounded so happy! Great experience we won't forget seeing that! The butterfly garden is really cool and you'll never be that close to them, such detail. I can't recommend this zoo highly enough! Also visit Micropia next door! It's part of the zoo, but separated entrance fee. It's worth it for a unique experience you won't have had before!
FABULOUS . Had a really good time with my partner, beautiful zoo with a great cafe/reateraunt on the canal located mid walk round. Great selection of animals too. Would definitely recommend.
Amsterdam Zoo. a great place to go if you have children and spend a great time. Great animals and great environment...

Loved the zoo and exhibit . We went when an exhibit called micropeia was on and we spent about 3/4 to almost our whole day at the zoo. It is well worth it as you get to walk through open air exhibits and see some animals right up close. The butterfly exhibit is amazing. Beware there is some construction going on but it does not, in my opinion hinder the experience! Also there is a touching tribute with flowers to one of their baby elephants who passed away.

The best zoo!. We were unsure that this park can fill 4 hours of our time, we ended up sorry that we didn't have full day dedicated for it.The animals act like they are in their nature environment, there is a lot to see!You may skip "micropia" it's little bit boring to someone whom unfamiliar with this things.

Nice few hours to spend!. A lot to see in, the zoo is located in the south east of the city not on big area.You should take the feeding times. The admition was 20€. You shouldn't miss the family of lamours, the seals, wolves. Very good with children, the animals are well kept.
Plenty to keep the family busy. Great place,was included free admission with the iam Amsterdam card,took plenty of photo,s,kids 13&11 both agreed that it was one of their highlights
