Aquarium included in the price!. This zoo is in a lovely leafy location of Amsterdam with lots of different animals to look at as well as an aquarium, reptile centre, butterfly house & sea lion pool :)
Lots to see. This zoo is surprisingly packed with a good range of animals. Nice cafes are spread around the zoo and the exhibits are large and full.
Great Day Out! Amazing Value. Had a great day here. So many animals to see and great learning experience too. Check out the timed programs. Animals well looked after and the place is very clean.
Amazing. The zoo was ok but entering into the butterfly building well that was like being part of a nature programme,the butterflies are everywhere landing on you,awesome place to visit

So much fun. I loved that zoo, its like the took part of the forest and made it a zoo not the opposite. So clean and the animals are beautiful and full of diversity. It was my first time to see a sea horse.

A brilliant zoo. Great zoo in the heart of the city. We really enjoyed our visit despite it being rather cold (well, it was November), it has many of the big ticket animals - elephants, lions, giraffe etc - and the indoor exhibits are super with walk-in enclosures with small animals and birds and a butterfly house too! You can easily spend all day here, our faves included the red pandas who were really friendly and the cheeky young gorillas. The zoo is also beginning the process of building a nice new home for the elephants who's space is currently lacking currently.

Butterfly Pavillon a MUST. The Amsterdam Zoo 'Artis' is one of the oldest Zoo's in Europe. It has a very remarkable history because during World War 2 it was a place where people could hide from the German's. Today the Zoo has many very beautiful new additions but the most wonderful experience is the Butterfly pavillon. Huge blue and green butterflies fly around your head or come and sit on your shoulder while you walk around in a little jungle. It is a small exotic journey, as if you are in paradise. And don't forget to visit the lovely restaurant De Plantage

A pretty nice city zoo. I love exploring Amsterdam by foot. It's a bit of a hike (maybe a half hour) from the Damrak over to the Artis Zoo and Aquarium, but it's a good stroll on a sunny day. The entry fee is inexpensive and there's plenty to see and do with the family. The butterfly pavilion is a pleasant place and the Aquarium is one of the oldest and best informed in all of Europe. It was even nice to see the local flora and fauna of aquatic life living in the canals of the city exhibit. The zoo portion is reminiscent of the NYC or the DC zoos. It's family friendly and a nice place to spend the day.
spacious. The zoo if nicley spaced out. A lot of animals that seem in good health and a great environment. We had the iamsterdam card so entrance was free.

Close encounters. Loved been up close to lemurs and monkey's. Had a sloth climbing over my head. Really close to pelicans and lots of them. Enjoyed watching the lemurs hop over each other and come very close- what a noise when screeched! Great that you see and photograph everything without big barriers

Very nice zoo. Animals were all well kept and happy, not much staff on hand however. Aquarium is lovely, and the zoo itself is housed in some fairly historical buildings. Great variety and all well looked after.

Loved it! . This is a huge zoo with a great variety of animals, however there were a lot of constructions going on, was hard to navigate around that aswell as a few enclosures looking too small for their animal, it was informative and I enjoyed browsing the various houses.
Highly recommended. Went here with our 3 kids ages 7,5 and 3. They loved it. Great day out. Close to the city centre. Lovely places to eat. They can't wait to return.

Nice to see. I highly recommend the aquarium and butterflies section.
Other than that the Zoo seems quite average to me.
Beautiful. The Zoo is beautiful..and all the animals are very well taken care of. Planetarium is a must do! very cool experience overall!

Variety !!. The main displays are really superb - open, visible, and animals kept in apparent comfort. But the real treat are the special sections - the insectarium, the reptile house, the aquarium, the butterfly garden, the planetarium, and the primate area. I try to visit zoos in every city i go to, and have to say this was the best I have ever seen !!
A great and friendly place. We were allowed to visit the newborn giraffe - the staff were so friendly and concerned in a nice way. Great playgrounds for children.

Always a lovely time. Artis is a pretty nice zoo in Amsterdam city center. it is wonderful to walk around or even picnic. they are remodeling a lot to give the animals more space which is nice. In my opinion the ticket price is a bit much, but I guess they do not receive government funding like other countries. We've been a few times to this zoo. December is actually a nice time to visit, as long as it is not raining. All the animals were pretty active and there were no crowds compared to summer months .

Fun day out in the zoo!. Being the oldest zoo in Netherlands and the one in the main tourist city, artist never failed to impress the visitor. My son loves animals and Artist zoo is the perfect place for small children. The size is perfect, they have all kind of animal and a lot of indoor places for rainy days. The butterfly room is my favorite and my son loves the gorilla and seal pool. The restaurant is situated next to the zebra and giraffes with big playground. Will sure comeback here again.

Exceeded our expectations. What a great zoo we didn't know existed until we purchased our I AMsterdam city card. Great selection of animals giraffes being my favorite! As well as reptiles, insects and butterflies. Monkeys that are free to roam an enclosure and you can get close to! This zoo is not just for kids!!

Amazing . It poured down with rain the whole visit but soon forgot about the weather. Beautiful place in the middle of a residential area. Animals well looked after and clean. For €20 it is well worth it you could stay all day. There is a reasonable price cafe but not much choice on menu. Lots of green area's for a picnic if you choose. There's elephants, porcupines,lions, giraffes and beautiful red cuddly pandas. Animal lovers paradise and even a resident cat keeping nice and warm in gorillas enclosure. Now I just need a house next door to watch the animals every day.

Typical Zoo. I have been to a lot of Zoos when travelling and this zoo is nothing too out of the ordinary. Although next door there is "Micropia" which is a zoo for bacteria, this was one of the best parts of my trip.

Good value and Beautiful. Went to the Artis in the pouring rain! Because of this, it was quiet and we got to see the huge variety of exhibits and wildlife the zoo has to offer. Very very good price for the amount of things we got to see. Was undergoing some maintenance whilst we were there so we'll have an excuse to come back! Zoo is large but everything is quite close together with cafes and seating in excess. Also has a planetarium which was an interesting bonus, however the shows are in Dutch so don't expect to understand! Interesting all the same. Favourite part was the beautiful aquarium and zoo history museum; really made us appreciate the age and popularity of the zoo. Must see for anyone in Amsterdam long enough. Would have probably been there all day if it wasn't for the weather but in total we probably spent about 4 hours there including lunch

Not the zoo we were expecting... . Although we visited the zoo 'out of season' we wouldn't have ever expected to see what we did. Building work going on around the zoo with loud bangs and drilling echoing across the grounds. Some of the most exciting enclosures were having work done on them and this wasn't mentioned when we were handing over our €40 at the entrance.The most upsetting thing about this zoo was the keeping of some of the animals. The monkeys looked unhappy and bored, the lions had a grey, dull enclosure with a lack of any greenery and the gorillas were laid around in their miniscule enclosure with nothing to play with. Most of the animals looked unkempt and in poor condition. I understand that zoos are for keeping animals but in 2015 I don't believe there is a place for this type of Zoo as a tourist attraction. As a comparison, we visited a zoo in Basel, Switzerland last year which was brilliant.

Impressive!. U should definitely visit Artis. This amazing place is so huge, it took us 4 hours to see almost everything there. And we were so impressed by the architecture of all the buildings that's so lovely. U will visit also the artis aquarium, and it's just a peace of heaven under water. U feel like snorkeling :D When we bought the tickets, we took Artis map also, it's sold for 2 euros, and it's worth it, the funds are going for an elephants protection organism.

1st time in Amsterdam 26/11/15. While in amsterdam wanted to do something interesting besides coffee shops of course so i decided we and my wife should visit the zoo since we adore animals. We entered the park at 9am and left at 3pm. There is so much to see and i think if ur in amsterdam this is a must!!!!!!! So much to see and enjoyed it to the last bit. All animals are well treated.

Fun and enormous . Prepare to set aside a day for this as the place is rather large. There is something for absolutely everyone- your usual lions, giraffes etc, a large aquarium featuring the largest Croc I've seen, a bug house, a bird house; the place has everything. There is currently some construction going on but it didn't take away from the experience. Watch out for the trees full of Herons

Loved it!. We weren't planning to go to the zoo, we had planned to go to Micropia and saw that there was a combined ticket. Even though there was a lot of winter upgrades being performed there was loads to see. Personal favourites were the aquarium, indoor mammal section and insect house.

Absolutely gorgeous. My husband and myself walked from the Leidseplein to Artis Zoo, it was an amazing walk through Amsterdam! Artis zoo is the most fascinating zoo I have ever been to. The exhibits blend into the natural landscape and it seems as if they have always been there. The aquarium was my favorite exhibit, the building is incredibly old And beautiful.
Open air zoo. The zoo is well situated and easy to get to by tram. Really like how the monkeys have open space to rain in and the route is quite easy to follow.
Very good city zoon. This had just the right access to the right animals and exhibits to keep a 4 year old well entertained for a couple of hours. A great late afternoon stop, and easy to access.

Nice half day out. I visited the zoo same time last year and it was nice to see that work and progress is actually taking place there. To some people it would look slightly like a building site (empty cages, barricaded areas) but to me I can see that they are improving the park and moving animals into bigger areas which is good. Lots of interesting animals and a lovely setting.

Not great.... The only reason we went to this zoo is because entry was included in our city card that we had earlier purchased. Its not a massive zoo and to be honest the one thing that put me off more than anything was the size of the enclosures for the animals, they were tiny. If i returned to amsterdam i would not return here even if it was free.
A Good Zoo. This is a big zoo, with lots to see, the aquarium had many tanks, one especially showing how the fish help to keep the canals clean. I'm sure in the summer it gets very busy.

Great Zoo. Visited Amsterdam in Jan 2013. This Zoo is great for a visit, kids would love it. We didn't have to pay an entrance fee because we had purchased the "Iamamsterdam" card. You get bus, tram and underground+ discounts into places, some are even free:-) :-) You can easily spend several hours here. Really enjoyed our visit.
Brilliant!!. Very good price for all the attractions in this zoo. Very clean and lots to do!!! Easy to find. Really enjoyed it! Great for all ages

Fantastic zoo. A must do in Amsterdam. Really enjoyed this zoo. It has a good selection of animals and very well laid out. For me, I enjoy taking photos of the animals and the enclosures are very well designed for this. The food in the restaurant was good and very competively priced along with the entrance price. Highly recommended.
Awesome Zoo !. I spent half day here with my friends, and it was awesome ! Very nice and awesome aquariums !I love it !One of the best zoo !!!

Very good day out with kids. Artis is great to go with your kids for a whole day out. It is quite expensive and it is actually massive so do take a whole day to enjoy it all.In the middle of the zoo they have a nice canteen with a rather big play round next to it, so you can take a quick break. We tried to do it in a half a day, and felt that we missed alot of things.

A fun day out in the rain. We spent the whole day here! the weather was not great but it was perfect to do in the rain! It is a family-friendly zoo. All the pathways are tree-lined with landscaped botanical gardens in the Plantage. There are hundreds of species of animals to see. The animals are all in spacious enclosures and we got to see elephants, gorillas, zebras, giraffes, meerkats and antelopes. There is childrens playground and restaurants. There is a butterfly sanctuary and aquarium.The zoo is open daily from 9am to 5pm, but opens until 6pm in April to October. Admission costs €19.95 for adults, €16.50 for children ages 3-9. Free entry for those under 3. You can get a tram to the zoo also.

Very good day!. You can buy a single ticket for the zoo for 20 euros or one for the zoo and another microbiology thing for 27 euros. My friends and me bought the single zoo ticket and had a really good day. The zoo is really big and a nice walk round. There's a wide variety of animals, more than the zoo back in Edinburgh and they also have a huge aquarium which I really loved. They have seprate buildings for the chimpanzees, gorillas, insects, reptiles and butterflies which made the experience even better. The one criticism that has to be made was the size of the lion enclosure in particular. There were around 4 lions and they didn't have any running space really which was disappointing. However overall a really nice day and would be ideal for a family day trip when in Amsterdam!

Very nice zoo.. Located in a good area, very clean zoo. A lot of the animals were not about but that is due to weather. Very nice location i must say and the layout of the zoo, smoke and enter!.. the restaraunt next to the giraffes is VERY good TRUST me

Excellent selection of attractions over a very wide area. My wife and I were thoroughly impressed by our visit to Artis Zoo; Loads of enclosures, indoors and out, and a great way to spend most of a day. They're in the process of renovation so some parts of the zoo are somewhat less.. scenic than others, but we had a great time. My wife is a huge fan of bats so was overjoyed to see them in the very first indoor area we entered. There are a number of cafes inside the site, and all are reasonably priced.

Somewhat underwhelming. Having read lots of reviews about how good the Artis Zoo is, I had high expectations of my visit. However, I was generally quite disappointed. Although there are a fair number of good enclosures, my general impression was of a preponderance of concrete. I was particularly disappointed by the lion and tiger enclosures - small and cramped, with little tree cover and no real opportunity for the animals to exercise properly. The Japanese snow monkey has been lauded online as cutting edge - I fail to see how a concrete pyramid with virtually no vegetation can be described as such.On a positive note, the great ape and the African plains exhibits are good examples of what can be done if some thought is put into enriching the animals' lives.If people want to visit a good Dutch zoo, I would recommend the Burgers Zoo, near Arnhem, instead.
amazing . here i got one of my best shots ever .. the design of the place and so many thing like the lighting for the aquariom ..

An golden oldie.. It was a long time ago that I was here. And you can see that they are still renovating the place. Still alot of animals and insects, big aquariums with water life. The only down side was the planatarium, which is turned in a restaurant now, and only. And Andre Kuiper, who grew up in the neighbourhood is barely mentioned.

Great big zoo. I loved the zoo, but then I love animals. There are loads of different species for you to see and plenty of things going on. Feeding times are particularly fun. We went on a Sunday so it was packed but you could still see everything on offer.

A refuge for the child inside you. I love this place. Unlike the zoos in India, this place looked like some place where the animals were happy. I could spend all day watching all kinds of animals going about their daily routine, playing, eating or just plain lazing around. And I actually did spend almost an entire day at the Artis.

5 time there. One of the best zoo, if you like to take pictures or just to walk. I was there for 5 times and all I can say, don't buy souvenirs - buy a ticket.You will find few bars inside (indoors and outdoors) get some beer and enjoy the view.

Good afternoon out. I always struggle to review zoos, especially as the criteria involved in the rating process goes something like this:-- Lots of animals - check.There was a lot to see which was good and takes a few hours to get through at a steady pace. They have an exotic fish section which was nice to see and provided a nice reprieve from the showers we were walking through whilst outside.I can't remember the Chimps' names, but they put on a good show of play fighting and pelvic thrusting to the crowds watching.The on-site restaurant actually served edible food which was a welcomed change to the usual boil in a bag and microwave crap I have come to expect at zoo cafés.Good for a nice walk around with your partner or a young family.

This zoo is exceptional.. We visited here in October 2015, this zoo is huge. We spent hours walking around without a map and got lost several times. You get to walk through an area with different animals all around you (bats, lizards, a tiny monkey species).Elephants, lions, gorillas, giraffes (a new baby giraffe as well), pelicans, flamingoes, crocodiles, camels, penguins and snakes.Well worth the visit.

Decent. It's a decent zoo but after visiting Berlin more recently it pales it comparison!I may be biased as it was a rainy day when I stopped by, but all in all, it's reasonably priced with a good variety of animals.

Great zoo but needs more upkeep. Some aspects of the zoo were brilliant. There was a rainforest experience enclosure where you walked through and bats, monkeys, birds, reptiles and sloths had free roam. The restaurants were nice and modern and it was nice to see a variety of animals. There was lots of info provided on the animals too.However some enclosures needed a lot of maintenance. Some were dirty and water needed changing, etc. A lot of the enclosures seemed to small for the animals, especially the lions. That quite upset me as they looked so miserable and the enclosure was tiny for the 4 lions I could see. There were also very few staff seen about and keeper talks are in Dutch, so English speakers be warned. Other than that, a pleasant and interesting experience!

Great Zoo!. I must say, the Artis Zoo is one of the better zoos i have been to. It is quite a wide area with plenty to see. Some enclosures are indeed open concept and it is quite an interesting experience. Easy to get to from Amsterdam Central (by tram).

Nice place. We have read that in this zoo you can touch animals, because they are not in cells, they walk around zoo. But when we came, there were only a few birds running around, all animal in the aviarys. Have to admit, thar aviarys are built in such a way, that you can see animals better. In general, very beautiful place, definately worth to visit with kids or just to relax and enjoy the nature.
Very good!. A very good zoo with a wide variety of animals. Staff are very friendly & passionate and all questions were answered.

Great zoo, amazing butterfly jungle. Artis Zoo is a very nice place to visit on one of your days in Amsterdam. Inside the zoo you can find all kinds of animals and different exhibits. The most recommended experience was the butterfly jungle area, where you are suddenly transported to a humid jungle full of amazing butterflies. It has an almost surreal feeling to it.The zoo is not huge but some of the areas do take a significant amount of time to experience fully, the aquarium building for example.In total: I had a blast.
Nice !. Nice zoo lots of different animals to see which I liked ! The animals seem to be confined which isn't very nice to see but still I enjoyed my experience there and the cafe was excellent.

Cool zoo. I love going to zoos in other countries since it is always so different than the ones we have in the U.S. We had fun. Some animals are in enclosures, others just run around free. You will have random birds and monkeys coming up to you. I would go back

Appalling. I visited this zoo in the summer of 2015, and was sickened by the conditions that some of these animals were kept in. The camels were covered in their own excrement and shared an enclosure with many species that were not associated with where they are originally from. The sea lions had a tiny pool with no decoration, no vegetation, and it appeared unhygenic. These poor animals were swimming around with no intent and looked extremely upset. Finally, the big cats in general had an enclosure which was completely unsuitable for their size and the amount of excercise that they need. The cheetah which I saw in an enclosure about 20m long and 10m wide was pacing up and down aimlessly. I was horrified by this zoo, the animals looked underwhelmed, hopeless and in some cases insane. Imagine being kept in a cage, not coming into contact with any of your same species. I am disgusted and will never visit a zoo again after this experience.

A great CIty Center Zoo. Visited on a dry day.It is really impressive how they make the best use of limited space. I would recommend purchasing a ticket before hand online as their is a long line for the tickets, as we were staying in the Lancaster opposite we purchased the tickets first thing from the zoo and the n visited a little later in the morning.I particularly enjoyed the chimps, the monkeys running free in their bio-dome and the butterfly house.At first though the meerkats where in a to small cage only to find they have access across the zoo through specially constructed tunnels.A real good zoo!

Fun for everyone. Artis is definitely worth a visit, and especially the silverback gorilla. He is the BOSS. We had a special moment when we passed by the wolves, they started howling at each other from both sides of the fence. Unsettling, because they sounded so utterly sad, but it was still a beautiful experience. The lion's roar also makes quite an impression.. I especially enjoyed the many monkey species, and the giraffes.
Best zoo!. This zoo is amazing it's a must see. Takes a while to go round so give your self about 2 hours. The restaurant by the canal is nice with a selection of food choices.

Great for kids and adults.... Well Artis zoo visit is something you can do with children or as a couple.. Great day for every age... There is a good restaurant inside.
Its a clean zoo, animals are happy and well fed..

What a wonderful Zoo 🌟. We have visited plenty of Zoo's with kids so far but this one is something really special. It is not large with too many animals but you can easily spend there nearly all the day. It was founded in 1836 and this old atmosphere is really ubiquitous in a very positive sense. You really feel like a man discovering Africa, India or New Zeland in 19th century. Artis Zoo is greatly located in a beautiful park with high trees and several cute relaxing zones. All animals are so close that you can nearly touch them. Some are ther even free. They are not afraid at all. Except rather traditional animals like lions, elephants, giraffes, penguins and sea lions, you can see there also plenty of very unique species that can be hardly seen somewhere else such as tiger sharks, white wolves, big antshunters, red pandas, colourful birds from very small places of the world, and so on. Aquarium, insect and butterfly exhibitions are very special too. Last but not least, restaurants and food and drinks there are of a very good quality as well. So, you can relax there and observe your kids playing in nice children playgrounds just next to animals and canal. I very strongly recommend to visit Artis Zoo. Btw it is a very nice 25min (2.5km) walk from the center or central train station.

Fantastic Zoo!!!. We came here on recommendation, and we wasn't disappointed. This zoo is brilliant, very easy to get to from central point. Very well mapped out, great variety of animals. A very good family day out if you have children, the price wasn't too expensive either.

A gem i am Amsterdam card. Spent a wonderful afternoon here not crowded ,super layout so green and well planned as most sites in Amsterdam spotless ,we had lunch in the restaurant fresh sandwiches made to order and happy staff 5star attraction .

Loved it!. Lots to see and lots to do, can get such good clear images of the animals. There are options for the animals to go inside or outside as they wish and they all look relaxed, happy and well kept.

Historic zoo with interesting species and some exciting changes. Knowing other zoos in the Netherlands all too well, I did not visit Artis since the early nineties. Why? i don't know - it might be that the relatively small area and its focus on education, rather than grand displays, was the reason. This week I joined my kids to have a look what changed. Well, some of the newer displays were actually very interesting, particularly the Monkey and Bird House, with free-roaming and well-visible bats, sloths, tupajas (tree shrews), a variety of small monkeys and big lizzards, and the Butterfly Pavillion. On the other hand, some enclosures were disappointingly small, like for the African painted dogs, the lions, elephants (which will be expanded soon), and the new savannah ws still looking a bit lost in between the buildings that surround it. Good trip for a long morning visit, and if you want to be up close with species not commonly encountered in other zoos (like Tree porcupine, Asian marten, Anoa, Rock cavy and Gundi).
Family friendly zoo. Some great sections in the zoo but I don't like to see elephants in a zoo. The lemur enclosure and butterfly house are great but the lions don't have enough space.

This is one of the best zoos I've visited!. I love that there are walk-through exhibits where you are in an building with monkeys and sloths. They have great large animal exhibits, too. It is well worth the trip.

Go!. Puts London zoo to shame. Very good attraction, clean and recommend for a really nice family day out. Lunch was above what you'd expect serving simple but nice food. Also good if you want to eat out with the zebras

Best Zoo. I have been visiting Artis since I was a baby and still really enjoy the zoo almost 30 years later. The zoo as a whole has beautiful buildings with the 1882 Aquarium being my favourite. In the summertime the Zoo is open during the evening with musical performances and a nice (yes, vegetarian) barbecue.

Lot's of fun and plenty to see. My wife and I had great time at the zoo.
You feel like you are getting really close to the animals and they have lots to see.
We managed to see lions, elephants, giraffes, gorillas and the list goes on...
Make sure you try the mini pancakes they sell from a stall, not bad value at 3.50 euros for 10
Surprisingly Good Zoo. Zoo was included in the I Am Amsterdam City Card so we decided to pay it a visit. Great selection of animals in beautiful setting. Flat easy walk. Definitely worth a visit

Beautiful old zoo. The Man Friend and I didn't get around early enough to make it to the traditional Amsterdam museums and tourist attractions so we opted for the zoo instead...we'd been together for over 5 years at that point and had never been to one together. I've been to a lot of zoos in my life and this was by far one of the prettiest & cleanest I've seen. The grounds are massive, there were lots of exhibits, and it was fun to just walk around and see what we saw. They had a lot of animals I'd never encountered before and you were very near the animals for most exhibits...it was definitely a "tourist beware" environment, as there were several signs placed in multiple languages warning guests not to stick their fingers in. You were THAT close to the animals.My only complaint is that some of the exhibits had a LOT of animals in them. And by that I mean that there just didn't seem to be enough space for everything in the enclosure (namely the giraffes and elephants, though there were signs near the elephant enclosure asking for donations to expand the area).

Great day out. This zoo provides a great day out!It's much what you would expect from any other zoo however the rainforest house was amazing, we spent ages in there spotting all the animals and we weren't disappointed.The aquarium was great too, set inside an amazing building there was just so much to see, not just the fish!I would definitely recommend getting here early and plan on spending the whole day here. We arrived in the afternoon and stayed for approx 4 and a half hours as we weren't expecting it to have so much to see, so missed out on seeing a lot of things which we regretted.Also I would recommend buying a map so you can make sure you see everything (2euros) we didn't and this is also how we missed out on seeing things as well as not having enough time.The zoo is currently undergoing some renovations/improvements but this didn't detract from a great day out.
Well cared for facility. Enjoyed the stroll through, it was part of My Amsterdam card and across from the Resistance Museum. Common animal exhibits with information provided.

Good activities for the day. I am starting this review with the negative in hopes the zoo will see it and take notice. SOme of the animals like the wild cats and some monkies have literally no where to go they are deppressed and running in circles in their enclosures and cages. there is so much free room in this zoo there is no reason why they cant make larger enclosues for the animals to roam...or to give some of them some companionship.on the bright side, there is only one flat fee to see this zoo/planitarium and we really enjoyed sitting and watching a star show,,,even though it was in dutchmaps cost two euros but worth it not to walk around in circles this place is bigbeautiful butterfly exhibit and gardens to roamwas easy to access from the tram that left us right across the street!

One of the most beautiful old Zoo's in Europe. Artis has fascinated kids and adults for many decades now. The beauty of it? Well, the tradition. You can feel a specific harmony between the city, the animals and the zoo complex itself. Really a one-of-a-kind feeling that you won't witness in any modern Zoo.Perfectly reachable on foot and P.T., a great option to spend half a day with the family.

Big Zoo with easy access from the tram stations. We went on our last day of our holiday after walking all around Amsterdam for the previous 4 days, it was a nice big zoo and we took the tram that stopped more or less outside the Zoo.Entry was 20EUR per adult but there are lots of vouchers around, Make Sure you bring the food here as the food leaves a lot to be desired and is expensiveThe Animals are similar to a lot of the Zoos around the world apart from the Gorillas in glass chamber which we didn't like and as they didn't look happy
Amazing!!. probably one of the best zoos I've been to! we went in may so the weather was starting to pick up and it was a lovely sunny day! you definalty get your value for money.

Superb old zoo. Artis is a beautiful example of an old city zoo. Great location, architecture and atmosphere, and they have many nice events. There is a downside though; because they are old and can't expand, they are a bit old fashioned in how they keep the animals. They do their best, but you'll find lots of smaller cages...

took 2 visits to see it all!. We visited on 2 separate occasions. Very necessary if you want to see the place properly. The animals are kept in as natural an environment as possible and seem very contented. The zoo covers a very large area and is sort of split, so that it is easy to divide up for future visits. Nice cafe on site too.

Paradise in the City. We came by the Artis Zoo by chance. We were staying close by and we were on our way to a recommended restaurant. As we walked by the grounds we saw how beautiful, lush and green it was. We returned the next day to visit the zoo. What a find! We spent a good part of the day there and saw many animals I had never heard of. There were animals of every sort, birds, reptiles and even bugs. The zoo is well layed out with good signage. The staff we talked to were enthusiastic and interesting. We learned from them. There are many buildings to go into (to dodge the rain) and at various times there are demonstrations and shows with the animals. This is a relaxing and fun day out for everyone - singles, couples, families and groups. We saw school children on a class trip with their sketch pads drawing the animals!
Beautiful. It's lovely went on a really cold in the morning, organised well loads to see, can get up close to animals as well.

Disappointing. Having read reviews of this zoo I was keen to visit it but was very disappointed. The entry system was very efficient and the cafes were pretty good and not overpriced. However I left feeling very sorry for the animals as they did not have much room to move about. I would not recommend a visit to this zoo.

Excellent!. Not really a "zoo person" but decided to visit this one on a wet Wednesday afternoon and I'm so glad I did!It's quite small (allow 5 hours) but you really get up close and personal with the animals. Something quite unique I think. From butterflies landing on you to giraffe's licking your hand to all sorts of creatures casually sitting on fences as you walk past, you really get a sense the animals are happy and actually want to be there.A tad costly at 20 Euro's but the money goes to a good cause so it doesn't feel that bad.

A beautiful and improved city zoo. For me it's mostly my childhood why I love this place. I went to Artis at least four times a year. Since then the zoo has been improving more and more. If you're in Amsterdam for a longer stay, I totally recommend checking out the zoo as well.

Amazing Zoo!! . This is the best zoo I've ever been too! Me and my partner were visiting Amsterdam for a long weekend and I read the reviews for the zoo on trip advisor and that we're all good so thought we would go for the day as it was on our tram route. I was so surprised by the animals that were running around and the beautiful surroundings! My favourite part was the indoor enclosure where the sloths, monkeys and lizards are free to run around you. They have every type of animal I wanted to see and it was well worth the money. I highly recommend this place for a day trip and even better if you have children . We most definitely will be visiting again in the summer!

One of the best zoos I've ever visited. Our hop on hop off Amsterdam bus tour stopped near the zoo, we hadn't planned to go into the zoo but on walking past it grabbed our attention. Without a doubt one of the best zoos I have ever visited. Loved seeing the lions, giraffes, elephants and the gorillas, sadly because we wanted to do other things on the bus tour we could stay for more than a couple of hours, but we enjoyed everything we saw there. My husband loved the giant crocodile! This zoo would be loved by all, young or old! It's so vast you could probably stay the whole day there. Would recommend this to everyone.
Fun day out. Lovely zoo, nice day out, good for both adults and children. Best when weather is nice, but can also do during winter

BRILLIANT!!. Whilst staying in Amsterdam, we decided to take the open top bus tour of the city and we are so glad we did because it allowed us to find this marvellous place!When we first drove past, it seemed to be a small but very welcoming Zoo. However, once we arrived at the Zoo, it soon became apparent that this is a very large Zoo!My two main points for this Zoo are: 1) The value for money is just outstanding!!! 19 Euros for an adult is incredibly cheap once compared to like for like Zoo's in Europe. 2) As mentioned previously, the Zoo is very large and you will need to allow a good part of your day to visit. Other points to consider: 1) The Zoo is very interactive. You get to experience interactions with animals that most other Zoos wouldn't permit. 2) The facilities e.g. Toilets, Shops, Restaurants etc... are of a very high quality. 3) The staff are very welcoming and love to interact with you. 4) BUY A MAP, this place is huge and sometimes it feels like its never going to end! Buy a map so that you don't miss anything. 5) JUST GO!!!You really will enjoy this place, I promise!

Worth A Visit. If you're in Amsterdam and fancy a walk on the wild side, visit Artis Zoo! It has a wide variety of animals, birds, reptiles, insects, fish etc to see and is also nice to walk around on a sunny day. Dropped a point off as I felt some of the enclosures were a bit small for the animals (never really thought about this until I saw the Blackfish documentary) but apart from that it is well worth a visit.
Brlliant zoo. Brilliant zoo,(best reptile house ever!) though let down by pretty standard catering though it was out of season so may be better in the hols

Beautiful environment!. I know that some will argue that Artis should not be supported as it is a old facility which does not house the animals in natural, open style habitats. That might be true, however, the zoo is beautiful with lots of green spaces and park like areas where you could rest or children could play. Several areas to buy food. Clean restrooms, The animals were active, easy to see and seemed comfortable. It was exciting to see them play and cavort...in many zoos you cannot see the animals
fun outing. The zoo is amazing, you have great animals, insectarium, aquarium and much more. Very educational. Also, good food at the cafe. And there are many events during weekends.

Beautiful. Zoo was really good, I love animals as it is but I did like this one - you get fairly close to the animals (as I nearly touch a few of them) and you can see them even if they are in there cage as you can go inside the building - you can also walk through one of the bird cages. would recommend if you love animals !
History and Wild Animals in the heart of Amsterdam. A small but beautiful zoo in the heart of Amsterdam. I belief it to bee there over a century ? and has a good stories to tell

A nice experience. Very nice to have a zoo more or less in the centre of the city. We walked there from the railway station, via the NEMO science meseum (with kids aged 9, 11 and 14). The kids liked it, although the space is small for the bigger animals. Also, many og the pens were empty. But all in all a nice experience.

Very nice zoo. The ZOO'S buildings are breathing with history. The animals look well look aftered, and it has nice family atmosphere. The spider monkeys are a big cheeky, and the pinguins are adorable.

Depressing and distressing. Watching animals run back and forth in tiny enclosures whilst young families point and laugh. Seeing people cry at the lions who lie unmoving in their crowded space. Hearing flamingos scream as they can't leave a small fenced off area overlooking their usual lake. Wondering how a leading city such as Amsterdam could have such a poor zoo.This is how we found our visit. The enclosures for the most part are depressingly small. Animals are clearly distressed at their situation. There is little (almost no) educational value nor, it seems, conservational value to the park - these being the two most important factors to a zoo. Instead we are left with a spectacle - creatures far removed from their natural habitat with no purpose other than to be gawked at. Some elements were better. The Penguins were having a great old time. Penguins always seem to get the most space in any zoo. The butterfly house is also interesting, although still lacks any real educational value. One thing I will say is the ground staff did a great job. The ticket staff were friendly, and the girl we saw cleaning out the enclosures was working very hard. The park is also very clean, suggesting some effort goes into keeping it that way. All in all a sad couple of hours. I only took one picture, attached, and didn't feel like taking more while we tried to make the most of the €40 entry fee (for 2 adults).

Plenty to see for adults and children. A great place to spend half the day. Plenty to see for everyone in the family and has places to sit and enjoy lunch. Animal actually seem to be well taken care of and aren't in hiding while in enclosures..

The best zoo I've ever been to. I've been to many zoos. I work in a zoo (upstate NY). I believe that the Artis Zoo in Amsterdam is one of the finest zoos that I have ever been to. The animal inventory is incredible. The setting, in a Victorian park, is beautiful. Most of the exhibits provide ample room for the animals. Access to the animals, especially for photography is incredible. Very few of the exhibits require the visitor to look (or shoot pictures thru) glass. There is a small 'Lemur Island' that has free running red ruffed lemurs walking around. Photo ops are abundant. The butterfly enclosure was fun to walk thru. I have to admit that, after 4 hours, I never got a chance to go to their aquarium. I would very highly recommend this zoo to any animal lover and/or photographer.

Fantastic Zoo. Amazing zoo, squashed as much as we could in 3 hours but could have stayed all day. One of the best zoos we've visited, lots of animals, lovely gardens, plenty of eating places and great value for money.The animals were very vocal on our visit which made us laugh.A must see in Amsterdam!

Outstanding Zoo in the middle of town.. We were pleasantly surprised to happen upon this zoo during our trip. For the most part it has been renovated to reflect current humane standards of animal confinement. The collection is small and selective but well-done. We found it to be a pleasant respite from touring the city allowing one to peacefully browse and collect photons while recovering from jet lag.
One of the best!. So much to see and do, we visited quickly due to a short trip unfortunately but still managed to see everything within 3 hours! 10:10 for beauty, variety and fun.

Up, close and personal . This zoo really enables you to interact with the animals in their own environments! The grounds are well kept and clean and you can easily find your way around. The animals enclosures are all well maintained and are of a good size. The animals are clearly well looked after and are happy enough to show off their skills such as the gorillas and the chimpanzees who put on a good shown

Large and interesting zoo. We had a lovely afternoon at the zoo. There is a large number off different animals and creatures to see here. It even has an aquarium and butterfly pavillion. Lots for both adults and children to see. One of the largest zoos I have ever visited
If you have it free go!. We went to the zoo on our last day as it was free with our I Amsterdam card. Lots to see and do and great if the weather is nice.
Excellent. This place has more variety of animals, birds, reptiles and many more. You need at least 3 hours to get the whole experience of this zoo. Great for all ages.

Great zoo. I visit zoos in most cities I visit, and this is really one of the best and interesting to visit. Lots of species, especially do not miss lemur island (not cages, they just walk around you!). The zoo is located not quite in the heart of sightseeing spots, but it is easy to reach by bike (use bikes!). The only thing that kept me from 100% enjoyment is a feeling that there is too little place for animals, at least for some of them.

An Oasis in the middle of Amsterdam. Our visit to Artis Zoo was hands-down our favourite part of our visit to Amsterdam. The zoo is an oasis of calm in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam and is a great place to relax for a few hours. It is a small, compact zoo but is one of the best that I have visited anywhere. It is beautifully planted with a great range of attractions, lots of places to sit and enjoy the animals who are all well-cared for. A brilliant day out and we will be visiting again when we are back in Amsterdam.

A nice change of pace. If the weather is nice and you have have time to kill until you can get your hotel room... This place is a good way to kill a couple of hours. Cute zoo with plenty of variety... I spent 3 hours here and probably could've spent some more. The aquarium is particularly impressive.

Nice place for the kids, and adults too. My daughter loved the butterfly enclosure. She spent some time going around looking for the butterflies and other things in there. Must not miss that. It's not the biggest zoo, but it's layout and animal enclosures make it a good few hours for the kids to see some animals.

A lovely zoo. I saw many zoos in Europe, but this one is the one I liked the most (even if it's not the biggest I have been to). The environment is lovely, attended, clean, and it hosts a lot of gorgeous animals (that seemed to be living in excellent wealth conditions, which is very important for me).

A must see - you will never see such happy animals!. The happiest animals I have ever seen. The best part were the vultures, and even better was the stunt pulled off by the white wolves - unforgettable!!! it was a rainy day but lots of fun!
Very nice spending time!. I really enjoyed time inthe Zoo where I spent around 3 hours - great set of animals and very bieautiful aquariums with fishes! The best part is the one with lemurs

Zoo Trip. A great zoo, very popular but some small enclosures. Butterfly house was nice and plenty to see and my daughter loved the Meerkats. Allow a good 3-4 hours if you want to see everything. Free with Iamsterdam card

A fab day out. I really enjoyed the Artis Zoo. We had a wonderful sunny day, so all the animals were out and about. As one or two others have mentioned, the lions and the elephants outdoor enclosures seemed a little cramped but the animals themselves all seemd in good condition and happy enough. The star of the show for me was a young gorilla who was super friendly and trying to communicate with his audience

Zoo Lacks Personality. We've been to many zoos (mostly in the U.S.) and Artis sounded promising. Sadly, we did not enjoy it that much. There was nothing that made it stand out from other zoos. In fact, it seemed to lack any type of charm or personality. The animals looked sad, and some of them appeared to be in enclosures that were too small for them. We didn't stay long, opting to go across the street to the Dutch Resistance Museum, which was a much better experience.

Unexpected treat. We had the I Amsterdam card and went here one morning because it was included and opened before the museums. This is a beautiful, intimate zoo in a garden setting. Animals are close and easily enjoyable. I wouldn't have skipped something else or paid for it out of pocket, but it was a great experience in a unique zoo among the local families.

Quite sad, not very good enclosures. Amsterdam zoo has potential to be really good, I know space is limited, but the enclosure for some of the animals is shocking, the lion enclosure for one is terrible there is 4 huge big cats stuck in the smallest space ever with no space to run at all it's quite disturbing, the crocodiles space is really sad too literally the most shallow water with no room, every other enclosure was a bit better, but they really need to expand a few

Monkey house was one of the coolest zoo exhibits I've been to... and I've been to a lot. A+.. This zoo was far larger than we expected, the exhibits looked spacious and clean, and there was great variety among the exhibits and regions displayed. Well worth buying the map on your way in for a small donation.The top spot by far is the monkey and bird house, where you get to see all kinds of animals (bats, sloths, lizards, you name it) within touching distance -- no glass here. We got close to lizards bathing in the stream, watched a sloth cross ropes right above our heads, and got swooped by bats. Very cool! Other rooms included bird exhibits where they can come out and walk around you or swoop overhead.The butterfly pavilion was neat, though I would have liked more signage about which butterflies are shown. We also enjoyed the aquarium, with a fascinating and diverse selection of fish, and I loved the viewing bee hive in the insect house.The only disappointment was that the planetarium was booked by a group of school students and we didn't find out until very close to the show start time. Perhaps a sign by the entrance showing which sections are unavailable would be a neat way of communicating this to visitors.
A wonderful and Intresting Zoo.. One of the best zoo’s I have visited so far. It have nice arrangement and also wonderful landscaping. A good and interesting variety of animals.
Fantastic Zoo Definatly Recommend. We visited in August 2013, The zoo was fantastic, i couldn't believe all the animals that were available to see. The price was very reasonable too
Awesome zoo! . After reading the reviews we were abit worried, got to say it was an amazing day though! Highly recommend - the aquarium was the highlight

Enclosures need more work, but TOP aquarium.. For €19 you get a decent day at the zoo - you certainly see LOADS of taxa from all over the globe. Although the animals seemed physically perfectly healthy, you can't help but question the size/quality of the enclosures/enrichment. Sure, it meant you never failed to get close to the animals - which was great - but I fear they tried to pack too many exhibits into the limited inner-city space, which was surely to the animals' psychological detriment. Our favourite part, however, was the renovated aquarium. There were no awe-inspiring, giant, seemingly ocean-sized tanks like you get in some places, but there were TONNES of them with all the freshwater and marine species of fish, coral, cephalopod, arthropod and weed you could think of. A top aquarium, making up you could argue for some lacklustre mammal/bird exhibits.
Small zoo . No fault of its own but lack of space is all that let's this place down some stunning animals and a pleasant afternoon overall

The Oldest City Zoo!. The traditional Artis Royal Zoo was founded in 1838 and is located pretty much in the center of Amsterdam. It's the oldest in the Netherlands and due to its size relatively easy to walk through with small children.The place has 27 historic buildings including an aquarium (1882), library (1867), planetarium, zoological museum (1855), botanical garden, bird house and butterfly pavilion.It's a haven for 900 animal species and 200 tree varieties. Popular areas include the flamingo pond, lemur land ,monkey rock and the savannah with giraffes and zebras as well as the elephants, camels, lions, penguins,sea lions and the various apes such as gorillas, chimpanzees, orangutans and gibbons. We were particularly intrigued watching the Asian elephant getting its toenails trimmed which, in effect, meant removing the callous-like skin from the bottom. There are several café/ restaurants on the premises and also a pet farm and playgrounds for the kids. Parking is available on the side but do validate your ticket at the kiosk near the entrance to get the special rate!

Great Zoo. Great way to spend two or three hours, amazing animals!Gorillas and apes are very active in the afternoon and havean outdoor and indoor enclosures that are terrific! Seals are great, lemur island lets you get face to face with them!

Fun Adventure!. The zoo is huge and very historical! It includes a planetarium, aquarium, zoo, and butterfly museum. It also has several cafes that are very nice and a super fun playground. It was just right for our 10 year old. We were there for 4 hours and still didn't see all of it. There are also exhibits for extra money.

Very pretty traditional zoo. In the heart of thr city, old style traditional zoo. Not very big, but well organized, the animals are kept well and thw buildings also have historical importance. A must if you are with children

Very interesting. Very interesting with your "usual" outdoor exotic animals as well as separate buildings for insects, lizards and a really cool aquarium part.
Like somebody else mentioned, the zoo does feel a little bit cramped but that's nothing that deteriorated the experience!
Nice. It is a huge zoo. it requires at least 3-4 hours. It has everything. i was quite impressed. It is a great place for children.

Wide variety of Animals. This was a mixed experience. On one hand it had a wide range of animals. However, on the other it felt very cramped and in need of renovation (a process it looks they are starting).

Not the best. This zoo really seemed to have very small areas for their animals to roam. I understand that they are making some changes, and building new environments, but it was quite sad to see some of animals, especially the lions, in a really small enclosure... maybe they have space to roam behind the scenes, but it wasn't obvious where. I visited mainly for the butterfly house, which was okay, but I have been to others where there is much more variety and density of butterflies. Best save your money and visit Micropia next door, which is much more interesting.

Must See and visit. Make sure you have a good 4 to 5 hours when you come here, it takes a lot of time to go thru, beautiful zoo as the age of the place has given it such charm. I am not a supporters of any zoo's but this zoo does have excellent programming and is doing away with small enclosures as well I had asked where the animals where from and acquired and most are babies from animals they have had for many many years.

Cruel - tiny enclosures not suitable for the animals they house. Visited in Sept 15 as it was free on our I Amsterdam Card. Only stayed around 15 minutes as couldn't bare to see any more clearly unhappy animals kept in areas far too small and not suited to their needs. Small pens housed seemingly random groups of animals together. Many of the bird species and also the lemurs are allowed to roam free - meaning that children (and adults!) are able to prod, poke and harass them all day. Walked passed the lion cage and there was a very large group of people watching and shouting - turned out this was because the lion was up against the back wall "attacking" it, clearly in distress. Saw other animals such as elephants, giraffes, sea-lions, all of whom looked depressed and in areas completely unsuitable. Obviously there are other, much more cruel zoos and animal shows in the world, however I was shocked to see all of this in a modern, western country like the Netherlands. The trip to the zoo was the only downside to an otherwise fantastic trip to Amsterdam. I would not recommend a visit - instead give your money to a well-deserving animal charity who may actually do some good with it.

Amazing Butterfly Enclosure. This is an absolutely amazing zoo, but the best part of all is the butterfly enclosure. Most of the zoo is just like any other zoo worldwide with the same kind of animals.This zoo has quite small enclosures with mostly baby animals however there still isn't enough room for the animals to properly move around.However the butterfly enclosure is absolutely stunning! Would recommend going purely for this! Get up close and personal with some of the most spectacular insects with the best colours! Big and small in a large free open enclosure you can walk straight into.

A mix of good and bad. As the title says this zoo is a mix of the bad old days of small concrete enclosures and modern expansive habitats. The lion enclosure is heartbreaking and the only thing that stops me being too depressed is the fact a new enclosure is being built for them, not before time. On the flip side the giraffes have a huge open modern enclosure which is a credit to the zoo. I appreciate that as a private enterprise, money is limited but I hope the well advertised changes occur soon. The main reason to recommend a visit is the fact your money will go towards building a better zoo. I look forward to coming back when the animals are all in an enclosure they deserve.
nice zoo. beautiful zoo, lots of animals, but some of them didn't seem to have enough room. the ticket is quite expensive, but it includes the planetarium.

Please shut this zoo down! . Same experience as the rest. Incredibly sad, the elephants were "performing" for the crowd but it was incredibly sad to see. They were clearly incredibly stressed. The sea lions were in an incredibly small pool and seemed to exhibit very repetitive and worrying behaviour. Very sad to see a modern zoo mistreat it's animals on this scale.Please do not support this zoo.

Animals, animals!. Big area into the city. The price is 20€, but it is free with the Amsterdam Card. The map costs 2€. There are a lot of species of animals. In some rooms the animals aren't in the cage (don't worry they don't attack you) and it is very beautiful. The vist takes about 2 hours.
Great place. A lot of different animals for a place larger than what it looks first. Design is very good and make sure you have about 3 hours to be sure to see everything

Very good zoo, even compared with others internationally. I visited the Artis Zoo while on a bit of a tourist holiday to Amsterdam. Going to the zoo hadn't been a holiday priority, but I had a spare day and the weather was good. I was pleasantly surprised! It's a large, good quality zoo, with a great range of animals. Even if you've been to bigger zoos in other countries, this one was easily up amongst them for a great experience.It had a good number of indoor tropical houses where you can walk among birds, butterflies and even sloths - that was a highlight! Giraffes were also particularly good, they had a lovely little baby giraffe :) And they had capybaras, which are my favourites! Hooray!A criticism would be that it wasn't very helpful towards international visitors - the map was in Dutch. Most of the labeling in the zoo was available in Dutch and English, but not consistently. There were a few animals where I wasn't quite sure what I was looking at! Also, all the toilets tended to be quite busy and not always entirely pleasant - not awful, but I would have expected better.

Nicest zoo ever. This is one of the biggest zoos we have ever been to . Includes many animal species , a butterfly pavilion and an isecterium , which was especially interesting for my youngest boy. It features a really big and nice restaurant and plenty of open spaces for the kids to play . We were planning to spend 2 hours or so but we ended up spending the whole day .. Such a nice place

Disappointing. The majority of enclosures are far too small for 1 animal, let alone 3 or 4. They do have a lot of different species, especially birds. The only good thing about this zoo was when I was leaving, I was asked to donate for a bigger elephant enclosure that they were building, which I was more than happy to donate too.I would not recommend this zoo

Always a great visit. This is a lovely big zoo with a big variety of animals. They always seem to be proactive with enlarging enclosures and opening up new areas which is good. You can easily spend a few hours going around the zoo and there are restaurants and attractions within the zoo also. Just outside the zoo is a tram stop too so easy enough to get to. Worth a visit!

An Oasis for Animals and Humans!. This beautiful zoo is a paradise for humans as well as animals! Two afternoons were not enough to enjoy all it has to offer! As an older visitor, with knee problems, my folding seat/cane was invaluable! Hope to return someday! Ask in advance to speak with a docent about the role of the zoo in hiding Jews during WW2.

A little depressing. Went there as been meaning to go for ages, and was not impressed. They've done a good job, and they are constantly improving, with some bits great (like being in with the monkeys etc. and decent aquarium) however some of it was quite depressing being a city centre zoo with very small dingy Victorian style cages for some of the animals like the big cats. Not bad, was torn whether 3 or 4 star, gave a 4 star for the recent improvements. Hope the rest catches up
Amazing Zoo!. Definitely worth a visit!Great zoo, with a huge variety of animals right in the centre of the city, busy at times but big enough to wander round at your own pace!

A great day out with children. This is a massive zoo, with a wide variety of animals. It also has a very large play area for children... with plenty of things to climb and slide down. It also has one or two smaller play areas dotted around. The food is good as well... with children's portions and a wide choice. We easily spent the whole day there and still didn't have time to catch some of the shows - e.g. in the planetarium. Overall a great day out.

Must see!. My boyfriend and I visited the zoo on a rainy afternoon in September but it was such a wonderful day nonetheless.The zoo is very open plan and you can get really close to the animals which is a really cool experience.I would definitely go back and recommend!

Brilliant. We really enjoyed this! Its so clean and spacious and the animals really appear to be healthy! It has animals to suit everyone - we had the I Amsterdam card so had free entry and got to skip the queue so that was brilliant

Allow plenty of time for this beautiful zoo.. We loved this zoo. Our only complaint was that we didn't plan enough time to thoroughly enjoy it. It is right across the street from the Dutch Resistance Museum so we thought we could just pop in. Its beautiful and the animals are wonderful to see. We will go back and spend more time at this lovely zoo.
Clean zoo with an aquarium. Biked to the zoo from our hotel. It is a great zoo with lots of exhibits to see. Advise to get there earlier in the day as it gets busy later on.

very nice zoo. O visited the Artis Zoo with my son, while staying for a few days in Amsterdam and it was really interesting. The diversity of the animals, birds, reptilians and insects collection is impressive. You can see pretty much anything from Mexican tarantulas and stick insects to penguins, lions, elephants, giraffes, zebras and even a Komodo dragon. This is definitely a must-see if you travel with kids in Amsterdam.

An unexpected delight. We were only in Amsterdam for the day and after giving up on Anne Frank's House due to the huge queue, we browsed through our Lonely Planet book while eating pancakes and decided to give this place a go. Walked there - but had we planned better we could have got the tram - and it was tricky to find as it's tucked away. However it was most definitely a hidden gem. Loved seeing the lemurs close up (until one got cross with me, bared its teeth and hissed!). Also got a good look at the giraffes. The butterfly house was a real treat although very hot.There's a couple of areas that need work. The meerkats could do with a bigger enclosure, as could the elephants. Also we didn't have enough time to explore as much as we'd have liked. This is definitely on our list for our next visit but will be better prepared.Really lovely. Don't miss it if you're visiting this great city.

Morning at the Zoo. A lovely zoo, easy to walk around. little carts supplied that you can borrow to tow your child around in. Lots to see, elephants, Giraffes including a baby, sea lions, penguins, in fact so much to see not enough space to write here! Staff very helpful and looked after our suitcases while we visited. Lots of cafes and baby changing facilities. A great place to take children and " big kids" ! Enjoyable day.

Well worth a visit, especially to see the silverback gorilla!. Really lovely zoo. Absolutely loads to see and the zoo is kept very clean. On our visit it was unfortunately raining, however we still got to see all of the animals and had a lovely time. Must sees are the elephants, giraffes, sealions and especially the huge silverback gorilla. Well worth a visit

Favorite zoo!. I've never seen happier animals in any zoo I've been to around the world than the Amsterdam zoo! I think these animals have the life. They must be on something if you know what I mean ;) A great place to spend the day. Oh and don't miss the cage-less red ruffed lemurs! They were definitely my favorite

Artis Zoo. A brilliant zoo! Nice and clean. Nice to be able to walk around with Lemurs freely roaming. Highly recommended if visiting Amsterdam. Very easy to get to from the Central Station on Tram 9.

Nice zoo, nicely laid out. We enjoyed our visit to the zoo. One thing to note: if you go shortly before closing time, they close the gates but don't kick you out. You can wander around for at least an hour after closing.

Great day out. Went to this zoo with my boyfriend and we had a wonderful day out! I hadn't researched the zoo much before going and was pleasantly surprised by the large variety of animals. We expected to spend just the morning there but ended up spending around 5 hours there and didn't get bored at all! Definitely visit the aquarium, that was a highlight. We arrived at about 9:15am and there was no queue at all which was great as we went straight in - so I recommend arriving early. The park was fairly large and not too busy. We bought a map on arrival which I also recommend as I didn't notice any maps within the zoo. The restaurant we ate in was a good price - we shared a 2 person platter for less than 10 euros and the food was good quality and staff were friendly. The only reason I'm not rating this 5 overall was due to the poor size of some of the exhibits - the lions in particular had little room. But a very enjoyable day out and great for everyone!

Surprisingly nice afternoon.. I wish we'd got there earlier, but it took us ages to find the zoo because it's not well sign-posted. So glad we found it! It's not too big, and it's nicely landscaped. The smaller enclosures are really well laid out. We saw racoons, meerkats, white wolves, mountain goat, okapi several large bird species, including a colony of cormorants. I'm not sure if they were part of the zoo, or had just taken up residence in the pelican lake. My favourites were the vultures.If you don't speak Dutch, it's fun trying to read the names of the animals in Dutch.There are spacious cafes to sit and watch waterbirds swim past, and a gift shop.I wish we'd had longer there. There's places to just sit and rest between the enclosures.My only negative point is ( and it's the same with other zoos) I don't like to see big animals like elephants, lions, camels giraffes, zebras in small enclosures. Having listed these animals, I've just realised how big the selection of them was!I would happily go back there tomorrow!

What a Wonderful Place. Another must when visiting Amsterdam, We only spotted this place when we were on the Hop on & Off bus and it turned out to be a great find. Would certainly recommend this attraction when next in Amsterdam.

Great outdoors activity. I went to the zoo with a friend one day when the sun was shining and we had nothing to do. It's quite big for a city zoo! There is a wide variety of animals, some that are extremely close to the public.
A MUST WITH FAMILY. excellent one of the best zoo's i have been to has every animal perfect for families and kids they didnt want to leave
My first zoo i ever visited in NL ages ago. This Zoo always keep it clean, animal friendly, green, fun and it is one of the best i ever been in the world :)
Relaxing break from the museums. Nice zoo with a wide variety of animals, we had done museums the day before so this was a nice change of pace.

Fantastic! . My 13 year old son and I visited yesterday and I was incredibly impressed. The whole site is spotless and very well presented with lovely garden and seating areas. There are many animals that I've never seen in british zoo's and you can get very close to many of them which is great. While many of the buildings are the original Victorian ones there is development going on too with a new cheetah area being built and modern buildings like cafes and the planetarium.The aquarium was fantastic - something many British zoos could do with adding, we actually thought the aquarium was better than our local one in Plymouth. Most definitely worth a visit - British zoos could learn a lot from this place!

Really brilliant zoo and day out . Although the Artis Zoo is fairly small by most standards, it is a brilliant place. The zoo is modern, clean, and well set out - with really good exhibits. As the place is small it is easy to navigate - which is always a bonus. The aquarium was definitely the highlight - it was huge and housed a great number of different fish. It could be an aquarium in its own right. Definitely worth a visit - great way to spend half a day.
A tad expensive for a day visit. Loads of birds and animals in the main well presented but some in depressing environments with little or no evident company.

Looking for the past, but it is gone!. I remember the zoo from the 1980's. there where Hipo's , icebears, Tigers,a lot of crocodil's a little kiosk in the middle of the zoo to drink something, brown bears, black bears. All these are gone, they are all dead! Like the zoo did not know how to take care of them!! Even the places where they were kept are gone! they had 2 sea cows, but they are gone together with the place they lived.I saw the animal keeper that had to clean the place from the pinguins at work,terrible, he doesn't like them,he is frightening them when they get close to him!!That man should not be in the zoo at all, but you know: voluteers do not cost anything.

The best Zoo. If your going to Amsterdam make sure 100% you go and visit the Artis Zoo! Me and my girlfriend went along only expecting to be there for an hour or so and ended up still there 4 hours later!!! Absolutely loved it!

Marvelous. U can call this a boutique zoo, but its ideal for young kids. Very well laid out, and very clean. Has a lot of animals, my son really liked the giraffe and the lion enclosures. Its complete value for money.

Pleasantly Surprised. Was expecting much from this, especially with the price being so low, but was a very good zoo. It was big, well maintained and a very good selection of animals. The zoo is also easy to find. The animals are in very small enclosures compared to other zoos I have been in.
Really nice!! . Even when it was raining it was fun to watch the chimpanzie fighting and the wolf and the pinguins its nice for every age!

Fantastic! . Loved it! Worth every penny, cheap food place to eat there and the animals were so cute! It was a massive zoo, need a whole day to explore, loved the little monkey rooms where you can see them up close and if you're lucky you can touch them, A little concerned about some of the enclosures like the Leopard one! But besides that it was the highlight of my holiday!

Highly recommended. Not the largest Zoo in the world, either in size or number of animals/species. However, it is very well laid out and there is much to see and enjoy. We particularly enjoyed the butterfly enclosure as we had not experienced anything like this before. Well worth a visit.

Good visit. This created a bit of relief after Anne Frank's house and the Resistance Museum and a good way to enjoy being outside on a sunny afternoon.The elephant and camel enclosures don't look big enough but animals generally seemed OK.Useful that you can get in free with I Amsterdam card.

They should close this zoo. This zoo is having great architecture, but the animals are living in way to small spaces! Specailly the big cats. They should relocate the zoo and make a better living for the annimals or close. This is no longer how we should see and visit a zoo!

Instalações mal preparadas. The worst zoo i've been there.In geral looks good for the most of the people, but when you start looking to the instalations it's possible understand that something it's wrong. There are too much animals per space, and the conditions are not good. Zoo must be a place to give a home to animals that have been on circus, reserves, and other places. The conditions of the habitats must be equal. They dont have space and they look really stress. I saw at leat 4 different species with real signals of stress.Sould have more people on the zoo to control who don't respect the signals. I saw people feeding animals, put the fingers and the hands on the instalations, and trying to touch them.The pirices of the shop and the restaurant are just ridiculous.The ticket its included on amsterdam card.To have a map from the zoo you have to pay 2 €
Nice place to visit. It is nice place to spend 3-4 hours at with children . as a Zoo located in a city it is a well maintained and very clean please . Variety of animals . Easy reachable by Tram

Not bad for a city zoo. The zoo was good. Lots of animals and not too spaced out so you got to see a lot without having to walk miles and miles. However, the queues were ridiculous and poorly managed.

One of the best I have visited.. Really good zoo. Well set out and neither too big not too small. The aquarium is in a beautiful building and is truly magnificent.The lemurs roam free in their zone, you can walk right up to them but don't touch. Great for kids.

Nice Zoo!. really a great zoo for the price. All the animals were active and healthy looking. Some were eating while we viewed them. We loved the up close and intimate feeling. Could not believe we had a sloth and some monkeys, etc. so close to us under the same roof. Our three year old loved it. August is a great time to go.

Fantastic visit.. This is definitely an attraction that will suit visitors of all ages. I visited with friends, but would gladly spend a day here with my children as I know they would be amazed and fascinated by it.We accessed using our iAmsterdam city card, but I would have happily paid the admission (very reasonable anyway, only €19,95 for an adult) as it was a great visit and I would go again.The zoo is actually situated in the middle of the city, but you wouldn't know! It's peaceful, tranquil and the air was fresh. The zoo itself is very clean, very well kept and well presented. I thoroughly enjoyed the visit, and all the staff that we encountered were very friendly and knowledgeable. There are so many animals to look at and so many talks to squeeze I to your visit, we didn't get it all done sadly which of course is a great excuse to make a point to re-visit in the future!I can't even begin to start listing all the different types of animals as there was just so much, but my highlight was a secure building where you could walk with the animals being loose and free in there too - monkeys running above your head on the tree branches and sloths sleeping next to where you stand! It was an amazing experience!Loved the visit, will return again!

Great fun. Little bit confusing with the lay out but had a good time. Need to sort out the wasps as we kept almost getting stung.Animals seemed happy and were all out roaming around.Was quite busy but was a weekend so not surprising really.

For the whole Family a Special Place. The ZOO you don't feel that you are at a Zoo where Animals are unhappy The setting is Wonderfull with every Detail given to the Animals Spacious and Clean very well appointed Gardens and Grounds We ended up at the restaurant De Plamtage for Dinner one of the best meals we had in Holland

More than just a zoo, its a day out. This really was so much better than I was expecting. Easy access from City Centre/Metro line via tram. Lots to see and do, with Micropia next door. Good attractions, spacious, easy to get around, with eating area by the canal. Very enjoyable and worth the visit.

Extensive range of animals and in sympathetic surroundings. Great zoo for families and couples. Particularly worth visiting if you are concerned about animal welfare - it is immediately apparent that the animals are kept in surroundings that are sympathetic to their natural environments and with sufficient space.

There's better zoo's in the country. First time in Artis and most likely it will be our last time as well. The grounds are lovely, but a lot of caged animals rather than more natural habitats.I thoroughly enjoyed the reptiles section, even though reptiles normally aren't really my thing. There are better zoo's to be found in the Netherlands. My favorite so far is the Noorder Dierenpark. A bit of a commute (2 hrs or so) from Amsterdam, but much nicer to be spending time in.

An interesting zoo for a day out. A nice zoo with plenty to see including an aquarium, reptile house, aviary and insect house alongside the larger animals. We spent about 4-5 hours meandering through the various areas and enjoying the sunshine. Lots of interesting information available about the various species on show and the current breeding programs. The African hunting dogs and red panda were highlights for me. Some of the enclosures seem a little dated and small, but there is development of new enclosures in progress.I recommend the cafe between the canal and the giraffe enclosure for a quieter and more scenic stop - excellent chips and mayonnaise!Overall a lovely day out with plenty to enjoy for all ages.

Great value for money, small enclosures. The zoo staff were all very friendly and helpful, as we were waiting in line to enter a woman lost control of her mobility scooter and subsequently mowed down the front of the queue. The whole thing was very dramatic so we knew this day was going to be eventful from the offset.The animal's enclosures varied from being excessively large (when containing smaller animals) to upsettingly small in terms of the lion and elephant enclosures. Hopefully this is something that will change.The aquarium was amazing! All in all the zoo was great value for money, you need a full day to get round all of it so make sure you go early

Place that you will enjoy. very nice zoo. All ages will enjoy. You can go by tram (just minutes wall from the tram station)It will take minimum 4 to 5 hours to finish it. Don't miss the butterfly, penguins , aquarium

Fantastic Zoo and Aquarium.. Amsterdam Zoo, is most definitely worth a visit, with a wide range of animals, with a really impressive tropical section with free roaming monkeys and birds flying around you, could be a little scary for children. The aquarium, within the Zoo is also much better then expected with a whole range of tropical fish, including sharks and an example of the fish that live within the Amsterdam Canals. The Zoo is quite big, so it does take around half a day if not more to get round.
