I would also recommend visiting early in the morning, we got there at 9am when it opened, but when we left at midday there was a huge queue and the Zoo was very crowded.

expensive but a pearl of the city. very good zoo if wearher is sunny. lot of animals.. it is all nice to see. animals conditions are good. all very clean and it is developing. predators are not so visibles but nevermind... go to see this zoo.

Great environment. We visited the zoo as it was free as part of our I Amsterdam cards. The zoo seemed to be part of a large garden complex, which provided lots of shade for visitors. The animals seemed well cared for, and photo opportunities were very good. Lots of places to eat, drink. Kids playgrounds etc. easily accessible via trams.

Amazing aquarium to compliment the great Zoo. We loved this attraction. Lots to see and well laid out. We spent hours here and took lots of pictures. When I return to Amsterdam I would love to go here again.Great day out young or old.

Some bits excellent ......some bits worrying . First the bit that's worrying. Some of the enclosures are a bit like the old London zoo with enclosures that are not big enough for the animals in them. Lions, some aquarium exhibits and the penguin enclosure is a disgrace. On the other hand the butterfly area is very good but generally the number of animals should be halved and the spaces increased. Could also do with more info on conservation.

Disappointing. Artis, short for Natura Artis Magistra (Latin for "Nature is the teacher of art and science"), is the oldest zoo in the Netherlands and one of the oldest zoos of mainland Europe. This may be a claim to fame, but it could also be their downfall. Although a number of sections have been renovated, i could not help but feeling depressed by the size and state of some of the habitats, mainly the big cats. Compared to zoos abroad, Artis is not a great one. Looking at it independently, I must say I was disappointed for a zoo with this history and reputation.

Very solid zoo. I loved this zoo. The animals seem to have more space than in some of the other zoos I have been too. It feels more wild though probably not for the animals. The big cats could use more room and the elephants seemed miserable. Still better than most. Makes for a great day!
Brill. Lovely zoo to visit, plenty to see. Only down fall all shows are in Dutch !! Use hop on hop of bus to get there, as far out. brilliant Aquarium

Wildlife in the city center. As a student i got a discount for Artis. Therefore i went there every month. It's not the prettiest zoo in the world, but it's old and the animals are alive and kicking. It was a meaningfull place during the war. Visit Artis, bring you're own food (or have a pancake with the flamingo's) and just read about the history and fall in love with the place.

Amsterdam zoo visit. Don't think about it just go! This is worth every penny/cent. Regardless of what your opinions are about zoos this is well worth a visit as you get a lot for your money, you could spend nearly a whole day there. Plenty to see & do!

One of the best zoos I've been to!. I have been to A LOT of zoos but this one is definitely worth mentioning. It's a really relaxing walk through with very clean, well-designed enclosures. You can see how much effort they've put in! There is also a small gift shop and several kiosks where you can buy food.

Artis zoo. This zoo is amazing. We were there from 10am till 18.00 pm. Even more if it was open till later. A lot of interesting animals, the pens for animals are large and very good conditioned. You can even walk inside the pen of monkeys they are at arms lenght. The butterfly room is very special and you must see the penguins - their pen is just half a meter high ;-) . Worth the visit and admition fee. One of most beautiful zoos i have ever seen.

Large zoo, in the city - lots of different animals. This zoo has lots of animals and is surrounded by the city and canals.You can spend easily a couple hours there (and more if you have kids). They seemed to have small strollers (like carts) where kids could be seated and pulled by their parents. There also seemed to be activities for children.We really appreciated the butterfly pavilion: as you entered the area you felt immediately in the jungle with all the noises, and the wet heat, and so many butterflies flying all around you.Some very impressive things also were a pack of wolves howling for long minutes.They also have an aquarium and a large penguin area (in addition to other the more "usual" zoo animals such as felines, giraffes, elephants, ...)When we visited, it was included for free when using the IAMsterdam card (that you get for a fee).We went there at the opening time (9AM) and there were not a lot of people then, but at the same time, several of the "star" animals had not been released yet in their enclosure (they were probably still being taken care of).
great place. OMG what an amazing day we spent here.we did this while on the hop on hop off bus it was well worth the money. prebook online so u can avoid the queue

Lovely zoo.. This is a very nice zoo although very dated in parts. There is a good selection of animals and the enclosures are good sizes. There were a few empty display pens that are currently being updated. Overall a good zoo with plenty to see.

Fantastic zoo. Have been here a few times now. One of our favourite zoos. Has everything a zoo should have. Fond of the aquariums there and it's nice seeing the baby elephant growing each time. Good facilities and you can even have a cheeky Heineken ;)

Great experience. Whether you are adults or a family visiting with kids it just feels great to familiarise yourself with so many animals (more than you can imagine). There is an impressive collection of birds, reptiles, wild and sea animals. As most of the zoo is open, weather could be an issue. It was a shame that we could not visit the planetarium as all shows were only available in Dutch. The museum cafe is bit pricy but has a nice collection of tasty goodies (local cheese-pie was mouthwatering).

Amazing !!. Came her with my mum and enjoyed it so much ! Loved it when you go into the room with the little monkeys and the sloth ! Its lovely to be able to see the animal without a fence between you , the reptiles were incredible, they have this massive crocodile alligator thing , which is just absolutely monstrous, breathtakingly huge, The whole thing was actually very tiring because you walk around for ages very slowly which hurts By the end but the cafes are perfect for a little break and a cake and coffeeI would recommend coming Here

Great fun!!. I vistited the zoo on a cloudy day and it really brightened things up for me! It was just a five minute walk from the Waterlooplein metro station and the ticket was included in my "I Amsterdam card" I had purchased the day before. The animals looked so well looked after and taken care of, you almost felt you were in their natural environment! There were elephants, male and female lions, giraffes, zebras and many more. The wolves were howling in a pack which was something I had never experienced before. There were different sections for the reptiles, butterflies and fish. I found it to be quite big. I was visiting with my partner and we took two coffee breaks. There are cafes well located throughout the zoo which we found very helpful. We also tried a cheese pastry and a coconut cookie which we enjoyed very much. I think it is a definitely must see for anyone who visits Amsterdam! Beautiful space, friendly and helpful staff, and a breathtaking selection of animals, birds, fish and reptiles.
Enjoyed it. I loved the zoo! Took us around 6 hours to complete our visit there. Very clean an easy signs to follow.

Worth it.. A great place with lots to see. Access into the park was confusing and time-wasting after purchasing tickets, going from one line to another. Overall great fun and very clean. You'll need around half a day to see everything.

Animaltastic!. This was the best zoo we have ever been to! Amazing array of animals in a very open environment - animals were not caged or looking unhappy, it was beautiful and every aspect was amazing to see. We would advise people to put aside a full day to go here. We spent 6 hours in the zoo and micropia which is a must see also. And when we got back to the hotel we were knackered! But the walking was most definitely worth it!
Olga . Small, very good located. Great animals collection, very stylish (as everything in Amsterdam). Great parking nearby giving a possibility to see more around

One of the best Zoo's of Europe!. One of the best Zoo's that I have visited!Do not forget to go into the Butterfly valley...It is a nice place to go if you have seen all the attractions in Amsterdam after 3 days.Have fun!

Lovely zoo with lots to see. A very pleasant zoo to visit with lots of animals to see. I love how the trails are simple and easy to follow. Plan to spend about 2-3 hours there. Great location right in the center of the city. Very nice outdoor play area for the kids.

Always good. Artis is a very nice destination when traveling with kids. Plenty of things to see and to learn and a very nice climbing tower with tunnel slides in the center of the zoo. Lunch at Plantage is 'a must'.

Amazing. This zoo is fantastic, every animal you want to see is right there. The lay out can be a little confusing but once you get the hang of reading the signs it becomes easier. You can easily spend hours and hours walking around this place and not get bored.

Zoo in the city center. I need to say that I am not a big fan of zoo's. Traveling the world for so many years seeing the animals in their natural habitat is what I prefer.But well if I have my cousin from 3 over he loves to go there.I will explain him when he is older so he can choose what he likes.I must say love the aquarium, butterfly garden and the insect space The zoo is getting a new look and I think for kids it is a nice place in to learn a bit about animals.The little shop near the bird cage next to the exit sold poffertjes I call them small round little pancakes with butter and icing sugar.They were so doughy it was not even nice big no no for a dutch warm sweet snack.Even my nephew did not like itThe Parade had way better ones yesterday. Food and shakes in the restaurant next to the entrance/exit was For me it is not a monthly thing because the entrance is almost 20€.Once a year ok.

A variety of creatures. A bit of a queue to get in, but it moved quite quickly. Once we got in we wandered around the different buildings with monkeys, lizards, birds and butterflies that roam free. It was hot so a lot of the animals were in the shade. The sign posts could have been clearer. Could have done with more information about the fish in the aquarium section. I would recommend taking a picnic as the restaurants were very busy. Overall, a good day out.

Surprising hidden gem. I feel like in the world of Amsterdam marketing, Artis Zoo ended up with the short straw. Everyone knows about the museums and the city is bombarded with ads for Body World, Madame Tussaud, Ice Palace, etc. The only ad I saw for Artis was walking through a corridor in Schiphol Airport. Plus how good can a zoo be in the very heart of a city?Apparently good enough to go two days in a row. I went with my 5yo son while my wife and 16yo daughter did whatever it is women do when visiting European cities from abroad. We had a phenomenal time and my son begged the gals to go again the next day so he could show them around and see the stuff we were too tired to see the first day.My son was engaged the entire time, asking questions about where the animals were from. Coming from North America, there were a lot of animals I had never seen before and many I had never heard of.There are also nice gardens to stroll through and rest in when you're taking a break. The animal enclosures are (mostly) pretty spacious and allow you to get pretty close.
Soooo beautiful. The most beautiful zoo I have ever experienced. The =is zoo gives you so much more than you bargained for. Lovely place for a family and enjoyable.

Very Good Zoo. Artis Zoo is a very good zoo located within walking distance of the center of the city. The zoo has a fine selection of animals. It is not especially well laid out and is poorly marked, however. Nonetheless, we enjoyed ourselves.

Educational. Lovely tropical gardens inside of here... We went with friends and spent an afternoon walking around. It was a nice day for it and like any zoo, very educational. Definitely worth the money!

Very surprising, Great day out!!. We went to Artis on a day we had nothing planned, turned out to be one of the best days we had!! This zoo is fantastic! I absolutely loved one part, you go inside a building and there are small monkeys and lizards on either side of a walkway not in cages! You could literally touch them!! The keepers are right there and are so informative, pointing out different species etc.The zoo itself is beautiful to walk around, great way to spend a lazy day!!

City Zoo. As other people have said, some of the enclosures are fairly small and I felt sorry f2f or the lions. Other enclosures on the other hand are quite sizeable v(giraffes and zebras for example). We arrived at the gorilla enclosure just at feeding time, what a sight. I did not know that gorillas liked leaks, yes leaks! Also, do not miss the aquarium it is superb. Entrance was included in our I Amsterdam card but had to pay €2 for zoo map. Thought that was a bit potent pinching. Also we got there early so missed queues at entrance which was not massive when we left but probably a good 15 minute wait.

Amazing . Fabulous zoo, large with so many animals and lots of seating and food/drink available. Good prices. Must see if you are visiting Amsterdam
Also has an aquarium and micropia but didn't visit the latter.

Okay. The zoo was good, we purchased tickets from the shop 'tours and tickets' as it was cheaper than paying at the gate and you miss the queue. The zoo was good with a lot of interesting animals and work being done to bring more animals to the zoo, but it was a shame to see the animals in such small enclosures with little room to move around, especially the four lions. Still well worth a visit.
Lovely zoo. Great day spent at the Amsterdam zoo! Lovely setting and great mix of animals, the baby giraffe was a personal highlight. Even better that it was free with my iamsterdam card
beautiful. It is beautiful zoo. It is very large, There are many kinds of activities. The lemurs walk freely. There is wonderful aquarium and a garden of butterflies.

Good few hours at the zoo . Artis Zoo has a wide variety of animals and you can get rather close to all of them to get good photos. Not very big, so is easy to get round in a few hours. Shame that some of the enclosures are rather small for the animals that are inside them.

Loved it. What a pleasant experience! We really enjoyed the zoo: it was very well maintained and very easy to navigate. Lots of interesting species to be seen from close range: particularly for the monkeys and butterflies.The expo next it it now: Microbes it's also very interesting...worth combining the two.

A very enjoyable day.. One of the nicest zoos to visit.Lovely surroundings for the animals.Lots of areas to visit.We were in the zoo for over 4 hrs.Easy to get to on tram 14 from Dam Square.Toilet facilities very good.Eating places quite reasonably priced.

A day out with chlldren of all ages - not only when the sun shines. Nice weather and the extensive number of different animals make this Zoo one of the wonderful Zoo's I have been to. Wonderful surrounding nature - in the middle of the city! - and a great number of different animals. New extension - certainly for a cloudburst - Micropia about the smallest animals (bacteria, viruses and funguses) is a fantastic part. Interaction high in the ranks for children.
Nice place. If you have a little bit extra time at Amsterdam, you should check the zoo. Easy to find with tram. I liked most these special animals like elephant, giraffe, etc.

Amazing. Went here with my other half whilst away on a city break. We knew straight away we wanted to go as looked really goodWell it definitely didn't disappoint. It was such a great day out. They had such a big variety of animals and gave you good access to seeing themMy favourite part was seeing the elephants play and bath. They had a sea lion show on and a beautiful butterfly enclosureI have recommended this to friends and family for when they have visited Amsterdam and I look forwarding to going back.

Well worth a visit. This zoo is in a central location of the city and initially had some mixed feelings about visiting this zoo on some of the past reviews I had read. My fears were unfounded and this a a good zoo to visit.The zoo is on the smaller side and easy to walk around and set in lovely gardens in between the animals. There is a very good selection of animals to see here especially considering the size of the zoo. The elephants were our highlight. The zoo is a little on the expensive side and is popular attraction for family's, it and had a long queue at the gates when we arrived. The signs are in both Dutch and English and the place is very busy but it is easy to see the animals and it's a great way to spend an afternoon.

nice zoo with great terras to enjoy a coffee!. If you like going to zoos, this is one of the nicest zoos I have visited. Most of the animals are outside and not kept behind fences, which makes the whole area very lovely. We had a nice time in the sun on the terras of the café, which you shouldnt miss.
An amazing zoo. Not only one can appreciate the space dedicated for the zoo, but also you can admire how they treat the animals and how well preserved they are. It is such an amazing place to visit.

Beautiful zoo worth a visit. One of (if not) the best zoo I have been to. Animals are well treated, looked after and seem very happy. The staff are very informative and happy to help or answer questions. What I loved most is that you have the opportunity to get up close to many animals in this zoo. We went as a couple and had a lovely day here.

Really nice zoo, well laid out and quick entry. 14 of us went and enjoyed the entire day. The food at the restaurants are nice and priced well. There are all types of animals, shows and the staff are friendly and knowledgeable.

Superb. Had a brilliant day here. Lovely zoo in a very pleasant area. Much more pleasant than where we were staying ( Yes, Red Light ! ). The layout, animals, info etc all great and we would love to go again. The food as well was very cheap. You certainly won't feel fleeced here.

Simply awesome place to be in.. We visited the zoo in May 2015. With our little daughter and my nephew. Not only the kids, but we were amazed at what can be done in such a small piece of land. We being architects, we could actually realize the amount of efforts and ingenuity that was at work here. They have accommodated so many species in such a small area, it is to be experienced to believe it. The kids love the many interactive installations that are put up at regular intervals. The small wheel barrows are a hit.We particularly enjoyed the enclosure where in the wild animals were free to roam around along with the visitors. Was quite a novel experience. They have a lovely restaurant and coffee shop. Check their monthly program before going.

Great Place !. Together with my kids we visited Artis Zoo today. I have to admit, that last zoos I visited were on a very high level (Berlin and Hamburg), so I was pleased by this zoo, but not overwhelmed. Some of the cages and basins are definitely to small for the animals. Prices are very high (90€ for 4 inkl. parking).Variety go animals is very good, especially the aquarium was nice. The whole are is clean an with a lot of plants.Good suggestion if you are in Amsterdam on a nice day with kids!

Great day. Took the tram to the zoo which stopped right outside. We didn't book tickets and bought them when we arrived and were in the zoo within 10 minutes. Staff were very helpful. The zoo is much bigger than you realise yet is well laid out. The elephants,giraffes and loins in particular appeared more content than they do in other zoos. This was a good family day out. Wasn't really planning on going to the zoo in Amsterdam on this weekend break but I am glad I did and would recommend this attraction to others.

Lovely zoo, and one of the best ones I've been to in a long time. I like my animals and I like my zoo's (which led to me to 4 years of university study), and I've not been to a zoo in ages, so it was on a trip to Amsterdam where we decided that a trip to the zoo was in order.We arrived bright and early to get in before the queues, however, there were no queues. In fact there was only a handful of people at the zoo the whole day, though I suspect that this might have something to do with the weather...Artis is very easy to get to by tram, and the walk from the tram stop to the zoo takes you by some great looking buildings and architecture. The cost of entry on the door was a shade under €20 per person, and you can buy a €2 map, the proceeds of which were going towards a new elephant house.The zoo is large, much larger than I had anticipated, but you should easily be able to see everything over the course of the day. There are the usual zoo stalwarts - lions, kangaroos, monkeys, gorillas, and the like, but also critters that I can't remember seeing at other zoos, though these were mostly reptilian, insecta, and molluscan in nature.While we were in the reptile house (they house a nice selection of snakes and lizards, including some awesome and very active legless lizards) it started to rain. Heavy rain. Torrential rain. Not the zoo's fault, obviously, but we were stuck in the reptile house for a lot longer than we intended (just as well I like reptiles). Once we felt the rain had died down enough, we wanted to run to the next enclosure, but, whilst running, the rain started off again, and we couldn't tell which way to go. Eventually we found a doorway in which to squeeze under just to get out of the rain. Unfortunately, we were stuck there for some 30 minutes whilst trying to work out where we could get to without getting soaking wet. However, the total lack of people outside, the howling wolves, driving rain, and swaying of the trees and vegetation allowed me to play out a "Jurassic Park" fantasy (that T. rex almost got us!)Once we could we headed over the sea lions just in time to watch feeding time (it was still drizzling, but the bulk of the rain had dissipated). Although the entire thing was conducted in Dutch (as it should be, being in The Netherlands and all) it was easy enough to follow. Besides, it was great fun watching the sea lions feed - they made a little show of it.Wandering around the zoo we took in chimpanzees, various ungulates, birds (the vultures were particularly gorgeous), elephants, giraffes, and a good many larger mammals.One of the highlights was the butterfly enclosure, full of great looking exotic plants, and, of course, butterflies fluttering around. The butterflies appeared "tame" or at least very used to human presence as they didn't scatter when you approached to take pictures. Marvellous.During our time there we took in feeding time with the penguins, gorillas, and red ruffed lemurs. The latter was particularly good as they allow the lemurs to come out of their enclosures to feed. They often jump over you to get to tree branches, and walk by you going you "the eye", however, I'm not sure they're tame enough to stroke, and because the whole talk was in Dutch and no one else was reaching out, I thought it was best not to. However, it is amazing to get up close and personal with such awesome creatures.We spent pretty much the whole day there and I believe we saw everything we wanted to. Oh, there is even a museum and planetarium in there which was great. Food wise there is plenty to have and it wasn't too extortionate price wise.In short, Artis is a great day out, most of the animals seem "happy", though I did see a wolf limping, but couldn't tell if it was an old injury or recent sustained. The staff are great, very friendly, and always with a cheery "hello".Easily one of the better zoo's I've been to.
Excellent. This zoo is by far fantastic. So much to see and it will be a good day out for any age, it does take a while to get around all of the exhibits so take sensible shoes.

Expensive, clean and busy. We visited today as a twosome of my daughter, aged 4 and myself age 33. Numbers are very important to small people. Almost as much as animals in the zoo. We were very happy that the animals looked happy, with the exception of the elephants who were in a very small enclosure and rocking from side to side. That said, the zoo is well organised and has a variety of species and lots of staff looking after them. It is much nicer than London zoo and is on a larger site in the middle of the city. It is easy to find. Get the number 9 tram from the centre of town and hop off and cross the street to find the queue. We waited in line for 20 mins but it was made painless by the ice cream from the shop next door.Inside the food plentiful but expensive. There are lots of places to stop and grab a drink or some food but the best is the cafe near the play park at the very back of the zoo.I would come back but I'd take a packed lunch and avoid it altogether on a hot day.

A true animal friendly zoo. Normally I hate ging to a zoo. I always feel a pity to the captured wildlife. In Artis however the animals seem to look happier than other zoo's I have visited (exept the gamepark in Kenya ofcourse)Also there's a lot to learn, not only walk around and gaze/
one of the best in europe. big one with very wide range of animals. very tidy, lots of flowers all around, good place to eat but in lunch time. excellent planetarium.

The Highlight of my Awesome Trip. I just completely loved this zoo. Had my little boy been travelling with me he would have enjoyed it too. So many mammals, birds, butterflies, reptiles, fish and so on. I loved each of their exhibit. The best part is that most of the animals are not caged. It's a beautiful zoo. One of the best I have ever visited and I have visited many of them. Their Dutch and Japanese Gardens are very nicely made. The food at their cafe was nice. Good for kids and adults.You need one entire day to watch each exhibit leisurely. As well as visit the Planetarium. I watched a movie The Space Trip in the Planetarium and it was a wonderful experience, though it could have been in English rather than Dutch. Overall an excellent experience. I will bring my boy here for sure if I ever visit Amsterdam again.

Great Zoo. Found this zoo to be very pleasant. Clean, well kept and relaxing to walk around. The animals looked very happy. Enclosures were big and offered good quality of life. I was a bit disappointed with aquarium but I understand as I am biased as I love aquariums and have visited the worlds best ones. This one was good for being within a zoo. Loved the butterfly enclosure - something I've never been too. This zoo has restaurants but no snack bars to offer a small refreshment. Also the gift shop was tiny with a small selection. As a souvenir shopper I was disappointed.

Really lovely Zoo!. We didn't really plan on coming to the Zoo, but considering it was so close to the Resistance Museum we thought we would give it a go, and we had a wonderful day! The Zoo itself isn't huge, which is a good thing to be getting around nicely without completing losing your way. The fact that there were animals very close to the entrance was really nice. Our favorite place by far was the reptile section where there were huge alligators. This is also indoors which was great for us as it was terrible weather! However we really enjoyed he whole experience, which we ended off with some lovely Dutch pancakes!

really nice day. was an awesome place but alot of the animals enclosures are very packed full of places for the animals to hide and not much space for them to run about and stretch. also on the trip advisor thing there was a picture of a polar bear, but they dont have a polar bear. all in all was a very good zoo and the map was easy to follow

Haven in the city. Such a smartly planned zoo in the middle of the city. They have a great variety of animals and they are all very close in terms of viewing proximity. This place is really for all-ages, and all of the information boards are in English, Dutch, and German. Check out one of the animal feedings- the keepers can usually answer questions in different languages. We go every time we are in Amsterdam. It's such a nice break from the city but also really a great zoo.

We went on a whim and had a great day 😃. Great way to spend a day in Amserdam. We were impressed by how much there was to see including the Aquarium and the Planetarium. The viewing of the animals was great, but encloseurs could of been cleaner and so could the water. The Elephants actually made me cry. They did't have half of the room they need and deserve, and when we saw the inside closeures, these were very small with no enrichment and the baby couldn't get to his food. Again, the encloseurs were not very clean. One of the elephants in particular was pacing and looked bored and restless. They were offering a small promotion in the shop, to help the elephants get a larger encloseur using some of the car park. It will be interesting to see if they raise enough money to do that. The animals in general looked healthy, although for some, more enrichment to stop them getting bored would be nice to see. The gardens were beautiful and the little parks for the kids were great too. There was a section with free roaming animals, like small monkeys, sloths and lizards were great and they had a huge area to play in while visitors could surround themselves and close up for photos. The staff were on hand to answer any questions and were very friendly. For €18 the value was great and the zoo was very clean ( apart from most encloseurs). We didn't eat there but we saw the restraunts were big. We went on quite a rainy day but there was enough to see both indoors and out to keep us happy. They offered also a free "daily news" with information on public talks, and animal updates. In general a great day out, just needs more attention to animal cleanliness and a better shop

Lemur experience. This is surely the most kid friendly place in Amsterdam. The array of animals is pretty impressive. Most amusing ones were lemurs. These Madagascar animals seem to be very friendly with humans. Penguins are sea lions are added attractions. Overall a tiring tour but educative enough for kids

Don't pass Artis during your visit of Amsterdam. A beautiful zoo in the centre of Amsterdam.When visiting Amsterdam don't let out the Zoo. One of the most beautiful zoo's in The Netherlands. The last decade they have invested a lot in the wellbeing of the animal. This result in nature-like animal houses, which can best be seen in the "Savanne".The newly added Micropia is also a worthwhile visit. It'll cost you extra though. But the world of microbes can't be seen anywhere else in the world in this way.

A perfect family day in Amsterdam . It is an ideal place for a family to spend a half day in Amsterdam , u can buy a tickets for hop on and off with zoo tickets as it will be cheaper and also there is bus stop just in front of the zoo , the zoo is so organized with many animals and with many toilets and eating area during ur visit , the aquarium was fine , but u have to buy a map to make a proper organized visit so u can c all the animals , it was realy on of the ideal zoo in Europe

Lots to see. We liked the zoo, particularly the elephants. There's lots to see and it's best to take your time and make sure you get around to see it all.One disappointment was the service in cafe near the entrance. The staff were a bit grumpy and we had to wait around 20mins for our sandwiches to me made. It's nice that they make them fresh and to order but we weren't aware and there were no signs to indicate this. Plus we had to try and get the attention of the person making them, which was tricky as they had their back to the queue of people. Overall a nice zoo and worth a visit.

Ace. A lovely little zoo. Not too big but not tiny either. Great for a day out, loads to see and really nice to walk around. Nice little places to sit and have a rest or a picnic. We had a lovely day out. It's easy to get to on Tram 9 from Centraal as well.
Nice zoo. Nice, good sized zoo with many animals. We especially enjoyed the the butterfly-house. First time we heard wolves howl!

Great Day Out. Spent the whole day here, so much to see and do. The kids and adults will be hard pushed to find a better way to spend a day. It helped that the sun shone throughout.Great picnic areas, seating by the water, top photo opportunities.If you go to Amsterdam don't miss a trip to this Oasis in the city.
Nice zoo. This is a nice zoo if you visit Amsterdam. They have a huge aquarium division. For those how live in Amsterdam a year card is to advise.

Excellent zoo - 2nd visit!. This zoo was so good last year we went again this year, it's enclosures are so close for viewing yet at a safe distance, it's great to see the animals happy in their enclosures. The zoo is not too big and not too small, we went on a Saturday so they were open til sunset which made the zoo a bit less crowded which was nice. The only downside was queuing to use our IAmsterdam cards for entry took ages!! There was only 3 out of 6 cashiers when we arrived, which went down to two twice before all of the cashiers arrived - eventually they figured out how to keep the line going quicker! Lol!

Been before but had to visit again!. I came here in 2013 and spent all day wandering around and had a great time so I was more than happy to come back with a different group of friends. Was a lovely day, we walked around at our own leisure there is plenty to do and see... Loved the seal show, I watched them feeding the bugs and the gorillas. Fun family day out with plenty to see and do! I would get there first thing so that you have the rest of the day to wander and make it to the seals for 11.30!Great to see these animals up close.

Very Enjoyable.. Very nice zoo with a wide array of animals, the animal enclosures are very good and give the animals lots to do. Price was very reasonable, I suggest pre paying for tickets from the tour operators in the city or off the tour buses as these tickets are cheaper than on the gate and also allow you to not have to question for ages!

Good for the visitors, not sure the animals are enjoying it as much. We visited here on a weekday and it was very busy so wouldn't go on a weekend! Lots of animals to see, many more exotic animals then in UK zoo but some of the elosures were just too small. All the enclosures were very well done but just not enough space in some of them for the animals to run around, in particular the lions and elephants. We had food at the cafe towards the back of the park which was good and reasonably priced. All in all a good day out, we were there five hours, but just seems a bit more could be done to make the animals happier rather then the tourists

Good but could improve. The zoo is a very nice one. Not the best one I visited though.The animals are well kept in a nice ambiance very similar to their natural one.The lions though need more space, their area is claustrophobic. Very friendly staff and Dutch efficiency everywhere. Liked it.

Very nice zoo with a relaxing atmosphere. We visited the zoo whilst in Amsterdam as my boyfriend has been pestering me for ages to go to the zoo so I thought why not visit a lovely zoo on a sunny day on holiday. We visited the zoo about 12pm and stayed until round 5pm. There are lots of animals to see but also the way it is laid out there are plenty of nice seating areas to stop, relax and absorb the atmosphere. It is very family friendly but also great for couples and friends too. The animals seemed fairly happy, but I did feel they do not have a lot space to roam around. If you like Zoo's then it is worth a visit.

Amazing!. The best zoo I have visited. I myself have a bit of a love hate relationship with zoos. I love going to look at the animals and enjoy the whole experience but I hate seeing animals who look somewhat trapped and not as well looked after as they could be. However this zoo was absolutely beautiful and so were the animals. The animals looked happy and very well looked after. Their enclosures were suitable for their needs, large, well kept, clean and lovely. And the other areas of the zoo were very clean too and all round pretty. It cost me around 19 euros to enter the zoo which I thought was a very good price (I think it was an extra 2 euros for a zoo map which I definitely recommend). The zoo is big but you aren't walking far to find the next animal to look at. I loved the indoor building where you could walk through and there was reptiles and monkeys in the trees/plants around you, it was amazing to see them that close. But I really did love looking at all of the enclosures! There is also wonderful restaurants and cafes within the zoo. There is a seating area next to the flamingos where you can have a drink/something to eat whilst enjoying an amazing view of them! I would definitely recommend wearing comfortable shoes as this is an all day event and definitely bring a camera! Make sure you go inside the aquarium too as walking past all of these sea creatures is an amazing experience.The only complaint I have is that the indoor part of the elephant enclosure was closed and the elephants were trying to get inside, although it would have meant people wouldn't have been able to see the elephants (unless there is a viewing spot inside too?), I would rather them have been happy indoors.
Amsterdam Zoo. Awesome!! Tonnes to see all the animals were well looked after, and amazing to see :) Would love to visit again, next time in amsterdam.

Artis Zoo. Fantastic! The best zoo I have been to for a long time. There are so many species to see and the set up of the zoo is excellent. Red ruffed lemurs are allowed to wonder free and they jumped all around our heads coming within centimetres of us! I thoroughly recommend this as a must-go for all animal lovers in Amsterdam!

Best zoo I've been to!. My and my boyfriend were shocked at how good this zoo was. I liked how some animals were put together in the same enclosures. There was a real verity of animals from cats to reptiles too an aquarium! All for under €20 and even less for children. Spent a good 2 plus hours in here. Also about a 20 minute walk from dam square. Recommend highly and would visit again!

Good zoo. We visit zoos often on our travels and decided to visit Artis Zoo while in Amsterdam. It is a large zoo so either hit the highlights or plan to spend a lot of your day here. They have a large variety of animals and beautiful gardens. Zoos are expensive, and I've come to expect that. However, I don't think I've ever had to pay for a map of the zoo before. To get a map (on top of the ticket price) you have to pay 2 euros. A good distraction if you've had too many museums but not the best zoo I've ever visited.

The best Zoo I've ever visited!. This zoo is amazing. It was literally opposite our hotel, so we had to check it out, and it by far trumps any zoo in the UK I've been to. When we visited we didn't actually realise the scale of the place, and what a wide variety of animals they had. They have all your usual zoo animals plus rare and even unheard of (in my case) animals, that all had spacious and clean enclosures, which is always nice to see. There was also a bird Avery and a reptile/butterfly house. We stopped to watch a Sea Lion talk, which although in Dutch was still an amazing thing to watch, and the cafe served a fantastic array of food and drinks, including fresh fruit smoothies on ice! Delicious. Well worth the visit.
Enjoyable. The inclusive boat trip is an added bonus. The zoo is well maintained but can become very busy especially at the weekend.
Great day out. Large variety of animals which generally have plenty of space, enclosures have a cool design with water rather than fences, takes about 4 hours to see it all, loved the giraffes!

Big. I was there with a friend and we loved to see the animals. The zoo is very big, we didn't have the motivation to go through all the parts and see each animal, but it's lovely for families with children :)

Animal cruelty. Outdated, small enclosures, no stimulation for the animals. As a biologist it's shocking to see so much stereotypical behaviour. Would be a great excursion for ethologists, I saw nearly all sterotypical behaviours for every species encountered. Either go and give them money in the hope that they will improve or better yet, spend your money at Diergaarde Blijdorp in Rotterdam, they know how to treat animals.Artis is a shocking monument of the past and I'm happy our ethics as a species has improved in the last century.

Zoo..why..but enjoyed itg. well hadn't been to a zoo since I was a child .which was many moons ago..very interesting ..nice places to sit within the gardens..you could spend a whole day here ..nice place to relax
Boring. Quite boring. Nothing to do, very few attractions, horrible restaurant, a place to take the kids and leave after an hour or two. Very disappointing.

Family City Zoo Visit. I agreed with my wife that we would go and see the Artis Zoo with our 8 year Old Son,I was slighty apprehensive as I usually dislike City Zoo's,well I was so pleased that I went along what a zoo from the Reptiles to the amazing aquarium,we spent 5 hours here and im sure we missed stuff but I could easily spend a whole day here,A Fabulous Clean and Bright Zoo,I will be returning.

enjoyable but could have been better. Whilst we did enjoy our visit to the zoo it was also very disappointing as we paid 40 euro(20 each) to get in and a lot of the animals were not out especially the big cats. It is also a massive zoo so prepare yourself for a lot of walking if you want to see everything
great activity for children in amsterdam. A very nice experience with my children. We really loved it. A perfect place to spend a day in Amsterdam with children

A beautiful setting for some amazing animals. We took shelter here on a very hot afternoon. The lovely gardens were an oasis and the animals mostly seemed very well cared for and presented. Clearly with such a long-established venue some of the enclosures needed updating - by coming and paying your entrance fee you will help contribute to this. We have mixed views about seeing animals in captivity but recognise the importance of such places in conservation.

Out of all the zoos I've been to in the world, this one is one of the best.. We loved the zoo in Amsterdam, it's in such an interesting area as well. Very, very easy to get to (via public transport anyway). The animals are either roaming free or in huge enclosures with only small fences but large rivers to separate you from them. This is always nice to see that the conditions they live in are good. They have such a range of animals here, and, considering we went here in early March, they were all still out and active. The zoo is mapped out and signposted quite thoroughly and clearly too. The only bad part, the food available is quite expensive and not very varied. I have over 100 photos from the zoo so if anyone would like to see any, please just inbox me what sort of content,
Excellent. What an amazing place to visit. So much to see the day disappeared before we knew it. Exceptionally clean and well looked after .

Definitely worth it. I have spent around five hours there, so it was definitely worth it for me especially because I could enter the Zoo for free with my I AMsterdam City Card (regular entry would be 20 Euros)What should I say, everything that could be said about this Zoo has already been said. If you like animals as much as I do, this is definitely a must-see for you when you are in Amsterdam. But I also feel that some cages (especially for large animals like the elephants) are too small. But I suppose that is a often a problem in large Zoos. And this Zoo IS large indeed.

Great Day Out.. Lots of unusual animals. Able to get very close to the Animals. The zoo was very clean and the animals were well cared for. The restaurant was large and had a good selection of snacks. The children seemed to be enjoying their day out.

no fences- so cool!. When you first arrive the first thing you notice- as someone used to North American zoos, anyhow- is that there is a serious lack of fence in the early enclosures. What a beautiful zoo- their use of water (moats) to enclose animals instead of ugly chain link fence was just a treat. The kids had a blast and we did too!

Animals are well taken care of.. Ive been hearing lots of positive things about the Artis Zoo in Amsterdam. Well indeed when we were there, I would say that, that this zoo was good. The animals were in good shape and plus the places/homes that they were staying were big enough. I find it also amazing that some of the animals they placed there were not even in a cage. The zoo tried enough to give an almost natural atmosphere for the animals which is really nice. They have lots of animals of different species and at the same time I love their butterfly garden. The butterflies just rests on your hand and you can have a closer look at them.This zoo is also good for wheelchairs, they can easily roam around, there are just some steep downhill in one side of the zoo, but it would be no problem with wheelchairs. There is a playground for the children, restaurant and a souvenir shop.

Best zoo. This is the best zoo I've ever been too. You get so close to the animals and there are so many to see. It took half a day and we was rushing as we only had a few days in Amsterdam. I have been to loads of zoos but this is by far the best! It's something you must do if you go to Amsterdam :)

Great Zoo. Enclosures are large and animals look like they have plenty of room to walk about. The Zoo itself is huge and it does include a planetarium and an aquarium within its walls, both of these are included in the entrance fee of 20 Euros per adult which is very reasonable considering it took us over 3 hours to walk all the way round, with a quick stop for lunch. The food and drink in the zoo is very reasonably priced also so don't be worried about being stung in the pocket during your visit. The zoo also has a couple of 'walkthrough' zones, one of Monkeys, one of birds and another of butterflies and moths. It really is a great day out and it is better than any zoo I have visited in the UK, Worth a visit when in Amsterdam

One of the Best Zoos. I was really glad we decided to take a trip to Artis Zoo. The zoo is a little out of the way - it took us a while to walk there but there is also public transit available. My favorite part of this zoo was that so many of the animals were basically free. For example, the lemur house is a house where the lemurs live, but they can exit the house and walk around in the yard which you are standing in. You're not allowed to touch them and there are staff around, but basically you are right up close with these animals. Several of the monkey exhibits were also very open. This allows you to take better photos than at many other zoos where you are shooting through glass or wires. The zoo is large and will take you a while to get through everything which, in my opinion made it worth the slightly higher price of admission. We also paid an extra 2 euros for a map, but the woman explained that those funds are helping build a better facility for the elephants.

Definitely worth going!!. We both massively enjoyed our experience at Artis-Park! The Animals were both abundant and varied. In addition there were several more interactive areas which allowed us to experience an up-close and personal interaction with the animals. All of this was laid against an aesthetically stunning backdrop, 10/10 would recommend for anyone visiting Amsterdam. It was easily accessible from the centre.

ZOOmeravonden / Summer evenings. In June, July and Auguts they have special evening openings (open till sunset) on saturdays with live music. ZOOmeravonden. In Artis you can buy some stuff for a picknick, but feel free to bring your own stuff as well!!

My hometown zoo!. Loved it as a child, and I love it now...been there numerous times, and if it wasn't so expensive I would go even more...now with some modernisations I love it even better! I do miss some animals though which where there before...the tigers, the hippo's and one of my fav's, the manatees...such a pity they don't live in Artis anymore. Of course there's still lots to see and many young animals too...there's even a part where you can walk among some free roaming animals (in the former money house).

Lovely zoo. The variety of animals was impressive, especially entertaining were the chimp & gorilla babies. You can even wander through the lemur habitat & there is a planetarium. The zoo was a quiet spot in the city & has beautiful gardens as well. Well worth a visit.

Great fun. It was a lot of fun and the best parts are monkeys, gorillas, pinguins. Nice for family visit with kids. I recommend also the Micropia museum which needs extra ticket. It was very informative and interactive.

Get close to the animals. Not an exceptional zoo but you do get plenty of chance to get close to the animals. Nice food, clean and relaxed layout. The Micropia exhibit is on the same site and is a good follow on visit in this part of town. Stop 4 on the Citysightseeing bus route.

A lot to offer. We enjoyed an entire day at the zoo. There was so much different stuff to see. The animals,the aquarium,the small museum about the history of the Artis Royal zoo.. did not get to see the planetarium,due to lack of time... but went to the micropia instead.

Amazing Zoo - Brilliant Time - Worth Every Cent. I loved this zoo and it was a lot larger and had more variety of animals than I ever expected. I thought this activity was maybe half a day I wish I had set aside the whole day for the zoo its huge I have never seen such a vast variety of animals to sea life beautiful place and the gardens too. Especially loved the sea lions at the other side of the park with the nice café on top had a latte while watching the sealions swim there are also glass viewing panels down the stairs of the café which i just found so relaxing and revitalising and beautiful butterfly gardens. Although was a lot of walking I left the zoo feeling completely refreshed.

A city zoo with a variety of animals bids and flowers. Busy zoo, with lots of very excited school children, which was lovely to see. I was suprised with the number of large animals, esp the elephants .The enclosures were clear and In Most instances large enough. My favourite section were the beautiful birds and the aquarium. A good city zoo with conservation mmind. Easy to get to on the tram.

A must-see for travelers with kids!. Great zoo - very spacious, green and beautiful! Large aquarium and a special tropical garden where you can see (and feel) exotic butterflies...Several playgrounds great for kids and small children. The enclosures of animals are very spacious and it seems that all the animals are very well taken care of.. they also have a place to hide away in their enclosures =))

big queue not sure why. Took a trip to artis zoo mainly because I wanted to visit the micropia museum which shared the location. Entry was free with the I Amsterdam card, but you do need to queue for a ticket and then queue again to get in the zoo. Pretty unimpressive to be honest, enclosures are very small, and the aquarium although had a few nice specimen fish had a lot of algae and to be honest seen better corals at local fish store. Glad I didn't pay my advice would be just visit the micropia museum unless you have children who really want to see the animals

WOW!!!. That place is AMAZING!
The animals are rare and incredible
There are so many there, it's not cheap BUT if you buy the I AMSTERDAM card you have a nice discount if I remember
But it's definitely a place you don't wanna miss. You have do be there in order to see. Words are not enough to describe :)

Great Zoo. This zoo is one of the best I have been too! All enclosures are very good sizes, some look small then as you walk along it you realise the animals area actually goes across 2/3 enclosures for them to freely roam.Lots of animals to see and different ones from your average zoo/wildlife park.We took 3 hours to go round and I'm sure we missed a couple of animals!

Impressive Zoo!. Very impressed with the overall layout of this place - much consideration and thought has been given towards the welfare of the animals. Took about 4 Hours but if you have more time there is a cafe located within with a spectacular view! Easy access by Tram as well.

Had noticed improvments since last visit.. Ok its not cheap, but still worth it... easily done as its in the middle if the city, if its not a rainy day you can spend a whole afternoon wondering around. Had noticed some improvements in the upkeep of the animals...Trams 9 or 10 or 14 stops nearby.
Fantasticly Green. As a lover of animals, I will always go crazy for a well kept zoo. Animals all had great space and the area is beautiful!

World Class Zoo. A great zoo has to have many components. But the top issue is for healthy, humanely treated animals in an environment where they are comfortable. This zoo has done a commendable job with this essential task.One of the best zoos I've ever visited. Lovingly cared for. Typical Dutch attention to detail. On a holiday to London and Amsterdam. Went to Royal Zoo in Regent Park with high expectations. Somewhat disappointed. Artis Zoo is a much better experience. Make it a stop on any Amsterdam vacation.

Historic Zoo near City Centre. As had free entry to the zoo with our Iamsterdam we decided to pop in after our visit to the Resistance Museum.The zoo was quite well kept and the animals seemd to be adequately housed although there wasn't a large range of animals to view. There is ongoing renovation to make the animal enclosures less cagelike. We did a quick circuit and were entranced by the large collection of pink flamingos that we don't see in Australia.The gardens in the zoo were pretty and well maintained with lots of grassy areas to sit and picnic. From the joy on the faces of the many young visitors there I guess that the zoo is a hit. I'm not sorry that we wandered into Artis Zoo.

A fabulous day on an amazing weekend. On a weekend visit to Amsterdam, we spent one day at the zoo. it was lovely, there was a nice place to sit and eat lunch. There were lots of animals to see as well as nice gardens. It is all flat so anyone with mobility difficulties would be able to spend there day there and manage. We stayed in a hotel near the train station and we walked to the the zoo so I would say its quite central and accessible.
Must see!. I love this zoo! The animals look so healthy and they are afforded so much space! Its such a large peaceful area!
Great Zoo!. Lovely zoo, with a wide range of animals and activities, plus lots of open spaces for relaxing, walking and picninking
Great Zoo. Wonderful Zoo, big enough to spend an entire day inside. The entrance fee is a bit steep - I think it would help a lot to reduce that a bit.

Wonderful Zoo, beautiful park & gardens, lost to do and see, great food options. The Amsterdam Zoo is just lovely, with something for everyone in any season. On warm summer days, you can have a picnic on one of the clean, well-kept fields or in the gardens. You can either bring your own picnic or purchase food. There are many options from healthy salads, fruit, sandwiches to less healthy chips and ice cream. Children portions available as well. There are enough inside things to do for when the weather is not so nice, like the aquarium, the butterfly building etc. The big restaurant "Twee Cheetas" has a very nice playground and a big terrace. There is a nice shop at the entrance/exit as well. Oh yes, and let's not forget the animals ;) Amsterdam Zoo is perfect for a day out.

Tiny living spaces. The animals have very small living spaces. The animals that can seem unhappy, all seem unhappy. The other ones nearly all look bored because there's nothing for them to do, there's hardly any space to move around. There are a few exceptions, but this zoo is a typical example of why there are so many opposed to zoos.

Beautiful zoo. Like others have said this feels less like a zoo and more like a nature reserve. Very open and you can get up close to some of the animals. There is an aquarium in the zoo also which is good.

another hidden gem. My wife and I decided on this brief stay in Amsterdam to explore one of the hidden gems that most tourists passup--the Artis Zoo. My wife can not walk long distances, thus we were very appreciative that the zoo provides free wheelchairs at the entrance. This is jot a large zoo in terms of the number of animals, but the layout is easy to manage, birds--both those in confined areas as well as the free roaming visitors--are everywhere. The plantings of flowers throughout were attractive, as well as the beautiful rhodendrens that were in bloom in several places. The zoo is a mixture of old and new. The acquarium is quiet old, but still interesting. The butterfly area and the small mammal facilities are newer and quite well done. We particularly enjoyed the former as there were two very informative volunteers to point out specific species. We ate at a new facility with both inside and outdoor tables. Reasonable priced sandwiches, fries, and very good desserts. Plan to spend 4 hours to thoroughly enjoyed this gem.

Beautiful park!. The park is beautiful on itself regarding the nature and the (monumental) buildings. They have many different kinds of animals, which makes the room for some species a bit limited. It is good to know however that Artis is improving the living spaces of their animals and will not acquire any new species anymore. A minor flaw I found were the feeding presentations. It was not even that crowded but I could not hear the speaker because of the noise of other people and they were very short. You will need a full day visiting this beautiful park.
good value for money. A good half a day out fantastic environment for the animals the bird house is phenominal Lots of photo opportunities and little snack areas and plenty of seating as well

Nice place . I visited here and I thought it was great in the city zoo! However I love animals and in the UK the zoos have bigger enclosures for Elephants and the lions! There are a heard of them it's too small!!! The lions need more space too! Apart from that it's beautiful and lots of greenery! Worth a visit!

Very pretty to walk through, beautiful old buildings but just too small for the animals.. I have very mixed feelings about this zoo. The fact that the zoo is 175 years old means that the buildings (for example bird house, reptile house etc) are very beautiful and historic. The zoo itself is beautiful to walk through with lots of fountains, waterways and pretty gardens. The staff are really nice and the main restaurant has delicious food.When it comes to the animals, I thought most of the exhibits (elephants, big cats etc) were just way too small. The elephants were seriously depressing, 4 elephants crammed into such a little space. Some other enclosures though like the lemur island and some others were however then again quite decent.So as I was walking through the zoo I really just had mixed feelings all the time. The problem with Artis is that they are in the middle of the city and have no space to expand. They are currently working on a project to give part of the parking lot to the elephants, which I think would be great. Otherwise they just shouldn't have elephants because that enclosure is not decent for them.There are so many beautiful zoos in The Netherlands, I just don't think that Artis sits at the top with Ouwehands, Blijdorp etc.

Lovely place. We randomly decided to pop in and what a positive surprise! Beautiful zoo and animals were easy to see. Liked the fact that there was plenty of nature left, it seemed more like a big park with animals. Take with you something to eat and drink since the prices are ridiculous as they usually are in a place like this.

In the heart of the city. I visited the Artis Zoo on a very warm day during my stay in Amsterdam. I was very impressed by all the plants and exhibits at the zoo. Yes, some of the enclosures are small, but as others have said, the zoo is working on expanding as it is able to. I liked how many of the animal areas were surrounded by moats and gardens instead of fences and wires. The zoo is quite large for being in the middle of a city and I spent several hours and saw most of the animals. There are also several food stands and a good restaurant next to the entrance that is cafeteria style with lots of good choices. Best of all, admission is included with the Iamsterdam City Card! It is also easily accessed by tram. I walked to the zoo from my hotel and took the tram back as it was a warm day.

Fun at the Zoo. You could easily spend a full day here even if you don't have kids with you. Lots of interesting birds as well as animals. Lunch was good and not too expensive. Choose from many options, pay and eat at tables in building near entrance (and bathrooms).

Very enjoyable and something different. We chose to go to the zoo after passing by and being able to see the Flamingos and other birds. From this we planned a whole afternoon there, however it would have been easy to spend a whole day there! The entrance fee was 20 euros each, and an extra 2 euros for a map. Once inside though, everything else was part of the ticket price, e.g. aquarium, butterfly house (and the planetarium although we didn't go in) so we felt that it was good for the price. There was a wide range of animals and exhibits, it felt that some of the there enclosures were slightly small however, we are sure that there was houses at the back for them to go into. It was unlike many zoos in the sense that you could walk around and for some of the enclosures, there were no fences, only a moat of deep water. This meant you could get excellent photos and was a very different experience.They also had an open lemur enclosure, where you could go to stroke them, and take photos close up. This was really cool!There were plenty of benches and places to have a picnic, and you could take in your own food to eat, which meant that it was a very affordable day out... I could easily have gone back for another day, as it was so good!

Enjoyed to the core!. I was looking forward to visiting this place ever since I read the reviews. The place is a must visit whether you are with kids or without. We spent 5 hours here n i would love to come here again
Amazing!. Huge zoo with lots of animals. We ended up spending all day here, personal favourites were the toucan, the elephants and the great hornbill - but they were all great!

Amazing zoo.. This is probably my favourite zoo i've visited. It was a very relaxed and comfortable atmosphere within the zoo, it wasn't hectic or busy and the animals seemed very happy and healthy. There were a great array of animals to see and the zoo was relatively "open-plan" in that you often never felt like there were barriers or fences and it was always easy to view the animals. The zoo was also very tidy and clean.

I feel sorry for the animals.... Yes, artist has tried and is trying. Still, I really feel sorry for the animals kept in too small cages. The set-up so Artis is great. However, it's not suited to today's standards...

zoo . one of the best zoo's i have every been to,but warning please if you have a british debit/credit card dont use the machine outside the zoo it doesnt take english bank cards as i found out when it swollowed my bank card. But all in all i had a great day at the zoo saw loads of animals and the zoo was very clean and well kept.plenty of photos on the digital camera
Very large zoo. One cannot visit Amsterdam without going to this zoo. This is a large zoo with very interesting animals and exhibitions to visit.

Great Zoo. I work in a zoo, so I can give a fair rating to this zoo, and it is wonderful. Being constrained by historical buildings that they have to keep, the zoo has done a good job of blending them in and is also in the process of updating. The food offered throughout is good. The sea lion program was very entertaining, even if I couldn't understand the speaker. The aquarium building is gorgeous and not to be missed. I took public transport (metro and tram) and it was very easy. Highly recommend!

World class Zoo. Artist Zoo is one of the nicest zoo I have seen in the world ,not the biggest by far, but in zoos size don't matter....
Very neat, animals well kept. Human size, it is at the level of San Diego, San Francisco, London, Berlin, Phoenix, ...
Don't miss it.
Expensive but my children like it. The tickets are expensive in my opinion. The animals were not so active and the elephant show was boring. Anyway, my children have no complaints.
Large collection of animals. Large collection of animals, birds, butterflies, fish. Beautiful way to spend your day, especially if you have kids.

Went for a few hours, Ended Up Spending the Day. My wife loves Zoo's. So we always take the time to stop if we can. We went there to spend 1-2 hours, only to be there for the day. I never thought a city zoo would have such an extensive collection. This zoo has it all. There is a good reason this Zoo is over 175 years old and going strong. We saw Otters, Butterfly's, Camel, Lions, Lizards, Snakes, Penguins, Gorillas....As I said it has it all. This was a great city zoo, one of the best I have ever visited. Take the kids, Take the Wife, Take the Grand Parents or more importantly take yourself.I posted lots of Photos, Check them out.

Huge & Amazing. Can't fault this Zoo in the slightest (well, except maybe having some of those phone charger boxes around for the people that use up all their battery taking pictures..).We spent a great 5 hours wondering around, and it did literally take that long - there is SO much to see. From giraffes to hogs. Sadly the Jaguars weren't in yet but the lions were beautiful, we went to see them 3 or 4 times.As adults it was €20pp, at first I was a little surprised thinking it was expensive but once we were inside it was well worth the money, especially for the amount of time we spent there.For lunch it's an extremely good price - €4 for soup, bargain (especially as you can't go elsewhere). Very clean & tidy, also easily accessed (we used the Tram).

Popular with the children. The day we visited the zoo it was chocker block with children although it was a week day. It is not the best zoo we have visited but it still has a nice layout with lots of trees, bushes and flowers mixed in with the animal enclosures. They are currently in the midst of doing some renovations and there are plans to build a new facility for the elephants (proceeds of the purchase of the zoo layout are designated for this plan). Quite a large number of the cages are really quite small but it seems that they are slowly changing this as they can. It is easy to get to the zoo by tram for those of us who are visiting Amsterdam. We always like to visit zoos wherever we go in the world and we enjoyed our visit to this one. Even better, the entrance fee was included in the cost of our "I Amsterdam" city card.

Great zoo, amazing animals, beautiful landscape, don't worry about negative reviews!. We were a bit anxious about visiting as had read bad reviews, and we have visited zoos all over UK and on holidays being real nature lovers. We were very impressed! The whole layout is so well done, beautifully landscaped in gardens, clever enclosures.The big cats could do with more space, but they are aware of that and are planning changes. The elephants space was also a little small but they are working on developing these areas.The aquarium was amazing, the pull for us to go. My son is a massive aquarium lover and the tanks were superb. Huge, well stocked, fresh and salt water tanks - some of them huge! The building it was in was amazing too. If you like zoos or have kids - do visit.We rode our bikes from the centre out and it was a lovely ride out to Artis. Great day out!

I hate this zoo - Small Cages!. I really hate this zoo, it's just so small! Of course there are worse zoos in other countries, but I just don't think this zoo lives up to Dutch/Western Europe's standards. All the cages or living areas are super small, for example almost none of the birds can fly. I do think the people that work here take good care of the animals, I just don't think the zoo is big enough to home all of these animals. There are MUCH better zoos in the Netherlands! Please don't support this.

Worth going. One of the few zoos that are located in the city center. The neighborhood is really nice: not very touristic, quiet and beautiful. The zoo itself is like any other zoo. You can find almost everything.

The Artis Zoo Amsterdam. One of the Best Zoos in the World! Not to be missed! Be sure to visit the beautiful Red Ruffed Lemurs that roam free and love to kick back and sun themselves on bright days! The zoo is also absolutely breathtaking in April when the flowers are in bloom.

I don't like ZOO's and Artis is not one of them. I wasn't to fond of going to Artis. I thought it might be just a nice, more expensive version of the ZOO. It's not. The feeling you have there is like you are in a garden full of animals. You mostly can't see all the concrete walls and fences. Everything seems to be accessible and touchable. Don't miss on the jungle house, aquarium and butterfly glass house. All 3 are beautiful and worth a visit. On Summer Saturdays come early, bring your lunch and spend a day there. They are open until the sun goes down, and there is plenty of space to lay on the grass. The only con is the "observatory". Animations are poor, and uninteresting and most likely won't leave the impression unless you are 3 :)

best zoo i've been too. This zoo is very unique and beautiful. Sutiable for all ages. I went with my partner and really enjoyed it! so much to do there and we went the middle of august so the weather was an added bonus! highly recommend to visit here when in Amsterdam and the tram 29 takes you straight here from central station!!

Great for a day out. Artis Zoo was renovated a few years ago, and when we decided to go there for a day out, we were pleasantly surprised at how the place looks now.Most importantly, a lot of the animals seem to have much more room than before, with some of them, like the elephants and the chimpansees living in big houses while they can also roam around in a connected outdoor area, while others like the birds and the lions have access to places with lots of plant life.The zoo also seems to be kept very clean.The staff also deserves to be mentioned for how nice they were.Aside from tickets to the zoo, we also bought tickets for an exposition at the zoo, which we due to a misunderstanding thought would be opened until a later time than the zoo itself.When we discovered this wasn't the case and we wouldn't be able to visit that exposition, the staff was very understanding and kindly returned the money we paid for the exposition tickets.We had a great day at Artis Zoo and definitely recommend it.

A great day. We went to The Artis Zoo on a weekend break in Amsterdam. It was January, so still pretty cold and freezing, but... the place was awesome. We had something called Holland Pass so we skipped the queue at the gate. The zoo itself is huge and we had a great time. We took beautiful pictures.

One of the best zoos I've visited. I've visited Artis twice, most recently with my girlfriend. We were both very happy with the range of animals available to see. The cafes and restaurants are also nice and quite reasonably priced.However, it was disappointing to see that the elephants have not yet been rehoused. On my last visit in 2013, one of them was showing signs of distress due to being in an environment that was too small, and there is a video on YouTube from 2011 showing the same. The zoo is raising money to provide a solution, and I have emailed them to ask how much progress has been made with this.

Fabulous place for kids spend the whole day!. I was very impressed with the amount of animals in the zoo! There are the big ones, like elephant, giraffe, zebra, there is also a very nice aquarium, a especial area for insects ( very interesting!), for reptiles and a little farm to kids cuttle the animals ( goat, chicken, etc) The place is very large! There is a restaurant inside, a cafeteria as well. I really recommend this place !

INDOOR AND OUTDOOR ZOO AND FLOWER GARDENS. During my last visit to ARTIS I really enjoyed the indoor AQUARIUM and BUTTERFLY-FLOWER-GARDENS to be away from the chilly June wind.The indoor bird and monkey house can be smelly but photo opportunities are great because there are no cages or barrier separating you from the animals.Every year the summer bedding is a little different in 2015 it is eatable summer flower-bedding.To see everything a whole day is needed.

Small exploitation of animals. At first I was happy to visit the Zoo in Amsterdam. First part appears ok and open.By time you get around to the Zebra and Orangutan the feelings changed.Zebra enclosed in a small gravel area, not a nice thing to see.The Orangutan was in a small enclosure and looked extremely sad :(Animals mostly appeared unhappy.Finally I found a set of cages hosting a strange bunch creatures, hybrid animals. Put in a less busy part of the Zoo. This small Zoo has no place in a city, the living spaces are too small.The experience ended up feeling like another exploitation in Amsterdam.

Up close with the furry friends, extraordinary ambiance.. This zoo far exceeded by expectations! At more than 150 years old (the aquarium was built in 1882), the experience is unlike any US zoo. The encounters with the animals are much more intimate -- I filmed a sloth moving from 3 feet away inside the forest house with no barriers, and got within a foot or two of penguins, monkey of all kinds, etc. The ambiance is wonderful. Right in the city, relaxing and uplifting. Probably my most enjoyable stop in Amsterdam!

Interesting zoo!. Me and my partner visited the zoo during our stay in Amsterdam, we had a nice walk from our hotel next to the central station to the zoo. The que was fairly big but it went down quick and we were in within ten minutes, we had a good look around and we enjoyed our time at the zoo!

Beautiful old charm zoo,in a wonderful setting. The zoo is centrally located,easy access.The zoo is over 100 years old ,beautifully landscaped.Love all he free range areas,like a walk in the park,During the summer music nights,a must

Even though it was raining cats and dogs... the animals brought the sun out :). What a fabulous zoo. Not the biggest you'll come across but wonderfully laid out and with some great attractions. Plus they sell hot dogs. Bonus. Only one small criticism ...please build a bigger enclosure for the big cats... otherwise wonderful despite the weather. Thank you for a great visit.

Good and getting better. Artis is a city-zoo which can be easily reached by tram (#9, direction Diemen Sniep) or by foot. Founded in 1838, this zoo is experienced, well seasoned and takes pride in renewing itself and innovate.Part of renewals and innovations is the current refurbishment, relocation of cages and animals and part of the zoo being inaccessible or bein routed past empty pastures. These are temporary measures, enabling the zoo to grow, innovate and give its animals the housing they need. Bear (pun) with them - slowly but surely it will get its shape and a better zoo will unfold itself. Tickets can be purchased online.

A nicely run Zoo. My family spent a lovely day here and saw an number of animals we have not seen elsewhere. Construction work is still in progress but this did not compromise our enjoyment. Pretty much all the Animals seemed happy in their environments. Of particular note is the reptile house which featured some of the largest false Garials I have ever seen and the Seal display which was very fun and informative for both my teenagers. The herd of Giraffes was surprisingly large and there were a number of young and adolescent animals which I presume had been raised at the Zoo.

My back yard. Perhaps I am biassed concerning Artis Magistra Natura, but I love it there. Artis is a classic mid 19th century Zoo and one of the oldest in Europe. Some of the atmosphere has not left, especially if you come early in the morning during the week. Avoid coming there in the weekends, its to busy then.Since I have have a subsciption, I can be found there with a a coffee just enjoying myself. There is a downside however. Some of the cages are very small. Artis is working very hard to make the circumstanses and cages much better, but like all good things it takes time. Still I think its very much worth your while.

Well worth a visit. Artis zoo is a great little zoo. There conservation and breeding programmes are fantastic. Some enclosures are a little small for the animals inside but the zoo is in the centre of a city. Well worth a visit if you have the time!

Great way to spend an hour or two. Well what can I say I love animals and zoos. Anyways, this is a very confined yet greatly diversified zoo. It has a great selection of animals including penguins, seals and baboons. Their exhibits to my opinion are world class. they also have a planetarium which I think is great. Watching the animals relaxes you, the only cons I found in this zoo are some of the exhibits which i found relatively small e.j. (elephant enclosure as well as the jaguar's.) Oh lastly, if you purchase an Iamsterdam card the fee is included so there was no entrance fee for me. the card is purchased right out of centraal station.

Best attraction in Amsterdam. Made the mistake of going to the Plantage cafe before we went into the zoo and wasted half an hour waiting to be served with coffee. Picked up a 'whats on this week' leaflet but the timings for the planetarium were different to what was actually on offer so we missed the Space trip, The zoo itself was lovely. All of the animals seemed well-fed and contented. We went round twice, The butterfly pavilion was super. The aquarium appeared to be only a small building from the outside was packed with many curious exhibits. Super day out! If you are without children find the Browerij'Tij nearby for an excellent pint of real ale.

One of the best Zoo's. Artis Zoo is simply amazing. Had a fun day with my husband. They have a wide variety of animals, fish, plants. I've been too many zoo's and this one is by far my favorite. It's huge and there's so much to do and see. A must see in Amsterdam!

Needs to know its limits. As a small zoo in a great location I really enjoyed my visit here!Lots of variety, clean and nice gardens.
