However, some of the enclosures for the larger animals were very small for such big/so many animals. The 'houses' were all very interesting, the aquarium had lots of sealife in too!

Better than expected!. A lot of places to eat and relax, loads of different animals, loads of space to move around, easy taxi drive or tram from city centre or even the central station. Easy to find your way around, good price entry.

Great. Enjoyed ourselves here for a morning wander. We arrived at opening time but had to wait till around 10.30 for most of the large animals to come out. Beautiful old zoo in the centre of the city. Lovely gardens. Would recommend a visit for young and old.

Pleasant couple of hours. The zoo was not particularly large but we still spent a couple of hours there. I felt that some animals needed more space, especially the elephants. There was a play area for children, which we observed them enjoying. A few areas where you could have a picnic. There were a couple of cafes, however we did not eat there so cannot comment on the food, but they did look very clean. We noticed parents pulling their small children around in pull along chairs, these appeared to be enjoyed by the children.
Great zoo a must in Amsterdam . We went with our 4 boys ages 10-3Best zoo I've seen in Europe , lots of animals very big and clean.Wasn't sure at the beginning if it's worth going so happy we did.

This Zoo Should be Closed Immediately. This is the worst, most depressing zoo I have ever visited. The animals are cooped in pens or cages that are far too small and it broke my heart to see the state of the elephant enclosure. I found this zoo cruel and inhumane and I would NEVER visit it again or encourage anybody else to do so.
Lovely atmosphere. Visited on a dry sunny day in May. Was enjoyable exploring at leisure even though it was busy it didn't feel over crowded. Worth the visit alone or with others

More than a zoo!. This is a great place to visit. It's like a museum/science museum and a zoo in one place. The enclosures are well suited to the animals, who all seem happy and well looked after. It's easy to reach by tram or you could just walk and see sights asking the way.

I am so surprised and disappointed at how terrible this zoo is.. I'm not a fan of zoos but I went here for a company outing. It's a preserved Victorian zoo, including how the animals are treated. We were taken on a tour where we saw elephants in small enclosures, big cats pacing back and forth in cages (because they are now insane). The indoor gorilla habitat was just some straw on concrete. The gorillas looked bored and despondent. The guide said they were "content." Yeah, right. It broke my heart. I can't believe that a city as progressive and animal-loving as Amsterdam thinks it is ok to have this zoo the way that it is. It's shameful.

interesting but very big. Although the dcline in my mobility has nothing to do with the zoo it was too big. My friend and I didn't see it. All, there were people wheelchairs but there was no clear point as to where to get one from, on a positive note they had animals you would not expect to see like otters wollabys and african elephants

Nice but small place.. Lovely place, however most of the animals are in small cages. Also most of the place at the moment is being changed around, so it would be wrong for me to give this place a full review until I visit it when it's completely new.

Appalling. Monkeys stuffed in tiny cages from the 70s with the public pressing their faces against the wire, hordes of mice and rats scurrying across the floor of every single enclosure, tiny, ill-supervised enclosures. Truly sickening. In a city which is otherwise so beautiful and enlightened, it is distressing to see such little regard for the welfare of animals. Avoid it like the plague.

Awesome. What great day out. An easy 25 minute walk from our hotel at Dam Square we easily found the Zoo in a picturesque residential area of the city.The Zoo is set in well landscaped grounds and is pleasant , clean and well laid out. The variety of animal, insect, bird and fish species rivals larger zoos I have been to and information about them is in both Dutch and English.We were there for a total of 7 hours and thoroughly enjoyed every minute and wouldn't hesitate to return again on another visit to Amsterdam.Would thoroughly recommend it.
Best zoo. I live in the UK and this is the best zoo I've ever been too! Not just because of the animals, but because of all the scenery and relaxing atmosphere etc. Definitely worth a visit!

A Well Kept Zoo and Park. What a wonderful time we had in this park and zoo! Everything is well maintained. The animals are well kept. You can watch them being fed (times posted - we liked the seal lion the best). Clean. Quiet. Plants well kept - tulips were still blooming when we visited in early May. Some small sculptures scattered around. We lacked having children with us so had to watch the joyful expressions on the faces of others, many with their Omas and Opas (grandmothers/grandfathers) on this weekday visit. Nice gift shop. A great place for a quiet respite. Trams # 9 & 14

Good Mix of Indoor and outdoor. Easy to get to by tram, if buy a city pass is free, nicely laid out for walking around. Particularly enjoyed the walk through butterfly house. Has a good mix of indoor and outdoor exhibits with plenty to keep children interested.
Best zoo ever!. Great for everyone, has everything you would want for a great day out including play areas and places to eat! Highly recommended.

A lovely park, an old style zoo, can get crowded. Its center city location makes it easy to get to, or walk to. The grounds are charming, with topiary trees and beautiful floral plantings. But its an old style zoo - the animals, though very close, are in small areas, small cages, etc. The zoos small size and easy access can also result in a big crowd on a warm day.

Great zoo!. The zoo is placed in city center (walking distance). It has great layout, offers much for the money (zoo, aquarium and planetarium). It has many places to rest, take a drink or grab a snack. You can be here whole day with you family.
artis. great place to be with the whole family even on a rainy day you can visit the planetarium or the aquarium etc.
Worth a visit. A great place to unwind . Education combined with unwinding in a nature resurve in the midle of Amsterdam

Disappointing visit to Artis Zoo, Amsterdam. Easily the most disappointing Zoo I have ever visited. Animals housed in miserable cramped conditions, whereas plenty of space given to (practically deserted) restaurants, and facilities for human visitors. What ever happened to the concept that a Zoo was for the animals welfare?Shame on the Artis Zoo Director, and on the citizens of the Netherlands for permitting the animals exist in such miserable conditions.Leonie LLoyd von Koenig

So much to see!. The zoo was incredible! The gardens were well maintained and it was beautiful to wander around: you would occasionally forget that you were in a zoo until your stumbled across another animal enclosure, it was so well presented.Definitely go exploring in the different "Houses" - you can read all about insects; fish; etc and learn all about their species.There were so many different species to see and you could wander around for hours exploring, which I did!A fantastic way to pass the afternoon.

Well below par zoo. I'm no animal welfare expert but surely this zoo is well below par. The animals did not seem happy and who would be living in the cramped/ miserable conditions they are. I think the price is far too steep and most of the animals where not able to be viewed due to them being in their shelters.I would not recommend this to any adult couple without children.

Got to visit amsterdan zoo. Nice place to visit for everyone who likes the zoo. I must say that I find the entrance fee for adults €19,95 way too expensive! Parking for a day € 9,- also too much but you're in Amsterdam! I would say, bring your own lunch en enjoy your day in the zoo.

OK for half a day out. There are lovely flowers and scenery - unfortunately not really for the animals.The enclosures I found to be too small, after visiting the likes of Colchester Zoo with large enclosures for the animals, this was saddening.The elephants really didn't have enough room.However, I saw a lot of animals I have never seen before in the zoo and that was interesting to see.The extremely large aquarium section was the best bit!

Nice zoo, especially for the kids. People don't usually go to Amsterdam for the zoo, but if you have some free time, the museums are too crowded, or it's raining, and especially if you have the IAmsterdam card, this zoo is a nice get-away. Some of the animals are indeed in cages that are too small by modern standards, and they told us that they're in the process of expanding the elephant area. Nice indoor exhibits, including acquarium and reptiles. We didn't spend too much time, but especially with kids, this could be a nice half-day excursion.

Good day out. The layout and presentation was good, but make sure that you visit on a warm day! We visited when it was cold and a bit damp and spent a lot of time trying to get warm. On the other hand, the we enjoyed it very much in spite of this.

Beautiful flora....a little heartbreaking for the fauna!. This is a lovely place to visit - gorgeous flower/bloom display but some of the animals have really small enclosures and I have to agree with some of the previous reviewers. It was a little heartbreaking to see the animals - especially the lions - with not much space for exercise or any greenery at all.The flowers were wonderful though and we enjoyed all the blooms more than the animals if I am honest.
Peaceful place in the middle of the city. The zoo breathes a nostalgic atmosphere. It is the oldest in the Netherlands. This also means less space for the animals.
Great place!. It's an ideal way to spend half a day in Amsterdam if you've seen everything already. It is very functional and has a lot of different animals.

Average. We visited with our very young kids, who loved it. But of course, they love all zoos. It had some nice play areas, but the animals were not well displayed. Many of the exhibits seemed crowded together. The food available at the big cafe near the giraffes was average, although the kids meal was a great deal (stickers and etc for the kids to play with). I did enjoy the canal fish exhibit in the aquarium, but otherwise I would say this place is a typical zoo, and not much more. Go visit Micropia near the front gates!

Beautiful zoo. I've been to quite a lot of zoo's around the world and this is definitely among my favourites! The grounds are beautiful and many of the pens are open with water barriers making photo taking much easier. All the signs have an English description alongside the Dutch and there is a great variety of animals. A fun day for both adults and children!

Since childhood a yearly must.. How much I enjoy it nowadays with the grandchildren. It is really a great Zoo. Whenever you are in Amsterdam, don' miss it. (And you don't have to be a or with child[dren] ). Also the staff does there utmost to treat the animals very very good.

Beautiful Zoo with nice park. My friend and I spent around 3 and a half hours there and we were not able to see everything! I recommend going in the morning and spending around 5-6 hours to explore the whole place (including the insects and fishes)! We stayed until closing and there were not so many people around; we could only see the park flora and hear the animals sounds without any human in the surroundings. It was a bit scary, thinking at some point a lion will jump in front of us lol, but a wonderful experience I would repeat for sure!

Lovely day out!. We visited the zoo this weekend just gone and had a lovely time.The animals seemed well looked after with big enclosures that looked interesting and it was big enough to spend a good few hours there but you could see everything. The only thing that was annoying was the queuing system...we queued for 45 minutes to get a ticket but then we had to queue again to get in so they could check your tickets... surely it would make more sense to partition off the area you buy your tickets in so you can walk straight through?Aside from that we enjoyed the day, beautiful gardens and lots of different animals to see.

Not very interesting. If you compare Artis to Zoos around the world, the impression you get is one of pity. Sure, there are a few new enclosures which give the animals some room to move, but MANY of the cages and habitats are very old (fashioned), cramped and out of date. I felt sorry for many of those poor creatures!

At least a day's worth of amazing animals in a lovely park. We really enjoyed walking around the zoo to see so many extraordinary animals and the wonderful aquarium. I do agree that some of the enclosures are too small and some animals showed repetitive behaviour of the caged and bored. I am sure with a bit of rearranging this could be solved. It is such a fantastic collection for people of all ages to enjoy, learn from and marvel at. I too would recommend the restaurant, Pantages. The other eateries have a good range of food but not as nice!

Prettiest Zoo I've Ever Seen. Artis Zoo in the springtime is an amazing experience. Life in all of its wonderful forms showcase their beauty in a small (compared to US zoos) but fantastic locale right in the heart of Amsterdam. Great kids area where parents can enjoy food and drink while watching their children play. Overall a great day- will be back many times over the next couple of months. If you're planning to attend more than 2.5 times in a year buy a season pass.

So beautiful in spring!. Being able to walk among so many wonderful species was great. And the tulip gardens were beautifully laid out, and in spectacular form. Lots of birds in nice enclosures. The sloths were also delightful. If you have time, be sure to eat in the restaurant - Plantages.

A lovely afternoon. Visited amsterdam a few times now and never had chance to visit, finally got there a few days ago, it was totally worth the wait, highly recommend a trip here the exhibits are awesome and the park itself is beautifully laid out. I'd recommend visiting on a fair weather day as most things are out doors

Big zoo but enclosures are FAR to small. I visited the Zoo on a trip to Amsterdam with my partner and we were very excited to see the animals and especially the Bears as that is my partners favourite animal. We noticed that many of the cages/enclosures were FAR to small for many of the animals! The birds with massive wing spans could hardly fly in their enclosure. We were more upset that there were no Bears available to see (bears were our main attraction).Overall it's a big zoo with a lot of animals just in the wrong size encloses that isn't fair on them. Definitely needs looking into by the owners....

The best zoo I've been to so far!. Really easy to find, it has it's own tram stop called "Artis". I think we got a number 10 there. When we got there, we had to que for about 5/10 minutes to buy a ticket, we were asked at the ticket office if we wanted to pay extra to go see an exhibition called "Micropia", we didn't really know what to expect so we decided to pay extra to go and see the exhibition, the exhibition was basically about germs and what germs lived on what etc. I wouldn't recommend paying extra if I'm completely honest... I found it quite boring!Besides that, the zoo was great, definitely the best zoo that I've been to so far. It was huge, we even got lost a few times! There was so much to see, we were there about 3 hours and a half and I'm pretty sure we missed a few things too. My favourite part was that it had rooms that you could walk into and actually be with the animals. They had a few rooms like this, we went into one which had monkeys, bats and lizards - they had the cutest little monkey in there, they also had a separate room that you could walk into full of butterflies which was nice.I really enjoyed my time here and I definitely think you should give it a visit if your ever in Amsterdam.

Big place, plenty to see. We spent about 4-5 hours here and I'm still not sure if we got to see everything, great choice of animals, i didn't rate five stars because i feel like some of the animal enclosures need to be bigger but apart from that great day out

great zoo. we visit on my girlfriend birthday and was surprised how much bigger the zoo was from which we was told, animals was easy to see and looked quite happy with there living place. one point is the lion enclosure could be a bit bigger. Still its a great day out we was there for about 5 hours

First Class. We visited the zoo as my choice for my birthday. Fantastic, its massive we were there about 5 hours, so much to see and do. You can get quite close to the animals and their enclosures are great, they had some animals that I had not see before, they had a butterfly enclosure, a place where monkeys and geko's run free. a surprise waterfall, so so much, The eating places were really nice and not over priced, for 1 euro they give you a token and a cone and you can do yourself an ice cream. I could go on but go for yourselves, Fantastic,

What a surprise. I am not a big fan of a Zoo but Artis is such a beautiful place. It is the first time that I realy enjoyed and could not get enough of it. So many places where the animals have lots of space.The gardens are also amazing. Do not leave without having a drink at the adjoining restaurant De Plantage

An enjoyable day out. Artis is a mixture of a large zoo and well appointed gardens. Many of the older sections of the zoo have been updated and more work to improve the facilities is being undertaken. Highlights are the butterfly house, the aquarium, the walk through lemur area, monkey island and the walk through tropical/subtropical house.

Great for children. I am not a huge fan of zoos, seeing caged animals is not my thing. I felt sorry for the lions, they seemed unhappy. Nevertheless I give 3 stars to Artis because it's a well maintained zoo, a great park for a nice walk with family. People who work there seem to take good care of the animals. Restaurant is clean and staff very friendly.

Favourite place. Brilliant zoo.enjoyed the two visit we did.a lot to watch.zoo is made fantastic for visitors since easy to watch most of the animals.Didnt disappoint me at all.wolves fantastic.elephants worth the money.fantastic Lions.amur Leopard amazing.so much i can go on and on.fantastic for familys

Lovely. I went there on a Saturday evening in August last year (2014). There was a nice concert, we drank some wine... Nice evening. We went for a stroll afterwards through the park and it's a very nice park. You can go on for a couple of hours if you want.

Fun excursion. Was a little chilly on the afternoon we went, so made a quick loop, but had a very nice time. Was included with the iAmsterdam card. Fun animals and displays. Located in popular area, so stuff to do on way to zoo and after. Was not expecting a zoo stop on our European vacation but was glad we were able to fit it in. Funny story - a penguin was hanging pretty close to the front railings, so I kneeled down to try to take a selfie with it in the background... but quickly penguin swooped over and started to snack on my hair (very long and curly hair). I had no idea what was going on while my boyfriend and another person were trying to get my hair back.

Had a great day!!. Two of us went it September, to finish a great week in Amsterdam. The zoo is nice with a planetarium and aquarium. The aquarium was a highlight. The gift shop at the end was good and alot of money goes to improving the environment for the animals.

Really small cages. I loved the authenticity of the zoo, but unfortunately you can see this in the size of the cages. Large arnivores trapped into smal cages, very depressing.. Artis please upgrade your cages!

Great zoo!. Visited with my 5-year old daughter. We were delighted to be very close to animals and even in contact with the animals. The tulips were at their best. It is very easily reached by tram.The micropia shows bacteria, fungus and virusis in very interesting way. Even for a 5-year old if you have energy enough to translate stuff to your own language and lift your child to see things.Bit expensive but good quality for your investment!

Too many animals in too small gages.. It has upsides, but predators are in very unnatural habitat and it feels sorry to be here. Also ticket prices are too high, and it's not well signed. Hard to find what you're looking for.

great zoo. loved visiting artis zoo, lovely animals , great day out with the children, also went in the planetarium and watched the story of the sharks and fishes( nemo type cartoon good for children) the whole ceiling was the screen

A great and versatile zoo :). I LOVED the Artis zoo, there is a great variety of animals and it was very informative. The zoo is very large so there is a lot of walking involved, but the weather was so nice I didn't mind.I did mind the bathroom in the cafeteria area only (I assume- I didn't find any other) and very hectic. Also I found it a bit difficult to understand whether or not I was missing any of the animals in the beginning only to discover after running around trying to make it to see everything that I already had.But other than that, I had a great experience and I would definitely come back.

A Good City Zoo. This is a good example of the kind of zoo that cities built in the 19th Century to promote civic pride. What this zoo, in particular, has achieved is a good transition to the 21st Century. It still has a little way to go, but it is certainly moving in the right direction. The only real animal welfare problem not yet solved is adequate accommodation for the elephants, however plans are in place to renovate and enlarge their enclosure. Other than that, this is a very good zoo with lots of animals that seem to be well looked after. The zoo is quite large and remarkably close to the city centre.

Visit to Artis Zoo. This is a very well maintained zoo and the animals seem very happy and chilled out. There are baby animals as well and this must prove they are happy. There is a variety of differenttypes of animals that I have not seen in other zoos so this was very interesting. Good value money to attend this zoo and would recommend a visit to anyone.

Quite spread out, lots of walking. Lots of interesting buildings holding different collections. Visited on a very cold and windy day, many of the animals had taken cover! Plenty of buildings to shelter in, some tropical and semi tropical with free flying birds. Good restaurant and plenty of loos.

Love love love Artis!. I love the zoo! I even go alone to Artis, no company needed, but my one year old loves is as well. It's nice that Artis is changing a lot of the animal caves. Some are so small, that I feel sad to watch. But thankfully that is changing.My favourite place in Artis is the butterfly house. They have huge butterflies in this huge glass house with all kinds of tropical plants. When it's cold outside, it's pretty sweaty, but other then that it's awesome.

A pure delight. This is by far my favourite zoo until now and that's mostly because of the huge variety and the way you interact with the animals. Instead of the usual fences, in many places, these guys used a normal 1m high fence and a water moat to separate the animals from the visitors. This allows you to much better see and photograph the animals ! The garden is well organised and for 2Euros you can have a map to guide you through the park. Be sure to visit Amsterdam's objectives using a 2 or 3 day city card as you'll save a lot. For me, the museums visited on a 3day city card + 1day region ticket costing me 79Euro, were worth about 150Euros in museum admission fees and transportation if purchased separately !

Great Value For Money. This was an off-the-cuff decision to go, and i am so glad we did. The Zoo is easy to navigate round, animals all look happy and there is lots to see! Would recommend again and again to anyone visiting Amsterdam!
nice day at the zoo. a lot to see and some activities for the kids also when we walked around. Dislike: zoos are not good for the animals. Like: butterfly park, akvarium, layout of the park.

Wolves and tulips!. Very clean zoo, with animals who seem to enjoy their environment. Easy to find, even by walking from Amsterdam Centraal. The garden areas were well-maintained, animals had good conditions. The butterfly-hall is amazing. Good place to visit for young and old, nice to see wolves playing around and having fun.

Poor excuse for a zoo.. I visited here recently, not through choice, but for a field course. I can't say I was expecting much considering it is not far from the centre of Amsterdam, but fair play it is a beautiful area... until you go in. The first enclosure you see when you enter is the camels/donkeys/alpacas/watusi cows/reindeers all in a small sandy area with very little vegetation to graze on- not exactly a natural setting for any of the species. As we walked around there were so many distressed animals in very inadequate enclosures. For example the lions - 3 females (2 looked overweight) and 1 male (whose spine and ribs were showing) in an enclosure that had more water than land, and not enough land to even run a couple of metres, they could barely muster the energy to move for the 30 minutes we were watching them... something definitely not right there! The bull elephant was kept in a tiny area where he could barely take a couple of steps forward. There was a snake (I can't recall which species off hand) that was trying to shed it's skin but the pool had no water in and an awful lot of poo (which for snakes who poo every 3 weeks or so suggests it hadn't been cleaned for a while!) so was struggling to shed. We saw the chimpanzees showing signs of autocoprophagy (eating their own faeces) in a small 'outdoor enclosure'. Nearly all enclosures were dirty, however we did see the Alpine Ibex being cleaned. Very poor enclosure sizes and unsuitable vegetation/subtrate in general. As a student being trained in the area of animal welfare, I shed tears when walking through the zoo and left feeling drained and upset that in this day and age the animals are being kept in such poor conditions. I for one will not return until there is a very big improvement.

Pleasant Zoo in Amsterdam. Artis Zoo is both a very nice zoo just outside the citycentre and a historic place. As a contrast to the sometimes busy city, Artis Zoo is a peaceful place, great for a walk and a cup of espresso.
Perfect. Many animals, great park and there are buildings where you have contact with the animals! Totally recommended!one of the best attractions in Amsterdam!
Loved it! . Came to Artis zoo for my birthday in summer 2014. Really quick process in buying tickets (really reasonable price too). Really clean and loved the experience.

"A Zoo that exceeds expectations!". Me and my friends visited Artis Zoo on a Saturday morning, little knowing that we would end up staying there for more than 4 hours! The zoo has a wide variety of animals, ranging from colourful birds to extraordinary looking mammals and even very rare sea creatures! There are specific areas containing different classes of animals such as the Reptiles' section, the Insects' section and a small but splendid Aquarium. Considering that the entrance fee is less than 20 euros, I would suggest this place to anyone going to Amsterdam, as it is one of the most value for money attractions in the city.

If you like Zoos you should love Artis. My family (50, 49, 23, 21) went to Artis at about 12:30 and when it closed, we still hadn't managed to get to the raccoons and didn't see the planetarium (went in there just after last show had started).However we love animals and can sit watching various ones for ages, so your mileage might vary.We thought it was one of the best zoos we had been to, and I want to stress the word zoo, not safari park, if you don't want to see animals in captivity then my advice is don't go.All the animals we saw looked very very happy and well looked after. The penguin enclosure looked like it could do with modernizing but they seemed happy.I suppose it all depends on how you look at things. I love all animals and own two dogs and two cats (and a load of fish) .We were watching the hunting dogs (looked a lot like hyenas in my opinion) and they had a fair sized place to run around in, but I could imagine numerous people complaining that they need more space.But I know if my dogs had that space to run around in, they would be in paradise. Sure they get walks every day, sure they go to the beach once a week, but I know they would love to have that pen to run and play around in rather than my garden, and I know they would never want to come in the house if they did, and when you look at it like that, well to me it puts things into perspective.Lions seemed happy, that was the one area in my opinion that could have been bigger, but I think I would always think that in a zoo, but they again seemed very content and happy.With that out of the way :)We had a superb day, we will go again. The inside place with the birds was awesome as were the gorillas.We had one really negative experience. We were hungry, had just gone through the very humid butterfly place and above that was a cafe. It was awful in our opinion (unless it was an off day), a tiny selection of food and drink, coffee tasted rank, neither me or my wife drank ours.Luckily however, we tried another cafe, this time the one near the giraffes and zebras (just over the bridge from them) , this one was superb, like visiting two completely different companies, huge selection of hot and cold food, fresh fruit, ice cream etc, coffee was lovely etc. We nearly didn't bother going in after our earlier experience but we are glad we did.While we didn't eat there, we did look in at the planetarium cafe and it seemed very similar to the one near the giraffes and zebras, so based on our experience, avoid the one at the far side of the zoo near the insects.Not sure what else to say, it's a zoo and it has animals :) Staff were very nice, all happily answered any questions in English and the inside places that had staff, the staff were eager to point out animals we might have missed hiding here and there.We were glad we went.

Great zoo!. We had a great afternoon at Artis Zoo! It's really close to the city centre, and it wasn't too busy. Plenty of animals to see, and it was all nicely compacted with not too much walking. I really enjoyed seeing the Sea Lions being fed.
Nice zoo. Animals seem to be well tended which is important. Displayed well. Zoo is comfortable, quiet, and well designed. Worth visiting for a couple of hours.

Lovely zoo, peaceful. Loved this zoo, it was quite peaceful and not crowded at all. A favourite was the tropical zoo houses with free roaming iguanas, birds, butterflies, monkeys - you could get really close to the animals. The playground features a lot of water, a huge favourite with my kids!

Amazing Zoo!. Artis Zoo was amazing and wasn't far away from the city centre at all. We got there early so that we could avoid the crowds and were lucky enough to see the zoo without many people around. From the outside the zoo looks tiny but its actually huge and takes a long time to get around. Ninety per cent of the animals were in adequate enclosures with enough space with a few exceptions. The size of the Lion and the Elephant enclosures where a total joke and was upsetting to see. The sealion show was good fun. Was disappointed that a fair few enclosures were empty too.The alligator is a must see... so big he doesn't look real! And the penguin enclosure was brilliant. Also loved seeing the baby monkeys. Oh and this zoo has a serious Heron problem its swarmed with them.
Love this Zoo. Its a nice zoo to walk around and has loads of different animals you could spend half the day walking round.

excellent experience. The zoo itself is quite large. They have large animals such as giraffes, elephants, lamas, tigers and so on. Separate houses: insectarium, aquarium, butterfly pavilon, houses for reptiles and monkeys. Me and my girlfriend spent 2.5 hours walking around and did not manage to view the entire collection, but to be frank I would be happy to stay there entire day. My favourite part was house with birds, lizards and monkey where you could go along inside the building. The view of a lizard crossing your way or monkey showing off above is just impressive. If you already seen all the museums of Amsterdam, I do recommend to spend half day in the Artis zoo.

MISERABLE AND UPSETTING, ALL THAT'S TOTALLY WRONG WITH ZOOS!!. This will probably be my last visit to any zoo. Built in the 1880's, to me this zoo is stuck in a time warp. It's sad when, in my opinion, the cockroaches in the relatively newly built Insect house have better living conditions than the Lions, Wolves and Elephants. The Wolves reside in a very uninspiring enclosure, bland, uninteresting for both the animals and 'spectators', far too small for the group. The Lion enclosure is also far too small for the pride. The whole place looked liked it need a good clean from top to bottom. The outside bird houses were filthy, full of dead and rotting vegetation and stagnant green pools from which they were supposed to drink and bathe. The penguins only had one small pool in which to swim and clean themselves, the other was empty, presumably waiting to be cleaned or repaired. The place seemed desperately understaffed apart from the newly refurbished Monkey House (built around 1910). Here at least the small monkeys could roam around an open environment and visitors could interact (but not touch) with them and the very informative staff. I am surprised at some of the comments saying what a wonderful experience this had been for some visitors. Yes, I am sure it's fun and satisfies curiosity but do they really stop and think about the conditions these animals are living in every day of their lives? We can simply return home after the visit, they are stuck there until they die. I would have loved the opportunity to walk around with a member of staff and give my opinions of the animals and conditions first hand. Maybe they will take me up the challenge. If you are visiting, after photographing or simply gazing at the animals, take a moment to examine the conditions and living spaces afforded to them and make up your own minds. I totally agree with the review "Sums up all that is wrong with Zoos". I also saw the 'disturbed' leopard pacing up and down looking clearly distressed and the 'dancing elephant' which wasn't really dancing but displaying behavioural issues. The whole place is FAR TOO SMALL, still stuck in the 1880's when nobody cared about animals but I sincerely thought we had moved on since then? Only the INSECTS didn't seem to worry too much!!

Amazing Zoo, a real experience. This zoo completely took us by surprise, we went on a fairly quite day so we got to spend a lot of time going around without it being too busy. They have a numerous animals to see. Would definetly recommend and the tickets were 20 EUROS pp
Amazing! Very interesting!. It surely worths a visit. There's all kind of species, even the tropical ones. Nice place, great behavior by the staff.

Sums up all that is wrong with Zoos. We only visited as free with IAmsterdam card and across the road from the Resistance Museum. As others have mentioned when we picked up entry tickets we were asked if we wanted to buy a map of the zoo and money went to help Elephants which we thought a good cause. To see a large bull elephant confined in an enclosure where all it could do was walk a few paces forward and then reverse a few paces back time after time was quite distressing. To follow that with sight a panther pacing round and round its cage clearly in a mentally distressed state was awful. By and large the animals seem to be contained in enclosures far too small and on hard ground. I guess we spent no more than an hour there including a coffee I thought it was was frightful . I am not one of those animal rights people but I honestly wish it were closed down.

Space in amsterdam. Artis is renovaties. Also when you don't want to go in you can experience on the side the tranquil environment of Artis. Have a drink, enjoy the noises of the animales. Almost in the centre of the city within reach of other nice placets to BE. Good for childeren to play and to experience!

Nice visit. we had a really nice time there. We spend more than 5 hours walking around the zoo. Almost all animals looked healthy but as others mentioned I think they need more space. The ticket was 20 euros

This zoo doesn't offer correct space to animals, a shame. I have been twice to the Artis. My kids like it or course. I decided not to go back since most of the animals have such a small space to evaluate - specially the felins who clearly show signs of depression. I visited some others zoos worldwide where animals where looking not depressed and were indeed living in a bit more space, at least decent.

Best Zoo experience for me!. Oh how i throughly enjoyed my visit to this zoo. Wonderful array of animals to view and numerous things to see including planetarium, butterfly house, insectarium, aquarium, free roaming animal house and so much more. On down side for me was elephants and lions these animals need much more room but all in all a wonderful experience in a fabulous city.

Its a zoo. When we arrived there were many animals hiding away as it was cleaning time, the weather wasn't great (can't be helped) but we soon worked out that a lot of the time you can go indoors and see the animals. There was a good variety of animals however the cages where small and animals mixed together. The planetarium was a disappointment, having never seen one before we were really looking forward to it. The film they showed was about fish but wasn't English so had no idea what was going on or what it was about. Food in the three cheetahs restaurant was good and staff where friendly. Built for family visits.

Stressed out animals and cramped enclosures. My boyfriend and I visited the zoo on our recent trip to Amsterdam as we were permitted free entry with the iamsterdam card. We would not have visited it had it not been free and I am relieved I did not pay for this experience. It was quite distressing witnessing some of the animals in this zoo, in particular the elephants. they were kept in tiny spaces, and for some reason were isolated from each other. One was evidently extremely distressed and was pacing the enclosure looking very aggitated and was convulsing and retching over and over :( When we were at the ticket office the admissions staff asked for a voluntary donation to help the elephants which we gladly gave- well, we couldn't see much evidence of this money going to benefit the lives of the elephants in this zoo at all. We weren't the only guests who were upset by these visably unhappy animals- we overheard several other English tourists saying how unwell and sad they looked. Other smaller animals looked equally distressed in their enclosures, circling the insides of their cages having obviously gone stir crazy. The penguins looked happy enough, but then they have been granted a huge habitat to frolic in together while the largest animals are cramped and isolated which makes no sense! I feel conflicted by the concept of zoos, but feel sadly they may be our only chance of witnessing much of the wildlife we have. Zoos like this have a responsibilty to nurture breeding and conservation of species but this zoo sadly falls short.

Great Zoo a must visit for anyone going to Amsterdam . Visited the Zoo on Thursday 19/03/15 with my girlfriend we walked from our hotel which was near Fredericksplein and took us approximately 15 minutes , The Zoo cost €19.95 and all i can say it was money well spent we spent 5 hours in the zoo and found it amazing . The weather that day was also good which made the experience even better , The zoo also has many indoor attractions so on a wet day it would still be well worth a visit . A Planetarium is also inside but we didnt have time to go in , the highlights for us where the free roaming animal rooms these where fantastic as you can get so close to the animals , a large aquarium and insectarium is also inside . The zoo has all sorts of animals from insects, birds, penguins, monkeys , gorrillas, giraffe, zebra, crocs, fish , it is well worth visiting the zoo for families or couples etc Food and drinks are also available inside but a picnic would also be a great idea because you really can make a full day from the zoo, and being so close to Amsterdam centre you would be mad not to visit
Amazing!. I love that zoo,many spieces as natural environment.Its 20 euro at the door but i think you must see.

Nice Zoo. I loved this zoo for several reasons, one being the enclosures were nice (most of them), they seem to have a successful breeding program, and also that it was full of families enjoying the sunny day (winter, but still sunny).

You simply must see this.. Like a little town, it contains so many species that you'd have to watch the entire David Attenborough production to see as many different mammals, reptiles, insects, fish, etc.

Value for money, unique experience. Everything was stunning! Extremely big with many animals. It took us 3-4 hours to see everything. The setting was awesome and the animals seemed to be very well taken care of.

Lovely old fashioned zoo:) . Great day out! There's loads of varieties of different animals to see! Some that I didn't even know exist (only a few In England) It cost £20euros to get in-which is a reasonable cost if I must say. There's loads too see from giraffes, monkeys, wolves, elephants , birds , sea lions , penguins ,butterfly's and many many more! There's is a big building for the aquarium and there's some cool fish. Or you can choose to go see the butterfly's, they roam around free and are very beautiful! Just check yourself when you leave to make sure you don't have any on your clothing! They are currently building an area for the jaguars too. The only criticism I do have is that I love lions, and I saw 4 lions in a really tiny enclosed space, if they wanted to be outside they couldn't really move around much. Anyway I would definitely recommend! We used tram 14 or 9 from central station! I heard food was expensive so we just bought a few sandwiches and drinks along with us :)

Rain on the zoo trip. I went to this zoo with my friends and the guy who we handed out tickets to told us if we dont wash the stamp off out hand we can go back the next day,so we did and we got in again.We did we very lost in the zoo we ended up looking at the same animals loads of times and we could not find others,we had a map but we still got lost.The animals we saw where amazing and they seemed happy,they had a lot to offer.It was a really good zoo,the aquarium was pretty small but was a nice place to hind from the rain.We ended up spending all day there and we lost track of time it was a lot of fun and would so go back but food and drink there cost quite a bit.

Could spend the whole day there. I understand what people mean when they say it is a traditional zoo, it does seem quite old fashioned but it's very charming. There was so much to see and some lovely parts including a butterfly room and a big room you could walk through with mini monkeys and lizards roaming around. If you have children this is a perfect day out. I will say though the lion enclosure seems insanely small to others I have seen in my life. There was no greenery and no where to run for them... Unless there was a part we couldn't see?

Great experience. Artis Zoo is a wonderful place with large variety of animals. And you can see that animals are well taken care off, as much as they can be in a closed space. But, there should be big maps all around the zoo, because it is a large place and one cannot find the animals easily by choice. We missed great shows because we couldn't find the meeting point. Map is available to buy, but should be available for free, regarding to the price of the ticket.
Great Zoo. We really enjoyed this zoo. It was really pretty and had a large variety of what appeared to be happy animals. I would recommend bringing your own food though as it was very expensive.

A day at the zoo.. A City centre zoo, attractively laid out and with a good assortment of wildlife, some of which were new to me. However I was not impressed with the space alloted to certain animals some of which showed signs of distress ! Once again free entry with our I amsterdam card.
Poor animals. A city zoo and very little sign of conservation. I love Girraffes but these were in such a small enclosure. The Lion looked depressed.

An excellent Zoo. An excellent Zoo and Aquarium. Lots of animals in large enclosures. Highlights include - Wolves, Red Pandas, Lions, Hyenas. Also, Microbia, and a Planetarium are both within the grounds and worth a visit.

Fun day at the zoo. I haven't been to the zoo for more than 15 years so visiting a zoo was exciting! Its so much fun just looking and different animals and just trying to understand them! They have a wide variety of animals from mamals to fish.. It was a good visit.. And yes i would visit again.

Great variety, great location. Lions, wolf's, penguins, butterflies etc. There was a huge selection of creatures from birds to reptiles to mammals and whatever I've missed? Easy to walk around, good toilet facilities, food stalls about and we saw baby elephant and giraffes.
Worth a trip.

Absolutely disgusting!. Animals are not created to entertain. It's ridiculous how many people are jumping for joy about how excited their kids are because an elephant is being poked to perform tricks. Absolutely disgusting!!!

a lovely day at the zoo. My wife and myself had a midweek break in Amsterdam and decided to visit the zoo, i wasn't expecting anything special so we were pleasantly surprised how good it was, excellent variety of animals which kept us entertained for six hours, admission price is reasonable at 20 euros each, it was a lovely sunny day which helped.
Zoooooo. For the size of this zoo and where is it situated it is absolutely amazing. U have an aquarium, elephants, wolves, gorillas and much more. And it is 25 30 min walking from the dam square.

The best zoo I've seen!. The best zoo I've seen in Europe, and I've been in half of it! Lot's of animals, even some I didn't know they existed, birds, butterflies, seals, penguins, reptiles, insects, and a great aquarium! Don't miss it if you're in Amsterdam! If you have kids they'll love it!
A great day out. Its a lovely little inner city zoo with a wide variety of animals. Although its not a huge zoo there is lots to do and see. I think it was well worth the 20 Euro entry price!
very big and very interesting. so much fun and interesting to see, even for adults! cheap tickets, and many places to eat. the zoo was huge. takes about 5 hours or so to see everything.

You've got to go!. I was totally shocked by the zoo, casually walking and its slap bang in the centre. Maybe a 2 mile walk from leidseplein. 20 euros entry and could stay the full day. Every kind of animal imaginable. We spent the full day in here and was worth the money. I highly recommend it for anyone of any age!

Larger than it looks. I visited the zoo whilst visiting the area, it is easy to reach via the #9 tram (€2.80 for an hours ticket).First impressions were that it was fairly large, however there were a few enclosures that you could see were too small for the animals that were located in them, and some others that had areas for water, but the water wasn't there. It was quite sad to see, especially the wolves as their enclosure was quite small, and the lions who you could see were bored as they were pacing in the same area over and over.It is ok to visit, but I don't think I'd visit again.

Good fun. Heard about this zoo from a friend prior to coming to Amsterdam and thought we would see for ourselves. The zoo was bigger than expected and there was the opportunity to get quite close to some of the animals. Some of the enclosures I felt were a little small, but overall it was very nice an well maintained with plenty to see. We didn't have to wait long to get into the zoo visited on a Saturday early march and the entry fee was reasonable. The cafe was also reasonably priced.

Awesome zoo in the middle of the city. Amazing collection of different animals from lions to giraffes to monkeys and wolfs theres lots of great animals here, the zoo is both indoor and outdoor. Its well kept and a great day out. The indoor butterfly sanctuary is just adorable lots a different species of butterfly just freely flying around its pretty cool also the aquarium is awesome too. Overall great day out i would say its worth the €19.95 entry fee per adult we had lots of fun and seen so beautiful animals and creatures.

Amazing Array of Animals.... Visited the zoo as had heard good things about it and couldn't believe the size of it and around every corner there was something new to see.So many different animals on show which was excellent, although was expecting to see tigers and bears, but none there.A couple of the enclosures were a little small for the animals, for example the lions and elephants, so hopefully they can improve that.Having to pay extra for a small leaflet zoo guide/map I felt was a bit off as that should come with your entrance. Also I think you should be allowed to come in and out of the zoo if your ticket is retained or a stamp etc. We had to leave for another booking but weren't able to return so didn't quite see it all.But on the whole it was good and much more than you initially expect to see.

not what i was expecting. I was really excited to go here after reading mostly good reviews. I wasn't waiting for Kong in the queue and there was a lot of animals (although I was disappointed not to see a tiger after I had seen tigers in the advertising).the food in the restaurants was also reasonably priced as was entry. The biggest let down was seeing animals in such small cramped enclosures. The animals were unhappy, I could tell this after studying animal behaviour. It was very upsetting to see animals like this abs I would not visit again. The animals need to have new larger enclosures built and if this isn't affordable animals should be moved to bigger zoos with more space for then.

Great Zoo with some real up close animals. We were quite late in the day, so the animals were mostly being bedded down for the night, but this was a good thing as we got to see them inside their quarters.As ever the gorillas are not to be missed.
Fun. Brilliant day out, really nice and we'll maintained zoo with lots to see, a large variety of bird species and monkeys and primates...

Wow excellent . What a brilliant zoo, I wasn't expecting much seeing as the zoo is in the middle of town but it was very interactive and had some great exhibits, it's rather large for a zoo in a town and every time we thought we had finished we would stumble upon more to see, there currently building a new part for some big cats and the elephants enclosure could do with being extended but I highly recommend a visit - currently free entry if you have a I Amsterdam card
Fun place. Fun zoo with lots of animals and attractions, not very expensive either, and lots to do in a day. In a relatively central area, too.
great value for money. great place to visit and great value for money the animals are will worth a look ...they have also a butterfly part ,underwater fish ,but very cold and wind but it was FEB

Brilliant attraction. The best zoo I have visited. This was my partner's idea and I went along but I'm so glad that we did. I learned a lot, got some great photos and saw animals that I had never seen before. The animals appeared to be really well-kept which is always a consideration of mine. I enjoyed the reptile and birdhouses, and the aquarium is really excellent. It's free of charge with a zoo ticket and doubles as a stately home and museum about the zoo, with some interesting whale skeletons and taxidermy. There is also a Planetarium that holds hourly shows about the stars and space. Brilliant attraction, well worth a visit and the 19 euroExtra tip: make sure to try the hot chocolate from the Planetarium cafe , it's the best one I've ever had.

Great day out!. We ended up spending our last day in Amsterdam at the zoo, and although a slightly different pace to our travels around the city centre, it was such a great way to spend a day. The queue to get in meant a short wait, but there were pamphlets to keep us entertained and the queue moved quickly. By the time we'd bought our tickets we had a map, a list of events on that day and had been helped by a very friendly member of staff. On weekends some of the zoologists do guided tours of the zoo, which we decided to join in on. They were very accommodating by speaking in English and Dutch so that we, along with the locals, felt involved. I'd definitely recommend doing this as you get a history of the zoo, a fairly comprehensive tour and in some cases behind the scenes looks into how the animals are cared for. They have a great range of animals to see, and in all cases are trying to help with the conservation and protection of animals under their care and around the world by encouraging breeding programmes and introducing their visitors to the plights of some of the more endangered creatures. Even in the freezing cold we enjoyed ourselves and the aquarium at the back with a mini museum tagged on was a really nice find when a bit of warmth was needed. The only disappointing part of the zoo was the lack of organisation and the crowds in the restaurants. Despite giving you very little choice but to buy inside the zoo, the few cafes there seemed to be low on food and filled to bursting with prams blocking the doors and people very confused about where they should queue. Other than that it was a wonderful day out which we would highly recommend to anyone with an interest in animals.

Fun! But it's still just a zoo.... If you like going to zoos, go to this zoo, it's a lot of fun and it has a lot of interesting animals from various parts of the world. But the fact that it is in Amsterdam doesn't really bring any distinction to this zoo. Yes it is in the middle of the city and that's not ordinary, but you won't learn a lot about the Dutch fauna. It's a nice and fun activity but that's all.
Big Zoo!. You can spend a day at this zoo so easily. There is a lot to see, lots of animals and exhibitions.Preferably on a sunny day.

Big disappointment. After reading the reviews here, I wasn`t sure to go to the zoo, but the weather was quite nice, so we decided to check out the zoo. The queue was quite big, we had to wait about 15-20 minutes to get in. The zoo is quite big for a zoo in middle of the city. Our first impression was that the animals seem to be very sad and haven´t always got enough place. In the enclosures isn´t any grass or anything green. Okay we were there in February and it rained a lot, but still. The two gibbons have a small "island" with about three ropes, and that should be a gibbon island. The mandrills have two thrown out Christmas trees to play with. In the camel field: camels, donkeys, reindeers and watusi cows together. Why? Only because all of them are hoofed animals? The aquarium is quite nice, but there is a part where stuffed animals are, and there is also a diorama with stuffed animals. If I go to the zoo I don`t want to see stuffed animals. The only reason I give the zoo 2 points and not only one is the butterfly pavilon. It is really nice and the butterflies fly actually on you and they are beautiful. But even after the pavilon I was very sad after leaving the zoo, and I was sorry for the animals.
A nice day out. A fairly good sized zoo with a good variety of animals. A good day out I'm sure if you live locally but if you're in Amsterdam for just a few days I wouldn't prioritiSe it.
Great Zoo!!. Really enjoyed our visit to this zoo, it had all the main animals you would expect (Giraffes, Elephants, Gorillas etc) and lots more. A very enjoyable day out.

fab!. it was a fantastic day, spent hours there! loads to see and do, as well as the animals there was an aquarium and butterfly pavilion. Also how buildings dedicated to reptiles and insects. Huge place! Great but exhausting day.
Great Zoo. I really liked this zoo, the elephants were my favourite. I wish there was a chance to interact with the animals for example feeding them.

Loved it! . Absolutely wonderful so much better than any zoo I've ever been to before! We couldn't believe how amazing this zoo was what a wonderful gem in Amsterdam! It was so up close and wonderful the animals were all around you and there was so much to do and see. It would be a wonderful day out for anyone particularly families. There are lots if exotic animals you wouldn't see in England and wonderful experiences for everyone
very good. A bit expensive but worth it . Lots of animals. check out the alligator,, it is so big I thought it was not real, but it was moving, the whole heated walk threw is very well done.

Nice old city Zoo. Artis Zoo is an old zoo, in the middle of the city of Amsterdam. Although they are modernising the zoo itself, it is very pleasant to sit and listen to the animals and the trees. Lots of nice animals in a parky surrounding. The big 5 is present.

Great morning!. This was a great morning out and we could have spent longer. The highlight for us was walking into one of the buildings to find marmosets, iguana and other creatures with no caged. The bird house was similarly open. Staff were very helpful and informative.

Very nice zoo. Very good zoo, good selection of animals including a bird house, reptile house and aquarium as well as all the normal animals of a zoo. However the map we purchased promised bears (my boyfriends favourite) yet we got to their enclosure and found something else in there... Hibernating maybe? But it would have been nice to have been informed even if just by a sign or something.Overall I would definitely go back

Better then I thought it would be. Artis Zoo is a lovely zoo which me & my boyfriend did not expect. We had brought the 'I am Amsterdam cards' which we received free entry to the zoo with the cards so took advantage of this. Good variety of animals including Lions, elephants, giraffes, zebras, gorillas, chimps etc However some of the enclosures were very small especially the lions & elephants which was not nice to see. The layout of the zoo is a little confusing as not many signs up saying where to go etc but as it was a nice day we didn't mind strolling around the zoo.

Excellent. Every time i go travelling to a new country i always visit the zoo. I have to say this was a beautiful zoo with free roaming birds. The animals are easily photographed as they are not all in enclosed cages. Its immaculately clean. Fantastic for children's education, lots for them to see do and touch. The restaurant is fantastic with a variety of hot and cold food.

Zoo . A zoo is a zoo. It was fun and enjoyable, but I felt some the animal cages were too small for animal itself. There were four elephants in a tiny enclosure but monkeys had it bigger? But like I said it was enjoyable and don't let my review put you off

Great for families with young children. Artis Zoo is a lovely zoo and a great place to visit with children. The layout of this zoo is very compact, so it is actually ok to move around with your stroller and not be totally exhausted at the end of the day. There are several fun playgrounds for kids. The zoo restaurant is awesome. You can sit down, have a peaceful lunch or coffee and let your little ones play at the adjoining playground. For the older kids there are really cool movies at the planetarium (which projects the movies in its dome shaped theater. The planetarium also hosts great facts about our solar system, gravity etc. My kids love, love, love Artis!
Poor animals! Terrible conditions!. Poor animals! Terrible conditions. Large animals, tiny cages. So sad to see it.. I would not recommend to visit there.. Visit the zoo in Rotterdam, much better!

Great Zoo. I thought the zoo was great! Animals were not all behind wire fencing and cages. Animals looked happy! Were lots of animals to see and I think for 2 adults it cost about 40euros so not bad at all. They have an aquariam aswell. Would love to go again!

Always nice for the kids. I mostly enjoyed visiting Artis with my chlidren. They loved it all. It is true that animals are not in their habitat, but they do their best in Amstedam. The variety is good and they have evolved over the years.
Super zoo. Had a day out at the zoo with my young grand daughter who loved it. A nicely laid out zoo with good facilities. A good selection of animals and birds and a very relaxed atmosphere.

It's OK but too small. I have been here only once, but personally I feel sad for the animals behind such a small place. I know kids will enjoy it, but it's just too small. I am biased as I am comparing Artis with some other larger parks (Zoos) in Netherlands.If you are a tourist, on a short trip and have a pass which includes the visit to Artis, then go for it otherwise it's not worth spending 1-2 hours.

tiny enclosures - not the best. this zoo was ok - nothing special - enclosures are very tiny - animals seem limited to the amount of space they have. just your usual animals - wolves , lions a depressed looking bear walking round in circles. Although did see camels which was a first in a zoo for me. but as i said just an average zoo.

New Enclosures Needed. Parts if this zoo are fabulous and parts are horrible. The big cats have no space to move around in the enclosures are tiny. Some of the smaller animals are roaming around free in the houses. We enjoyed the aquarium but to see the lion's and leopard's in such a small space was heart breaking.

What are people talking about?. I have been to a fair few zoos all over the world and this is right up there as one of the best. I'm an animal lover and I don't believe animals should be in enclosures for our entertainment/enjoyment but with the exception of the big cats (which did have a very small public space - they may have a bigger area out of view - here's hoping) I didn't feel any of the enclosures were small/lacked stimulating equipment etc. If you are comfortable with the idea of what a zoo is then I don't see why you would feel disappointed/uncomfortable/sad even with what you will find here. It's a beautiful place, well landscaped, with enclosures well spaced so it didn't feel like everything was on top of each other. The admission price was pretty good (not like London Zoo!!) and they have a wide spectrum of animals, some of which I had not even heard of!It's worth a visit if you like animals, they appear to do good work and in the majority the animals seemed comfortable and not the normal stressed appearance you often get in European zoo's.

Disappointing. First of all I will say I looooove zoos as I am a huge nature lover but this place was quite frankly disappointing. They do have a wide variety of animals but the enclosures are pretty rubbish for the time it's been there. The aquarium needs a serious facelift!

Absolutely awful.. Heartbreaking. 4 lions in a tiny enclosure. Elephants sad looking and not enough space. Lots of large cats and small cats that had tiny enclosures and we're just pacing the whole time, no where to climb, nothing :(. The amount of disrespectful children in the place was rediculous!! Throwing things at the animals whilst their parents watched, some trying to stamp on ducks and chasing them, absolutely disgusting and no keepers were seen the whole time I was there, no one to tell children not what to do, no one anywhere. The lack of enrichment within the enclosure was also disturbing as the animals all just looked like they'd gone crazy. So shocked at the lack of animal welfare within this zoo in this day and age. So upset. I love zoos for conservation but these animals are not better off there more than being dead.

Good fun even for big kids. We were not planning on visiting the Zoo but with our last few euros on our final day we decided to pay a visit. Must admit I thought it was a tad pricey at 20 euros per adult, nevertheless we enjoyed ourselves. Huge range of animals to see, a lot more than you would think looking from the outside, would be great trip in summer.

An amazing zoo. You would never expect a zoo to be active in winter, but in Amsterdam you can go to this zoo in the middle of February and see every species imaginable out and about enjoying their day! Giraffes, monkeys, exotic birds, butterflies, apes, porpoises — they're all on display in a very well laid out, accessible zoo. The zoo offer strollers for families, restaurants for dining, and rangers who pop up at different locations to provide ad hoc information on what you are looking at. Great photo opps too. I can only imagine that this zoo would be even better to see during the spring and summer.

Nice change of scenery in Dam. My GF and I spent 5 days in amsterdam and got a bit bored of walking around the same streets, so it was nice to get away from it all at the zoo. All the animals looked happy and healthy, with plenty of room in their enclosures. There was lots to see from Lions to chimps and gorillas. Most of the animals you would expect at a zoo. The only bad thing for me was the only tiger there is a stuffed one. The food was nice and pretty cheap. It is well worth a visit if you are in Amsterdam and have 2 - 3 hours to kill

Amazing butterfly exzibit!. Every zoo is interesting but Artis zoo Amsterdam has smth unique. Butterfly exzibit is the most interesting thing I've seen since Cosmo Caixa Barcelona.Animals are well taken care, aquarium is ok,nice picnic lounges but Amazon reptile exzibit, butterflies and planetarium are must see things at Artis. Located close to city central, get there by tram and spend wonderfull time in the afternoon with friends and children.

Fantastic zoo!. We chose to visit on a Monday and it was really quiet which as great! We felt like we had our own private visit as we barely saw anyone else. The staff (especially Lemurs and Penguins keepers) were informative and friendly. Even translating into English specially as I was the only non Dutch speaker. Felt like I had my own private penguin feeding time!The price is fair for a zoo but still 19.95 EUROS which could put some people off. It was well worth the visit. Make time to listen to the keepers and note feeding times. The sea lions and penguins were hilarious to watch.

Lots to see!. We arrived at 11am & left at 4.15pm & I'm sure we missed things! Absolutely loads to see - even on a cold day. Our favourites were the many indoor exhibits / animals - there were lots of them & I think this is what sets Artis apart from other zoo's we have been to - really beautiful, well presented & so close to many of the animals. This is not to say that the outdoor exhibits / animals were not good it's just that the indoor parts were so great. The animals look in good health. We visited the planetarium & aquarium - your entry ticket into Artis gives you entry to both so actually not bad value as you really can spend a whole day here & feel like you have got your monies worth. At the end of the day, the kids absolutely loved their time at Artis & for me that is what it's all about.
Amazing!. Really large place that takes a good amount of time to go round. Few enclosures have minimal caging for a more natural surrendering. There is also a planetarium and aquarium.

Lovely!. we had such an intimate experience here for some reason, I am not, per se, a huge fan of zoos as I believe animals should roam free, but, this zoo somehow seemed different; animals had more space to roam, they seemed happier, they were very well looked after, it seemed, we had such a lovely time here, and ate there, too, the food was good, that we decided to go again, and we enjoyed it again.. yes, very good..

This zoo is awesome !. The high number of species is the best assests of this place. The zoo is beautiful and weel organised. They are making big progress for the worse part of the cages (some are really old). The places with no barreer between animals and visitor are really great, like the forest house or the lemur island. Animals seem healthy and well in their head. Take good shoes since the visit is pretty long if you want to see everything ! Even in winter the animals were there and thriving !

Everything you'd want to see at a zoo. Good sized zoo, large enclosuresLots of animals! Elephants, zebras, giraffes, monkeys, lions, tigers, penguins, meerkats.Butterfly house.There was a good sized play area for kids.Not over priced in entry fee.

Highly recommend!. Unlike a lot of European Zoo's, all animals in this zoo have plenty of space to roam. I loved visiting here! I have visited the zoo about 5 times it's so good. Quite cheap, around £20 which is fair for what you see, and I would especially recommend a visit in summer. There's a small shop for souvenirs but it's a little on the expensive side. Food is ok, very Dutch so if you like Dutch you will enjoy. The elephants are the best attraction!

Even in winter this a great place to visit. Spent about 3 hours here. Even in winter there are plenty of covered houses to visit and most of the animals didn't seem to mind (except one shivering merekat). Animals have loads of room to move, plenty of space in the enclosures. Cafe is a little pricey but the food and drink and good there. Loads for the kids to see and do.

Superb Zoo a must visit for familes. excellent zoo, vast in size, clean, good services, massive amounts to see and do, you could spend hours and hours there with the indoor and outdoor exhibits. If you are visiting Amsterdam with children or even just adults i would highly recommend a trip to Artis, we had a fab time and there are lots of nice places to eat nearby so its a great day out!!

Lovely!. Visited over winter. Weather was awful but the zoo was still beautiful. Would recommend this for anyone visiting Amsterdam, we are a group of friends 18-22 and loved it. Would deffo recommend for couples, older travellers and for families it is a must do!It is set out lovely, very open, most animals are in enclosures or on little islands as opposed to cages. Would recommend getting a map for €2 as you will probably miss certain bits with out one.The best bits for me where the Butterfly house, the sea lions and the elephants.

Great Zoo. Great Zoo! Good range of animals, certainly superior to London & Edinburgh in terms of variety, although enclosure size does seem a little cruel for some. Not 100% what they were called, but not far from the entrance, the goat like little nutters managed to sneak into my top 5 favourite animals. Running around like Bez from The Happy Mondays on a mad one, tiny lamb sized fruit loops dropping off a 6ft rock face, while 2 of the big lads are having a fight on the top of a shed roof - mental scenes. 2 things though;they do need to clean the glass looking into the gorilla enclosure, the red light district's were nicer and no butter to go with croissants in the cafe, it was a tough morning.

Lovely zoo - feeling very sorry for the animals. This place is enormous - and I wish I'd read the reviews before we went, as another reviewer has mentioned that there was a map available and that the zoo would be hard to negotiate without one. It was!When we arrived, I thought it was very small looking, but with every turn, we found something new.They have a massive range of beautiful creatures to see, including Elephants and Wallabies and Llamas, oh - and fish and monkeys and reptiles - it doesn't end!It was freezing that day and the animals must have surely been feeling it too, they didn't look happy or interested and from the sound of the Wolves they were all feeling the same way. I don't think I've seen animals so depressed.I really enjoyed going to see all the different animals, they were all beautiful, but I left feeling very concerned for them.
A great birthday. We went on my birthday and it was one of the best. We saw when the lions, penguins and the giraffes was fed. The butterflies house was so beautiful. One of my favourite zoo

Animal friendly zoo and beautiful park. Instead of looking at them IN cages they have several cages where you can walk IN to their habitat. Great selection of animals around the world in well kept habitats and a great park to walk in

So many animals. There are a huge variety of animals at this zoo, which makes it very interesting compared to other zoos that I have seen. There is however a major problem that needs to be addressed. A lot of the animal enclosures are far too small. This is especially the case for the elephants and the lions. The male lion seemed very distressed. Yes it is good for us humans to look round because it is not far to walk from one enclosure to another, however it is clearly cruel to the animals. Also other than the gorillas, there was not much evidence of stimulation for the animals, e.g. they were just laying the food in front of them rather than making them forage for it. The zoo is clean, and it was interesting to see animals that I have not seen before, however, there are serious concerns for the welfare of animals in terms of space.
Good Zoo. Hi,Its a nice zoo with lots of animals. And we spend and knowing lots of new animals and species. I can recommend it to all people and kids.

Love it! Much bigger than you think - spend the day.. We loved the afternoon we spent at the Artis Zoo but could have quite easily spent the whole day there - it is massive and there is so much to see! My highlight was the monkey house where you walk through and there are small monkeys, birds, bats and even a sloth roaming free all around you. You can get so close to them, it was a fantastic experience! The zoo is huge and it is easy to miss things if you get off track - we could have done with a map! All the animals were fantastic - we were lucky enough to see a baby chimpanzee being fed by its mother which was really special. The Lions, Giraffes, Elephants and Gorillas were great too! Would love to go again.If you fancy a warm little snack find the Poffertjes house by the petting zoo.

Penguins are cool. Zoos are my primary point of interest wherever I go. And as a penguin lover they were the highlight of my visit to Artis zoo. But the whole place was amazing. I highly recommend it.

One of the best. I have been to many zoos in europe including in Berlin/Spain/Athens but i have to say this zoo was the best of all.Especially the tropical section where u can see the amazing coloured butterflies
Enjoyable afternoon. I wouldn't say anything stood out in particular to make this zoo different from any other but I liked it. Great way to amuse the kids in a city.

Must visit Zoo. Many species of birds, animals, insects and fish...super nice. worth a view especially if visiting with Kids and family. Depending on how long you spend with each attraction you could easily spend 3 to 4 hours looking around.

The best zoo :). Had a fantastic time at this zoo with my partner. This zoo is much more open than others i have visited and it was really nice to see the animals out and about. We tried to see as much of the zoo as possible. Top points for us were; lemur land, where lemurs run free around you, The butterfly enclosure which was beautiful, although watch your step because we spotted tiny frogs walking around too and the gardens were also beautiful and we took lots of pictures.We also visited a building next door which the zoo workers recommended called micropia - thye called it their "invisible zoo" which was also fantastic.Highly recommend - my favorite place to be in Amsterdam.
Really nice Zoo. I really enjoy this zoo, just as much as my kids do. Have a nice walk spending time with your family, my favourite part is the aquarium.

Amazing zoo!. Being a big fan of zoos I was very excited to visit artis, and I was not disappointed! Quite expensive to get in, and I feel maps should be free instead of €2, as without a map the zoo would be quite confusing to navigate! However this being said I thoroughly enjoyed my visit here! The forest part where you are in the exhibit with the monkeys was my highlight, and the Savannah area is also very nice. Cafe was also not overly expensive and had nice views of the giraffes. A great trip for anyone who loves being close up to animals!

Gem of Amsterdam. Historical zoo in the heart of Amsterdam. Perfect place to visit with or without kids. Quite a lot of animals indoors so weather doesn't effect visit that much. Animals are easy to see and there is always something to see. Thorough visit will take whole day.

A must go while in Amsterdam. I love zoos and this one us no exception. We went on a rainy day in january. Most of the zoo is indoors so the rain was not a major issue. There is a n indoor rainforest setting were you will meet monkeys, lizards, sloths and bats, a massive butterfly house, insect house, reptile house, bird house and huge aquarium. All of which are clean and well kept. Some of the bigger animals are outside such as lions, giraffes and elephants. It is a 20 minute walk from Amsterdam centre. The tram is also a great to get there as u get off at the artis stop. The zoo is right around the corner. I will visit time and time again, rain or shine!

Best zoo we have been to!. Despite the rainy weather, we had the most fantastic time at the zoo. Easily the best place we went during our 5 day trip to Amsterdam. Not only is there is tonnes to look at, you can get so close to the animals, who all looked happy and well looked after despite the January weather. There is an aquarium which is beautiful and very relaxing and also you can go in a small planetarium but hardly any of it was in English so that was a waste of time but you don't have to pay extra to get in so it didnt matter. We used our Iamsterdam cards anyway so the whole day was free. I can imagine that it gets very very busy during the summer so go early. As it was winter during our trip there weren't that many people around so we got to see everything and take our time. Well worth it!!

Unusual animals from a North American perspective.. I've been to many zoos throughout the USA so, with that in mind, I give this zoo a 5 rating because of the unique animals. There are some species there I have never seen anywhere else. It's beautifully laid out and doesn't take all day to walk. If you are a zoo or biology person, I highly recommend it.
Good day out!. We had a fab time at the zoo - it's very well presented and has alot of fun activities along the way. We loved the aquarium especially!

A Dancing Elephant and Chasing Butterflies.. Went to the zoo during what was probably quite a quiet period.
