They have an awesome range of animals from the tiniest butterflies (housed in their own tropical enclosure) to a magnificent elephant who was dancing!It is reasonably priced compared to other capital city zoos and the cafe is also resonable.It took me and my partner about 2.5 hours to tour the whole zoo, however this could easilly become 3 / 4 hours with a child!

Great zoo in the city!. This is a great zoo in a great location in the city. It is really compact so easy to see all the inmates in one visit, however, to do the animals justice you should allow a minimum of 4 hours. The zoo has a mix of old and new enclosures and facilities and with the exception of the tigers and other cats the animals had plenty of room and everybody looked happy. There are 2 young giraffes and the sight of them chasing each other around their large enclosure was fantastic. The aquarium is supurb and worth a visit alone. Good facilities and food at reasonable prices. We visited in early January and the 2 main cafes were open all day. Some building work ongoing to build a new enclosure but this doesnt really cause inconvenience.
Not a great visit. Animals looked awful. 4 elephants in one tiny enclosure, one of them looked like it was going crazy and could barely turn around. My boyfriend liked it, but it really wasnt for me.

Great zoo. So many different animals in one place, loved the Gorilla, the butterflies that you couldn't get pics of because they don't stop, the big tortoises the aquarium and all the other amazing animals you get to see. Definitely recommend this zoo. We got there at about 1pm and still managed to miss the Planetarium because we spent too much time looking at animals which proves how much there is too see.

Lovely Old Zoo. My husband and I love zoos, we have tried to see as many in the Netherlands as we could, the Artis, is the one we have seen the most frequent..we have seen this zoo in all seasons,, its the most beautiful landscaped Zoo we have seen in the Spring. It is the oldest zoo in the Netherlands and probably in all of Europe,,The animals appear to be very well cared for, we really enjoy each one, and we have our favorite animals that we love going to see. We try to see the new babies that are out with their parents,, it is such a joy to see. There are several nice places to grab a drink and a snack,,I especially love the one where you can see the zebras and water fowl..Our only disappointment is when the schools bring the kids to the zoo, they are undisciplined for the most part, the teachers or aides do not seem to be BOTHERED by the bad behavior, they scream and run and jump , it is quite annoying ,, this occurs every time there are a load of school kids at the zoo. It is too bad the schools and the teachers have no control over the unruly kids. No we are not fuddy duddys but it would be nice to go to the zoo with out screaming kids running thru the zoo.Aside from our gripe about the school kids,, it is a fantastic zoo

Lovely Zoo. This is a lovely zoo,we have been here 3 times now,and each time it has been as good as the time before.You can get up close to the animals and birds.The penguins swim pass you just by your feet.The inside enclosures are great where the birds and animals are free.The people in the enclosures are very good they point out the smaller mammals to you so you don't miss them.They are very knowledgeble and informative as well.The butterfly room is lovely and there were so many flying around its so lovely to see.When we were there this time there was a lot of work going on around the site as they are increasing the jaguar area and it will be very large by the looks of it.It would be nice to go and see the results.There are a few places to eat but we go to the one where you can look out onto the zebras.The food is okay to.The wolves were howling which was amazing to hear and they can go from one side of their enclosure to the other by a tunnel that goes under the path you walk over.It really is a full days trip out as aswell as the zoo there is the aquarium with loads of tanks of fish and the planetarium to go in as well if you wish.This time it was December for our visit and it was a drizzly day but it didn't stop us from having a great time.We also walk there from our hotel and it takes about half an hour so we get to see more of the city as we go.But i believe the no9 tram takes to there anyway.A well worth visit.

Lovely zoo get close up to animals. Zoo is a short tram ride from the centre of Amsterdam - we bought some special pack which has gold and silver tickets which you can swap for tickets to different sites.we chose to use our gold ticket on the zoo as the children would enjoy that more than looking in a gloomy museum all day.

Great zoo in a fun city. This wonderful zoo in the heart of Amsterdam is the oldest zoo in the Netherlands and one of the oldest in Europe. It is compact (meaning that enclosures for some of the animals are smaller than in many other leading zoos, and also that youdont have to walk too much), but that does not take anything away from the attractions of the place. A must visit if you are traveling to Amsterdam with kids.

Great closeups with animals. Excellent zoo with a good variety of animals to see.We really liked the monkey house where you got right up close with the monkeys and no barriers.The information cards in the monkey house and the bird houses were also fun for identifying which animal is which species.Most everything was translated to English, which made the experience better for us.

Worst zoo - needs closing down!. This is by far the worst zoo I have ever been to! 20€ to go in which is acceptable as I have paid this before, and on top buying a map which is 2€ which apparently goes towards improvement for the elephants, so of course se purchased. As soon as you start walking round you begin to think where is the rest of the money going? It certainly isn't going on the animals! I've never seen animals look so unhappy and stressed and ill! The majority of the zoo only has one animal in a huge pen all by itself along with a huge dead tree stood in the middle. The animals are just curled up in a corner shivering and shaking because they're so cold and skinny. On the contrary some cages have far too many animals in for the size! There were 4 elephants in one cage when there was barely enough space for 1! I will admit that the inside parts are well presented and the animals inside seemed much happier! It's so cold in Amsterdam, why not make the whole thing an inside zoo? It's really run down and needs some serious TLC. I think clearly the staff are pocketing the money because you can tell the animals aren't gaining anything. The only animals that looked content were the Penguins and seals, and that is because they are meant to be in cold surroundings! I really can't understand how there are so many great reviews on here.

Changed my view about zoos. I was enjoying my visit, seeing all the animals, having a bite at the cafe near the entrance, having a good time, until I saw the bear. This poor bear was pacing around in a circle, jerking its head whenever it turned. Clearly it was bored out of its mind. It felt really sad to see that, and to be honest, I just wanted to leave after that. While the zoo itself is impressive in terms of design/layout and the range of animals to see, the incident with the bear really ruined my visit, and I'll probably not be returning to any zoos in future.

Loads of Animals. . Zoo - LOADS to see absolutely loads of different animals. PlanetariumAquariumAll zoo animals from around the world. BAD THINGS FOR Me: Poor lions enclosure - it was tiny. Birds of prey enclosure small. GOOD things. Loads of educational things to learn about. Space / fossils / every animal board has information. Spacetrip was on Dutch only - we walked out. Cafe is ok - Not much selection.

Beautiful but .... One of the best laid out and attractive in appearance zoos that we have seen. We were here over the holiday season and whomever is responsible for cleaning was off for the holidays. We had to leave more than one exhibit because of the over powering smell of ammonia . Would like to see it again during a non-holiday when it is properly staffed so that we can enjoy all of the exhibits. Also hope that the future renovations create a little more room for some of the larger species exhibited here.
Great zoo. So it was actually a while ago I visited here but it's a very well later out little zoo with allot to see for it's size if your in Amsterdam for any period of time definitely worth a visit

Not to miss...!!!. Even though it was a very very cold day...we enjoyed so so much...!!Impressive variety of species...wild animals...bears...gorillas..reptiles...insects...butterflies...but also penguins and seals that you can also watch them dive through the glass wall.....Also we visited the Planetarium inside, wich was nice...not something special...!!Great place to be and stroll around the gardens...!!You will feel like you are in another place completely!!

Fantastic central zoo. Loved this place. Almost don't want to give it a review and spoil the surprise.Huge variety of animals (african wild dogs - komodo dragon) including a few free roaming animals. Only downside was the limited space the big cats seemed to have but hoping the current development of some new housing will lead to improvements for those guys! Could easily spend hours here.
good. collections of old and unique animals and also large collections of fish inside,, one must see this zoo

Great day. Visiting in December made no difference to the experience. A treat for animal lovers and a fun day out to see a different side to Amsterdam. Artis Zoo is really worth a visit, easy to walk to from the central area of the city.

Brilliant time, loads to see! . Went as part of our iamsterdam card package (extremely good value!). Spent about 3 hours wandering around on a cold morning! Was a lovely atmosphere, getting so close to some animals was very unusual, would recommend going into each of the houses, especially to see the sloths and pigmy marmoset, the lizards appear quite friendly too!! Had a close encounter with a cross lemur, the keeper didn't seem bothered, but showing its teeth was enough for me!! The lions seemed in to small an enclosure, they are doing renovations, so hopefully they will address that. The gorillas were fascinating, beautiful and mesmerising to watch. The aquarium is so worth a visit.Had a lovely coffee in the cafe by the giraffes, cake pretty good too and a very reasonable price considering a tourist attraction!! Easy to get to on tram 9 from centraal station.

The best Zoo i have been too. Wow , a lovely spacious zoo with a great variety of animals who all seem very happy , the zoo caters for dutch and English speakers very well and there are various walk through exhibits where you are very close to the animals

Great. Loved this zoo, the fee is quite high but there are a wide variety of animals, i have been to many zoos in the world and this one had one of the most varied selection not too mention for a European Zoo. This zoo by far was better than London Zoo - more animals and more exotic animals too such as Elephants, Leopards and Asian Lions and people are friendly too.Only problem i had is the Lion and Elephants enclosure had a fence which those animals could easily have crossed, especially the lion if it was hungry which was quite scary.

Lovely visit to the zoo on holiday!. The Artis zoo is so reasonably priced compared to those in the UK, and quite easy to find via public transport, in a nice area with some lovely passétiers and cafés nearby. The staff on the ticket desk were friendly and helpful, and we spent a good four hours wondering the grounds of the zoo admiring the animals. The zoo is also home to an aquarium and planetarium, as well as an insect house. There are plenty of places to duck into if the weather isn't great to wait for the showers to stop, and plenty of outdoor seating to enjoy a picnic or just sit and watch the animals. The zoo was very clean with no litter or cigarettes anywhere. We went in a day where there were several school trips, but as the zoo grounds are so large we were able to explore peacefully for most of the day. The zoo does also have a cafe but the menu is limited and a little overpriced, so we didn't bother purchasing anything from there. The trip to the zoo was actually one of my favourite days whilst on this trip!

beware feeding time. While this zoo is smaller than other European zoos, it has no less atmosphere for it. There is a sense of intimacy when you wander around this area. and if you prefer zoos where there is interaction between the animals and customers then you definitely have to check this place out. There is an island where you can walk around with the monkeys while they are squaking at each other. no need to be afraid. The elephant enclosure is another good area to visit - especially when the young ones decide they want to play ball and dad doesn't :) the souvenir shop is limited as is the cafe but the animals are all well looked after and there are regular information sessions from the keepers. If you can get there for feeding time - do it. It's quite entertaining - especially the Lions (around 1230).

AMAZING ZOO. this is an amazing zoo! Clean, beautiful and huge! The animals are very well kept and healthy. It would be easy to spend an entire day here. We went without kids and as two grown adults still had a great time. I would go again. Worth the visit!!
Nice. Worth the visit! Many animals and an impressive aquarium! However it is mostly a children's way of fun and as an adult I got a bit bored after a awhile

Loved it!. I really loved it. Walking to there, there and from there took us around 23000 steps from trainstation :D Worth the effort. Saw my first panda- red panda. That free leamur was soo cute, almost ran me over. Loved the butterfly house. Really hot and moist though. If i ever get a chance, i will visit it once more.

Worst zoo ever!!! Not zoo worthy!. The zoo is a very old one and does not live up to the present day standards for animal wellbeing! The animal areas are small and one can clearly see that animals are stressed; skin, behaviour and other issues cleary visable. One can not say that visiting this zoo is educational; maybe it is a good education to show how zoo's should not be used! If you love animals; please do not go here!

feeling like traveler. This Zoo is very beautiful with some newer and older buildings, the butterfly garden is really beautiful and you can walk through it, so you definelty can notice more butterflies. Furthermore it isn't to big, so you don't have to climb mountians to see all the animals in the zoo. Also the way to a certain animal is very clearly explained, which makes it easy to find them. A pity is that the big cats, in the big place that they live are sometimes hard to spot.

good zoo...but times change. Was an interesting visit but as I have done African safaris and a lot of other wildlife things it felt weird. I appreciate this is the only way some folk can observe wild animals plus also conserve them. But their natural environment is the only real way.

well maintained zoo. We were in Amsterdam for four days so decided to spend one of them at the zoo, we were not disappointed. A little expensive to get in unless you can find a discount, once in we followed the signs around which were easy to read. loved the seals and penguins. The best bit was the butterfly house as they fly pass or land on you. Monkey house was good too as you can walk around while they are free to roam about you (little monkeys!). Lion area did seem a little small but they did not look uneasy and you could see them well. Some other zoos have such a large enclosure you often can not even spot them. we didnt have food as we took sandwiches. You can easily spend four or so hours here. well maintained, lots of keepers around to help tell you about things.

Amazing zoo!. I have been to London Zoo plenty of times, however I found the Artis zoo even better. Such a variety of animals, even some I had never heard of before! There was a lemur part were the red ruffed lemurs walked about freely, and we even got to watch them being fed. I stroked a couple even though you weren't meant to and it was the softest thing I have ever touched! The staff member didn't tell me off, he just laughed and shook his head and waggled his finger. Definitely would recommend for all ages!

Good day out, small enclosures. Having Colchester Zoo on my doorstep sets a high standard for zoo visits. Good variety of animals, my only problem was that some of the enclosures seemed too small - especially the lion. Definately worth a visit, especially on a hot day

WAKE UP CALLS. my wife and I are from Suriname but live near Artis. When people ask us what we like about out neighbourhood we always say: every morning we are awoken by elephants and monkeys! Due to the abundance of birds in the zoo we also enjoy the twittering (no pun intended) of multiple birds both local and exotic that are attracted by their relatives in captivity although their captivity has been greatly assuaged by allocation of more individual space. The zoo offers a lot of amenities for both homo sapiens as other animals. I really enjoy taking my grandchildren out for a picknick in Artis. Also during summer months parties are organised within closed doors which makes the zoo a kind of family member. Right across from the zoo there are many nice restaurants for young&old

Amsterdam city zoo and park. Artis is an historic park and zoo in Amsterdam. They are in the midst of renovating the animal housing. The zoo has all the animals you would expert in a zoo, among others, lions, elephants, bears, zebras, crocodiles, monkeys, sea lions, penguins etc. Furthermore they have a beautifull aquarium, and a butterfly farm. The spend a lot of time landscaping the flora and fauna in the park, which makes it a beautifull place to visit in every season. The price is quite high, but if you are planning to go two timers or more, you should consider a pass partout. We love go come in Artis and would recommand it to all visitors (and residents) of Amsterdam!

Amsterdam city Zoo. The zoo is really in the city of Amsterdam. Easy to reach by public transport.It's a nice zoo, with many different things to visit apart from (of course) the animals.All in all I love to go here, it's a nice walk and there's always something interesting to see and some good time to spent and talk with the people you want to spent time with.Recommend!

One of my favorites!. This zoo is one of my favorite things to go to in Amsterdam. Especially since I live around the corner of course, but also because of the fact its a real city zoo and they know how to use the small area. The penguins are the best!

Best zoo i have been to. I was a little shocked at the price but i soon released it was well worth its value for money, amazing zoo, the animals are all extremely well looked after, they had many enrichment techniques and the zoo itself is beautiful.Also the zoo is very accessible and within walking range of city center, would defiantly recommend.

Two adults at the zoo!. We are two 50 somethings and we had some time and decided to visit Artis Zoo. Although not large, we enjoyed sitting outside and watching the animals. A very pleasant place in the middle of the city. Like a breath of fresh air. Great exhibits and atmosphere.
Not many animals. This Zoo is average. It is a walking distance to the Maritime museum. Not many animals there. The Zoo map is not provided for free even though the entrance fee is not cheap.
Great. I loved this zoo, would defo go again on my next trip! Loved the lions and baboons..spent about 2 hours here was lovely scenery

Great place to visit!. It is a very nice Zoo, in the centre of Amsterdam, easy to reach and with plenty of thinghs to do and to see!
Not to miss if you are in the city!

Zoo!. I didn't even know there was a zoo in amsterdam until I visited in February! A local that I knew took me and it was absolutely beautiful! Had such a nice day there and there is such a variety of animals and its a world away from the rest of town! Very enjoyable experience!

More than just another Zoo. Been to Artis many times. It keeps getting better because they do a lot to explain animals to children. Especially recommend the aquarium and the exhibition showing the life in the canals in Amsterdam. The place is just the right size. Plenty of organised activities and places to eat healthy food (not just chips).

Unexpected delight. This lovely zoo is a great place for families to enjoy animals from around the world. One of the best parts is a butterfly habitat with some of the most amazing plants in this city. There are plenty of places to take a break and get a bite to eat or something to drink. Not the usual tourist thing but really nice to visit.

My First European Zoo. I went to the zoo with my husband. He only went with me so I wouldn't go alone. We loved it! European zoos are similar to American zoos, but different in many ways. I saw animals I have never seen before. The animals appeared to be happy and well cared for. I was fascinated by the birds, big and small, that allowed such close contact. I fell in love with a penguin, a red panda, a monkey the size of my thumb, a duck, and a weasel animal with a yellow coat that laid down at my feet. I will make this a stop on my next trip to Amsterdam.
Must visit place. this zoo is worth visit because of the architecture of the enclosures as well as the beautiful aquarium building. old horses and girafes are the main attractions.

Great zoo with much to see. I was surprised at some of the negative comments about Artis. At the start it was a small zoo but it has been expanding regularly - now with an African Plains section and a waterfall. There is an array of features including the butterfly house, a fascinating aquarium and some cheeky monkeys who throw dust at people who get too close.There is an excellent cafe at the African Plains which serves hot and cold food including little punnets of strawberries and fruit. The planetarium wasn't working the day we were there but staff gave us free tickets for another visit to make up. Can't complain about that.Given its not quite the size and splendour of say Zurich Zoo but its an honest attempt to develop a well laid out and animal friendly environment.The only thing a little annoying was that the planetarium programme is in Dutch. Really for an international zoo that welcomes many thousands of overseas visitors - the commentary needs to be in English or at least English subtitles.Staff at the zoo and cafes were very polite and friendly and didn't object to tourists needing directions to the next attraction. Worth a visit and a leisurely stroll.Trams regularly pass by the zoo, particularly the 9 and 14 trams
Good. The equipment is good, and the place is easy to find, but it is a bit similar to some other zoos, no any special points can be found here, it is worth your visit anyway!

Favourite zoo in Europe. Just a beautiful zoo with sculpted areas and very clean enclosures. The animals look content and don't move to harassment by people. The cafe have great prices on fruit and drinks which is a surprise for any attractions in Amsterdam. A great day to be had especially the aquarium with its many large exhibits.
lovely. did,ent think there was a zoo in a city.easy to get to on tram lots to see and theirs a lovely aquerham very interesting lovely day out

Perfect for a visit. this zoo is worth visit because of the architecture of the enclosures as well as the beautiful aquarium building. giraffes and cheetahs were missing on the day but we visited anyway. Overall a pleasant way to spend some time

Nice zoo. A zoo is a zoo but I think it is worth mentioning the architecture of some of the enclosures as well as the beautiful aquarium building. Was disappointed that the giraffes and cheetahs were missing on the day we visited though. Overall a pleasant way to spend a few hours in the fresh air.

City Zoo in Amsterdam. Artis is one of the oldest zoo's in Europe; the 19th century buildings are beautifull! Due to regulations, Artis needs to build a new facility for their elefants. Artis can use all funds for that, because expansion within citylimits is very expensive.A simple way to help Artis succeed in building the neccessary new facility for their elefants; just GO and visit this wonderfull zoo! Spend a morning or afternoon and be amazed by this beautifull zoo with spectaculair animals!Check www.artis.nl for more details.Great zoo!
A Zoo. Artis Zoo is a zoo like any other zoo, but the fish tank area is good. we had a good time on a rainy day :-)

Lots to see and you can get really quite close to the animals. Beautiful zoo with lovely green areas and plenty of animals to see. There was an aquarium and a bird section as well as the usual animals to see. You can get quite close to some of the animals so you can get some great photos!

Great review...from a zoo sceptic... I've read quite polarising reviews about this zoo prior to our visit and decided to give it a go for my partners birthday. I tend to be quite sceptical about zoos as I adore animals and don't completely agree with having animals in captivity. My view on zoos revolve around 3 core things...animal welfare, value of education to the community and conservation efforts. I'd say Artis works pretty well on all of these points.The habitats are very well laid out, as this is a city zoo to enclosures aren't the biggest but they have done a great job with them. Where possible they have gone down the European route of avoiding fences or walls and using moat's instead, this is much better for the animals. Above all else the zoo and enclosures are incredibly clean. The big cat enclosures needs reworking, but they are in the process of construction on the new buildings they will be moving them too. The zoo has a great combination of animals, architecture and gardens. The staff are very friendly and the talks are very worthwhile. Would certainly recommend.

Average. I didn't find the zoo to be anything special. I mean, it was fine but it didn't stand out to me from any other zoo i've been too. The aquarium is pretty cool, and there's a beast of a crocodile there (though i just ended up feeling sorry for him his tank is so small). If you have time then sure, check this place out, but i would not say it was a must see.

Worth the time. Artis Zoo is amust visit if you are going to Amsterdam with kids, friends or family. There is a display from large animals (gorillas, elephants, etc) to insects. There is a couple of sea lions and sharks but nothing amazing. There are also some guided tours but you can walk your way around the zoo without the need of the guided tours.

I can't understand why there are so many positive reviews. This 'zoo' is a disgrace. If you see the big cats' and wolves' cages (and yes, these are cages, not compounds), the monkey 'islands', the sea lions' pool, and many of the other 'attractions', you feel like you've traveled at least 50 years back in time. Yes, this might be one of the oldest zoos in Continental Europe, but this is not an excuse for its 'standards'.The 'savanna' area appears to be up-to-date at first glance. However, soon you'll notice ostriches standing close to the fences apparently stuck in some sort of a traumatic loop (supposedly caused by having been in way too small cages for years) that forces them do the same thing time and again every couple of seconds. It's sad. Really sad.Some reviewers have pointed out the 'beauty' of the aquariums--in most reef tanks, the reefs are dead (or barely alive). Half of the tanks look like they haven't been cleaned in months. Great aquariums? I don't think so.Granted, the butterfly dome (whatever its name is) is neat. At least in theory. There were kids running around and screaming (as they did in the entire park) with no respect for other visitors (ok, these are kids) or the animals. If the parents can't (or don't want to) keep their kids in check, you'd expect that someone from the zoo would intervene, but no. (Not directly related to the zoo, but: Indeed, I saw two kids spitting at animals. When I told them to stop, their mother came up, telling me not to tell her kids what (not) to do. Ok.)To top it all off, they charge 20 Euros per ticket. Please don't go there and support Artis. Whatever would happen to the animals if this zoo were to close down couldn't be much worse than the dire existence they're living right now.
175 year old. Very big, consist of all types of birds and animals, in a very green envinronment, collection of rare birds. just 10 min drive from central point of Amsterdam.

Loved the zoo. We 100% loved the zoo such an unexpected treat to find a zoo of this size in the middle of a city!! All the animals looked well cared for although I was slightly upset by how little space the camels, reindeer's, donkeys, llamas and horned cow things have between them.We spent hours looking around and you could get super close to the animals. We came to the zoo to see the Bear however upon arrival at it's enclosure we discovered it has since left the zoo.A lovely way to spend the day - 100% recommend.

Big and great. We had the Amsterdam card - so the entry was free of charge. It was an amazing big and beautiful place, very clean and very practical. I personally loved the Aquarium, a large old building with a lot of different fish.

Micropia. We went to the Artis Zoo or should I say to the new exposition, Micropia!Very interesting exposition about the micro-life. Very interactive and very good explanations about each subject. We arrived there at 10 AM and without even knowing it, we finished more than 2 hours later. Done with passion and with intelligence, I can only recommend Micropia to everyone from a kid to a grown up adult.

Nice, but pricey. I went to the zoo with no expectations, and it was OK. The ticket price for 20? was a bit pricey for me. The Zoo is HUGE and it will surely take you an hour to two to check it out. Also, wanted to see the Gorilla, but the cage was empty. All in all, id say if you wanna see something cool and have the money check it out- but in the morning or near noon.

Brilliant day, even for adults!. My bestfriend and I came to Amsterdam for her 21st birthday and on Saturday afternoon decided to have a look at the zoo. Absolutely incredible day, very interactive with lots of shows and you can get very close to the animals, almost in touching distance! Well looked after animals with large enclosures, the only problem is as you can get so close to the animals, screaming children obviously make them nervous so they don't like to come up close to you. There should be more staff to try and keep the children from disturbing the too much. Expect giraffes, lions, elephants, otters, capybara, llamas, camels, a huge aquarium, taripins, gorillas and many more!Also very reasonable price of €20 for an adult, excellent quality for money and big enough for you to walk around for hours.
Very nice zoo not far away from thr centre. The zoo is located very conveniently for tourists and has nice restaurants and cafeterias. Not to mention all the beautiful animals.

Pretty good. Wide variety of animals and for the most part looked well cared for. I would say that the entry tickets were a bit too expensive bit that could be just because the zoo wasnt really my number one choice on the itinerary.

kids heaven. I love to go to Artis with kids. You see more through their eyes, ahev more fun. Artis gives animals space in their own right. In doing that, you see more relaxed animals, at least that is what I think. I especially love the aquarium. Really worthwhile to sopend some time (even without kids :)).

Huge!!. The zoo itself is actually huge! Very pretty and scenic, especially the garden area with the Roman statues. Sadly it was raining when we were here but I imagine during the summer it's stunning.They have a vast amount of animals and all seem well looked after and well fed. In particular, the chimps and gorillas were fascinating. You see them in a very large glass enclosure and you can watch them for hours. Very entertaining!

Zoo with a natural setting. The Artis Zoo uses natural, not caged settings for its large animals. You may not see as many as you would in other zoos but it makes the experience more pleasurable. Ghe grounds are filled with a vast variety of plant life that makes it a pleasure to walk around. There are plenty of play sites for small children and you can rent a buggy to pull them in when tired. Highly recommended.

small zoo in heart of the city. It's a nice small zoo in the heart of Amsterdam city. One would easily be surprised how well they managed space to cater a wide variety of animals in a small space. Children would like this place particularly.

The Zoo. Artis Zoo is a large zoo with lots of displays. It is best to get there early in the morning so you can see everything. The tram stops outside the zoo so it is very easy to get to from Amsterdam city. It is great for all ages.

Steep entrance fee but totally worth it. I went here on a weekday. It was a bit rainy.The entrance fee is quite high, but this contributes to the animals' well being.The animals look well taken care of, and there are many places to actually feed and/or touch a few animals. Some exhibits have free roaming monkeys that you can feed and touch, and other areas have free roaming exotic birds.Animals include:Large mammals like tigers, bears, kangaroos, elephants, panthers, lions, giraffes, rhinos, hippos and chimpansees/gorillas and others.Every small mammal you can imagine including armadillos beavers and platypus.They have a large area for insects and reptiles including big snakes, exotic insects, aligators, lizards and turtles.There is also a large area for the aquariums. Huge aquariums with sharks and a diverse assortment of exotic fish, jelly fish and coral.All in all, no matter what your favorite animal is, you are bound to find them here (also hyenas, owls, ostriches, a big butterfly farm, sea lions, flamingos, okapi...i could go on forever..)There are nough places to grab a bite to eat, but as expected it's very expensive.Toilets are scattered throughout the park and are pretty well maintained. Very clean park.Well worth the money. Would recommend to go on a dry day to see more animals as some were hiding from the rain.
Great day out. if you like zoos this is one of the better ones ,good selection of animals and it is friendly and very family orientated
Love it!. Love this beautiful zoo in the centre of Amsterdam. Many people come here to see the animals but also many come here to relax, play, meet friends etc.

A small Happy Zoo. IN the middle of Amsterdam Artis is an old zoo with a few lovely buildings datiing back to the nineteenth century. There are a few places where you can roam around the animals, the Vari's a kind of lemurs, walk around on an island, and sometimes even jump on your shoulder, since they are perfectly harmless, I like such an experience a lot. Buttreflies dart around in a lovely greenhuse and every day you can hear stories on specific times on the seals, the penguins, the evultures and many more animals. You learn a lot from the people who take care of these creatures and all of them are enthousiast about their "own" special animal.Not all animals are present since Artis doe not want to perpetuate capturing wild animals to boast they also have a Tiger or a dolphin. Artis does however also help with breeding the rare oryx.

Great for short visit. Great place for any occasion. Not a very big park, but that makes in even better in my eyes. In a few hours you can view the whole zoo. Recently there opened some new places to drink and eat next to the zoo, which makes it even better to visit. Lot's of animals, very different buildings and nice staff. Been there for a few times now and i definitely go back! It is a little pricy though.
Best zoo I've been too!. Loved it here, absolutely massive and took us a whole day to walk round it was a lovely day and had some great animals too look at

Wonderful Zoo. Visited the zoo on 31/10 with my 2 friends. What a marvellous zoo this is. All the animals are well looked after, plenty of variety and lots of photo opportunities. A great day out and easy to get to by tram.
Great Zoo - Sad Big Cats. A nice Zoo.Small mammals area and indoor exhibits great.Big cats looked very bored in cages that were too small - Other than that great

well worth a day trip. Fancy something different from the shopping, museum, bars and drugs than I would definitely recommend here. went with my boyfriend thought it was last for 2 hours as it is not really advertised but was walking around for 5 hours.The aquarium was amazing, the lions and reptile areas were worth a look.The signs/descriptions have about a third missing in english but didn't really spoil any thing .

Half a day well spent. This zoo is absolutely huge with so much to see and do. As adults in our mid 20s we still enjoyed it! It seems like a great place for kids as well. It also has a planetarium so definitely worth the price.

Awesome zoo!. We had a fab time at the Artis zoo! Not too expensive, but lots to see. Been to a few city zoos in the past, where animals are few and far between, but not here! Make sure to visit the gorillas, giraffes and lions! There are also cheeky meerkats and penguins all really close up. The butterfly enclosure was also fantastic, and you get an aquarium experience thrown in, too. Insect room not my bag, but loved the reptiles.We paid the 2 euro donation for a zoo map, and I'm glad we did, as the signs were sometimes confusing. Agreed that it was a shame not all the signs were repeated in English, but what can you expect! Definitely worth a visit, even if you don't have kids. We're 26/27 and just act like kids! Loved it!

Fun Day Out. Loved loved loved being surrounded by monkeys, lizards, bats, birds all kinds of species not in cages allowing you to get up close with nature :) The butterfly house is stunning I wanted to move in and never leave!Was such a different day out for us in Amsterdam a refreshing change and a great day out :)

free with i amsterdam card. lovely place with aquarium and butterfly garden inside. not all animals are inside the cages so i felt more close to them.but i feel sorry about the lions, their cage is super small.

Good Zoo. Booked a trip to the zoo as part of the package with DFDS seaways. I have read good and bad reviews about the zoo so wasn't sure what to expect. The animals are not in cages which was nice to see. I do agree some of the enclosures seem a bit small but the zoo is working on that as they were building a new enclosure when we were there.They have a small childrens area where you can go and walk amongst the amimals. Most of the signs were in English but there was pictures of the animals on the information signs so didn't need to read anything.to find which way you had to go We were there 3 half hours we saw everything but it felt a bit rushed. 4-5 hours would be a more realistic time. The information you can read about the animals was in English.Worth a visit

Oasis in the city. A great city zoo shoe horned into a city block of Amsterdam. Wonderful animals in an excellent environment with moats and walls in preference to cages (where appropriate!!) Good aquarium and plenty of facilities.Only downside was the signage; most had summaries in English but frustratingly far from all.

Returned for another visit.. Despite having been here a year ago fancied another visit. Glad we did as the sun was shining and the animals were in fine fettle. Having been to Edinburgh zoo a couple of months ago and been sadly disappointed it was refreshing to see happy animals and interested zoo keepers. I think the pride of lions, the elephants and the giraffes are the highlights but was strangely mesmerised by the ant eater....

Amsterdam Zoo. Very large zoo. Took us almost 4 hours to go throw. Very kids-friendly. There are plenty of benches to take a brake. There was a felling that we a in the forest .Very large cages .Actialy , the feeling is that there are no cages.My advice is to bring sandwiches and fruts for kids. Bring camera!!!!!
Was lovely to see animals in the city!. I think some of the enclosures could be bigger for the animals they do have but all together it was a lovely little zoo.
Endless zoo. Its a large zoo with many sections so you are always entertained. Im an adult in my 20s and went with my husband and was worried that we'd be bored but we weren't. Its worth a visit!

Good city zoo. This is a very old zoo, and that shows with some of the enclosures which were variable. Some looked grim (spectacled bear) but others were very nice with lots of plants. It is large for a city zoo and there is lots to see. I liked the enclosures where marmosets were running around free. What drove me crazy sometimes was that the exhibits were often not well labeled, and you had no idea what you were looking at and where the animal came from. This needs to be improved! That said, there are lots of good things about this zoo, and it makes a great day out!

Beautiful day. Our trip to Artis Zoo was just what we need after a few days in the bustling city of Amsterdam. We spent an extremely enjoyable afternoon wandering around amongst the animal enclosures and never once felt that any animal was unhappy or ill treated. Like nearly all zoos these days Artist Zoo is adapting and developing enclosures as quickly as funds and support will allow. We had lunch in one of the restaurants and although the service was rather slow the food was ok.

Should be closed down!. Artis Zoo is one if not the oldest zoo in Europe and to be honest it shows. although they are clearly trying to keep up with more modern zoos and the grounds are kept well, I couldn't get over the small enclosures and tiny cages. I am sure in some warped world these probably meet some kind of standard set in Europe as being acceptable, but when there are so many zoos that offer larger spaces and that have more facilities that are better equipped to care for the animals I just think in my heart that the animals kept at Artis should be re-homed else where, where the animals will receive a better quality of life.

Perfect day out!. We took the canal cruise to the Zoo and back which is a perfect way to see more of beautiful Amsterdam. You get tickets from the boat company so there is no queuing at the zoo. The Zoo is absolutely beautiful, very well designed and you can get exceptionally close to the animals! A little sad to find out the talks weren't in English but it didn't matter much as there was so much to see that we didn't feel we needed it. Would highly recommend a visit to the Zoo if you are visiting Amsterdam.

Best day out. Not a fan of the zoo but had promised our 9 year old We we there from 12 till closing at 5 and still didn't see it all. Although expensive worth every penny except the food. Take a picnic if you can as overpriced and not great
Excellent. A beautiful zoo with a fantastic variety of things to see and do. Fairly compact yet will take you the whole afternoon at least!

Amazing zoo! Loved it. . First of all, may I stress that there is absolutely NO evidence of animal cruelty at this zoo (as per some recent reviews below, which did actually put me off visiting). The animals all appear to be very happy and have enclosures which I believe reflect their natural habitat. Compared to zoos in the UK, I thought this was much better. Bigger and more informative. Great value for money. Go see it :)

Pricey but worth it. It is a perfectly sized zoo in the middle of Amsterdam - not too stretched out, great for kids to run around from display to display. Also the individual pens are very smartly arranged so that each doesn't feel like a cramped box for the animal(s) even though some are fairly small. The restaurant area is nice and well located next to kids' playground so you can have lunch while your wee one is monkeying around on ropes and seesaws. Food is OK - Dutch staples (bitterballen type snacks) which are too bland and fairly boring for my liking but there are salads and baguettes as well so it isn't all kroketts ;) It isn't the cheapest of attractions, though and the free kid ticket cut-off age is 3. Still, it is money well spent and the zoo is worth coming back to.

LOVED IT!. Loved this Zoo. I love animals so had to visit the Artis zoo while in Amsterdam. Unlike the London Zoo, they have meerkats, sea lions, fennec fox's and camels!! As well as some others which I haven't seen before. Could have easily spent my whole day there.

Get the Artis Express!. We booked a deal with the boat company Lovers (near Centraal Station), for €25 each we got a boat too the zoo, a boat back including a sight-seeing tour and entry to the zoo. Considering the zoo itself is € 19,95, it's a pretty good deal. It absolutely poured it down the whole time we were at the zoo but it was still an enjoyable visit. They had quite a lot of baby animals and also a breeding room where some chicks where hatching so the awww factor was just through the roof. The baby chimp was the cutest thing ever!!Quite a small zoo but it's got a good selection of animals.

Ok for a day out. Visited on our trip to Amsterdam, weather was great which made it a lot better, great day out if your traveling with children, not the biggest attraction but is located in city, not been to a zoo for many years quite shocked at some small cages, its not a safari park !!

A good day out, but pricey. Both adults and children enjoyed the interesting variety of animals. Plenty to see and do, and all well organized. Overall, we had a very nice time, and would recommend it. There are free pushchairs for young kids (not for babies), which were very helpful as well.However, a few things could have been better:* Apparently, there are gorillas at this zoo. We were unable to find them. There's a sign saying they're at their outdoor enclosure, but no explanation where that is. The giraffes, too, were not where they show up on the map, and we found them by chance. And this is a map that costs 2 euro!* The planetarium is a nice bonus, but be aware: showtimes on the schedule are subject to change, and this announcement will be on the screen outside the planetarium entrance, and in Dutch. Not speaking Dutch, we had two very disappointed kids who were rushed across the zoo to see a space movie, only to learn there is a reserved screening for school about underwater life.

Big, nice and fun Zoo. Things we didn't like: while we think 20 eur price was worth it, you should not pay plus 2 eur for a map you really need! Also, cafeteria (food and drinks) is a bit expensive. If you are on a budget, do bring your own snack, there are nice areas where you can sit and enjoy them.Things we liked: The Zoo is definitely a big one, and there are many different species. We saw all the well known animals like lions, elephants, giraffes, etc, but also so many others. The yards, cages, resting areas for people, everything seemed vast and very nice. There are special habitat-like buildings where animals are free to roam around you, monkeys jump above you and it's amazing - iguana 10cm from you! Staff was nice on several occasions and focused our attention on animals which were harder to be seen. There's also a building with many aquariums and a planetarium which is free, but the shows are only in Dutch. Even so, we enjoyed the show as visually it is very nice.

Micropia exhibition good but better online info needed. We went to micropia. Good exhibition. With a baby of 11 months. There were no baby changing facilities at the exhibition, and then we were not allowed to take the pram in because it was busy. We had checked on line for info before going and that was not mentioned. Had they said that prior to going we would have taken a baby carrier to hold him while we walked around. Bit annoying because we were not prepared but could have been.

Animal cruelty. The zoo was definitely not what I hoped or expected.The zoo is quite small&what is worse the big beautiful cat(lions,cheetahs etc) are in the tiniest&shortest cages I have ever seen.They literally could just about pace up&down.The animals did not look obe bit happy either which is not surprising considering these animals roam around places like Africa hunting.I'd say the most excitment these animals get is moving from sitting position to another.I am no animal rights activist but if they seen this zoo they'd have a riot.All the other animals may have had bigger cages but they also looked miserable!The zoo gift shop was not worth having&the restaurant was way over priced for food that would not even be in the league of the likes of McDonald's!I would save your money folks&give this 1 a miss.

Nice Zoo..But . Nice Zoo..plenty to see .even though the big cats where not there Only the Lions and Leopard who I felt so sorry for as it was just walking up and down his cage with no Expression .. I think in genral the animals are well cared for although the cages and enclosures could be bigger ..Best part was the Butterfly House just loved it .. in all we had a wonderful day ..and would go again ..
Not impressed. I really only visited the zoo as it was part of the I Amsterdam card offer. Found the paddocks housing the animals incredibly small and a little sad.

Best zoo I've been to!. Was extremely impressed with this zoo! The open plan enclosures are brilliant and I have never seen so many active animals. I liked the variation of indoor and outdoor attractions, particularly liked getting up close to a small monkey in one of the inside houses! I would definitely go back, I've been to zoos all over the world and this is one of my favourites, lots of enrichment for the animals too.
Great zoo!. One of the best zoo's I have seen. And I've been to quiet a lot of zoo's in my short life. Go take a visit. It's close to the center of Amsterdam.
Lots to see. Was very impressed with the zoo, lots to see indoor and out. Nice walks around the ground, all in all a good day out.

Open until sunset. Even in September, the Zoo is open until sunset. If you arrive in the morning, be prepared to fall in a long line during the summer--especially if the weather is good. If you arrive after 5pm, there is no line and there are less people but you won't be able to see the animals being fed. However, you may still be lucky to see the vultures having their dinner.

A full day out!. We spent about 6 hours at the zoo. It is huge! We were by no means sauntering around either. Quite impressed with the butterfly house and the savannah area. Would definitely recommend a visit!

Check out new addition Artis Plaza. New brasserie has been opened; where once was the library.price is high for any drinks; when you want to pay the bill it takes some time before you can pay this! It was not busy at that time!I wonder what will happen if you just walk out.Not really impressed.

Top zoo. Artis zoo is one of the biggest I've been to, and one of the best. You can easily spend a day here if you have the stamina! We spent around 5 hours there inc a lunch stop and saw just about all of it, but we were a bit all 'zood' out by the end and had seen enough animals for one day. Its well laid out, with most enclosures of a decent size for their occupants(big cats excepted--the lions need a bigger enclosure) The butterfly house was surprisingly excellent and fascinating,as was the massive aquarium building. Too much to describe. Its a great zoo, one of the best, so give it a go if you like animals.

Getting close with the animals. Located in the center of Amsterdam this place is one of the few good places to visit if you are on a family vacation with kids. You get to go really close to the animals and the zoo has a wide variety of animals from all over the world. Some of the cages were a bit small though. Favorite spot was the butterfly house.
Good zoo!. We had a lot of fun at this zoo. You can get up close and personal with a lot of the animals. The monkeys were cute and they had a nice aquarium.

Amazing zoo. My partner and I visited the zoo while on a week-end break. The zoo is immaculate and the whole experience was great...I personally love Gorillas and was my sole purpose of the visit and wasn't let down at all..I could have watched them all day,babies were so entertaining and the silverback was spectacular!..there was other animal,birds just wondering around,in their own locations..we didn't even get to make it around the whole zoo,had limited amount of time..main restaurant was very clean but a bit hectic but the weather was beautiful and was very busy..If you have kids or animal lovers this us a must see..if ever get the chance would drfinately return.

Beautiful zoo!. We went to Artis during our 3 day stay in Amsterdam. It was a beautiful sunny day so it made the day even better, it took us about 4 hours to walk around and see everything. There is a LOT to see in there, who says it's "not great" or similar stuff is not right at all!!!! I've been to the zoo in Prague and Zvolen Slovakia so I know what a good zoo looks like.. It was definitely the highlight of our trip for me and my boyfriend loved it too. Never been to a Zoo where you have monkeys jumping over your head and butterflies flying around you and you feel like you were in a rain forest! Didn't manage to go in to the planetarium but we are going back in 5 months so I won't miss it this time!

Beautiful zoo!. We went to Artis during our 3 day stay in Amsterdam. It was a beautiful sunny day so it made the day even better, it took us about 4 hours to walk around and see everything. There is a LOT to see in there, who says it's "not great" or similar stuff is not right at all!!!! I've been to the zoo in Prague and Zvolen Slovakia so I know what a good zoo looks like.. It was definitely the highlight of our trip for me and my boyfriend loved it too. Never been to a Zoo where you have monkeys jumping over your head and butterflies flying around you and you feel like you were in a rain forest! Didn't manage to go in to the planetarium but we are going back in 5 months so I won't miss it this time!

Good day out. Wasn't sure what to expect as I'm not a fan of Zoo's, but was pleasantly surprised. Animals looked healthy and clean. Enclosures were on the small side and some a little stony and unnatural. However others looked like a real effort had been made to keep animals comfortable. There is even a new enclosure being built for a breeding project for Jaguars. Lots of animals to see close up. Zoo grounds are pretty with lovely flowers etc. would recommend for a day out in Amsterdam especially with children.

TOO much to see in this visit. Not complaining but truth - took 4 hours just to walk around. Could not figure out if planetarium was open or closed for repairs; avoided. Butterfly room was excellent. But wished they had more species of. Helpful staff.Seems like all souvenirs made in China. Why?Used IamAmsterdam card and got in for free. 19 EU value.

Love the Artis Zoo!. I attended the zoo with our family and there were too small children with us. It was a wonderful zoo with a great variety of animals, small aquarium, lots of places to stop and sit, lots of places to grab a nite to eat, etc. we had a fabulous day enjoying the weather and the ambience of the whole zoo. If you have small children, or just enjoy animals, make sure you visit the zoo!

Really nice zoo better than ones in the uk. Not the largest zoo as it was in the middle of the city but i still really enjoyed it. Theu had a wide variety of animals and a really nice aquarium in a beautiful old building with some huge fish specimens. I would live to go again as i really enjoyed the way it was layed out and the way the animals were displayed.

Nice way to spend a few hours. The Zoo is small, yes, but it is the oldest Zoo in Europe which gives it appeal. We had fun and there are even sections where some animals roam freely amongst you. Really enjoyable. We had fun. Would recommend if you have kids and want to entertain them for a few hours.

beautiful zoo. Couldn't get over how beautiful the trees and plants were around the zoo, well kept! Most of the animals do not have cages around them (unless they have sharp teeth) just some water, so easy to see the animals. Large variety of animals compared to zoos in England, elephants/giraffes/wolves/camels etc. In the city centre so easy to get to. If you have luggage and ask they store it in the ticket office for as long as you are there.

best being butterfly park.... It is a well maintained zoo. Has several areas like planetarium, insectarium, reptile house, aquarium, butterfly park and area for wild animals. My little one really enjoyed the sight of animals, giraffes, zebras, lions, gorillas, chimpanzee and many more. I was amused by the butterfly park.
Great old zoo. Free on the I am Amsterdam card. Buy the map to ensure you see everything. Everything you want in a zoo, old style so be prepared for the real life smells and some old cages etc.
Great Zoo. Well set out wonderful to walk through the monkey section and they are not in cages. slightly too many empty cages but had a great afternoon. Bang in the city centre is also a bonus.

Good little zoo. The enclosures are a little bit smaller than we are used to in England so I can understand some of the comments I've seen, but I don't get the impression there was any discomfort involved. They are also undergoing a lot of construction work. The giraffe and zebra enclosure looked quite new and really spacious.It's a lovely way to while away a couple of hours, but wouldn't fill a full day as it's not huge. It's close to the City Centre as well, so easily accessible on foot or by tram.

Nice zoo. It's not the biggest zoo in the world but nevertheless I found it quite nice! The also have plenty of activities for kids and they will surely love it, just check the calendar and book a brunch.

Love a zoo. I love visiting the zoo, it really doesn't matter what country I'm in!
A really nice zoo, my wife loved the flamingos, while my highlight was the vultures! Both these thing we don't have at the Melbourne zoo!

Nice experience, well set out, easy to get to. Went here in august, so was peak season, we just paid on the door, no need to get a skip the queue pass. The zoo was well set out, although a lot of the cages and pens were empty. Aquarium was a bit disappointing, but everything else was good. A nice big cafe area in the centre with play area. I think though that once you have been to Chester zoo in England though you won't be totally impressed by this one, although we did enjoy our day, we were probably in there about 3 hours but could have taken longer if we had watched the feeding sessions and talks and had a meal. My favourite part was probably the seal enclosure which you could watch them swimming through a wall of glass.

Forget the red light district, this is much more entertaining!. We visited Amsterdam on a DFDS 2-night mini-cruise and pre-booked a joint canal cruise with tickets to the Artis Zoo (approx. £12 each) online before we left. We have been to Amsterdam many times and so find the Red Light District a bit boring and opted for the Zoo instead. It's a great place to get up close and personal with some of nature's finest animals. A bright late summer's day completed the great experience. Taxis direct to Artis from Grand Central Station (where the transfer coach dropped us) cost just approx 5 euros, whilst the no 9 tram, stops 100 yds away on the corner from the Zoo, was just under 3 euros each. Well worth the visit.

disappointing. I love Zoos, but this is the negative example for it. junk food everywhere, more a park than a zoo but without the love for animals. Gorillas were a lot of fun, but the cage looked awful. For this very disappointing experience, they rip you of with high entrance fees. I would have expected more from the dutch

It made me sad. I found some of the cages in this zoo really disappointing. While there has been some effort made, many of the compounds are small and/or very boring for the animals. To see Plains animals without any grass to graze, seals with nothing to play with in unadorned concrete pools and penguins with murky water that stinks ( I know penguins can be smelly) makes me sad. Given the price of admission, if we had not entered on our Amsterdam Passes, I would have been fairly cross.I think the final straw was people being permitted to sit close to the animal enclosures smoking.

if you have enough time don't miss the zoo!. i've been here twice in my last visits to amsterdam and everytime i had a great time. to enjoy it don't go in the weekends because it's a place where a lot of dutches come with their families and the place is crowded, not to mention the tourists. also it's best to choose a sunny day. the entrance fee is almost 20E if i can remember, no discounts for students. the place is very well organized, with a 2E map you can see everyting in aprox 2-3 hours. it's a very beautiful place where animals seemed happy:) the seals and the elephants were my favourite!

Artis zoo. we were staying at Barbacan hotel which is in the same street of the zoo. The price is 20Eur. At the entrance they provide you a map as the zoo is very big and there are all types of animals. From insects to birds to large animals and also fish. It was a very nice experience. Another good thing is that most of the animals are not kept in a cage but they are kept free in an area which is separated from where the people stand by water. very clean environment as well.

Great day out for all ages. I had heard good and bad things about the zoo but decided to check it out for myself. There was a bit of a queue to get in (locals seemed to have free entry vouchers), but this moved quickly without any problems. The zoo is big! It is in lovely grounds and I really enjoyed it. There are some parts that do look run down but I think most zoo's have a section like that, which they know needs to be improved and you could see from other parts of the zoo that this is clearly what they are heading towards. Artis really is a lovely place to visit and to have some quiet time. It's great for families and couples and is well worth a visit if the sun is shining in Amsterdam.

zozozozozo nice. A great "collection" of different animals, birds, etc. Often it is possible to come close to the animal to almost touch it, including foxes and other dangerous ones :) I would expect bigger aquarium but what they have is still very attractive.Although it's not very close to the city centre.
Zoo trip. A very pleasant visit to the ZOO. The Sea World was definitely the best (large aquariums and many species of animals)!

Eye Opening. We turned up at the zoo looking forward to seeing animals from afar. While I did enjoy seeing the lizards and insects, it started to feel very sad. The worst part was when we were looking at the bear. It just seemed wrong having him kept in such a small area. The bear was walking in circles like it has become bored out it's mind. Shortly after this the chimpanzees began violently attacking one of their own with the crowd mostly looking on horrified/covering their ears. I get the desire to see these animals up close, but I think this visit has helped me decide against returning to this zoo or any other.

Fantastic!. A surprisingly large Zoo and you can easily spend 3/4 hours here at leisure. You get very close to the animals and there is obvious investment in bigger and better enclosures. There's no health and safety police like you see in England! The aquarium is brilliant, brilliant, brilliant! The reptile house is also brilliant, brilliant, brilliant.Be sure to catch any feeding times as the keepers tend to be quite involved with the animals which is nice to see.You do need to pay extra for a map but you honestly don't need it as the Zoo is clearly signposted and it is not so large that you could end up missing things. There's a free brochure at the entrance that tells you what's going on for the day you visit so it's worth picking up.
Fantastic. This zoo is on a small site but i have to say i was very surprised just how near to the animals and in some case you can handel some of them. This has to be the best zoo i have visited.
Enjoyable. Lovely place to visit with family and easily reached by bus. Lovely area outside zoo as well. Recommended
Nice zoo for kids. This zoo has almost everything you can expect.It is well organized and will fill a few hours of your free time. It's not a huge zoo but its big enough.We had a nice time.

Brilliant . What a wonderful zoo this is, a variety of animals from all around the world, the brilliant reptile house and the wonderful aquarium. What a collection of fish they have. It is a big zoo so allow time to visit and walk around. Definitely recommend and will be back

Great day out. This is one of the best zoo's that I've visited. There is so much to see and greet value for money. The grounds are beautiful with the lovely plants and flowers. The animals look well looked after and their pens large enough to give them a good quality of life. The aquarium is amazing, having never seen some of the weird and wonderful fish that are on offer to see. I would certainly recommend this attraction as a place to visit.

Great outing for a 4 year old. Artis Zoo is a great outing for a 4 year old in Amsterdam. The zoo is located in the city - 8 tram stop from Centraal Station and less than 5 minute walk from the Artis tram stop to the zoo. Lots of open space for the animals (in an urban setting) and people to leisurely stroll about and the butterfly pavilion was great - lots of colourful butterflies. The little one loved that one can almost touch the butterflies because there were so many flying about.One can easily spend a minimum of 1/2 day at the zoo. There are 2 restaurants and several food carts that sell food throughout the zoo. 2 bonus to the zoo - there is a big playground outside the Restaurant de Twee Cheetahs and there are free carts to use for carting a young child around if you are without a pram. We had a great outing, though not a cheap outing - family of 3 (2 adults + 1 child) the cost was € 56.40 plus € 2 for a map. For the amount that we paid, we would have thought the map of the zoo would have been included. All in all a good zoo.

Best day out! . We went in a group of 8 and absolutely loved the whole zoo. There is so many areas to look at, with a wide range of animals. The only disappointing factor was the size of some of the in closures, particularly the bigger animals or the birds not having much space to fly. Although, the inclosures were well kept and the animals did look happy. It cost 19.95 Euros and was a whole day out, worth every penny.

Fab way to spend a Saturday. Visited last Saturday and was very impressed. I had the I Amsterdam card so it was free in. I would happily have paid the €19.95 admission though. The zoo is huge so wear comfy shoes. I was impressed with aquarium, less impressed with the planetarium only offering talks in Dutch. The butterfly garden was the highlight of the day for me.

seen many; this one is definitely one of the better ones.. My kids, both my girls, (3yrs and 9yrs old) really enjoyed it, learnt a lot. My wife and i could spend some time independently sketching, while one of us took them around. The place is quite and peaceful in some areas. You do have to pay a bit additional for the map. Good thing is you do get very close to the animals than any other zoo, due to the enclosure design. The cafe is nice and not so expensive. A day well spent and would recommend anyone with kids to definitely visit this.

A zoo is a zoo. We visited as an alternative to Nemo which is closed on a Monday (!?!)I'm not keen on zoos but apart from the poor layout it wasn't too bad. You will need to pay out an additional 1.99 for a map as there aren't any around the park. You do get a lot closer to the animals than at some other zoos and most of the animals were outside to be seen unlike some places where there's supposed to be an animal in there somewhere but no-one can find it.Some cages seemed a little small and some of the animals were showing repeated pacing behaviours of captivity but there is some obvious investment in new enclosures. Highlight was the penguins, giraffes and elephants. Work is much needed in the sea-lion area.

disappointing. We were looking forward to going to this attraction. We have been to a few different animal parks and zoos over the years. Our first view was the enclosure with the camels and reindeer in it. It was just sand ???. No grass anywhere and not particulary big. This unfortunately was a theme that continued throughout the zoo. On looking at the map that was a additional charge 1.99. We concluded that it was laid out really oddly with many small enclosures and no definitive route. The first few animals we came across were in small cramped areas. No space to run around at all and some empty. The place just seemed old and dirty as well. Some places smelt really badly. The enclosure with the giraffes and zebras was a welcome relief. It seems that it is a newer enclosure and looked good.The butterfly house was nice as well but trying to look into the sea loin enclosure was so dirty you couldn't see any thing.The aquarium is a welcome relief. It is laid out really well with lots to see. Really liked the canal exhibit. On heading down that side of the zoo they are revamping that side with new enclosures which was nice to see.Just hope for the animals sake they keep revamping the place as it needs a lot of investment to get it up to standard.Id even like to see less animals but with larger more natural enclosures.

Nice zoo!. This is the only zoo I've ever been to, so don't have anything to compare it to, however I really enjoyed it. There is a good variety of animals, insects and fish to see. The queue to buy your ticket can be quite large to buy your ticket but although it looks as though you're going to be there hours I was only waiting about 15 minutes for a ticket, and once inside there was no problems in viewing or seeing anything I wanted to see.There is a place to eat on site however I did not use it so cannot comment on this.The map you get when you buy your ticket is really useful and easy to use.I got the tram there, which was quite straightforward and only a couple of minutes walk after getting off.

Lovely little zoo. I consider myself to be an animal lover and this was the perfect little zoo for me. The animals looked happy and well cared for. The zoo is also trying to build bigger enclosures for the animals too. As the zoo is so small, You can get so close to the animals too. There is a lovely selection of animals to look at. It was quite pricey but worth the visit,

It's just a zoo, but a rather nice one. Visiting city's zoo is a bit of a tradition for me and Artis is definitely one of the better ones. All the 'classics' are there as well as some more unusual animals. I especially enjoyed the aquarium section, which has some very beautiful coral reef arrangements.
Nice Zoo/park. Artis Zoo is of course known for the animals, but it is also a very nicely landscaped park to walk thru. Different interest are catered to.

Really nice zoo with all kinds of animals.. Great zoo with a wide range of animals, from lions, butterflies and large snakes to a big aquarium. The animals also seem well taken care of and the cages were clean and well set up. Definitely worth a visit, especially if you like animals and probably even more if you have kids with you.

A must see destination in Amsterdam. This zoo is excellent was was loved by my family. We had the Iamsterdam card so didn't have to pay extra for visit but do need to go to the counter to get the pass for entry. We also bought a map which was really useful and would recommend. It was a lovely sunny day and got to see plenty of animals and birds. You really get to see them really close. Good fun but beware, it could take most of the day as it is massive.

Perfect day out for the animal lover.. I was apprehensive at first, not wanting to buy a ticket to this attraction. Most Zoos are purely founded to exploit animals for profit. But after reading reviews and doing some research it seemed okay, and my other half really wanted to visit while we were staying in Amsterdam.It was an amazing day out! The Zoo is putting so much of its funding into creating a natural and happy life for their animals. They are currently raising funds for a new and bigger Elephant enclosure whilst a new Panther enclosure is being built so that the other large cats can have more space. (This was reassuring as I didn't think the other cats looked like they had a comfortable amount of living space). The rest of the animals all looked happy and healthy and were kept in large, natural enclosures.The Zoo is very keen to encourage interaction between the animals as they would in the wild, and so they are kept in enclosures together. I.e. Giraffes and Zebras together. This is something I haven't seen in other Zoos. Additionally, a lot of the indoor enclosures have no barriers and allow the visitors to actually walk through the habitats, examples of this are with the smaller species of monkeys, birds and bats. There is also a small aquarium within the Zoo, another great little place to visit. We went on a nice sunny day and there are some lovely little garden areas to sit and relax, the park is kept clean and well kept and I really couldn't fault it! Tickets are reasonably priced at 20 Euros.
Great zoo, very relax atmosphere.. It's a zoo within a park. It's not a very large zoo but you really can see every animal at close range. Love the lions, gorilla's and rhino!

Fun Day Out!. This is one of the best zoos! We managed to see all of the exhibits within about 4 hours including time to sit and have a drink.Plenty to see, thoroughly enjoyed the day!!Would definitely go back!

The most beautiful zoo I've been too!. We visited on a beautiful sunny day and had such a nice time. It is a small zoo but the enclosures are amazing and it is so green and full of plants and flowers - it felt like a botanical gardens. Lovely to visit the Aquarium too, which is a beautiful old building. Plenty of places to sit and relax with a book or lunch. I highly recommend - it one of the highlights of our holiday.

Very nice attraction to attend. Missed out attending in 2008 - was glad to visit today though. Beautiful weather with nice flowers/gardens in bloom. Lots of space to sit down in garden areas but it was crowded today - not a bad thing though considering lots of zoos don't have those areas. Animals appeared active and healthy from what we observed. The cooler weather had the animals active today which was a plus. Nice zoo and we look forward to seeing all the construction complete on the west side of the property.
Nice but crowded. Great indoor exhibits, some cages very depressing. Understandable as built in crowded city centre. Restaurant food expensive but ok.

One of the best zoos I have been to, will return!. I saw every exhibit in about 3 hours, which was great! My favorite the monkey house where you walk around in a habitat and the monkeys can get very close to you. My fiance and I were very fortunate to see the world's smallest monkey inches away as it was eating from one of the feeders. The zoo is a great walk and has some beautiful themed gardens along the way. I enjoyed the zoo so much, I will definitely be returning again.
Great. My teenage children enjoyed seeing animals in captivity that were being supported with breeding and health.

A must do in Amsterdam. Went to artis zoo in June with my two best friends was easy to find and didn't take long to walk to with some lovely sights to see on the way there :-) the zoo it's self is better than any zoo/safari park in the uk it's very well kept and the animals look very happy and you can get quite close to all of them :-) the zoo is beautifully kept with lovely gardens and nice places to eat lunch and it's a very reasonable price would highly recommend to any visiting Amsterdam especially families
Best zoo . This is the best zoo I have ever been to! Lovely animals, clean tidy and the animals look healthy and happy. Wish I could go more often! Defiantly worth a visit

Zoo visit.. Whilst visiting Amsterdam with our granddaughter she said she would like a day at the zoo which is close to the centre of the city so off we went. The entrance fee is 16.50 euros for children and 19.50 euros for adults. The zoo is kept clean and tidy although when we visited there was quite a bit of work being done altering the animal enclosures.The zoo itself is quite large but easy to get round with a map that is given to everyone on entrance.The cages are kept clean and the animals seem content as much as possible being locked up all day. The bird cages are large enough for the birds to be able to fly freely as are most of the animal enclosures.There is an area where you walk where the animals roam free' and also a childrens area where they can get up close to pets which are mainly farm animals. There are also plenty of restaurants around the zoo.A planetarium is also included in the entrance fee.All in all well worth a visit.

Not bad at all.. I was a zookeeper for some years so I decided to visit the zoo whilst in Amsterdam. It's a good zoo with a good range of animals. The butterfly exhibit is excellent as is the aquarium. There are some nice walk through areas with free roaming birds, lizards and marmoset monkeys. Some exhibits had signs in English and Dutch, some just Dutch, some none at all and quite a few were wrong which was a bit shabby. The elephant exhibit is a bit small and it's a bit outdated in some areas which still have the old style 'iron bar' look.Overall it was worth a visit, you can get a few euros knocked off if you buy your ticket before hand from a bureau. The exhibits are mostly good and the animals look fit and contented.

Really lovely Zoo. Artis ZooThe Zoo is big and if you don’t have your own buggy I would suggest you borrow one of the child trolleys they offer for free. Our 2 year old was tired quite quickly.CostIt was Free for us to enter the zoo by using the AMSTERDAM card which I would recommend buying. There is no map given out as they ask for 2 euro as they are building a new elephant house. We gladly paid the two euro. I suggest getting a map as the zoo is big.FoodThere is a place to get food over by the elephants but it was very busy the day we were there so I suggest you pack your own picnic. We did.There is a small gift shop but gets busy very quickly. TramsThere is a tram no. 9 and 14 that stops at the side of the zoo and just a very short walk from the entrance.There is also a large aquarium in the zoo which is very good with lots and lots of different types of beautiful fish and a few scary ones too.Well worth a visit for young and old.
A Gem in the City. Possibly the most diverse zoo I've been to. Lots of things to see and do. The butterfly house, insectarium, penguins and owl made it very worth it. great day out.

Bigger than you think Zoo. We have done Zoo's around the world over the years and this one sits in our top 3 !
