Despite grim rainy weather my daughter and I loved every minute, such a diverse variety of animals in just beautiful settings very well laid out with the chance to get shelter if needed ! Informative signs in Dutch and English ! Also in a charming area of Amsterdam , right next to tram pick up as well . Would happily go again and spend a lot more time .
Lovely. I'm used to the great Zoo in Lisbon, but this one, despite being smaller, is still good. We loved the trip. 2 hours is enough to see it.
beautiful!. beautiful zoo with a lot to see! came with a friend and we really enjoyed our visit at the zoo. very recommended!

Great zoo. This is a very large zoo, and has it's own Aquarium as well. We spent the whole day here.They did have a couple of areas closed for refurbishment but there was still plenty to see.I highly recommend hanging around the Lemur area, having them jump overhead and walk around you is great fun!The food is traditional Dutch junk food & salads, so plan accordingly.

great for young kids. I went with a 4 year old and 1 year old and we spent a lovely afternoon. The animals are all healthy and in fairly open enclosures and you can see them at close quarters. It's also not a very extensive zoo which makes it just right for younger kids. My 4 year old loved the sea lions (we watched the zookeeper make them do tricks), the butterfly garden, giraffes, llamas and elephants. The lions were pretty impressive too and quite surprisingly not caged in. the zookeeper talks are in Dutch only though, so we couldnt follow what he was saying but we enjoyed all the things he made the animals do. There's also a slide in the shape of a giraffe which my daughter loved - what a lovely idea for a slide. Usually the zoo is open till 6 p, but on Saturdays in June, July, Aug, the zoo is open till sunset (which is like 9 pm) and you are allowed to make a picnic on the grass - wish we had known this. There's also a planetarium with several shows (no extra charge) - it's all in Dutch, no english shows, but my child likes "being in space" and didn't care too much about the commentary. the shows are about 25 minutes long, we went for the one called "Spacetrip" which seemed to be a general show about the universe, stars and planets. We ate at the planetarium cafe which offers soup, sandwiches (incl. vegetarian options), juices and coffee. You are also allowed to bring your own food in - there is a microwave in the cafe to warm up food and baby milk which was very handy.

a little expensive.... ... but worth a visit. A lot of different animals; very interesting, also for children. Unfortunately, some areas were inaccessible due to work, perhaps they're further improving!Entrance costs almost 20 € per person (children under 12 years free)

Great, even in the rain. I always have mixed feelings about zoos, but the size and layout of Artis is really good. The animals all looked healthy and although some of the enclosures could have been bigger (isn't that always the case with zoos) the animals didn't look disturbed or cramped.We spent about 3 hours there and didn't even see everything. We managed to skip the biggest rain shower by going in to the butterfly house, which was amazing, one of the highlights! My niece and nephew (8 and 11) also loved it and could have stayed longer. It's not cheap...16.95 for kids (my 11 year old nephew had to pay for an adult ticket) and 19.50 for adults, but you can definitely spend at least half a day there. There are several different cafes and restaurants, we had a snack and drink at the one near the entrance and it was simple but fine, not excessively expensive either. There are about 3 or 4 snack bars, cafes directly opposite the entrance as well if you don't want to eat there.

Lovely zoo for an afternoon walk.. Had a lovely time at the zoo in Amsterdam. It isn't too cheap to enter but the layout and facilities offered make up for that. The zoo was much larger then I thought and there were many different areas to visit. There was a great atmosphere and it wasn't too busy even though it was a Saturday afternoon! It was a nice break away from the regular tourist attractions in Amsterdam.

AMAZING zoo!. A fantastic zoo for all ages. We spent most of the day here and really enjoyed it. Took lots of photographs and saw loads of animals, birds, insects, and sea animals. Well worth a visit.
Beautiful.. A wonderful zoo. The animals are not in cages and appear to be content. The surroundings are beautiful and at 20 Euros entrance fee, a visit is a rare treat.

Very Nice Zoo. We try to visit the zoo in every city we go to that has one. This was a very nice zoo and reasonably priced as far as zoo's go. My husband and I had the I amsterdam cards so we were free and only had to pay a discounted rate with the card for our 11 and 4yr old as our 1 yr old was free. You do have to pay 2 euro for an english map which I thought was a little unusual but I guess its an extra way to make money I guess.  The zoo also has an aquarium and butterfly pavilion as well as a animal house where monkeys and birds roam free. There is also a free roaming Lemur exhibit and the Lemurs come out of no where! You can bring your own food in the zoo which is always a plus. We spent about 3 hours here and where able to see the whole zoo. It was a very fun day!

Great day out.... This zoo is huge and all of the animals look in a good shape... we spent most of the day at the zoo and didn't wanted to go back to the hotel... I would definitely recommend it to my friends and I will go back again!

Average. First impressions were brilliant, staff very friendly and helping for English tourists. The animals don't look to happy, they are all in cages or very small enclosures, especially the lions they are surrounded by water on a VERY small island. There wasn’t a lot going on regarding feedings or talks. We were looking forward to a sort of petting area for smaller animals but no such thing at this Zoo. The aquarium is great, we were really impressed with that, but there is lots to do in Amsterdam, I wouldn’t recommend a trip to the Zoo.

Fantastic zoo!. My boyfriend and I have been to many zoos all over the UK and were excited to visit this particular zoo after reading brilliant reviews. The zoo is well served by public transport, we caught the tram from the city centre within 10 minutes. The zoo tickets are affordable at €20, although you have to buy the map for €2 but this money goes towards a newer and bigger enclosure for the elephants. Much needed!!I was really impressed with how close you can get to the animals here, and how many of them were not caged up, which allowed beautiful photos without railings and cages in the way. The zoo grounds are beautiful and spotless. The majority of enclosures were really well thought out. Some of the animals seemed a bit distressed and were pacing up and down or showing unusual behaviour - this is why I have not given the zoo 5 stars. I think the zoo is aware of this and are trying to sort their problems out, by proposing a smaller car park to make space for bigger enclosures.The ticket price includes entrance to the planetarium and aquarium, excellent value for money. Although we watched a show in in the planetarium in Dutch and didn't understand a word!Brilliant day out :)

Great day out!. I had heard great things about this zoo so was very excited to see they were all true! It was extremely busy, down to the great weather I think. All the animals were out & about! We spent about 2.5 hours walking around taking in everything. Would definitely recommend.

One of the best ZOO i have visited. Any one with love for animals can spend the entire day here, doing nothing but just admiring the different verity of animals.The layout of this zoo is visitors friendly including description/information boards, maps and signs in Dutch and English.All animals are healthy and displayed well. Birds and butterfly sections made thoughtfully. This place is not too far from dam square and also included in Amsterdam card.

Very nice. Very nice zoo but if you visit Loro Parque at Tenerife you will see that there are a lot better. Tip: you can a boat from central station and it takes you to the zoo and back with lower price. So you pay less, take a canal ride and visit the zoo too

Excellent selection of animals. One of the best zoos I have been to, they had a wide range of animals that looked well looked after.
The area was large and well kept, a good day out.

Great attraction for everyone. large zoo with many animals, not far from the city center (about 10 minutes from Dam square with the tram), suitable for all ages and not too expensive (20$).
Fabulous day for the entire family.
Fits perfectly to the entire amsterdam experience.

Nice location and grounds. The 20 euro entrance fee was a great saving using the I AMsterdam card but you still have to queue for a ticket. Currently some redevelopemtn working going on so bits of it are a mess and one or two enclosures have vanished. In general the grounds are nice and there is plenty of variety. Some animals (the wild cats in particular) showed signs of stress (repetative behaviour) but on the whole most things seemed well cared for.

Fantastic value for money!. I couldn't believe how affordable the zoo was! Never before have i been able to get so close to all the animals, there was even animals i have never seen before such as the giant anteater!The staff were really friendly and let us leave our bags at the reception for no charge. Loved every minute of it, would definitely go again.

A super day out. This is a really good zoo with more than enough to fill a whole day. There's a very wide range of animals in well-maintained grounds, and it's very helpful that nearly all of the display boards are in English as well as Dutch. A surprising plus was the food in the main cafe. Despite a rather chaotic queuing system, the food was of a very good standard and was some of the cheapest we found during our week in Amsterdam. Overall, Artis is excellent value for money.

It used to be all about the polar bears. My favourite attraction within the zoo used to be the polar bears but during my latest visit I was disappointed to find out they were not there anymore. Other than that, I do not find anything more exciting than any other zoo I've been, except maybe from the planetarium. The location is convenient, the entrance fee reasonable.
Get closer to the animals!. I've been so close to the animals in any of zoos I visited before. Excellent! Good location and lots to see, you can spend all day there!

Great Zoo!!. Reasonable entry fee and impressive range of animals! Very near the centre and very friendly transport wise. The old and the new are very well merged together making it a great experience with friends, family, couples or even solo! Expect to spend at least a few hours here!

Guest mistreatment of animals - no zookeepers keeping watch. This zoo is disgusting and mismanaged. Within 10 minutes we witnessed a guest grab a duck by the throat and chock it while the guest and her family laughed about it, no zookeepers around to witness this sort of mistreatment of animals or to complain/get information from. Plastic rubbish in the enclosures.And, guests using enclosures as ash trays, literally saw another guest leaning over a small enclosure with a cigar and dropping his ash into it, zookeeper at this particular enclosure couldn't care less.

A great and surprising experience. My family and I were in Amsterdam for four days and were preparing to visit the key attractions, museums, etc. when my kids who are older teenagers suggested going tot he zoo as they had heard that it is less about caged areas and more about open enclosures. My wife and I agreed expecting a standard zoo with nothing of great surprise. How wrong we were! First of all, the layout is great for getting around easily without the awkwardness of having to double back but what was particularly impressive was how we moved from one enclosure to the next with the level of interest being maintained throughout. Our usual experience of zoos is that there are key animals which are the "star attractions" and others that tend to be walked past with a glance. Many are even hidden away that are hard to see. In the Artis Zoo, we moved from one great point of interest to the next and actually did this from 10.30am to 5.30pm with two breaks, it was just so interesting. I think the key aspect which made it so interesting was the close proximity to the animals and just how lively the animals were. They seemed very bright and content and we observed much interaction and play going on. If there is such a thing as a "happy" zoo, this is it! Intiially, we felt that the 20 Euro admission fee each was a bit high, but on leaving after a great day, we felt that it had been money well spent.

very beautiful place. In this zoo which is also an very old historical place you will find almost any animal from all over the world its a very big place and when you walk around there you will see the old buildings and gives you an good impression how old the place really is very nice place to spend your day if you visit Amsterdam
Excellent Zoo. An excellent zoo that manages to bind the old and the new. Many animals share the same space with you during your visit making it a unique experience.

Great place for everyone. We use to come here twice a week, when my son was younger. Unbelievable how many animals are there: whole day is not enough to see them all. The park has a huge playground for toddlers as well, so if you don't know where to go with your kid- this mind be a solution. Planetary is rather poor, but for children of age between 3 and 6 can be interesting. If you are staying in Amsterdam longer -I would suggest to purchase a year-card: 12 month long you will be able to come back daily if you want to.

Nice city zoo. This is a nice city zoo. Excellent choice if you don't want to spend a whole day in the zoo. Also very suitable for small children. Go to the garden with all the butterflies or enjoy all the beautiful fish.

An excellent zoo for children. While there are some excellent parks in Amsterdam, the museums can be a little dull for children. If you are in Amsterdam with children - definitely have a trip to Artis Zoo on your list of Things to Do. Its in deceivingly large grounds with pretty well maintained surroundings. There's also a planetarium with a variety of shows (included in the price). The layout for the animals is pretty much flat (not that unusual in the Netherlands :) ) with only the sealions and bears having enclosures that are up a hill/stairs. That said, the aquarium has some impressive exhibits and that is on a couple of different floors. If you've a buggy keep an eye out for the lifts. Some of the enclousures look run down - there is a line just past the elephants of what should have been medium sized cats that were all empty. That said, when we were visiting there was a building works program going on so perhaps they are on a list to be refurbished. Given its a city zoo you're pretty close to the animals - close enough so that you could almost touch the penguins. For many of the animals there is a clever use of water to separate enclosures and give you and your small people unobstructed views. There is a lot to see in the zoo with many different animals large and small. While my youngest daughter loved seeing Elmer I've got to wonder if the enclosure was big enough for the family in there who looked as if they could do with access to water on the hot day we visited. Perhaps its time to take the lead of London and Edinburgh and move the elephants to a zoo with more space. Very helpful and friendly staff. An impressive adventure play park and decent prices for food and drink inside. I enjoyed it and would visit again.Take the #9 tram from the central station to get there: takes @15 mins. #9 is suitable for buggys/strollers if you get on in the middle. Tram tip - you can get off at the middle doors with a buggy, and press the buzzer as you come up to the Artis stop.

Animals need more space, aquariums need cleaning and people smoking joints with pram in tow !. I was expecting a lot from this zoo considering the 20 euro entry fee.Most of the animals were healthy but several did not look well at all. The spaces for a the larger animals like Elephants was far too small, even by zoo standards.The aquariums were filthy. You can tell how a place is maintained by the look of the saltwater aquariums. They were severely infested with bristle stars and red algae. Not a good look and the fish will decline soon after.The most shameful thing was several families I saw walking around with prams and / or toddlers and smoking. Disgusting. I cant imagine what it does to the animals.

A hidden jem. Everyone goes to Amsterdam to do the usal red light district and coffee houses. Well this place is a real jewel in the Crown for a nice quiet day. We went for 4 days and had done and seen all the usual things. It's no more than a 20mins walk from dam square and when you go through those gates you feel as if your in another city completely.
Very nice. Lovely relaxed day walking around this. New structures currently taking place but well sign posted and animal welfare is excellent. Plenty of snack facilities available.

Better Than London Zoo ! (in my opinion !). Wonderful grounds and surroundings. All the animals were actually doing stuff !....There's also a planetarium with a variety of shows (included in the price) the layout of the enclosures and facilities for the animals made for a really great day out. Clearly the animals are very well looked after. One criticism I can think of is that the shows are in Dutch . I realise it's in Holland but a translation would have been great especially as English is so well spoken in Holland.
Lovely zoo. What a lovely zoo we had the Amsterdam card so this was included although me and my partner went alone would defiantly take the kids here one day

Nice zoo in the city center. Nice zoo with a variety of animals in the city center. The place is colourful with a lot of flowers. I totally agree with another reviewer saying that "the zoo itself is not the biggest or most impressive but incredibly beautiful."
The zoo was a little bit pricey (about 20€/person) but the ticket also included the entrance to the aquarium.

Beautiful zoo right in the centre of the city. We visited the zoo in order to kill a few hours on our last day in Amsterdam and were sorry we had to leave. It was right in the centre of the city, easy to walk to and find and not too pricey. The zoo itself is not the biggest or most impressive but incredibly beautiful, with lovely old buildings and a rich history, being one of the oldest zoos in Europe. We particularly loved the large conservatory type buildings filled with tropical plants, monkeys and birds that you are free to walk through. The aquarium is also well worth the visit and is included in the price. All in all a wonderful day out and most certainly one to visit to get away from the busy city.

A nice day out. We went on a summer Saturday evening for a few hours. Beautiful gardens, places to have picnics, live music & friendly staff. You can get up close to most of the animals. A pleasant way to fill in a few hours

Perfect!!!. Go there in the early morning to the opening time. You will like it without no doubts! Big, atmospheric, with great number of animals and birds, it will be good variant not only for those who are with children, but for those who and alone and adult.Tasty food in the cafe opposite open-air cage with giraffes and zebras.

Outdated french fries farm. I know this zoo all my life, and it has basically not improved. I can only feel sorry for the animals encaged in rather minimalistic confinements. The quantity of animals on the limited space of this zoo is not of interest. Rather fewer species, but higher quality spacious living quarters within a species specific habitat-like environment. This zoo rates low on my list of worldwide zoos that I have had the luxury to visit during my travels.

Great day out!. We went to the zoo expecting to kill a couple of hours but ended up staying here for most of the day! There's plenty to see for everyone, an amazing aquarium & a play-park for children. There's also a planetarium which we didn't visit as it was getting late by the time we found it. The cafe was very good value for money too in a city where a burger will set you back £14.An adult ticket cost 19 Euros & included entry to the zoo, the aquarium & the planetarium.

Zoo trip Amsterdam. A lovely zoo with a nice park relaxed atmosphere the staff were welcoming and friendly.The animals looked well looked after, Well laid out everything easy to find and easy access from city centre.
Do not miss it. If you travel with children or if you like to visit a Zoo where the animals are well taken care of, then don't miss it. It was a really enjoyable experience.

Best zoo ever!. This zoo is amazing and is a must do for everyone that visits Amsterdam. The animals are very well looked after and it appears a much more open and friendly zoo compared to many. There are good restaurants and cafes for people to visit too. It was not over crowded and offered great value for money with an excellent low price!

Lovely place to escape the busy city centre. Great zoo with lots of different animals. Great for families, but we enjoyed it as a couple as well. We enjoyed the design of the buildings and the absence of massive overbearing cages. A lovely place to spend a morning or afternoon. Good zoo but nothing spectacular or massively different from other large zoos.The price may be a bit high, but we bought an I Amsterdam card which included the entry price, so was well worth it.

Best zoo we ever visited. It was expensive to enter , 20 Euro per person.But we really liked it .Animals really feel great there ans are super active I never so such active animals in zoo.Zoo planed in a way that each time you discover new corners there. Not too crowded and had extra activities. Recommended to tourists with young children.

Very good experience.. This zoo was amazing you really feel like your in with the animals. There is a really nice garden in the middle of it and there is plenty to see. The biggest restaurant was very good quality. There was lots of renovation going on for new enclosures etc, but it didn't bother our experience.

A tour around world different species. Very complete zoo, a bit old, but this is its charm somehow. 20 € for a nice tour around all the world animal species is worth if you like animals, of course. However if you love them you will feel cross about the small room for some of them, Nice places for butterflies and gorillas.

worth a visit even more than once. being my second trip to Amsterdam I decided to visit the zoo again. The zoo is massive and full of greenery and picnic tables. Its a nice place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. It took us hours to walk around and the animals were amazing and so close. It also has an aquarium and a reptile place. Best zoo I've been to.

Worth a visit. This Zoo is huge and contains almost every animal you can imagine. Unlike other, smaller Zoo`s, you might end up doing this as your only activity one day. My personal favorite was the mountain leopard!
Nice Zoo. A nice zoo in Amsterdam. If you are visiting on Sunday, there is a free tour guided by volunteers. The zoo is renovating different spots, but there is still more than enough to see.

well worth the tram ride out there. The Artis Zoo was under going some refurbishment so not all attractions were available. Generally the sign-posting for the animals was easy to understand and the information at each enclosure was clear and concise. the Aquarium could use some seating dotted around for the disabled or ederley. The highlight for me was the Asian elephants, especialy the youngster who must have been watching the world cup during his stay as he kept me entertained with his ball skills. The Butterfly house was also a memorable occasion as you could get up close and personal to the delightfull creatures as they flew around.
It's a Zoo. Reasonably priced and not over busy. It's a zoo so don't expect a safari park, but some good areas to learn and watch.

Great Zoo but gosh it is EXPENSIVE!. This is a great zoo but I was surprised to be charged 16.50 euros for a 3 year old child. Then to be asked for anther 2 euros for a map! No one likes to be charged for extras on top of a steep entry fee. Lovely zoo but at that price we'll make it a single visit.
As zoos go... I enjoyed this. The aquarium is the clear highlight, as with the reptiles but not the worst zoo I have ever been to.

Plenty of animals and a nice layout. Great zoo full of lots of animals to see. There is a reptile house, insect house and an indoor butterfly garden - all of which means it is still a nice place to visit when raining. My only issue with this zoo is the same as with all zoos and is that I just feel that it's wrong that we keep animals trapped in little rooms so we can see them - but that being said I do know I'm a complete hypocrite by visiting them myself.

JUST AMAZING!!!!!. Someone had told us it was small, i don't know if they had been to the same zoo, because it is anything but small. I loved it, so much so we got annual passes! You have to make the time to visit here, it was fantastic!!!!!

Much bigger than I expected. I must say I was pleasantly suprised, the zoo was massive, if you go as a family you could definitely spend the while day there. There was a lovely open space with monkeys and you could get up really close. Lovely day out

A must!. We absolutely loved the Artis royal Zoo, the animals all have alot of space to roam around in which is great to see, all taken care of and clean. Was a great trip and used the i amsterdam card as this meant it was free!

Fun visit!. We went here for a fun day with the kids. It was interesting to see the different animals they have here as opposed to the zoos near us in Chicago (such as wasbeers also known as raccoon! Who knew I had zoo quality animals in my backyard). And don't miss the climbing playground by the cheetah cafe for older kids. They loved it!

Standard Zoo, fun for small children, dull for adults. While visiting the Zoo, I've noticed that there isn't much too see,Quite a few of the animals on showcase or embalmed, the aquarium was a lot smaller than I though should be, and didn't hold too many attractions there.I think that kids would love the park, but for adults, it is kind of dull, and not recommended.

Everything one should expect in a Zoo. Well mantained, varied fauna- that includes sea animals also. A must if travelling with young children. One can find animals of all continents.Well laid out parks give an extra charm to the place. Children , will love to spend here.

good place for adults and children. i went to the zoo with a person who was in wheelchair,i must say it is quiet far from amstardam red light district but a bus takes you partly there we got cab.the zoo is good and ok for people in wheelchairs,the cafe at the zoo was reasonable and the shop was reasonable as well.

Good alternative to beat jetlag. We had just flew in from California and our hotel room wasn't ready. Trying to get our bearings in the city, boarded a bus that headed to the zoo. No need to focus or read brochures here, it's a nice bunch of cooped up animals.

Definitely worth the money (when it's finished!). Quite a portion of the zoo is being redesigned but there is still a huge amount of animals and birds to see. I was a little depressed at seeing the family of elephants in their tiny compound and the same for the lions and gorillas, but generally it is a very good zoo. Unexpected highlights for me were the butterfly house, the merekats (that behave exactly as on Attenborough programmes!) and the huge number of penguins. The best exhibit was the enormous aquarium that seemed to go on for ages! It's much bigger than Brighton's Sea Life centre.Oh, I forgot to mention the planetarium. When I went, the vision-filling film was "Astronaut" (made by the UK National Lottery Fund) that has to be seen to be believed - but it would be better if it was updated to 4K.PS don't go if it's raining because only a small proportion of it is in doors (obviously!)

Good day out. We went to the zoo for my daughters birthday. We had a lovely day. The surroundings were lovely - like a big park. We were delighted that the lemurs were out in the open. I would definitely recommend it.

Alovely zoo. What a lovely zoo. Been to Amsterdam several times before but I've never been to this side of the city. What a little gem this is.Recommend it to everybody. Easy to get to. Trams number 9 and 14 from outside the centrall station. If you've bought an IAMSTERDAM card (a really good buy) you get in free.

Educational. Great place to take the kids when visiting Amsterdam. We had a lovely day in the sun seeing all the animals. Seeing the large tortoise getting frisky lead to a talk of birds and bees with the kids. Good thing we are flexible like that.

Loved it.. Didn't think this Zoo would be very good because it's not advertised, but I was overwhelmed with how big the park actually is and how many different animals there were. I was incredibly impressed with the aquarium! I would recommend to anyone, but one visit is definitely enough.

great zoo. Great place for children but not only. When you buy ticket you also can buy a map (2E - for elephant's new cage) of the zoo with info aboud i.e. feeding animals. There is a planetarium, insectarium, aquarium in the area. The zoo is very big so you can book around 3h for it. Entrance for adult costs 20 E but free with Iamsterdam city card.

Very pleasant way to spend the afternoon. Spent a very relaxing afternoon here with my 16 year old son last weekend. We visited after going to the Resistance Museum opposite which we also enjoyed (if that's the right word). The zoo was a relaxing contrast. It isn't cheap but no zoos are and I felt the animals were well looked after and cared for. I didn't feel we were being ripped off and it's certainly cheaper than London Zoo.
a lovely small zoo. Lots of information about the animals. Particularly liked the reptile house. Staff were helpful. The aquarium is definitely not to be missed, some amazing fish.

loved it!. we visited a zoo on a saturday so were expecting it to be very busy but it wasn't too crowded but still had a great atmosphere. it was a really pleasant trip, a lot better than we expected with a great variation of animals, birds and insects. it was nice that cages had been used at a minimum. would definitely recommend!

Lovely zoo in very well presented grounds.. lovely zoo, not a big zoo but just enough to see in 3-4 hours. The grounds were lovely with beautiful flower beds. the only negative is a couple of the animals looked liked they were showing signs of being distressed.

A nice afternoon out or a Zoomernight. A afternoon or half a day in the morning is a nice day from all the other touristic spots in Amsterdam. While a small zoo, seems to have enough variety for everyone. Space seems very well managed. I did notice that people complain about the price, well is that really justified, if you do not like the price then do not pay and don't visit. There are of course nicer zoos in the world but considering how old this zoo is and the area it is located in, they do a great job. If you got time and the weather is nice get out to this spot. BTW during the summer months on Saturdays they are open until sunset...about 23:00 (Zoomernight!)

Very good range of animals. Artis has an impressive range of animals, including all the 'big stuff' as well as butterflies, insects and a good range of marine animals and fish. The animals also seemed well cared for and most of the enclosures were spacious and well designed. Highly recommended.

Let's go to the Zoo tomorrow. And it won't disappoint.Excellent zoo right in the heart of Amsterdam. Looks small but wonderfully inventive with it's use of space to get many varieties of animals in and still give them great quality of life and space.Personal favourites were butterfly house with the amazing assortment of birds and butterflies and some of the more unusual mammals such as the Fennec FoxesVery good site if you want to see Herons as well!Restaurants and food quality were found to be really good and pricing on a par with what you'd expect to pay in the UK.Along with a cruise on the canals and the Anne Frank house this is a must do if you are in town for a while.

Lots to see for a fair price. I've seen a few reviews on here complaining about the 20 euro ticket price. It's a large City zoo and there's lots to see, the ticket price is justified, London Zoo is over £20 for an adult, which is of course considerably more when you consider the exchange rate! Nice features such as the butterfly garden, which has lots of beautiful and large butterflies flying around the enclosure freely. I will comment however that some of the enclosures are questionable, for example, I don't feel that the lions or the other big cats had enough room at all! It was a nice day out and will take 2-3 hours to walk around and see everything at a leisurely pace.

A wonderful Zoo. We had a fantastic afternoon here looking at the many many animals - including the baby monkeys! The zoo was quite large but easy to navigate with lots of sign posts. The variety of animals was great and there was even an insect house, butterfly house and aquarium. You could get really close to the animals, especially in lemur land where they were roaming free and coming right up to you!

Good but expensive. We went there so our 3 years old son has some fun memories from Amsterdam. The zoo is great, nicely set up, with lots of green areas and good variety of animals. Our son loved it and we also enjoyed it.What i did not like: it is very expensive, 20 euro for adult is the most expensive ticket we bought in amsterdam. They also charge 17 euro for kids 3 years and older and 2 euro for map (wow, thats greedy!).Another disappointing thing was a platerium show, run in dutch and quite boring so we left after a few minutes (so did a few other groups).

Call RSPCA. The animals here are living in horrible conditions; the camels coat was shocking, the birds sounded like they were screaming for help and the so called king of the jungle, the lion, was so frail and could barely make it up the step in its tiny enclosure. I did not enjoy this experience and felt being there was completely immoral. Not what I was hoping for.

Interesting zoo. An adult ticket for the zoo cost €20. We easily spent a couple of hours in the zoo, you could probably take longer with young children, or if you were interested to read all of the information of the individual exhibits. There were multiple places to buy something to eat or drink within the zoo however we did not buy anything so cannot comment on the prices or quality. Some of the exhibits looked quite small for the animals, primarily the lions and the animals in the aquarium. However, there were a lot of staff on site, and while there we saw the reptile house being cleaned and the animals looked well attended.The zoo is a roughly 30 minute walk away from the centre of Amsterdam, we walked, however the Metro ran alongside on the main roads to the zoo. Several areas of the zoo were closed for renovations and building work, and while this did detract from the overall aesthetic, it appeared as though the zoo was well tended to.
Very fun zoo. Great zoo, lots to see and do, everything is in English too (like all of Amsterdam). Fun for kids and adults. Great on a sunny day!

Fun family day. To get inside Artis as a family with young kids (<10), it will cost you more then €70,00. For that price, I expect beautiful animal shelters and lots of space for the animals. Sadly, that is not the case. That being said, the park itself is nice and spacy. Kids will love it. There's lots to do, see and eat and drink. At some spots monkeys walk freely and they have a great variety of animals. For me as a local, it's both too expensive to go often and has too little space for the animals for me to really enjoy.

A really cool zoo. Some exhibits didn't have fences around them, making them feel nice and open. There was a varied amount of cool animals too. The only thing was a few of the enclosures were a little on the small side, but definitely worth a visit.

These animals are not living in good conditions.. The lions had no grass to lay on, only sand that I'm sure were miserable. The condor cage was a nice size though. Oh, and don't put a sign saying you have sharks in your aquarium when the only shark you have is a tiny nurse shark. That was quite upsetting.

Good but.... Hermanni turtles were in really poor condition, their shell seemed broken and deformed. They need sun to stay healthy and not be kept in a small terrarium under UV lamps (especially in June). I was really sad seeing that.

Lots to see!. The zoo has many beautiful buildings within and the aquarium was very nice. Unfortunately we didn't understand the show at the planetarium as it was in Dutch but it was still worth watching and it's not their fault we cant speak the language. Food is healthy and tasty in the cafe.

Amazing. We literally spent 4 hours at this Zoo! The weather was great too and we managed to get round and see all the animals and went into the big Aquarium. Way better than any Zoo i have been to round here!

Fantastic day out with wide range of animals.. A very reasonably priced attraction with a wide variety of animals. Some of the animals were showing stereo typical behaviour which was a shame; perhaps more could be done to stimulate the animals. The zoo was very clean with lots of opportunities to get a snack or a seat and overall is an afternoon well spent!

Day Time fun at the zoo. I didn't think i would enjoy the Zoo as much as i did, it was fantastic a great day out with my partner, so much to see, stand a little away from the elephants because i got splattered in hay! It was all good fun! 100% recommend it :)

Best Zoo I've Ever Been In.. Totally Recommend.. This zoo was free when you had the IAmsterdam card. We got there a little after opening and it was quite pack with a long enough cue but don't let it steer you from going. For a euro you can purchase a map to the place which is what I should have done! The animals were amazing! You also were quite close to them, you could literally put your hand in and touch a penguin that's how close. It's a beautiful place with lots of greenery and loads of places to sit down which was great because my feet were so sore. There's also an aquarium inside. I would totally recommend you to go!

Kids love it. We took a boat and stop on route at the zoo . Unfortunately the movie shown in theatre is only in Dutch only ; the staff did not indicate whether there is sub title with it . We needed to pay 2 euro extra for the map . The animals in the park are in good range , the stroll thro the park cum garden is an easy one . The play ground was the place our kids found the most exciting . We have been to many zoos before ie Melbourne , Bangkok and Singapore and this zoo rank one must visit.

An ape-tastic attraction!. I visited Artis Zoo as I had free entrance courtesy of the I Amsterdam 48-hour pass that I purchased upon my arrival in the city. It was located less than a five-minute walk away from my apartment in the Plantage area of Amsterdam.This zoo is by far the biggest and best zoo I have ever visited. It has all the animals you would expect to see plus reptiles, spiders and other creepy-crawlies I would flatten with a phone book if I saw them in my living room!I spent ages walking around the large grounds but most of my time was spent watching, photographing and filming the monkeys going ape in their enclosure; I was thankful for the thick glass separating them from me and keeping me safe!Another highlight was the appearance and bizarre behaviour of a big, brown bear that performed an OCD-like ritual several times in my presence.I may not have visited this zoo had it not been free to do so but I'm glad I did. I would thoroughly recommend it to everyone and children would undoubtedly love it too.

Brilliant. We stayed in a hostel close to the zoo and whilst walking around decided to visit. I have never been to a zoo before however my first experience was amazing and they had everything to offer. There were all kinds of animals. I would definitley reccomend

WILD & WOUNDERFUL. The zoo is one of the best that I have been to, it is big and spaces and you fell as if the animals are not caged up. There is a large variety of animals, birds, reptiles and butterflies. We spent all day and enjoyed every moment. We watched the vultures fighting over their food and the elephants playing with balls

wild. Great place especially with the children. Never bored and the exhibit with the bats, monkeys and birds and lizards roam free as you walk through was wild. We loved this place. The Gibbons had a small battle that looked and sounded a real as the wild gets, but we felt safe in this place of the wild. Big like!

Absolutely beautiful!. I truly love animals and went to several zoos and aquariums in Europe, but I have to say that Artis in Amsterdam is one of the most beautiful animal park I have ever seen. The price for going into a zoo is generally not cheap, it is pretty much the same as anywhere else in Europe. However, as long as you decide to spend at least 3 to 4 hours in the zoo, then I can say that it is totally worth it! All the animals you can think of are there. They even have an aquarium and an insect area! On a sunny day, it is even more enjoyable! I will be back for sure when I have children!

Excellent zoo in the heart of Amsterdam. We were pleasantly surprised at how big the zoo is. Since it is in the heart of Amsterdam didn't think it would be that large. It is a very walkable zoo and the waterfall is nice feature. The kids would enjoy it. One section allows you to walk in and see the monkeys and birds all around you.

Really liked some of the animals simply roaming around the zoo. They have a good collectiojn of animals. Several animals just roam around where people walk. There are also rooms where you can enter and several animals roam around. It is like you have come to forests of Madagascar.My daughter loved it

Very Nice - due some updates though. This is a very nice zoo indeed, and was our first stop in a tour of European zoos... all in all it holds up well and I would say as far as national zoos go, it trumps London zoo.You can tell that at its core this is an old zoo, with a number of old exhibits such as the spectacled bear enclosure, macaque island, chimpanzee exhibit and many of the old buildings still being in place. I think that many of these could do with a major overhaul, and some of the animals could certainly do with a lot more space (such as the lions). However saying that there are some gorgeous exhibits here.The reptile house is quite nice, and the aquarium is absolutely stunning. This are also has a museum which is very well laid out and interesting.The Giraffe and Zebra have a very nice large open paddock near the restaurant (which as you'd expect in such an attraction is a bit pricey but very nice), however the elephants on the other hand seemed to have very little space in comparison.All in all a beautiful place, certainly worth visiting... Some improvements need to be made but you would expect this in an old zoo, where the age of the buildings may well prohibit them from making such changes in the future.
for a cold day visit the butterfly garden. artis is a great city zoo, with also a lot of inside things to do. Don't forget to visit the butterfly garden

Lovely zoo with all animals imaginable.. I've gone to this zoo many many times before, and my opinion hasn't changed a bit. Not only is this zoo very large for the centre of the capital city, but it also uses its size properly. I can't think of a single animal that you wouldn't be able to find there: reptiles, all types of bugs (huge poisonous spiders and scorpions included), an entire hall full of live butterflies you can stroll through (reccomended), fish, seals, penguin, monkeys, elephants, big cats, many types of birds and a fabulous restaurant with a massive playground (any kid will love the slides). Not to forget that there is a planetarium (a must for anyone that is interested in astronomy or any other form of science). Next to the planetarium there is a nice little café and a giftshop for souvenirs. I've been here atleast 10 times if not more, and I recommend it to any couple/family with or without kids.
Excellent place to visit. I can't say this is a must see place, but it's really worth to spend a few hours there. Extremely huge territory, variety of animals, plus a few bars with snacks around.

They really seem to care about animals. I went there last week with my wife's family. It was brilliant! The place is huge and the habitats looked very similar with the real ones, in the wild. You will definitely spend a day in there. If you have I Amsterdam card,it's free and you just need to queue for a bit to pick up you tickets :). The staff are friendly and helpful. Don't get my word for it. Before you go, have a look on Google for pictures and reviews. Have fun! :)

A place which worth a visit. Not all the species was found in the zoo.Great bicycle parking area it was like endless.No free tour guide. Most of the species was either missing at all or sleeping so they should have informed us in the first place or charge us a little cheaper because of that! An interesting place for animal lovers, at the end of the park was like dumped or unfinished. It takes you hours to explore the whole park.

Excellent Zoo - A must!. This Zoo is definitely a contender for one of the best I have visited.The enclosures are intimate yet accessible to visitors and animals are easily visible, as the Zoo had made a real effort to blend the animals into the attraction. There are no high fences or restricted views on the enclosures and this makes for a much more enjoyable experience.The zoo is large with plenary to do and the Aquarium gives you another experience altogether. There are interactive activities throughout the park and the restaurant bad bar area are set in a prime location overlooking the Africa enclosure and lake. We were fortunate enough to see the baby make giraffe born on the day of our visit which was incredible.Add this to you list of attractions when visiting Amsterdam, it won't disappoint you.

Great place to spend a day. The Royal Zoo is spread over a large area.There are other exhibits to see apart from the animals. There is a Planetarium, the Aquarium, Dioramas and plenty of gardens to rest in. A baby giraffe had just been born. There were crowds lined up to see it.Only downside is still seeing moneys and some of the larger animals still in cages, instead of open areas.

Good day out. Had a good day out at artis zoo with my daughter and grandson, some years since we've been here. Plenty to see, good cafe, lots of school groups which unfortunately meant we couldn't get to see a lot of the animals as children were busy doing school projects, drawing animals, filling in questions etc etc, realise that's no ones fault but just meant our grandson didn't get to see a lot of the animals close by. Have to say we have also been to The zoo in Rotterdam and found that better, more space, good layout animals enclosures looked better cared for, good facilities and better value for money

Excellent - loved every second. After reading reviews on here I thought this would be a bog standard zoo. It really isn't that at all. The zoo itself has a wide range of animals that you can get close to, which was brilliant for my 1 year old. The zoo itself is lovely, it's clean, is set out so it's not too big or too small & the greenery is lovely. We also didn't have to pay for the zoo because we had an iamsterdam card, which I would defo look into if you're visiting.

Nice place for the kids. I've been to artis so many times, I really enjoy it especially in the spring. It is a bit small but you have to remember its one of the oldest zoos in Europe. You can easily spend the whole day walking around or just sit in the cafe. Worth a visit.
Fun day out. The zoo was very busy - we went on a day when it was full of school children and noisy teenagers! The zoo was well set out and we got to see most animals in the rain.

Awesome zoo!. Fantastic zoo, it took us about 4 hours to walk all the way around and see everything! I was very surprised to see a massive aquarium full of sharks & other ocean life. Much better than any of the zoo's i've been to in the UK. Had some animals that i haven't seen in captivity before. There's a tram stop right outside which leads back towards Amsterdam Centraal which is good. The only TINY problem i found was that we couldn't find any of the maps of the zoo anywhere, so we just had to walk around and make sure that we see everything and not to miss any. If you go to Amsterdam this is definitely one of the "not to miss" attractions. Would happily go back :)
Nice but pricey. My husband took our kids and they really enjoyed it but he did say it was way overpriced for what it was.

Nice zoo. The Iamsterdam card covers the cost of this too. It is very.....zoo like. The butterfly house is good as are the monkey areas. Having been a fan of Chester Zoo, this is not as good, but it is a decent day out for the family.

Amazing, loved it!!. Me and my sister went to this zoo a few years ago and loved it!! You need a few hours for this place to take it all in!! I'm hoping to go again this year as it's got incredible animals! And it's aquarium is phenomenal!!

GREAT TIME. My brother and I spent 1/2 a day here had a great time walking around seeing everything. the day we were it was kids day kids from kindergarden & grade one the moneys & elephants decided to make out. they knew what was going on laughing and pointing it out to all

Nice attraction, very nice for kids. Nice attraction for families with kids, not as extensive as London Zoo perhaps but still very nice. Good area's to stop and relax. Extremely nice and helpful staff.
Only downside the big cats are difficult to see , other than the lions which have a large open enclosure, so was unable to observe anything in around 8 enclosures.

Lots of animals!. Spent all afternoon at this Zoo! It has good cafes and food courts and lots of different animals and enclosures! Only things I didn't like was the condition of the camel, he looked very rough and is in need of a good clean and also theres a bear which seems like he's gone a bit crazy. In his enclosure on his own and just walks in circles and swings his head around, needs a partner I think. Apart from that I loved the place, ran around like a little child.

Wear your walking shoes. This zoo is incredible. A was half expecting, judging by the map of Amsterdam and the location of the zoo, we would be in an out in 2 hours tops! I was wrong- we spent 6 hours there. The zoo is a great deal bigger than it looks on any map. Unlike with some zoo's here at home, this zoo had animals a plenty - from elephants to insects! It's a truly great day out and the kids will enjoy it too. It is really reasonably priced too at €20 per adult.

Average. For the price the zoo was average. Good for young children I'd say, especially in the reptile and primate houses. The larger animals were kept in extremely small enclosures I'd say. My favourite area was probably the impressive aquarium.An ok few hours out but I feel time and money may have been spent better elsewhere in Amsterdam on our mini break.

Nice. The zoo is clean and easy to get around, our daughter loved seeing the animals especially because they are not all in cages. We got great pictures a family and would love to go again when it's not raining.

Small but good zoo - park. As a child my father took me to our local zoo almost every weekend. Some of my best early memories come from these trips. Now I am a father myself, I take my son to our local zoo myself. At the moment Artis is our local zoo. It's located on the Eastern side of Amsterdam's city center. That makes it very easy to get to, but at the same time limits zoo expansion. This is not one of the world's largest zoos. It is however one of the oldest, and preserves as much of its old architectural splendor as is possible while adapting enclosures to modern views on animal welfare. The aquarium in particular is a beautiful neo-classicist building which has lost none of its charm. Several other buildings are currently being restored and will open this summer as a museum of the zoo's history and a microbe zoo (if your zoo is small, exhibit small animals). Not that all animals are small, there are elephants, giraffes, lions, ostriches, zebras and a sealion aquarium. Still, Artis seems at its best with more humble creatures. The butterfly house is beautifully peaceful (except on weekends and holidays), there is a bird and small primate house with free roaming monkeys, bats and birds, and a remarkable arthropod exhibit (do not enter if afraid of spiders!)Artis is particularly innovative in how it feeds the animals. This is most noticeable in the vulture, african hunting dog and wolf enclosures, where the animals are fed whole carcasses instead of chopped-up meat. It's entirely normal to see a half-eaten lemur or goat being torn up or dragged around. A bit grisly, but normal and stimulating behaviour for carnivores.Because of its small size and location Artis can get very busy. If possible avoid weekends and holidays altogether; most Dutch primary schoolchildren have Wednesday afternoon off, so it's pretty full then too. If you're visiting with small children, notice the free hand carts about 150m from the entrance (just by the Japanese macaques). Put in a EUR 2 deposit and drag your little one around if you don't have a pushchair. There aren't many of them, so be early if you need one. By the entrance you can also pick up a weekly 'newspaper' showing feeding times for various animals and other interesting talks and happenings. It is available in both English and Dutch.As with most other Dutch zoos, Artis is rather expensive for a single visit, but if you have a season ticket to other European zoos there is a good chance that you qualify for some form of concession. The reverse is also true: you can get 50% off most other NL and BE zoos with your Artis ticket. This is very good value as a season ticket only costs as much as three seperate tickets. If you think you'll be visiting more often, get one straight away.
Not just for the kids!!. I loved this place, it was such an experience and I would definitely go back again! The animals seem very well taken care of and the monkeys especially were very friendly :)

Lovely afternoon. Spent a nice afternoon wandering around the zoo, visited as part of holland pass, well worth a visit. Although the zoo enclosures are quite small they are renovating and trying to improve this. The walk through the lemur enclosure was lovely
Worth a visit, especially on a sunny day. Especially since the birth of the baby giraffe. However you may want to wait, if you can, until they have finished the building works.

Amazing zoo. I've been to many zoos, but none compares to this one. The animals were beautiful and well fed and happy. The place itself was stunning, the trees, the greenery, the enclosures. 20€ seemed quite expensive at first, but after seeing it you realise it's worth every penny. If you have a sunny afternoon to spare, don't hesitate

Needs more direction. Fairly good zoo which isn't too overpriced at all. Plenty of animals to see and you could easily spend 2-3 hours walking around.
Found it pretty hard to know what we had seen and what we hadn't. The trail is fairly hard to follow and it would be easy to miss things out.
A good collection. It is not perhaps the most exciting place in Amsterdam, however it does have its charm, if you have not been to larger zoos.

No place for this in 2014. I came away from this zoo vowing I never want to go a zoo again. I didn't know in this day and age that you were allowed to keep animals in such old fashioned, dirty and cramped conditions - it was something out of the Victorian era. The most horrible conditions were reserved for the lions - 4 lions with hardly any room to move. Such magnificent creatures - I just felt ashamed to be a human looking at them. Other animals pacing up and down in that horrible psychotic way animals do when they are trapped. Please turn this place into a garden.
Big zoo. The zoo was brilliant. All sorts of animals. Make sure you get the map at the start when you are paying because its like a maze in there.

Awesome!. This was truly a very lovely zoo and one which offers a wide array of animals. The animals also seem to be happy and have large enclosures, many of which do not have bars or a cage at all, but instead use landscaping to keep them in. The zoo also has a very good cafeteria style restaurant called the twee cheetahs, which was very good and offers good views of the animals. This is a great place for people of all ages.

Many youngsters are born now. If you visit the fantastic city of Amsterdam, with it's canals and historical buildings don't forget to go to Artis Zoo. Many young animals are born this spring. Just a couple of days ago a baby boy Giraf is one of them. Enjoy your day and enjoy the city.

As good as you'll get for a City zoo. Easy access by tram from the City centre, a few cafes in the area too. Well kept, nicely spaced out zoo. Good information guides for butterflies, reptile house etc. nice aquarium - enough indoor areas for a colder day. Good feeding sessions / information talks by keepers in Dutch and English. Elephants looked a bit bored, but otherwise all animals looked wellcared for, with decent space for a City zoo - and far more than London Zoo, for example. Recommended for families - easy pathways.

a bit expensive, but worth visiting!. The Zoo divided into 3 regions, including the Planetarium, Botanical Garden and Museum of Geology and Zoology. A wide variety of animals of all kinds. I especially liked the huge aquarium.

Worth visiting the 176 year old zoo!. I was hesitant to go to this zoo, while visiting Amsterdam, due to some negative reviews about cruel animal conditions. However, I love going to foreign zoos and aquariums and decided to go anyways. I am glad I did! We bought the 2 tickets at the zoo as well as the map, yes you have to pay for the park map, honestly though I don't mind paying a bit more knowing the money is going to a zoo. It was a rainy day so we were grateful for all the indoor habitats that were warm and dry. The bird sanctuary was wonderful being that the birds could roam all around you, so be careful of the bird poop! After being to the aquarium in Barcelona the aquarium in the Artis zoo was a bit of a let down, but still nice. Walking through the butterfly sanctuary was wonderful, walking through with all the butterflies fluttering around us. On a side note the planetarium information is all in Dutch, so unless you read Dutch it's rather pointless.

Not an American Zoo. I thought this zoo was very interesting. The usual zoo animals, and an aquarium that was popular. There were some walk through exhibits with monkeys and birds that were free to roam thru the room with you, one of the monkeys came very close and surprised me! The zoo was clean and the grounds were quite stunning.

Pleasant but expensive, still worth visiting. This zoo is very pleasant, animals are taken care of and they have plenty of space, so most of them seem happy. It is very tidy and quite big, so it's a great place for a walk in the afternoon. On the other hand it's very expensive and if you want to buy any food or drinks there prepare to spend A LOT. However, if you buy iAmsterdam card, the zoo ticket is for free (with this card many attractions and museums offer tickets with discounted price). Nonetheless, it's worth visiting, especially with little children as it's very family friendly and you have very small chances of seeing sad, tired animals.
Nice and old zoo. Nice place to be with family and children. Full range of animals in very big and old zoo. It's also very big garden. If I'm correct, it's more than 100 years old

Very animal friendly but expensive. This zoo is very animal friendly, you can see that the animals really enjoy themselves, most of them have tons of space. I would suggest to bring you own food as it is way too expensive and the tickets are also very pricey (around 20 euros per person). But you can spend hours in this zoo in the centre of the city. Take tram 9 from central station and you'll be there in 15 min.

Fantastic zoo.. This zoo is extremely family friendly.Almost everything Is outside as you'd expect from a zoo with plenty of places to sit. There are a few attractions including feeding time a planetarium style cinema featuring an underwater adventure and a large cafe area.The zoo is easily located but a good 20 minute walk from central station (on a hot day) To be fair we actually stumbled upon the zoo while exploring Amsterdam.The price is fairly steep, I think we paid around £23 to get in per adult which was around 30 euros. The grounds are clean, well presented and the staff are extremely friendly and speak both Dutch and English.It's definitely worth a visit if you are visiting and looking for something to do for the whole family. Do note this zoo has no tigers sadly :( or it didn't when we visited although there are pictures of tigers on the promotional materials.Would we recommend this attraction? Yes, most definately.Value for money: ***Entertainment rating:****Location rating:****Family friendly rating: *****

Well worth a visit. Fantastic range of animals; they all seemed happy although the new big-cat enclosure currently under construction will improve things for them. Good use is made of the restricted space the site allows and it is obviously being continuously modernised. The highlight for us was a baby sloth.

Lovely zoo. Must have been good, I took near on 1000 pictures, a excellent zoo and animals are well looked after... Something for everyone and was not crowded like some zoo's.The baby gorillas was amazing.

Amazing zoo. This zoo is huge and reallly well maintained. Lots of different animals ( alot more than london zoo ) . We did try to walk here but was to far so ended up getting a tram from the centre which was easy. Would definitely recommend visiting here.

Amsterdam zoo. This historic Zoo offers a wide range of garden and architecture styles and of course the whole spectrum of biodiversity.
The bedding and tulip-displays in spring rival those of "Keukenhof"and there is a tropical butterfly hothouse.

Not the best zoo we've been too.... I agree with another reviewer - this zoo was a bit sad. Don't get me wrong it is a lovely zoo, the gardens are well kept and there are plenty of facilities and a good wide range of animals. But we just noticed how sad some of the animal enclosures were. For example there are a couple of very sorry looking Kookaburras in a cage with some sea birds!? My husband is Australian and you see these guys in the bush very commonly, we thought it was a bit of an odd environment for them. And like with any zoo you will get someone complaining about the animal welfare - but we did feel strongly that the amount of space the cheetahs and lions had was a bit on the small side. We had a nice morning with our son who loved looking at the animals, but we did leave feeling a bit disappointed.

small but nice. We spent roughly 3 hours in the zoo.It is a small zoo,but is big enough for kids to enjoy.There was a little bit of renovation going on,but alright as it is for the better stay of animals.Our 6 year old daughter had so much fun seeing the elephants,penguins,giraffe,sea lion,birds etc.The aquarium was so good and had so many fishes.Fortunate to see some piranha too :)I am sure kids would enjoy the place.
Nice zoo. Had a lovely morning at this beautiful zoo. Really liked the lions & the aquarium was spectacular. A great variety of animals who all look well cared for.
So so. In comparison with others zoos which I've visited this one is small, but not bad. animals' cages are close to the visitors so you have a good chance to see inhabitans very well
The Zoo. We visited the zoo the other day. Great day out. Plenty of animals and information regarding them. I mainly wanted to see the aquarium, was very impressed with that! Would love to go again!

Disappointed. I hate to write a negative review, but we try to visit zoos in every city we go to and this one was kind of sad. There was definitely an effort to provide some stimulation for the animals, but the pens were small and the best thing I could say, is that at least these animals are being fed and not hunted, as they would be in the wild. We generally love seeing the animals, and walking around the parks. This one was disappointing.

one of my favourite zoos. love this zoo great facilites and the selection of animals and their habitata is great and very realsitic! Visited this zoo probably about 6 times and every time it gets better and better. try to get there on a nice sunny day and you will not be let down by anything! I can only recoomend this zoo to anyone whol ove animals. great zoo to take picutres aswell as most cages are very open.
Lovely zoo. My family and I had a great day at the zoo. The animals were well cared for and the staff were helpful. Well worth a visit.

Brilliant Morning Spent. We visited the zoo early in the morning so there was no ques but was still busy. The park is fantastic, animals are well looked after and they have a wide range of animals to suit everyone. Great for little kids and big kids!

Better than expected. My partner and i had purchased an 'I AMsterdam' card for all the museums and sites to save money. We went to the zoo to get our moneys worth but got much more out of it then we expected! Alot of the cages were open, so no bars to try and avoid when taking pictures. You could get up and close to the birds, reptiles and monkeys (The aquarium is included in the ticket price) Nothing like it in Australia. I would highly recommend it to anyone. We only allowed ourselves 3 hours but could of spent a day!

Artis Zoo - Avoid if possible. We visited this place during our stay in Amsterdam. its a below average zoo. We visited this place only because of my friend's daughter who insisted on seeing this place. It was waste of time. nothing compared to Berlin zoo ..We did not pay anything as this was a part the amsterdam pass.

Definitely worth for visiting!!. After I read many reviews I was expecting to see small cages and animals with too less space for movement, but I did not see any such things. I was surprised but in a good way. Other than this, the animals seemed to be well cared and very healthy. The staff members were very nice and the atmosphere in the zoo was very friendly and full of joy. I think that 20 Euro is the right price for this zoo and you will not regret afterwards. You should definitely try it!

Animal cruelty behind the Tulips. Just came back from Amsterdam. Had the dubious pleasure of visiting the Amsterdam Zoo. The entrance was quit promising with nice Tulips and young kids being chased by their mothers. The ugly truth started to emerge when going be the monkey display. Very typical to the zoo, a mount of artifical rocks trying to resemeble some natural landscape from the moon maybe. The monkeys sitting on ledges around the bizarre rock arrangement. There were many such hard and grotesque displays around the park. The worse part was the Gorillas enclosure or dungeon I should say. What hits you right away when you enter is the stench. The Gorillas are kept in a small concreat room sounded by glass for the people to be able to watch every move and jeer and the poor primates. After a few minutes I noticed the male and leading female trying to go back to the cofinment of their inner cell, just to get away from the jeering people. I also noticed more than one individual eating feces, which is known indication of distress and mental problem. The choices of food are mostly junk food with little vegetarian options. No surprise there. Very sad exhibition emphasising peoples ignorance and cruelty. Avoid this park!!!

Nice experience for us but a bit uncertain for the animals.... Good value for money. Nice place to stroll around as it was not crowded when we visited. The atmosphere is not as hectic as in the London Zoo, as everybody seemed really laid back. On the other hand, the enclosures seemed a bit too small, i.e. for the seals, cats, etc.

Bit Disappointed. Its a lovely clean Zoo but the animals have not much room, its good value for money and I expect the children love the experience of a zoo, I would love to see the cattle, lions and the monkeys to how more space, they need this.
Good place for family visit. Surprise to see there are some rare animals from overseas, can see the animals closely. Gardens are lovely as well. Some indoor display bit smelly.
Great Little Zoo. Lots of interesting creatures to see. Look out for the monkey house and save it until last. It's excellent.

A must see!. I have to say I disagree with a lot of previous reviews I thought the zoo was really big and took us 3/4 hours to walk around and we still missed parts out.There is such a varied selection of animals and lots of places to eat and buy drinks from carts dotted around the zoo.Really recommend a visit here
beautifuly laid out zoo. lovely sunny day when we visited.The animals seemed content.Aquarium,butterfly,reptile houses fascinating.

Worth a visit!. Although this is quite a small zoo is packed with a variety of animals including giraffes, elephants, lions, gorillas, butterflies, fish, chimpanzees and so much more!Only €20 to get in so would highly recommend it.Allow about 3 hours to get around and see everything.There are many cafés to stop for food and drink but they're quite busy and more expensive than shops outside of the zoo.
Excellent little zoo. My niece aged 10 loved this zoo. It is smaller than elsewhere but include a butterfly enclosure, great reptile house and acquarium. Would really recommend

Great place. We spent an afternoon at the zoo & it was great. Lots of animals and the grounds are lovely. There is a cafe/restaurant on site which seemed to have a large selection of food/drinks and very good indoor and outdoor seating areas. I would recommend Artis Zoo for a day out, it was good fun.

busy but good city zoo. animals were well kept in good surroundings. The zoo isn't too large so gets busy , particularly with school children, and when we were there, lost of college age teenagers who were more interested in fooling around than anything else, but this didn't detract from a very enjoyable visit. If you like zoos you will enjoy this one. Leave about 3 hours to see it. There are cafes for drinks and lunch but these were very busy

A flora and fauna brought together. I had never thought such a concept would exist: a zoo and a botanical garden combined. Yet, Artis Royal Zoo has been around since 1838. Clearly, Holland was ahead of its times.

Interesting. The zoo was very interesting and a lot of fun, many of the different buildings allow animals to run around you. The chimpanzee enclosure was pretty depressing however, and there should definitely be more security in some parts as many people thumped on the glasses. However as an overall experience, it was very enjoyable.
Super. Amazing how a zoo in the middle of one of the biggest cities of Europe, can be so big and calm. A nice time away from the business and with a great range of animals.

Historical zoo in the centre of Amsterdam. Historical zoo, with many historical buildings. Ideal to end a citytrip to Amsterdam with children. ecause of Easter there was a quiz route for children on the theme of "eggs", a bit difficult but it gives focus to a visit.The cage with the Amour panther is indeed rater small, but works are in progress to enlarge it.The "Two Cheetahs" restaurant is a bit chaotic.Very nice butterfly pavillon, with rather big butterflies flying around you.Walking between two Wolves' Dens (interconnected with a tunnel) is a bit strange.I approved that a lot of the monkey rockw were actually in the open air, as was the Gorilla roc, with an impressive Silverback.Free for holders of an year card of the Antwerp Zoo.
Not spectacular. I liked Blijdorp zoo in Rotterdam better. I think it's an average zoo and if you are in Amsterdam, there are many places which are more impressive.
Great day out. Well laid out easy to wander around & view the animals.Spent 3 hours there & really enjoyed it. Well worth the entrance fee

A good example of a family friendly city zoo. We visited Artis on a sunny Saturday in mid-April when the zoo was full of families enjoying a day out. It was busy, but didn't feel crowded - just a short queue to get in and very little queuing at any of the facilities. We ended up sending four hours there - more than we expected - the zoo is cleverly laid out so that it feels a lot bigger than it is. The flower displays were as good as many a town park, and there are plently of benches to sit and relax. Visitors felt close to the animals - even among them in a few places.To our non-expert eyes, the standards of animal welfare were good. Conditions in city zoos are never going to be ideal for big cats, and there was a solitary bear that looked bored out of its head - but the zoo stated it was a temporary home as part of a breeding programme.If we'd realsied how long we were going to spend there we'd have brought a picnic - the cafes on site are ok but nothing special. Other than that we throroughly enjoyed our visit and would go back again if we were in the city in good weather.

Fun at the zoo. Visited the zoo and found it very interesting and nicely designed. It cost ?20 each but worth it especially if you have children. There is lots to see but unfortunately on ou visit they were construction works goin on for the big cat enclosure - it will be a better environment for them! Enjoy just wondering around and seeing all the different animals and species. Well worth a visit on a nice day!

Some cool enclosures, some less cool. Some of it was fantastic. There's sections where you can walk and see animals - lemurs, bats, butterflies - with no barrier between you. This is amazing. However, there are other enclosures where you get the sense that too many animals are crammed into too little space. Specifically, the lions and camels were two I felt this way about.Seeing the animals was great, but I was a little worried about them.

If they're going to keep exotic animals they need to give them better enclosures.. I'm not a fan of zoos anyway but against my better judgement we went for a visit just because our hotel was right across the road from it. I really wish we hadn't of bothered, not just because of the 40 euro (for two, entrance fee) but because of the lack of space the animals have.There is several exotic animals in this zoo and not any of them have ample living space. The lion and his three lioness looked very bored and hungry. The elephants, even though they are expecting a new enclosure were couped up in a very lackluster environment and it just broke my heart to see the baby in there. I'm sure the animals are looked after but it pains me to know this baby elephant will be there for the rest of its life.The zoo is very spacious and there is a lot of areas where other animals could benefit from their enclosures being expanded, I get that it's expensive but if they can't home the animals appropriately maybe they shouldn't have them at all. The tiger and the leopard especially as they were kept in very small (for their size) cages.The zoo would benefit from making a bit more of a bigger deal of its aquarium as it's located in a really lovely building and is home to several species of fish and underwater creatures. It really impressive although slightly dark.I really could go on a tangent on how much I dislike zoos but it's for reasons like this one that I do. There really needs to be more efforts to adapt the animals living arrangements especially if they are going to attempt to keep so many exotic animals. The poor speckled bear was SO bored he was doing circles and circles and circles in his little box of land he had. It basically looked like a dumping ground of old logs with no rhymed or reason and it just didn't look great at all. Same goes for the giraffes, they were out in the soaking wet rain trying to eat from the gutter.
Great!. Great fun but twisted ankle got in the way. For 18.50 you get to see sea land and air animals!! It does need a guided tour or something. Dublin's zoo has a great tour in comparison

Had such a good day!. The zoo is really big and they have lots of animals. The butterfly friend was nice which my friend enjoyed (I have a phobia so not the same for me I'm afraid). We spent around 2 hours and managed to see everything. It's very clean with good facilities and you can get really close to see the animals.

Not bad but not great!. Overall the animals are well looked after! It was good, but it just needed a little more. I have been to better zoos, such as the one in lisbon(which is fabulous by the way). The penguins enclosure upset me as there was no clean water and no where near enough for them to swim in....sad times. Lovely that they are making a bigger enclosure for elephants, but they were well looked after. Keep it up...

Surprising number of animals seemingly well looked after. My partner and I visited the zoo on a rather grey day but still had a great experience. I was completely taken aback by the size of the zoo and the wide variety of animals present: e.g. giraffes, lions, elephants, red pandas etc. I was fairly impressed with the space available to most of the animals and the steps taken to improve their conditions. By this I mean that the zoo is aiming to raise sufficient funds to allow the elephants to move to a larger enclosure which would appear to be needed. I would suggest people buy a map (2 EUR), the funds from this go towards funding the new elephant enclosure. Furthermore, I think that if we didn't have a map, we may have missed some of the animals due to the sheer size and number of animals in the zoo!The only animals I felt that could have had more space were the lions. However, perhaps this will improve with the elephants being moved. Great day out in Amsterdam for people of all ages (my partner and I being in our mid 20s) and something a bit different from museums, Anne Frank house or coffee shops!

Great with kids. This zoo is really brilliant! Very park like and all the animals are there. We especially liked the seal show at feeding time, spectacular. There are enough places where you can rest, drink and eat and it's easily reached by public transport or by car, we didn't have any problem finding parking nearby.

had a great fun time !. I love going to zoos and this one is great, the highlights for me were the lions and the elephants, I was so close to the lions and had such a great view of them. the zoo has lots of different animals and great facilities.
