The zoo was a little hard to find, and its expensive to get in, but its a great way to have an enjoyable time.

Lovely zoo in the middle of Amsterdam . Artis is an old zoo but quite famous for its quality. They try to extend and give the animals more space. However they allready realized a lot changes allready. Dont miss the famous Aquarium, butterfly garden and gorilla house. And at the end take a break in "the two cheeta's" restaurant and playground. Kids adore it!

Loved it!. I love Zoos and Artis is brilliant! We spent hours and hours looking at all the animals. On top of it being a Zoo, it's also a lovely park, so you can literally spend all day in there. It's a bit on the pricey side, but it's worth it if you have time to stay and absorb it all.

The oldest Zoo of the Netherlands. and unfortunately, it shows... It is a fantastic location, don't forget to visit the "Hollandse Schouwburg" closely to the Zoo. The animal quarters are good, and they take good care about the animals, this is a good thing, and a priority. For an old Zoo this is not any easy task, but they managed it. Prices are reasonable... But in my opinion they are not taking good care about their visitors... for example... the shortage of toilets.. Today one place was closed.. and at the entrance you just have for example 2 toilets for men... so a long que and very dirty. Also the restaurants are very inefficient especially if you like to have a coffee. Just one register... ?? also the decoration is very poorly. Every where you can see that you can make donations... But please... go work a bit more efficient and you can earn a lot of money.. More and More efficient places to get a drink or bite... Overhaul your shop.. make it fun to buy something.. and they will earn 30% more.. easy....As I said.. They are very good for animals.. but they should look to for example Blijdorp in Rotterdam, how to welcome their visitors a little bit better!
feel sorry for the animals. the animals are locked up in very small cages, i will never go here again! I understand that they don´t have any space to give animals bigger cages but i don´t like this..

Great day out. We enjoyed a visit here at the end of March, although there was quite a long queue for tickets, it went down quickly. One slightly annoying thing is that you have to pay extra to get a map of the zoo, I felt that this should be included with the ticket price but at a couple of euros it wasn't too much extra to pay and it was very handy to have. I'd say it's well worth a visit and it's probably teh best zoo I've visited as there is so much to see - butterfly house, reptile house, giraffes, elephants, sea lions, lions, chimpanzees, penguins and even an aquarium too!

Didn't expect it to be so good. Easily the best zoo I've been to. I was a bit sceptical about paying 19 euros but I feel it was well worth it. Arrive early to avoid queues. Awesome sea lion shows, and lots of variety.

Enjoyed a trip to the zoo. Spent the best part of the day at the zoo and still didn't see everything. Highlights included seeing a very large crocodile in reptile house, the lions eating chickens and walking around the butterfly pavilion. Well worth a visit.
Good. Enjoyed our visit. A little bit pricey I thought though. The butterfly pavilion was great and also the forest house. Lots of children there on a weekend of course!

Excellent experiene. Free if you have the I Am Amsterdam card, the zoo is an excellent way to spend a morning/afternoon. There are lots of different kinds of animals to see, and it is arranged in a way that you don't feel that the animals are actually caged. There are loads of free roaming birds and smaller animals to pet. A great zoo!

Best zoo ever!. This was by far the best thing about my trip to Amsterdam!€20 is extremely well priced for what you get, and some of the animals are amazing!The reptile area is great! A very good selection in there and very educational. I'd highly recommend this zoo to anyone! And you'll be missing out if you don't visit!

Disgusting in this day and age!. Small dirty enclosures,kids climbing on enclosure alls throwing mess and screaming at the poor animals,dirty enclosures that looked as if they were not cleaned for weeks,rusty cage bars,sad looking creatures,pacing insane bears wtc,small stinking water area for seals ,the whole thing was totally heartbreaking! I wanted to release them all,the lions were in the most disgustingly small enclosures,giraffes pacing up and down to the point it looked like they had gone mad.this Victorian zoo needs either shutting down and becoming a superb play park for kids or demolishing and a beautiful memory lark ,green space to the memory of those poor disgustingly housed creatures! I was disgusted,told one member of staff about the gorilla being so bored she was eating her own toilet matter and he looked at me like I had grown two heads! This is not normal behaviour,I study wild animals and most there were substandardly housed and cleaned ,amazing it's not been shut by health and animal safety and health authorities!

Great zoo! (and the aquarium is a hidden gem). Artis Zoo is one of the best I've been to (and as a Biology graduate and life-long animal enthusiast - I've been to a heck of zoos).Do plan ahead for time. It's a little far out from central Amsterdam, so factor in the walk there so you can enjoy the Zoo at a leisurely pace - we only had an hour and had to sprint round the enclosures, give yourself two or three to see everything.PRO-TIP: Check out the aquarium! It's tucked away at the back, but it's one of the best bits of the entire Zoo. They've got fish from across the globe and one particularly large tank that has huge, hulking, prehistoric-looking fish in it.

Very enjoyable afternoon. Arrived at the zoo by canal boat. We purchased a ticket that included zoo entry and a one hour canal cruise. Really lovely place with a great selection of animals in a very clean environment. We popped into the large cafe and had a lovely coffee, panini and cake. This was very reasonably priced (a nice added bonus)

Good value ! Great variety !. Easy to find ! We were lucky and had a lovely sunny spring day to walk around this very lovely peaceful calm zoo . A huge variety of animals to see. Amazing to be able to get so close to them . The serene giraffes . The sad looking elephants , the hungry lions, the crazy chimpanzee's ! The beautiful butterfly house ! Well worth the money !

I LOVED THIS PLACE!. I love this place, there is so much to do, walk through and look at. there are plenty of animals you can look and get close to. its well laid and and the people on reception are lovely. One of the best Zoo's I've been to! I would recommend it to everyone! Well kept too.

One of the best I've visited. Think of Amsterdam and you think of canals, the Red Light District, windmills and tulips. Going to the zoo is the not the first thing that would pop into most people's minds but a visit to the Royal Artis Zoo is a must for anyone visiting the city. Located right in the heart of the city the zoo is huge and easily requires a whole afternoon to fit everything in. Highlights included four lazy lions, one leopard sleeping in a tree (still a thrill given the rarity of seeing one doing anything!), an excellent aviary and three very playful elephants. The aquarium is also first rate - it is stocked full of various tanks and don't miss the sections on the ground floor!And a warning for those expecting everything in English - it isn't. All of the enclosures have information about the animals but for the most part it is in Dutch and why shouldn't it be, it's their zoo…..
Great zoo!. Well laid out. Easy to cover in a day; in the city, easy tram ride. Animals are well treated. Zoo and aquarium are clean and well kept.
Amazing Place. My husband and I accidentally came upon this place. So well done with some cool animals…giant Pelicans and cute Lemurs to name a few..

One of the best zoos ever. Right in the city, it's easy to get to and affordable. We spent hours there (7!) and would have happily spent longer. Great animals and educational pieces, even if the English options were limited but hey, it's a Dutch zoo! Highly recommend - go for a whole day and make sure you catch feeding time at the wild dogs or wolf enclosures - truly eye opening! Also, a lot of enclosures are "walk through" where you can get literally gave to face with monkeys, lemurs, bats, etc. first time I've ever seen that, but don't touch - animals don't like it.

Good Day Out. As zoos go, Artis is pretty good. We got to see plenty of animals up close, although some of the older enclosures don't seem to give enough room for the animals. Your entrance fee includes an aquarium and a small natural history museum. There is also a planetarium, although for some reason this was showing a cartoon about fish speaking to each other in Dutch.

Baby boom in Zoo. Artis Zoo is located on a quite big ground, easy to approach with public transport. There are a lot of kind of animals (some didn't show up), 2 weeks ago were more babys, the giraffe baby, a chimpanzee and a gorilla. The aquarium is really beautiful. There is a restaurant and playground for kids too.

One of the Best Zoos Ever!. The zoo is a huge! You could probably spend a whole afternoon there and still miss out something!It's conveniently located on one of the tram lines, do some research on google maps before you head down so you won't waste precious time finding out which tram line to take. We went in the morning in the depths of winter so it was pretty cold but we warmed up real good in one of the restaurants there! Maybe it was winter so some of the animals were sleepy but there is a huge variety of animals. The penguin enclosure was great! As were the lions and the elephants and the giraffes! There is a very very old aquarium and an educational building that shows taxonomy and the some other cool stuff about the evolution of animals. I thought that this zoo is one of the most educational ones. You really learn something there and it's not just about seeing all the animals. It's really great for kids too as there's plenty of space to run about but it might be good to bring a pram as they might get tired walking around (not from experience because we don't have kids but we saw many parents with their kids being pushed around in prams so it seems like a pretty good idea!) Though some of the exhibits didn't have english translations, it didn't hamper our visit very much. So if you head down to Artis, say hi to the animals for me!

Fantastic Zoo. We spent 4 hours here ona Sunday afternoon. The animals are well looked after, the zoo is laid out very well and the animals are easy to find. The map was an extra €3 but it was well worth the spend.
Great. Do not say you want a map of the zoo when you purchase your tickets. It is easy to navigate the zoo and they charge you 2 euros for the map when you buy your tickets.
Fantastic day out. Clean zoo with well looked after animals we spent 6 hours here and what a fantastic day we had.Our 3 year loved it

You must visit the zoo. The zoo is very large and has a lot of different areas in it and takes a good 3-4 hours to have a look around. But there wasn't a lot of English translations in the zoo and it was hard to no what some of the thing was but other than that it is a really great zoo and I would recommend to anyone.

Large Zoo. I'm not a big fan of the Zoo, but I must admit the animals were very well cared for, Really interesting information, and plenty to see. Quick admission entrance. Plenty of room to walk, sit and for children to play.

A pleasant zoo in the centre of Amsterdam. Artis is a pleasant experience and a great way to while away a few hours. The entrance fee is on par with most city zoos. The zoo itself is surprisingly large with a trip easily swallowing several hours and the selection of animals is impressive. Some enclosures are small to the point of bordering on cruel with the lions occupying a particularly small area. A highlight of the trip was seeing the community of red pandas who were very active, especially when compared with those seen in other zoos, where they could usually be substituted for soft toys without much difference.With the zoo having such a history I was disappointed that there was little of this evident and with no information available to buy. The gift shop has the usual selection of soft toys as well as some books detailing the history of the site. Regrettably these were only available in Dutch. An opportunity missed.

A real Zoo. This is one of the best zoo I've visited in my life. So many animals and attractions make it perfect. The animals too are kept nicely and treated nicely. The auditorium is also awesome! A must visit if you're an animal lover or with kids!
if zoo's are your thing then you'll enjoy this one. Not being a lover of zoos and not having been to one in years I gave this one a try. It was a zoo - humm, what else can I say
Artis Zoo. The zoo in Amsterdam is very good, the first time i went it wasn't very nice to see the polar bear uncomfortable but it wasn't there the second time so i have nothing to complain about.

Amazing Zoo. Love this zoo, its not a huge zoo but the attractions that are here are great. the butterfly pavilion is lovely providing great photo opportunities. the lion enclosure has no fence in the way so we get a great view of them. and they were very active at the midday mark. The wolves are another impressive feature as they put on a show nearly all the time howling along with each other. The enclosures are very well maintained which is good to see and you can also go in with the marmosets again another great feature. Only down side is it is a little expensive @ 19euros to get in per person and 2euros for a map. that's the same price as London zoo and London zoo is bigger however comparing the two the animals and enclosures in Amsterdam are much better than london

A Great Day Out. This was a planned trip and was worth going to. As others have said on here, there were some empty cages and perhaps one or two animals would benefit larger enclosures but, the zoo was clean, tidy and undergoing some major renovations. There were lots of indoor exhibits which were good for dodging the showers. We spent about five hours there so good value for money. Very close to the tram stop so convenient as well.

Really nice zoo. We really had a great time at the zoo. It was a cold drizzly February morning but all the animals were out. Lots to see. The lions and bear didn't look too happy but all the other animals looked well looked after. €20 each was worth it.

Great visit. This had not been on our list of places to visit but I am so glad that we did! The afternoon was chose happened to be sunny and so walking round the zoo at our own pace in the sun was amazing. There is a large selection of animals, and the grounds the zoo are set in are gorgeous, it is very clean and very well maintained. The zoo is very large and so it doesn't feel as though it is very packed with other visitors, and you really can just stroll at your own pace. Loved the butterfly room and seeing the sea lions from beneath there pool.
zoo. We spent 5hrs at the zoo was really enjoyable,loved the lions ,penguins n elephants,something for everyone.

My first time at a zoo!. Excellent layout and so much to see. You wont be dissapointed. Great cafe to eat in. Do check out the walk through bird house.... but beware of the monkeys :) Cats were amazing to see too!

Fantastic. Wife and I visited on 19 February ,what a brilliant day.So much to see,give yourself a good 3-4Hours to really appreciate every thing.The gorillas were amazing to watch, plus check out the bird and forest house ,walking amongst the reptiles,birds and small monkeys was such an experience .Also the butterfly pavilion is a must do,what with that and the aquarium and loads of animals on display the money for entry was well worth it,(we be back) P.S the pelicans what a laugh they were!Tourists from Scotland

Great experience. I visited the zoo with my husband yesterday and had a great day. The zoo is massive. There is so much to see. The enclosures are big, great range of animals to look at. The aquarium is phenomenal! Very grand. Well worth a visit if you like animals.

Worth a visit. The zoo is only a short tram ride from the city centre and admission is free with the red I am Amsterdam card.The aquarium is fantastic, as it the butterfly house.The lion enclosure is very small, far too small for 4 grown lions.There is plenty of interaction available.

Excellent. We arrived as the zoo opened and were greeted with a smile and all of our questions answered. We set off exploring and had a wonderful day. A few of the animals were not about on our first trip round but as we went back to them they were all out on display. All though some of the animal areas seemed slightly smaller than some zoos i have visited, all animals looked in very good health and to be enjoying themselves. There were a couple of cafes around to grab a hot drink to keep you going and lots of benches and grassy area where you could take a picnic.Fabulous!!

As good as Chester Zoo! And that takes some beating!!. On a cold Saturday in February we visited the Artis Zoo. What a great place to spend a day. Highly recommended, with or without children. When in Amsterdam, visit Artis. :-)

Awesome zoo!. Loved that the ticket price included the aquarium, reptile house, bird house & planetarium too. The sea lion show is really good, the penguin feeding not so good and both are in Dutch which is expected really! Took us around about 3 hours to get round everything, definitely worth a visit!

Lovely way to spend a day!. Very well laid out zoo with so many interesting animals. I particularly like the way there is a butterfly pavillion and aquarium included. Definately worth the €20 entry fee. Being a big cat lover though, the only visible cats were the lions, although it was a cold day so perhaps the tigers etc were kept in. I loved that you could watch the sea lions underwater...

Fantastic Day out. Some of the cages are small, but they are increasing the cage sizes. The best part of this zoo is the wide range of animals they have and the close proximity. It is a really enjoyable day out also has an aquarium.

Great zoo. Visited while staying in amsterdam with my boyfriend. Approx 20 euro entrance fee. Huge range of animals and also a planetarium, zoological museum and aquarium (which the entrance fee covers). We left it a bit late in the day to go and only had 2 hours to get around everything before the zoo closed which really wasn't enough - I would recommend at least 3.5 hours to allow time to get around everything without rushing. We didn't have time for the museum or planetarium. I would go again if I was in amsterdam.
Loved it. Went to the zoo for valentines... Got in for free with our amsterdam city card :) Good day out me and my boyfriend enjoyed it! Deffinatley worth going
Valentines treat . Went to the zoo with my boyfriend on valentines and it was lovely. Big selection of animals and we spent hours wandering about.

good city zoo. very easy to find the zoo. It was 19 Euros each to get in. The zoo seems a bit on the small end of the scale when looking at the zoo map. There was some areas of the zoo where work was being done but this was minor. The walk ways through the monkey and bird enclosure was great for taking photos. Most enclosures were very good in a way that lets the public get close to the animals. The lion enclosure was very good for this. I feel the best enclosure was the wolf's. The wolfs put on a show for us. You could easily spend 3-4 hours here just watching the animals. Another small feature that worked well for DSLR users was the heaters that allowed you to demist your glasses or lenses, before taking photos inside the humid climate. Overall a great day out when in Amsterdam.

Highly recommend. Visited the zoo with my other half for valentines day, were a bit skeptical at first but once we got inside we were very surprised at the amount of large animals they had- big range of large cats although a lot were sheltering inside due to it being so cold in feb. Absolutely loved the aquarium, some of the biggest fish I've ever seen! Amazing!! Highly recommend this zoo well worth €20

So much fun. Really wonderful canteen style restaurant at the back near the giraffes- the zoo is a lovely place to spend the morning and lunchtime!
A little pricey but well worth it. Don't buy a map, good sign posts, you won't need one

A lovely day out. A great day out, we spent a full day here and had a lovely time. A great collection of animals, including an aquarium, bug house and reptile house. Had lunch in the restaurant, which was a bit pricey but that is to be expected in large attractions like this.
Amazing. Amazing zoo! :):):) must go to if visiting amsterdam! So many different animals and species and an amazing aquarium!!!

Worth a visit.. This is well maintained zoo, with a good collection. I especially enjoyed the butterfly house, and small mammal house. However, it suffers from the same problem as many city zoos, which is lack of space, and I would be happier to see some of the animals (elephants, wolves, etc) moved to an institution which can provide them with more appropriate enclosures.

Great visit. Great visit to Artis - really professional and non-commercialised. Animals look really well taken care of and staff really friendly and helpful. Must check out the Apes and chimpanzees - great visit overall. Money well spent and great value

Nice Little Zoo. I was pleasantly surprised by this zoo. A little on the smaller side than I'm use to and the price was about twice as much as ones I've been to in the US. The zoo is obviously older but because of that I think it's why it has so many trees/plants and the walkways are not as wide and open as you'd expect to see in US Zoos and it makes the zoo nicer overall. Some of the animals you can get right up next to, including an indoor exhibit with a room that the monkeys are roaming free.

Beautiful. Such a nice place to go and visit when you are in the city. The animals and the layout of the zoo make it stunning.The butterfly house is gorgeous as they are flying all around you and they have food stations around the house for the butterflies and they come and sit on the food. Great location for family, friends visiting the city or for couples

very profession zoo. It’s quite strange definition - professional zoo.However, I have not the better wording to describe very well maintained zoo situated on relatively small area in historical center of Amsterdam.I’m not a big fan of the zoos – we visited this place on request of our kind and were very positively surprised by organization of exhibition, living conditions of animals, birds, spiders, butterflies, etc.It’s easy to imagine that many generations of zoo’s personal took care for convenience of visitors and comfort and wellbeing of animals. The butterflies exhibition is more amazing then in Singapore, for example.The aquarium is situated in old building. Notwithstanding to this, the sea life exhibition is pictures and very well visible. The special pleasure – to spend few minutes in diorama of North Sea dunes ….The special thanks for education materials provided in the zoo. They are accessible and interested to the kids. I would like to recommend visit Atris zoo fort everybody with kids.

Outstanding. If you are an animal lover then you must come here!!! Best zoo I have ever been too! Such great value for money. was €20 for an adult. We spend 3hrs inside and loved every minute. There is a room which the monkeys are free to roam around with you, birds are flying over your head and lizards crawl below your feet! Was amazing and the highlight to my weekend break.

One of the best zoos I've been to!. This is a MASSIVE zoo, make sure you have plenty of time to get round it, we had to miss out the Planetarium unfortunately.There are so many different animals, mostly in good sized enclosures. I was a bit upset by the lion enclosure, really quite small for 4 lions!We had great fun watching the elephants get a pedicure and were even treated to a little trumpet by the baby!!We traveled to the zoo via Canal on a 'Lovers' canal tour. It was a beautiful trip and much cheaper to pay for the cruise and get the zoo ticket included than to travel there yourself and buy an entry ticket.

Highlight of Visit. Used our I-Card, so good value. Yes it is old, and some areas the animals have smaller than other zoo's, but they do seem to be modernising and in phases. However this is a great place so many differant animals and a great setting, well worth a visit.

One of the worst I've been to. I feel sorry for those who call it the best they have been to.While the variety of animals isn't bad, it's difficult to comprehend why some enclosures are the size that they are. The lions and other big cats have it especially bad. The aquarium was nice. Long story short, I wouldn't visit again even if it was free (20€ - no comment. For 20€ I expected a much, much nicer conditions for animals.) I do hope they start using the money wisely. Another huge issue I had - the primates and some other animals obviously need more vegetation, instead they have bamboo growing everywhere except inside their enclosures and cages. Like I said I expected a lot more from this part of Europe.

historic place but.... Because of the fact that it is one of the oldest places where animals are shown to human beings it hurts me to see under which ancient conditions the animals have to survive there...I would appreciate if the city moves it to another area out of the city so that the animals will have enough space and respective conditions to be kept out of their wildlife...

Love it. I think that Artis zoo is great. There are a ton of animals. I loved seeing the giraffes. you could get so close! They come right up to the fence next to you. It is awesome. The zoo is Easy to navigate. Worth the price. Fun for kids and adults.

A wonderful day out.. I have been visiting Artis for many years now and have fallen in love with this little zoo with a huge ambience. No matter if it's raining or in the winter Artis has plenty of indoor buildings to hide away from bad weather, in the summer months I recommend taking a picnic and just enjoy a few hours of peace in this little oasis of animal magic.

A Hidden Gem. A friend who had previously been told us about Artis Zoo. It is really easy to get to by tram & its a wonderful day out for both adults & children. I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

fab place for children on a day trip to Amsterdam. Loved the whole place, easy to get to from the centre of Amsterdam. Our family of six did it on foot but there are even quicker means. It was a little expensive for all of us but well worth it and a lovely childrens play area and great food

Historic site but not up to modern standards.. Natura Artis Magistra is the oldest Zoo in the Netherlands and it shows. There are interesting historic buildings springing up from around the park. The animal spaces for the larger animals are to cramped which is unfortunate for the animals involved. Fortunately the planned future expansion of the park should correct some of the issues. You can easily spend a few hours here and the interesting places for me are the planetarium (at the entrance) , the aquarium, the significant historic library and the feeding of the Sea-lions.

GETTING BETTER. Loved the zoo, included in Iamsterdam card almost next door to Dutch Resistance museum, in the process of expanding the Zoo good location easy to get to No 12 metro takes you right there.

excellent. Visited this zoo with my girlfriend who works at chester zoo , so throughout the visit we were comparing the zoo to Chesters. I loved this place however what I must say is the number of animals in the enclosures compared to the amount of space they have is too much for example the vulture enclosure had a fair few in such an enclosed space which I think needs to be addressed. what I did like about the zoo is how open it is , when we walked into one part there was monkeys jumping aroundfrom tree to tree above us and I think this is a great idea , I have never seen this in any zoo I have visited before. would recommend a visit to artis zoo , we even bought an toy elephant who we have called lola and brought her back with us ... who would think we were 21 years old !

Make sure it's not raining. Granted it probably wasn't the wisest decision to visit a zoo in the rain. There weren't many indoor areas and a lot of the animals had taken it upon themselves to go inside. That said, what we did see was great, I particularly enjoyed getting so close to the lions and the lemurs. I thought it was a bit of a shame that there weren't any tigers but as zoo's go it's not the biggest so you can't have it all. If it had been nicer weather we'd have probably got a lot more out of it, but even in the miserable weather we really enjoyed it. If you have kids I'd recommend it. Entry was free for us because of the Iamsterdam card and there was a lovely cafe there too which sold really cheap, tasty food.

Wonderful zoo to visit. Note, tickets are free with the iamsterdam card. Transport to the zoo is easy as there is a tram stop on the corner near the entrance. The zoo is small (in comparison to other zoos around the world), which is a good thing if you are short on time like we were. The Girraffe Cafe (not sure if that's the name, but it's next to the Girraffe enclosure) was cosy and served good food and great hot chocolate, perfect in winter. The place seemed very kid friendly (we didn't have kids with us, but it was good to see and we were impressed). A map is 2 euros, which is all donated "to the elephants", so it's good to know the money goes towards looking after the animals. If we ever return to Amsterdam, we would definitely come back.

A must see. Liked no.... Loved! everything about this zoo, this was our second trip to the zoo even my dad who isn't keen on zoos lived it.There is nothing to dislike. It's has to be to of your 'to do' list when you visit Amsterdam.

A great zoo. We had a great time at Artis, the zoo isn't very big but it is nicely arranged. There were some animals I hadn't seen before, the butterfly pavillion was quite interesting, although I am not a huge fan of butterflies. We visited the planetarium because it started raining. The film we watched was only in Dutch and we couldn't get much of it but there are films in English several times a day. On the whole, we enjoyed our visit!

Lovely zoo. Been there twice and i simply loved it...specially its mascot which u can find in every souvenir...so good cafeteria to rest and enjoy a piece of cake and hot chocolate...my favorite section is the wolves!

best zoo so far but overpriced. tickets were 40 euros for me and my boyfriend, quite over priced but perhaps worth it because although I have been to many zoos, this was probably the best one because there were so many animals that I had not seen in any other zoos. However bit concerned with the amount of space that the animals have, which are tiny and surrounded by water to prevent their escape.
Nice day out!. Being new years day all shops were closed so while out walking we came across the Zoo. We had an enjoyable afternoon.
The animals need the right surroundings. Great zoo.Not enough property to expand on.and not enough funding.The animals need sufficient environments to be comfortable and happy.Great staff.

Great day out in Amsterdam on Boxing day!. Wanted to visit the zoo as recommended by a friend of my husband. It was a cold and rainy day but we can't unfortunately choose the weather but with lots of indoor houses ie: the aquatic center we were able to keep dodging the rain and educating ourselves at the same time!At first we thought it looked a little unkempt as some areas were blocked off and we seemed to be getting nowhere fast but as we made our way around our fears were quashed and we really enjoyed ourselves. The butterfly indoor section was beautiful and the aquatic section fascinating. Many large animals like giraffes and elephants which we don't get to see in British zoos very often were here to see in full glory. We hadn't enough time so our visit was cut short and we had to rush at the end so please leave a whole day for yourselves to enjoy and get your money's worth. Reasonably priced for 3 adults ,was about 68 euros. Lots of incredible animals. Well worth the visit and will go again next time we are In lovely Amsterdam!

A great day at the zoo! . It was cold outside and raining but we still decided to go to the Artis zoo after reading so many great things about it. We thought in the beginning 20 euros are quite expensive but it was worth every cent! The zoo is well maintained and the variety or animals you can see there is just amazing! The staff at the zoo was also really friendly and it's definitely a fun activity to do with your friends and family!!!The only minus point to mention is the expensive food and beverages at the zoo. Those are really over priced- so for those who wanna save some money- bring your own sandwiches and drinks!!!
great zoo. Amazing zoo, lots of animals, reptiles, monkeys etc. We loved lemur land-tame lemurs everywhere. I would definately recommend this for kids, lovely big play area too

Great Zoo. Zoo's are hard things to review you can find them in most cities and a lot of the time the same animals. However Amsterdam Zoo is spacious and a little bit different to the average zoo. A good few hours spent here and an interesting mix of animals and great aquarium. A very well managed and clean zoo. The walk to the zoo was also nice coming from Dam square. Would recommend.

Great Zoo to visit when in Amsterdam!!. Its great to see all the animals in this Zoo. They are taken care of by such caring people. The Zoo has gone through some renovation and looks even better now. Its a Zoo over a 100 years old and still very now!!

Good memories!. Nice place to visit with kids and not only with kids. Fantastic aquarium with exotic fishes and animals. Monkeys, alligators, snakes, bulls a lot to se and a lot to remember. If you wish to visit Artis Zoo, you have to pick out one day, it's so large, you will spend there 4-6 hours.
Not to miss on a visit to Amsterdam. The zoo is well kept, very clean, animals are well look after and there are adequate signage... very well managed zoo. worth a visit a thousand times

Worth a visit. Good day out, took a long time to get round the entire zoo, fair entry price!Although there was no route to take around the zoo, still a good day!Lots of animals including elephants giraffes and alligators !

Well Worth the 20ish€. At 1st first glance, it looked expensive but once we got inside we realised it was well worth it. Don't listen to the reviews about enclosures being too small...they where really good! well set out, lots of room and the animals looked happy. The tropical houses where amazing. very impressive. Large selection of animals. many larger indoor places : butterfly house, insectarium, aquarium, reptile and tropical houses with reptiles, monkeys, birds. gorillas and chips could be viewed from indoors. and a few more. It rained on and off whilst I was there and there was plenty of indoors bits to do when it was raining. would recommend. well worth the moneyCould easily spend hours here. We did ! !
Amazing!!. It is an absolute must!! Loved every moment of it. So much too see and so close to the animals too. Worth every penny!!

Good idea for a sunny day!. This is a great zoo in the middle of the city. I could find a lot of different kinds of animals rares ones inclusive.There is a park beside the zoo, you pay a fixed tax of 9 Eur if you have a zoo pass.There you can find a aquarium and a planetarium.There are a restaurant and a cafeteria inside.Around 20 Eur for a adult pass and it worth specially if its a crowded day for the others touristic attractions.
Huge!. Combine Colchester and London zoo and you have Artis zoo. A lot of animals, lovely restaurants/cafés and very good value.

A seal of approval. I think we got lucky with the amount of people at the zoo as we went early on new years day but it was very spacious anyway so even if there was throngs of people it would be well worth a visit. Unlike other zoo's I have gone to you are very close to the animals at Artis park, I don't know whether that is safe or not as that Lion was licking his lips at me but at least you can see a lot. The only reason this review doesn't get 5/5 is that is was a little on the pricey side but then again, what isn't expensive in Amsterdam! All in all, well worth a visit :)

A hidden Gem of Amsterdam!. we loved Artis Zoo in amsterdam. Its hard to believe your in the middle of amsterdam when you are there! undergoing construction on parts of the zoo - hopefully for bigger better homes for the amazing animals!
Wonderful Experience. This is a wonderful zoo. I loved the exhibits, the animals and the atmosphere. Overall a great experience and an excellent value.

Expensive. It was quite expensive to get in, about 18 Euros, if I remember correctly, plus I bought a map for nearly 2 euros (this was apparently going towards extending the elephant enclosure) It was quite a large zoo, with a good variety of animals. Most of the enclosures were decent, but some, like the lion enclosures were too small. The weather was cold, and although there seemed to be what looked like a little door in the walls of some (perhaps to an inside enclosure for them) most were closed. This could be because they were being cleaned or whatever but I felt sorry for them out in the freezing weather. On the other hand, the animals looked well cared for.There were a few different houses to go into as a break from the weather, butterfly house, birdhouses, monkeys, aquarium. All very informative. There were two or three cafes which I didn't visit. Great for kids, you could borrow a little cart to pull smaller children along on, also wheelchairs. I would recommend a visit, although expensive for families will while away a couple of hours

Amazing place a must visit !!!. I visited with my family which included 2 children (8&9 yrs old ) and it was amazing beautiful animals, one of my favourite things a little bridge to walk through with waterfalls just magical :) you don't really expect much places in Amsterdam for kids but it was great attraction. disabled people also get in for free which we didn't realise till we looked at the receipt which was great the people were exceptionally helpful. you could see the animals were happy and healthy although I did notice a few enclosures were a bit small for the size of the animals. but much better than other zoos ive been too the staff looked to work very hard.Pros: large placelots of different animals.cafesgift shopplay parksplenty bathroomsdisabled friendly (free entry)a lot to see for the price.friendly and helpful staff.
Nice zoo that tries it best. A very cold day and yes some the animal 'house' could be bigger but a very nice visit and a nice big restaurant. I think the gift shop was a bit small.I would go again.

Small with lots of different animals in small enclosures.. Lots of enclosures within easy walking distance of each other. Many animals in small spaces. I think this would be better if there reduced the number of animals and increased the size of the exhibits to give them a better life experience.

All the animals look healthy but............... Amazing to be able to see so many animals so close up and their coats look very healthy. Staff seem to work very hard with animals and with plants. Looks clean and well organised. Wolves seem to be in a very confined space as the lions. Certainly cold day but wolves howling lions looked sad furrowed face. Sniffing the air. Maybe anticipating lunch. Baby elephant made squeal/yell (never heard that before), maybe just wanted to play the mum scurried over to it and held its trunk. The primates seemed to have a bit more freedom some scurrying about on the loose. Seemed a very well run zoo but as ever not a lot of space for lions, wolves, giraffes etc Interesting but sad.

Great Day. I visited this zoo with my husband on my birthday and was a little worried it wouldn't be that great because it was cold and raining on and off. I visited Edinburgh zoo in similar weather and none of the animals were out, but Amsterdam zoo was completely different. Most of the animals were out and you could get much closer to them. There was a wide range of animals to view, and I especially enjoyed the lions, red pandas and monkeys. I still can't understand how some of the animals don't escape as many aren't enclosed, such as the red pandas! The main downside was that it appears a couple of the animals don't have much space such as the lions, but you can't see the enclosed areas they have this night not be as bad ad it seems. Overall a really enjoyable day and I would recommend it to any family :-)
Little zoo, pricey... Its your typical zoo, not much to there. We enjoyed seeing the rhino and other few animals they got there.Nice place to go with kids though!
Really good for kids old and young. Great zoo in the middle of Amsterdam. saw everything from Crickets to Elephants, our 4 year old loved it.

Small but fun. Small zoo compared to major cities but worthwhile to spend a couple of hours. You'll have a reason to visit another neighborhood in Amsterdam. If you are travelling with kids, definately worth a visit. Nice pubs in neighborhood for lunch and/or drinks.

Awesome zoo!. We had such a great time! I must admit I was a bit hesitant at first, after reading some previous reviews about this site, but I'm so glad I didn't let that discourage me from visiting. I don't know what the other reviewer's standards are, but for us this was a perfectly beautiful and exciting zoo, with so many hidden gems and beautiful scenery. We had the privilege to be around for the feeding time of the california seals, which turned out to be the cutest thing! The zoo keeper throws fish at them and they catch it in the most cute and hilarious way! We really had a great laugh, and then later enjoyed watching a baby seal kissing kids on the cheek... So cute! Be sure to walk on the promenade, where you'll be surprised to discover a pouring waterfall... Also, don't miss out on the zoo's aquarium, where you'll find some crazy looking sea creatures.

wow!!!. We spend as couple, 4 hours at the zoo.The price seemed high at first, but after I realized this Aquarium features butterflies and insects we made an excellent choice when we got there.Highly recommended.One of the stunning zoos we visited them in Europe.

Good and bad. This zoo is good if you are not to concerned about animal welfare, it is completely different to British zoo's I.e the cages and enclosures are very small compared to the UK, the aquarium tanks are surely illegal but saying that you did get to be up close to the animals! The cafe is reasonabley priced and the entrance fee isn't as bad as I thought it would be! They seem to be doing alot of maintenance at the mo! We left feeling blessed to see the animals so up close but with a guilty conscience as it seemed cruel with the lack of space!

Nice Elephants. The highlights of our trip to the zoo were the elephants and giraffes which were being fed and cleaned during our afternoon visit.I was also impressed by the cross section of an Amsterdam canal scene in the aquarium and was not aware that the canals were home to so many different types of fish.

Great inner city zoo.. Easy to get to but try and buy your tickets beforehand as the ticket office queue can be slow. Once in there all the animals you care to see. Cafes and bars great and lots of places to sit and watch the world go by. Some of the enclosures seem little small for the size of animals in them but hey ho what do I know about running a zoo...

Must see. Great place to go and there is so much to see. From the butterfly house to aquarium to reptile house and all the animals outside. Could easily spend around 3 hours there. Was almost too much things to see!!!! Overall great activity to do and you are able to get some good photos of the animals up close. My favourite has to be the butterflies or sea lions. Would definitely recommend.

Absoulutely Fabulous. I visit this zoo every time I visit Amsterdam. It's huge and you need all day to see it all but there are plenty of eating places and lots of seating in the grounds so although there's a lot of zoo to get round it's not tiring and constant walking. It's a shame to have animals in zoos but this one really is the best I've seen, the enclosures are very roomy and the animals are sleek and well fed and seemed to be well cared for and relaxed, it's a brilliant place and I'd recommend a visit here

Perfect!. Very lovely place! Everyone will enjoy it, al the different kinds of animals can be found in Amsterdam Zoo, from ducks to very rare species, there are also different facilities at the area! You will not get bored there for sure!
A lot to see. Awesome place, a lot of things to do and a lot to see. A lot lot of animals. A wonderful location for a zoo. A must see for all the family

A bit sad and would not recommend if an animal lover... We felt sad for the animals...very small areas for them, and behaviour suggested many animals were bored. Very expensive too. The best thing is the wonderful climbing playground for our children...they could of stayed all day there.

Amazing experience. This was a amazing experience loved every minute was brilliant. So many animals and you can get so close to some as there is no cages around some and also the ones that have enclosures are just separated by water which is lovely to see them have there freedom.

Excellent zoo. Don't be put off with what looks like a small zoo on any maps, this is big for a city zoo, we found it pretty hard to locate at first, and after around an hour walking we discovered it at the bottom of a residential street. Just under €20 to get in, but it's worth it. It has some beautiful animals in, the lions, giraffes, apes, and bear we're all a treat, but the walk through enclosures were an unexpected surprise, including the butterfly house-which you might usually find boring, but was great. This is a very very old zoo, and could do with some updating, but overall enjoyable. The only bad point I guess I could mention are the toilets, which smelt really really bad. But if you get chance to spend a few hours whilst in Amsterdam, then go there and give this place a try. (Maybe take a taxi though so you can find it)!

Brilliant zoo!. Spent a cold afternoon walking round the zoo was the best zoo I have ever been to! loved the huge crocodile, giraffes, penguins and aquarium. Lovely setting beautiful gardens and cafe was nice as well had hot choc and apple pie for two which came to about 10euros so fairly reasonable as well.
perfect to all ages. The place is beautiful and very good for all ages, but for Kids its the best places in Amsterdam and close to the Central Station in Amsterdam you can go on foot

Big and Healthy Zoo. This zoo is huge. plan on spending at least 3-4 hours here. The aquarium was really big as well. All the animals seemed to be in really good care. We were here in December so it was not crowded at all..but COLD.

A wonderful way to spend 4/5 hours. This place was fantastic - it's hard to believe such a large zoo can exist in the centre of a city!My girlfriend and I spent a solid five hours and lovely every minute of it. There's a great variety of animals to go and see, though it is rather easy to walk round in circles lost!There is a Sea Lion show which isn't really a show at all, merely the Sea Lions getting fed. Still, pretty enjoyable.

Best zoo ever. This is one of the best zoo's I've been to. It was winter and cold out, so I was concerned for the animals. After walking around and getting a chance to every animal they seemed to be very content. It was one of the highlights of our trip. They have every animal you could imagine and they were out and ready fir people to see them.
One of the best attractions of Amsterdam. The second oldest zoo in Europe and it is a great way to spend a day with the kids or just discovering wildlife outside of the discovery channel...

A really nice zoo. I thought this was going to be disappointing but was surprised. Quite a high entrance cost but I suppose it goes towards keeping it all going. A bit haphazard and a little difficult to navigate around, the signs a little small offering directions. A good zoo, unfortunately some small enclosures. Good eating places. It wasn't busy on a Sat afternoon in November. Would. Recommend a visit as the gardens around the animals make it seem fairly natural.

Great day out for all of the family. We spent most of the day in the zoo and it was really good entertainment. There were lost of really interesting animals as well as a butterfly house, a planetarium, an aquarium, and lots of activities. Our favourite area was the small mammal house, where you could freely interact with some cute marmosets. The sight of the day was the 3 month old chimpanzee and mother. It cost us 19.50 euros but was well worth it.

Wonderful. Went to Amsterdam during October school holidays and decided to take our 10 year old daughter to the zoo as the weather was very good.Zoo was very reasonably priced and very easy to get to either walking from central or a 5 minute tram ride...would suggest to buy tickets before hand as there was quite a large queue,but with pre bought you got straight through.We were in the zoo which has a huge aquarium,an insect area and a beautiful butterfly house as well as all the birds and animals for round 3 and a half hours and it was excellent,we walked miles but never really noticed because there was so much to see.This zoo is a must for everyone,families with toddlers could get little carts for the little ones which they loved.Definitely would recommend.

Great family entertainment!. Except waiting for some time in a (short!) line and no free maps ofered, I have all the best words to say. Our daughter enjoyed every minute of our visit, she even forgot to go to sleep, when it was her time already far away.There are many animal species presented, on outside and inside places. Some spots are not easily accessible by baby puschair. We really enjoyed our visit there and would love to make it longer if our daughter could remain awake. Recommended to all families!

Brilliant day out!. Well.... What can I say.... This is the best zoo I have ever been to. Couldn't believe how close we were to some of the animals... Only some water between us. And walking through the enclosure with the monkeys and butterflies. We spent about 4 hours at the zoo. Could have spent more if it wasn't pouring of rain. There was still loads of things to see inside. Well worth the money. Have been recommending to friends.

Excellent Experience. Off peak visit to the Artis Zoo is a great experience since you can wonder around freely with very few people around you. The variety of animals is great but what made it really special is the butterfly house and the Aquarium with a large variety of fish and butterflies roaming freely around you. It was easy to go around and explore and price was right compared to other attractions which you pay more for less.

Wonderful day. My teenager chose the Artis as the main activity of one of our days in Amsterdam. I wouldn't have chosen it myself, but am so glad she did, and we got to experience it! Gorgeous zoo and botanical gardens in the heart of Amsterdam. Exhibits were so well done. It was so pleasant and interesting that we spent the entire day there! Wonderful.

Small zoo, lovely gardens. If you love Zoos and find yourself in Amsterdam this is a must see. I think the most unusual exhibit was the rain forest. Nothing separated us from the animals. I have seen this type of exhibit with birds, but never monkeys, bats and iguanas.

Good visit. Central to Amsterdam, 20minutes walk from Central Station or 7mins by Tram. Reasonable entry price, lots of animals, insects, reptiles and aquarium. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff, we didn't have time to see the Planetarium but heard many good things.

enjoyed. really enjoyed the zoo,good views of all animals,especially the lions. loved the wolves,bear penguins,elephants.well kept zoo,animals looked happy.did think it was expensive,as adult and children over 9 all same price.

Different place to visit in Amsterdam. Ample zoo not far from Amsterdam central station (20 mins walking). There you can find all kind of animals, from Africa, Asia and America: monkeys, lemures, penguins, lions, gyraffes, elephants, and so on.Unfortunately the ambient where they ae kept is the open air of Amsterdam, which is not quite the tropical climate (for some) or the cold climate (for some others), so I don't think the result is quite good for the poor captive animals.Anyway I guess around Amsterdam is one of the few things which are worth visiting.

Great for all ages. Very easy to navigate. A little crowded in some areas with LOTS of screaming children! Loved how they did feeding shows with the seals and thought Lemur area was great to get up close and personal with the funny little creatures.

175 year old zoo in the city centre. This zoo was founded in 1838, and a lot of the old buildings are still there. The collection of over 900 species of animals, 200 different types of trees (of wich are 74 on the monuments list) makes this zoo an unique place. Sure, some of the housings could really use an update but Artis is working really hard to give all the animals the space they need. It's a constant struggle between keeping the original buildings, and still being modern in terms of housing the animals. A very goodaxample is the new monkey house on the left front side of the zoo. The building exterior is still original, but the inside is decorated like a jungle with several species of monkeys, bat and lizzards walking around you since there are no more bars.
Nice city zoo. well equipped zoo, with a nice selection of spices. defenetly worth to visit. Expect a lots of loud kids! :)
Small with some nice old buildings. I expected more. The zoo itself is small, and not many different animals. Very good to take children, though.

day out with my child. Amsterdam`s Zoo is ideal place to go with a child during holiday,make you busy for full day,children are always exciting,location is good,you have to choose a good weather,than you will really enjoy nice threes and gardens around

Amazing animals. There are some awesome bongo type african type things! at first sight when entering the zoo. They are truly amazin to look at, the build it up so you cannot see a fence, it looks and they act as if they were out on the savanna crusing along. Superb setup and the animals looks so prime clean red and majetatic. The food inside the Zoo is just average but the animals are just amazing, i visit this place at least everytime i am in town, once a year. Recommended

A really good day out for children. We like this zoo and have been a few times.Even if it is raining it is still worth a visit. After all, it always rains in Amsterdam. lol. Just take a poncho.My children love the elephants and the butterflies are brilliant.

Disgusting!. Animals in small unsuitable enclosures,from meerkats in what can only be called a miniature sandpit with kids climbing on the walls throbbing crisps and spitting,Dutch children too,to the lioness with enough space to walk only a few steps before either paddling in the water or banging into the wall! Unbelievably small stinking enclosures for everything ,some creatures had barely enough space to take a few steps before they reached their limit....spoke to a member of staff who seemed surprised by my opinion,they have the legal limit of space,yes legal but not humane or correct for any of the animals to actually function as they should! This was no pleasant visit to an animal conservation zoo,this was a visit to a Victorian style and age zoo which has outlived its use.....the seals were swimming back and forth the bears rocking insanely in stinking concrete bunkers,the look in the eyes of most creatures was heartbreaking to the extreme! I am extremely surprised and shocked this has been allowed to continue to function,I can only assume money has passed hands or wildlife protection organisations have not actually observed without giving the zoo warning,if indeed they have ever crossed its threshold! Sad day wasted but report put in with relevant authorities,I am praying this establishment will,not be there for another hundred years,as humans we have a duty to give creatures surroundings similar to their natural habitat if we dare to claim we are caring for them or in a preservation breeding programme,some bird caged she birds had no space to fly,some animal enclosures allowed only for a few steps and certainly no running and bounding leaping as they were intended to do in the wild! Disgraceful in this modern day and age! It would be better used as a water park or children's fun park!
Lots of Animals. Loved it here. Enclosures where a bit small for some of them which wasn't great but there was lots to do and lots going on here!

Not the best of zoos. This is a small city-centre zoo
We liked the reptile house and the birds
Many enclosures for larger animals e.g. Lions, seemed quite small;
Some animals e.g. Wolves looked very bedraggled
One elephant was rocking back-and-forth in a manner which seemed completely unnatural and disturbing
I have been to far better zoos and we left after 45 minutes
A Great Day Out. This is a very good zoo. Loads to see. Well worth the time. I was very surprised at the scale. Obviously not a huge place but clearly very popular with local young famalies

Great Fun. Was visiting Amsterdam for a few days and decided to pay the zoo a visit. It did not dissapoint, was beautiful walking around and was not overly priced. The plentarium was a great experience too!
Very nice. Very nice Place. Comfortable for animals, Close to the city center. Children have had a lot of fun. Adults too. Nice butterfly`s exibition. Planetarium.

Loads to see. Artis Zoo is great - you can easily spend the whole day there. We enjoyed all of it - the lions were brilliant (and very close!), meerkats are always marvellous, I loved the butterfly house, and there's a good aquarium too. The catering wasn't the best but it wasn't awful - and I think you can take your own food in anyway. Lovely surroundings and of course quite busy. Best if you turn up first thing as it gets really crowded late on in the day.

Zoo designed for people. Great to visit this little touch of green paradise in the city. Unfortunately designed more for people than the animals but given the age and size of the zoo this was to be expected. Lemur colony was excellent for an interactive experience.

Best zoo I have visited. While it is an expensive family day out (~80 euro for 4) this is beyond doubt the best zoo I have ever been to. A great collection of healthy content(as far as I could tell) animals excellently displayed. Well worth a visit and wish I had spent longer.
LOVELY ZOO. Been many times before, but never fails to be an enjoyable 4 hours, lots to see, with Lemur Island, lemurs running around you.Monkey House again with smaller monkeys around you.

Lovely way to spend a morning. The zoo is improving, it still has some hangover problems from when a zoo was about entertaining the public - the lions did not have much space and some of the other big cats appeared agitated by the confined space. But other parts of the zoo were very well done - the butterfly house was stunning and walking amidst the birds and monkeys in the tropical house a lovely experience

Artis. A small Zoo, around 20-30 mins from centraal station, deff a family orientated attraction. As all zoos, caging is animals im small enclosures is never a good thing, some Animals look distressed, but this is true of all zoos not just Artis. Feeding time of the Sealions is a must for children of all ages.Only 3 star rating because the zoo is only small, but easy to spend several hours there.

Much better. On visiting this zoo in the past I was a bit concerned with the animals habitats etc. hadn't been for years so this year we decided to visit again. We were over the moon with the changes and upgrades that have been made. Everything is so much better. What's more is the price, very reasonable for the amount of time it takes to walk round everything. Was really impressed with the new wolf enclosure and also the walk through with the monkey's etc. A great 5 hours spent here. Highly recommend.
Worth a visit. Well worth a visit if you have children or as a couple.lots of things to see and do.food prices reasonable but if I had children with me I would make a picnic if the weather permits.

beautiful neighbourhood, harsh zoo.. This zoo is very small. the cages are very small and a lot of the animals seem to be respond badly to captivity, the bear looks like he's about to lose his mind going in circles. I know its a part of any zoo, but I usually love zoos (Berlin zoo, Prague zoo, Jerusalem biblical zoo are great). on the plus side: this is one of the oldest zoos in Europe and it's located in a lovely neighbourhood which you might not get to see if it wasn't for the zoo. the butterfly section is really nice as well.I'm also sure it will be fun for the kids so it might be worth the visit if you are travelling as a family. You should consider the botanical gardens which are nearby as an alternative.

Unexpected highlight in Amsterdam!. We were visiting the Resistance Museum, and stopped by here afterwards since it's open a bit later. It was a very pleasant surprise. Late spring afternoon- lovely green spaces, no crowds, no noise. A welcome respite from the chaos of central Amsterdam. One of our favorite places in the whole city!If we're back in Amsterdam, we'll make it a point to come here. It's part of one of the tourist passes, so why not?

Excellent. The zoo was one of the highlights of our trips out of everything set up for tourists this is the most value for money. 14.50 gets you in to the zoo, the planetarium, a butterfly garden, insect house and theres a walk through part with little monkeys, bats, lizards and an iguana. The food places weren't bad the prices were really cheap. Overall we had a great time and it took the whole day to see everything. Its also easily accessible from central.

Great zoo in Amsterdam. Our kids grew up in Amsterdam, so we had the chance to visit Artis often. It's an excellent zoo! Whenever we have time during visits to Amsterdam, we visit this zoo.We also love the part of town where it is located, a nice area to visit if you have time.

This zoo blew us away. What a surprise! In the heart of the city is this bustling zoo! They have everything! Mamosets, to seals, to butterflies, to gorillas to elephants. They even have wolves which I haven't seen before. They have howling sessions where everyone congregates to see what all the fuss is about, the wolves seemed quite satisfied once everyone was there; lovely animals to observe.The monkey "house" and the other styled "houses" such as the buttefly and lizards were a brilliant concept. You get to walk through all these animals and be part of the enclosure it feels. In the monkey house they even had a squirrel creature which is apparently the same one from the film "Ice Age". Very cute as he scuttled around near your feet. There is so much to do here it is unbelievable, the zoo itself has alot of history and serves as a museum too. There's even a planetarium! This is certainly a place you come for a day trip but we only had 3 hours scheduled for the visit so had to jam pack everything in. We got in for 31 euros for the 2 of us, it's a fair price for the amount of things there! Some of the animals seemed to be in peculiar pens, i.e. the camels with reindeer and other horned animals, it seemed a peculiar collaboration but there must have been a reason. Likewise we did feel the lions were a little overcrowded but could only hope they had a wider enclosure round the back, they had nowhere to hide as around 30 people stared at them in one go.
Over-Priced. The zoo, like any other zoo, is lovely. It's a bit hard to find yourself in there because there is no logical order inside. For me it was over-priced, but it was nice in general.
disappointing. Big animals like Lions, Panthers and Leopards have very tiny cages - a pity to see that. Probably the outcome of an outdated structure in the center of the city.

Loved the turtles!. We visited in december and where surprised the zoo fully open to the public! Spent a great day here with ao many amazing animals to see, my sister loves turtles and was in her element with being so close to the enclosure they where in! Lovely day trip!

BEST ZOO IN THE WORLD!!!!. Seriously though, this is the best zoo I've been to and is like to think I'm quite the connoisseur..I've been a couple of times and they actually have all the animals advertised. You don't just wander around reading signs about animals that aren't there - always a plus :)You could easily spend a day there with the planetarium, aquarium and various talks.. Or just spend it all at lemur land where the lemurs lounge around within your graspWe went on a sunny Saturday afternoon and it's such a big place it didn't feel busy at all :)

The good, the bad and the ugly. Artis is the oldest zoo in The Netherlands, located right in the heart of Amsterdam. Just these two ingredients create a very special atmosphere. The zoo is cramped for space and the city buzz can always be heard (if you're lucky you can hear the wolves cry when an ambulance passes to mark their territory). Many animals (and the aquarium) are housed in classical Amsterdam-style buildings.The focus is on preserving species, meaning that this zoo doesn't try to have as many animals as possible but rather the most special animals. While space is limited by the city around it, Artis still offers a wealth of different animals. Everything from insects to elephants can be seen. Some building have seen better times, yet the animals are seem healthy and well taken care off. Sometimes cages are stuffed underneath bigger buildings are around shady corners, but discovering these special places makes Artis all the more fun.A final note: most signs and presentations are available in both English and Dutch. Like most Dutch, the staff speaks excellent English.
Nice and interesting Zoo. I know that people donot go to Amsterdam to visit a zoo, but truly if you have time go to this zoo; it is so nicely done.
Most pleasing. Is a great zoo to visit, make sure to visit the butterflies' place, is amazing.Makes for a great way to spend an afternoon.
So much to see. What an an awesome day we had at the Royal Artis Zoo. We arrived late and never managed to see everything but its a place you would want to visit again anyway. We loved it

Strange little zoo. Artis is the city zoo of Amsterdam, in the south east of the city. You can easily walk there from "town" but you do walk through some fairly boring office building areas to get there. The first exhibit is an odd mix of reindeers, African oxen and geese. Pretty quickly you become aware that the zoo was once a private mad man's collection of exotic beasts, kept in his garden in Amsterdam. There's certainly a wide and varied collection of creatures, but I did feel vaguely uncomfortable about the size of their "pens". Despite this, none of the animals looked unhappy, except the brown bear, and the zoo is very clean, and you do get to see the animals quite cleArly. Nice clean spacious restaurant at the east end of the zoo has great views.

Great zoo!. Really enjoyed this zoo, and this is from a couple that doesn't have kids. Many exhibits give you the feeling of being quite close to the animals (often separated by water), and in some areas, the animals walk around amongst people (lemur exhibit), though you are not to touch them.Quite a big penguin rookery, which was very impressive. We went right before closing, and wished we'd had more time, but at the same time, we still managed to see a lot, and the zoo was really quiet towards the end of the day (visited on a beautiful sunny Sunday).
Great zoo in heart of amsterdam. Marvellous zoo. Great animals beautifully laid out. Highly recommended. Great day out. Great fun for all the family.

If you have kids.. If you have kids,this is a very pleasant afternoon worth. The Zoo is small, but there are a lot of animals.Some people think the in closures are small, but the animals are very well cared for. The Dutch are famous for their kindness and fairness. By buying a ticket, you help towards conservation too!

I was counting for more. It is a good, nice zoo, really clean and well maintained, but I expected more. The aquarium was a huge disappointment, but I was there in 2012, maybe they did something. The attitude of workers towards the animals was a big plus, you could see they care about the animals, but the place is small, some cages are really tiny.

Amazooing. We went there on a little cloudy day, and didnt feel overcrowded.They have really nice animals, and more or less everything I expect from a visit to city wildlifereservate. The park was very clean, and well structured, beautiful decorated.It seemed like the animals was well cared, and looked like great conditions for them all over. The pets behaved very natural and some didnt mind the attention too much.Their seals, lions and monkeys really made me smile out there.Couldnt find their bears ;)We went to their restaurant, it was hard to get a seat, and will call their selection, okay. Atleast it was possible to pay with Mastercard in there.

amazing. cheap entrance, large variety of animals, great atmosphere... just wow. when i was visiting the park it started raining but i was so in love with the place that i continued the visit despite getting soaked!

A VERY MEDIOCRE ZOO, POOR MAITENANCE.. The Artis Zoo has some good animals. Unfortunately, the zoo is so dirty, antiquated, and poorly laid out it is hard to enjoy. It is a fairly small zoo with almost no staff around to help you. The few bright spots include the lions (5 of them), buffalos, and a modest bird collection. Save your time in Amsterdam for other sights.

Not bad at all for a Zoo. My daughters and I liked the zoo to a point. Some of the exhibits were great, but some were very small for the animals like the big cats. The aquarium was very good. you get to walk through a room with monkeys, birds , bats and other animals all around you. With young kids you probably could spend the whole day here, they also have a planetarium with visual shows on. The overall experience was very good considering that its one of the oldest zoos.
Lovely butterfly house. Sad to see lions and elephants in such small enclosures. The butterfly house was enchanting and the aquarium was also very good. Lovely gardens and restaurant.
very nice. Very nice place.Good to come alone or with children. Lots of animals, birds and others. Aquarium has many fishes both from tropicals and local.

A nice zoo in centre of city. Though a visit to zoo, was not our part of planned agenda, but on the last day of our week long visit to Amsterdam, our initially planned visit to Bruges failed, so we decided to pass time in zoo.It is situated in east side of city. Initially it looked small from outside, but once you walk inside, it has lots of things to offer. Though I found a lot of enclosures vacant. We could not find Giraffe. The best part was the Lion enclosure, where we noticed five of them basking in sun. Aquarium was not big, unlike other cities.I would not recommend Amsterdam zoo too much.

A child once again. A wet morning but I was not deterred. I couldn't believe I spent over 3 hours. The seals were my favourite! The animals looked well cared for and adequate information was provided for each enclosure.

Wonderful way to spend the day. As long as the weather is kind! A lot of it is outdoors. On a warm day it is a real pleasure to walk along the many shaded paths. Even though it was busy it never felt overcrowded.

Zoo is small but fun. The zoo is a nice change from the museums and canals. Don't expect a huge zoo as this one is fairly small. That being said - you should plan at least 3 hours. The butterfly house is a must and I did like the outside lemur exhibit too. I felt the zoo was a bit pricey ~$26 US. If you have run out of museums to see this is a fun alternative. The kids seem to really like the interactive exhibits.

Best zoo ever!. We went here very last minute as our set plans did not happen, and we're so glad we did! The zoo is HUGE - need about 3 hours to get round it all properly - and just has everything. Planetarium, Aquarium, Reptile House, Insect House, then every animal you could wish to see! The pens are clean and none of them are in really small cages. It's a nice atmosphere - there was a childrens' birthday party happening in one corner. Dead easy to get to on the tram, and there's a nice ice cream shop round the corner! Entry was about €15/adult, which is definitely a fair price for a fantastic day out!

Amazing large Zoo in heart of City. Walkable distance from centre of city, spacious for animals, clean and animals well cared for. Walk in Bird houses well worth a couple of walks through and the butterfly house.

Deceptively big!. We visited the Zoo and Botanical gardens with our i-amsterdam cards (cannot recommend these enough!!!) and had a fantastic day! On entering the zoo I thought 'this doesn't look much' and felt a little disappointed, but after you start exploring, you find that there is so much more there that you though possible - it's kind of labyrinth like! Lots of very different sections and some unusual creatures and animals and there are interactive play sections if you have children. Helpful and knowledgeable staff who also give talks and displays.We were also quite impressed by the cafe - still 'zoo prices' but very nice food and fact service - there seemed to be one guy cooking but he was doing an impressive job! I got drawn in by the little monkey character in the gift shop, who is the zoo's mascot and ended buying a calender and a mug - watch out for that!
Great day out. beautiful surroundings and 175 years of natural history.many animals seen for the first timeWould recommend this trip to anyone
Small but good. A small and somewhat old zoo, but it was very informative, and Komodo dragons are not often seen in Europe

Really enjoyable. This is a fun place. I got more than I expected coming here. Beautiful healthy clean animals, big spaces for them to play, caught the time when they were fed (that was fun to see). Also, monkeys run free and they are really cute, it's a lot of fun to see. An aquarium included and tanks for the seals to play. Something special - the butterfly house, a big glass house where butterflies fly free and play with you :). Green place, really pleasant for some afternoon relaxation. A small waterfall, a park, an insect exhibition, a surprise-crocodile at the beginning any many more.
Really enjoyable day. Our family really enjoyed our visit and thought that the animals appeared healthy and well cared for... We especially enjoyed the butterfly house!

Great zoo. Really good zoo, entry price was ok (a little pricey), but took a long time to walk around so worth the price. We went on a glorious day but there were a lot of indoor exhibits too for slightly rainier days. Bit of a confusing layout a map is probably recommended.

Very big!. We had almost a full day there! You may see all kinds of animals from weird insects to a puma! The most amazing part is they feed the animals the way they should have been fed in the nature so you see hunted animals in pradetor cages! Has a great restaurant too.

Enjoy a lovely day at the Amsterdam Zoo. In July and August, the Zoo is open on Saturdays till sunset. There are live-performances and theatre for kids to enjoy. The planetarium is also worth a visit.

Good, with a few bad points.. it was a good zoo, I wouldnt say it was worth the 30-40 Euro to get in though. Had a very cute and good selection of animals, but I wouldnt go again, considering the price of the food/drink once you got in, after already paying so much, and I know most museums/zoos and whatnot charge what they like, but asking for 30-40 euro entrance fee, then having to pay up to 15 euro for snacky food and not a proper lunch/meal for two? Silly! Good for the cute animals though. I liked the cute animals.

Really enjoyable, great spot for photographers!. We went in as it was free with the IAMsterdam card (which we highly recommend!). The zoo was very big and there was plenty to see. The fences, where possible, are lower than a British zoo so you can take really good photos and see the animals properly. We loved it, can't say enough good things about it! It would be great for kids and plenty of picnic space as well as 2 restaurants so that's an option as well!
Excellent value. Lots to see, animals well looked after.We were here at least four hours,not too crowded. Easy to find,tram from central station number 9.
Nice trip. Lovely zoo with all the animals you'd expect! Queues weren't very big and easily accessible via the tram line! Nice restaurants and a petting zoo for children, great for families!

Had no idea a zoo could be this FUN!. On our last full day in Amsterdam we debated cycling or seeing the zoo, before our Anne Frank House visit. We originally decided on cycling, but kind of last minute chose the zoo. SO happy we did, this is a fantastic zoo and we've been to the San Diego, National and other zoos. By far you will get closer to animals here than anywhere else you have been. We were there over three hours and had to leave due to timed tickets to the Anne Frank House, but easily could have spent another two hours. EASILY.Get there around noon and you will catch a number of the feedings going on over the next two hours (12:40 the lizards were fed ;-) .The primate house was our first stop and really set the tone, we walked in and right above our heads were small and medium-sized animals running around - literally a couple of feet over ourheads! Very cool, and beautiful animals. The animals were very active - something we experienced all through the zoo. Little kids may be a bit scared as many of the animals really are roaming free - the peacock is not threatening, but the lemurs running around may scare youngsters (even though I saw no attempt of the animals to touch people).We happened to catch the lizards being fed which was amazing. Lizards don't usually move around a lot, but when you throw in a half dozen or so grasshoppers you will be amazed at how fast the can move. SO COOL! Ditto on the primate feeding. Lovely to see the animals really moving around, not just laying around.Rather than go through all the exhibits, let me just say that if you have kids or like zoo's, this is a great way to spend half a day or more. LOTS of benches so you can sit and watch the animals at your own pace - two huge dinosaurs the kids can actually climb on, next to a large grassy area great for a rest or a picnic.
