There are lots of food options all through the zoo so you can munch as you go (and lots of restrooms as well).Overall this is one of the best thought-out and arranged museums I've ever seen. Great photography options, too.

Brilliant zoo. This zoo was fantastic. One of my favourite zoo's that Ive been to in Europe but slightly bested by Malaga Zoo in southern Spain. Huge with a wide range of animals that you get very, very close to. So close you could probably lose a finger fairly easily (the wolf enclosure). But as a group of adults we thought it was amazing to be so close to the animals.
get up close to some animals. Small, urban zoo that feels bigger. My children loved the exhibits that allowed them to get very close to the animals - especially the lemurs!

175 years old and still lots of fun. This year the zoo celebrates its 175th aniversary and made the gardens extra beautiful with the flowers. I loved the variety of animals and how nice everything looked. My favorite was the little monkeyhouse, the lemurisland and the area with the tapirs and capybara's. It was wonderfull to stand in the middle of all the jumping monkeys and other creatures and have the lemurs come to you. Nice for families and for a romantic couple outing.
Nice trip for the whole family. it was a nice and short trip for my little girl to see all the animals and the gift shop was great for cool souvenirs

Very good organised zoo. Usually I visit every year and another zoo with my family. The Artis zoo is a well organised place with many animals to see. The animals are well treated. The Butterfly Pavilion is the largest of its kind in the Netherlands, It really hot inside there but they have some special hot air machines that you can use for your glasses and also for the cameras and lenses.We visit it with 6 adults and 6 children, nice place also to have a snack and a coffee.

Good zoo. Worth a visit for animal lovers.. I've been to the Singapore zoo and various zoos in the UK. I didn't expect to be wowed by this zoo but I was. And this is why. The exhibits are all beautifully planned and designed, and it truly is a beautiful and scenic zoo. I was surprised at seeing that the macaque and the huge animals (buffaloes?) were in enclosures that were not fenced at all. Just surrounded by a moat. Well it worked somehow. The animals never attempted to cross the moat and approach the human sightseers. The moats made the exhibits look very natural. Almost like we were standing right next to the animals in their habitats. And the moats also did well to stop people from disturbing the animals (like tapping or shaking the fencing - which happens in fenced animal enclosures in other zoos). There is a beautiful and quite extensive collection of aquatic animals in the zoo's Aquarium. It's very very nicely done. I really never expected to be wowed by it, having been to many Sealife centres in UK and the like... but I was. I truly recommend visiting the Aquarium.Other highlights include the wonderful Butterfly house. Truly one of the biggest I've seen so far and the ceiling is very very high (as it is an attempt to emulate a rainforest in the Amazon with the tall tall trees) so the butterflies have loads of room to fly about and hide. I was actually happy for them. Yes, we did not get swarms of exotic butterflies flying about and landing on our shoulders and heads like it normally happens in smaller butterfly enclosures with much lower roofs - so in a way, we saw fewer butterflies and those we saw often did fly at a distance from us. But at least they were not getting their wings torn or injured by visitors because there is lots of space for them to fly and escape and take a breather. And yes the high ceiling also means this butterfly enclosure isn't overly warm and stuffy and humid like many other butterfly houses we've been to. The climate inside this butterfly enclosure is just pleasant.There is a nice Insectarium building on site too. Not as many insects as some other places we've seen elsewhere. But the kids room is quite interesting for the kids - lots of nice interactive experimental fun which touch on insects.There are several cafes dotted around the zoo so you're never far from somewhere you can eat or drink at, though food is a bit pricey for what they are, as is typical of zoos.There is a beautiful scenic garden at the edge of the zoo too. With a pedestrian walkway/bridge over a large canal/waterway with boats on it, and lots of flowers in bloom. This being Amsterdam, it is truly a peaceful and tranquil haven away from the rush and bustle of the city centre. I sat on one of the benches along the water for a rest and I felt I could take a nap there. In the near distance, cars and pedestrians can be seen driving on city roads. So near yet so far. The other animal exhibits are also really nice and worth visiting. There are the requisite gorilla, lion, tiger and giraffe exhibits which every zoo worth it's salt will have.The Aviary section is also lovely. Lots of exotic birds to see - quite a good collection of them too.There are cute little wooden pushchairs for hire too, if you have toddlers who aren't good with walking. It does entail a lot of walking if you wish to see most of the exhibits in this zoo. My feet were really aching at the end of my visit. Entrance ticket prices are reasonable for zoos of this standard. For me and my 2 young daughters, it cost me about €50. Which is similar to what it costs to get in the London Zoo.All in all, a really nice zoo. There's something for everyone here. Whether for a child or an adult. It was truly a surprisingly charming zoo. As I've said, I've visited many zoos before and they are considered very nice zoos... but this one wowed me too. It is unique in it's own way and very well-designed. If you're in Amsterdam and you or a loved one is an animal lover, definitely worth visiting this place.

Small but beautiful. At first I was a amazed at how small the animals areas are but they look so healthy and well looked after. The best part of this experience had to be walking through the lizard house, it was fantastic! The staff are really helpful. Everywhere was clean and well maintained! Had a great trip here with my husband, we even went into the planetarium although all in Dutch you got the idea of what was going on. I would recommend this to anyone who wants a day away from the centre of Amsterdam!
Zoo :). Nice big Zoo, whan I was there it was a rainy day but it was very nice. Lots of diferent animals, cool monkey house and nice aquarium. All in all super 2 hours walk.

Overpriced zoo. The zoo itself was quite good which is built inside the city itself which I really liked. The thing that shocked me was the entrance fees of 20+euros for a zoo. Felt it was a bit too much nomatter how many animals we get to see. Also we could not see some animals as the cages were empty. I would say you can visit it of you have kids, else skip it

We love it here. We have been to quite a number of zoos throughout the world, and I must say that Amsterdam Artis Zoo is the best that we have been so far. Truly value for money. Our kids really enjoyed their trip here.It is best to get a Holland Pass. You will avoid having to queue up at the ticket counter. Just go to the entrance, and the gatekeeper will ask you to tear off your Tulip coupons.

Really nice Zoo. The zoo is a little expensive at 19.50Euros each but it's a lovely zoo. Plenty of various animals to see. Lemur island was great fun with the lemurs walking alongside you. The enclosures are actually quite open so you can see the animals really well without the hindrance of railings. If you have nothing else planned head here for a few hours. There are plenty of places to enjoy a picnic so make sure you stop by a supermarket or deli and stock up.

Amsterdam Zoo. A great zoo, enjoyable for all ages. A lot of animals, both local and exotic. It will suit anyones taste. Kids will love the big playarea. Maybe the adults will too. Be there when the zoo opens or the que will be massive.

Lovely day out. I went here with family including 2 children (both under the age of 10). It was a lovely day out. Lots of different animals to look at. Some enclosures were a little small which was a bit sad at times, but on the whole a very good day out! Reasonably priced!

Expected it to be average but was very memorable!. Coming to the Zoo was a last minute thing we decided when we were wondering around Amsterdam. We had taken the canal cruise all morning and thought WHY NOT?! because one of the stops was walking distance to the Zoo!We only had 2 1/2 hours to go through the whole thing before it closed so we walked around really quickly. I read the reviews before deciding to go and read that it wasn't very good but WE LOVED IT! The zebra's, the lions, the snakes, crocodiles!It was a lovely sunny day as well so it was heaven!Since we were so late we didn't get to see any feedings except for the new elephants! They are such amazing creatures, we were in awe. The best thing about the zoo -- the animals are sooooooo close to you. I swear, the lions could probably jump out and touch you if they actually wanted to come closer.. all the enclosures are surrounded by moats.. must be very deep because none of the animals tried to get close to people.I've attached a few pictures of some of the animals.THIS ZOO IS A MUST SEE. If we do come back to Amsterdam, I will definitely want to spend the whole day here!!!!!!!!!!!! Best animals to see: Lions/Wolves/Elephants/Bear. Also go see the aquarium! Frickin' awesome!Negative aspect - I felt sorry for the Bear... It was lonely and kept pacing. I really don't think it's happy there.... There must be some way to make the enclosure bigger or maybe let him/her have a mate.

Innercity zoo. We stayed opposite the Zoo and had free entrance with our Iamsterdam card so had a quick visit. Good aquarium however I did feel that many of the spaces for the animals were too small, lions, monkeys and owls particularly.

Fantastic day out!. Spent an afternoon here as it was brilliant. Didn't prebook tickets but maybe should have, spent about 20 minutes queing instead of walking straight in.Lots and lots to see- personal favourites were the butterfly encounter, seals and the aquarium. The tropical fish are just manginifcent!Tip- eat outside the very reasonably priced lunch restaurant and watch the zebras and giraffes roam in front of you.Great day out and no complaints! Ten out of ten :)
Beautiful. This is a must see! Most beautiful zoo i have ever been to! Take sandwiches if your on a budget and enjoy them in the gardens as the restaurants are a bit expensive

cozy place although not very big. make sure you buy the map of the place when you get the tickets, it is much easier to plan the route and ensure you see all the animals, for smaller kids there are several playgrounds once they get tired of looking at animals. some cages looked very small, and as it was quite warm several animals were sleeping. the aquarium is very nice, they also keep a "statue" of the hypo that used to live in their zoo for many years. the tropical park was amazing, with all the butterflies flying around and feeding off fruits:) the white wolves put on a great show with their howling:) watching the monkeys at feeding time was fun, as they washed every piece of fruit they got:) do check the timetable on the Planetarium screen as there are several shows and movies during the day. at the gift shop we exchanged the minicards from the hotel for free postcards of the Artis zoo. a big parking is next to the zoo.

Great fun and not only for families :). Artis Zoo offers a great day out from the busy city - not only is it huge and you can definitely spend all day here but it also offers many little "performances/tours" during the day, e.g. feeding the seals. Also, I would always pay the 2€ extra for the map of the Zoo as otherwise, you may feel a bit lost and forget to see many parts of the Zoo.I would further recommend to get to the Zoo as early as possible as this way, you will save a lot of time on queuing and are able to enjoy a lot of the animals without big crowds of people.

Could spend a full day here.. I really enjoyed the zoo although I did feel that some of the enclosers were a little bit small. There are plenty of animals to see and lots of cafes. It was busy but it never felt over crowded. I would suggest getting a map for 2 euros as it helped to make sure we saw everything. Work is currently being carried out but that didn't affect our visit.

nature's right & kids delight. If this is your first time to Amsterdam and you have no kids then probably better to go to another attraction like a canal tour or the Amsterdam library. There are plenty of happy kids delighting in all the animals and exhibits. It's quite a large zoo and the flamingos really look out of place in the middle of winter here - but cool nonetheless.
A nice park. The animals here are very uncommon in the most parks. Flamingos, Leopards, uncommon birds and lots of fishes. Dont miss out the different tours they got here. Different ones everyday!

Pleasant for adults as well. Great job with the entire place and well maintained. Get a stamp on your hand and leave and come back same day as you wish. Avoid going there on Saturday and Sundays since is packed.

Time travelling to the animal kingdom. Amsterdam's Artis Zoo might not be on the top 10 of Animals Rights Activists in these days, where large natural scaped openair 'cages' sweep across the Zoos of Europe (and the world one imagine) - don't get me wrong, the animals seemed to do week, but the architecture does date back to the time, when the primary purpose of teh zoo was to display the animals in cages where they were easily spotted as they didn't have anywhere to run. But the zoo is extremely cozy with its very lush garden corridors and every building (also the new ones) have a beautiful design. The Aquarium is like stepping back in time with its greek goddess statue in the hallway and its classical architecture.When the rain broke out for an hour we went to the Planetarium, where they showed a IMAX movie about the universe which really fascinated the young ones (and the parents:-) - entrance was by the way included in the entrance fee to the Zoo.All in all a beautiful place to take a time out in the midst of the city.

Wonderful!. As a girl of 20 years in Amsterdam for the first time,one should not think that this is the place to visit first, but this place is wonderful! I walked around in the dull rain for hours. It has a wonderful butterfly garden, and you can see the zebras playing and running around. The seals are enjoying themselves as well. The zoo is filled with big threes and and everything is so pretty. A little bit expencive for a Budget travelling student, but it's woth it! Wonderful!
Amazing zoo!. Very interesting and vast variety of animals! You will enjoy it, even though it is not city centre, but still very easy to reach if you will take a tram, around 15 min to reach.
The old zoo :-). This zoo is very old. With a lot of big old trees. The animals does not have so much Space as ex. Odense Denmark. But still... Very good to spent a day.

Kids loved it! . Kids really loved to spend the whole day in the zoo. We adults liked as well, it was easy to go around and no too much waiting time..but it also made us (adults) a bit sad.. Animals don't have much soace...

Great for the family- all year round. Many years a family subscription here, Artis throughout the seasons has a cosy homely feel whereby you can bring your kids and there is always something they want to see. One time the butterflies, another time the aquarium, and there's always the majestic giraffes and elephants. It is a beautiful serene location, where in the summer there are many places to have a picnic or eat in one of reasonable restaurants. During your visit here you feel out of Amsterdam and with the animals that you feel are in general OK in their own respective environments. For tourists the usual translators and guides etc, there is also a Planetarium. With a subscription definitely good value for money.

Well presented and well run. This was our second visit and it didn't disappoint. The zoo is well laid out and labelled and there is plenty to see. The animals look happy and their environments are large and maintained to a high standard. It is one of the better zoos in Europe and is easily reached by tram..or on foot...from the city centre.

great little zoo. This is a very cosy compact zoo that you can stroll around at leisure. Some of the houses have animals at hand running around your feet or up the trees , which brings nature to you. There are plenty of eating places for picnics or to buy .

Zoo/Planeterium/Aquarium. This place has it all! The zoo has a wide variety of animals, I especially like the different wild cats they had. They also have an amazing Butterfly house, which is absolutely beautiful, just try not to go on a hot day as it's even hotter in there. There are also guided tours you can take, and you can be given a map in English.The aquarium has a large range of fish too, I especially took interest in life in the Canals, you can see all the species of fish that actually live there... including eels!The planetarium is also fascinating, but all in Dutch. I went to go watch a show and only understood half of what is was about.Other then that I enjoyed the food and the beautiful gardens.

Surprised. We were most surprised to find this wonderful zoo with beautiful gardens most interesting with some very unusual animals and birds. The highlights for us were the aquarium and the butterfly house. Highly recommend this.
A zoo in a garden. This was a surprise with the enclosures with the animals and birds set in a lovely garden setting. Don't miss the butterflies.

There's a zoo!?. The title is how my friend reacted when I mentioned going. He's been working in Amsterdam for years, but simply never associated the place with a zoo. But sure enough, right there in the city centre (in Plantaage neighbourhood) there is a compact but not too small zoo. It's similar to London zoo in that sense - it's amazing what they've packed in (without it feeling unfair on the animals), and they're constantly renovating and improving it.
Lovely Zoo!. It was a fantastic experience. Quite a variation of animals and very enjoyable. An awesome and relaxing place to go at after a late night out.

Good day out. Went to the zoo on our first day in Amsterdam. Que at the main entrance was busy when we arrived but we only waited 15 minutes which isn't too bad. We bought a map then lost it about half an hour into walking about and it was tricky to navigate about without one because its really big. We loved the monkeys and the aquarium the over all experience was great. We took loads of pictures and had something to eat at the cafe near the main entrance. Would recommend this to couples, family's with young children.
Lovely place. Its a fantastic experience for kids and adults too. Must visit if you are in Amsterdam . Well connected and easy to reach with kids .
Zoo!. Good transport links, family friendly, amazing butterfly house with dart frogs in the undergrowth. Some of the mammal enclosures seemed a little small though (I'm sure they were fine).

Great. Although not a lover of Zoo's was with a 7 year old so decided to give it a try, the Trolley no10 leaves you at the top of the road. Was impressed by the selection of Animals they had and the enclosures where quite ample.
Artis zoo. a real big zoo in the center of Amsterdam , must see !!! Large variation of animals even a jaguar they have over there and not a car !!!
Good place with many different kind of animals. You will see lions, elephants, wolfs, zebras and a lot of beatiful animals. There are also a terrarium. I recommend this place.

Fabulous!. The day we went to Artis Zoo it was ROASTING, but despite the really hot weather we saw most of the animals. They seemed to be well cared for, and helped to keep cool by the staff, which was nice to see. The zoo is very close to a tram stop, so easy to get to. Plenty of animals to see, from elephants to parrots, and everything in between! The reptile house was especially good, along with the marmosets and bats! The zoo is pretty big, so we stopped at the Two Cheetahs restaurant for a bite to eat - nice enough food, but a bit expensive! The staff were friendly, and we got our picture taken as we went in, and there was an opportunity to buy it at the end- a nice memento for the day! Artis Zoo is a great place to visit!

Beautiful surroundings. Really nicely set out zoo with a wide range of animals. Loved the forest house with lots of animals roaming free to spot and the butterfly pavilion. The zebras, giraffes and elephants were another favourite. Enclosures looked very natural and similar to conditions in the wild. Very large and took a long time to walk round it all, was a really hot day but there were plenty of shaded areas.

A Favourite Spot in Amsterdam. One of my favourite spots to visit in Amsterdam! The entry price is a bit hefty (around €20, I think) but worth it. If you pack a lunch and some drinks, you can spend an entire day here for only the entry fee. The zoo is in the middle of the city, but you can't tell once you're inside the gate, which is nice. There are quite a lot of animals for a smaller zoo, and the feedings are fun to watch (especially the penguins - the staff has set up chairs so you can sit and enjoy the show).Whenever anyone comes to visit, I make sure to take them here, and I try to stop in a few times every Summer. I definitely recommend Artis if you're in Amsterdam, especially if you have little ones!
needs an upgrade. best area of the zoo is the butterfly enclosure and the gardens are well maintained. however the zoo is in need of a very big upgrade.

Lovely zoo great day out. We had a great day out at this zoo with our 2 year old. Fantastic conditions for the animals, lots of shady areas for sunny days. Loved the monkeys and the waterfall area. The Two Cheetas restaurant is brilliant.
Quite expensive (around £20 each), but we'd say it was worth it.
Interesting. There were some interesting sights not as many animals as you expect. The animals don't seem to have big enough enclosures

Great zoo, well worth a visit. A brilliant zoo, easy to get to with lots of great animals. It had the best aquarium I've ever been to, and I've been to quite a few Sealife Centres in the UK. It had lots of spectacular fish and colourful tanks. All the animals appeared to be well looked after. We spent about five hours walking around the whole zoo, had a few ice creams during this venture. There was plenty of seating around which was a great relief as I have annoying back issues at the moment! The flowers and decor around the zoo were very pretty. To conclude the zoo made a wonderful day out.

Lovely day at the Zoo. We had a lovely day at the zoo and it was nice to see the animals, especially the birds roaming freely and not completely caged in. It is a great place to take the Kids, but as i with all Zoos. It wasn't too expensive and there are lots of cafe/small restaurants to have a coffee and some food in, again at an OK price.

So much fun!. A perfect sized museum, not too big so your feet start blistering, but big enough so that there are lots of things to see, especially a really cool butterfly house! The aquarium is really cool too. We took a canal tour to get there, and it was easy to get back into town as well with quite a number of street cars passing through.

Refreshing, spotless presentation. Right in middle of Amsterdam, easy access, full of many species of animals, all in excellent condition, and to top it off a music concert started at 7.30pm though not sure the animals appreciated it.
A must see. This is one of the most beautiful zoos I've ever been to, variety of plants and animals, definitely a must see in Amsterdam.
Loved it. Really busy but so big that you can get away from the crowds....reasonably priced cafes and lots of animals to see...really recommend...get the number 9 tram from Central Station
A morning at the zoo. This was a lovely site, very shady and well laid out, lots of trees and close to the animals. I would go again.
well laid out zoo. Excellent mixture of planting and animals. Would recommend you buy an IAMSTERDAM card which gives feee entry to this and other attractions plus trams.

Relaxing Afternoon at the Zoo. We visited on a Thursday afternoon and whilst there were plenty of people around it was not too busy. Reaching the zoo was easy being a short tram ride from the city centre.The zoo is real pleasantly laid out, more like a park with lawns, trees footpaths between all the animal enclosures. There is plenty to see and wandering round slowly looking at the different animals was really pleasant. The aquarium was an amazing old building with some interesting displays, such as the one depicting an Amsterdam canal. The butterfly house is worth a visit - but be warned it is warm and humid in there. And penguin feeding time is something to behold - I think every heron within 20 miles had turned up seeking a prime position for a free meal should one of the fish intended for the penguins be dropped. Also on display when we visited was a 3-month old tapir.The zoo also has a restaurant, a cafe and a planetarium which gives shows at various times, none of which we used so I cannot comment on their quality.We bought iAmsterdam cards which include zoo admission.

Descent zoo high price. The artis zoo is a good zoo for its size. The price of ?19.50 for adults is pretty steep. Luckily we got in free with the amsterdam city card. I you want a map it costs 2?. We opted out since we thought we could looks at maps posted along the way...there were none so we took a lot of wrong turns.There were signs for a free app to download, if we had done that before we went we probaly would have done better.The animals looked fairly happy and they place was clean. The best part was the lovely flowers throughout! There was a great kids playground at the end which if our kids would have beem with us they would have loved.Plenty of food/beverage carts throughout which was a must on a hot day!All in all if you have the city card i recommend it, if not just know its going to be expensive. Check out there website for hours they advertised "open till dark" for saturdays in july/aug. It would be a great evening activity with the kids when the rest of the attractions shut down at 5-6!

lovely attraction. The grounds of the zoo are quite simply wonderful, the floral beds are so attractive. The animals are housed quite well and the avian collection is very interesting. The aquarium is a must see

Zoological Delight. We went relatively late in the day. There are over 900 species of animals on display here. It features a zoological garden, a reptile centre, aquarium, planetarium and zoological museum. There is a lot to see here. All of the placards are in Dutch and English, which was great for understanding the animals. We unfortunately found a few animals to either not be on display or extremely elusive. We particularly enjoyed the the primates, they were very animated and playful. There are also some wild animals who occupy the zoo as well, including some adorable ducks and chicks which where wandering around near the zoo. The grounds are beautiful and well kept and most enclosures are spacious. I would have to say that London Zoo is marginally better but we thoroughly enjoyed Artis. We spent about 1 hour 30 minutes visiting and wished we had more time for this, would recommend spending at least 2 hours here to fully appreciate although you could definitely spend the whole day here.
amazing. great day and a little bit different to the usual attractions around amsterdam well worth a visit and if a nice day chill by the seals with a beer

A lovely way to spend a day.. We visited the Artis Zoo in Amsterdam on a Sunday in May. The first challenge was to find somewhere to park our bikes, not because there wasn't facilities, it's just that there were so many bikes. Any tree, fence, etc is fair game. There was a bit of a line up out the front, but this moved steadily and didn't take that long. The zoo is quite quirky, as with many things in Amsterdam. The Monkey House and Bird House are significant in regard to their architecture and the fact that the animals are not caged off from you. We happened to be there during feeding time, and the animals come to the feeding trays and are oblivious to the many visitors that were watching on. Great opportunity for photos!! I was taking a shot of a small monkey and the attendant tapped me on the shoulder to alert me to the fact that an iguana was approaching my left ear. It was great, very unique. Some of the enclosures were a bit on the small size (large cats) but they are undergoing extensive renovations to address this over the next 5 years. The gardens are beautiful, clean and well maintained, with plenty of lawn being ideal for a picnic or just to laze in the sun to give your feet a rest. The gardens are punctuated with various objects of art, that further enhance the settings. The aquarium was something else, make sure you go upstairs to the mammoth fish, they need to be seen to be believed. I enjoyed the chimps, the llamas, the vultures, giraffes, penguins and elephants. There is plenty of seating throughout the zoo and several cafes to purchase food and drinks. It is very easy to get to the zoo with the tram going right past. We thoroughly enjoyed our day here and would recommend it for everyone, no matter what age.

Wonderful way to rest your eyes. We stumbled upon the zoo, whilst looking for the museum quarter. It was a toss up between paintings and animals, and to be honest we'd had enough of renaissance portraits. The zoo is in beautiful grounds, with a nice mix of city and garden architecture. The animals look really well cared for, and content, which is always good to see. The butterfly enclosure is mesmerising, and the lions drew a crowd. It's not cheap, at nearly 20 euros per person, and charging €2 for a map is a bit cheeky. It's still cheaper than London Zoo, however, and I'd say even better. The food is not the best, and not all outlets take Visa debit card, which was a bit strange.

Doing Some Great Conservation Work. Very close to the centre of Amsterdam... 35 acres of immaculately kept gardens to wander around and enjoy with the animals spread around the grounds. Never seems too cramped despite there probably being several thousand visitors there on the afternoon we spent.My wife is cat stupid...and to see an extremely rare Amur Leopard and a Black Panther were worth the admission fee alone.I personally am not a fan of zoo's... once you have been fortunate to see wild animals roaming free in their own environment it all seems rather sad.....did thing the cats could do with at least four times the space that they had assigned to them.....However, from an educational standpoint for children who otherwise may never have the chance to see these beautiful creatures, and especially regarding the excellent work zoos are doing in relation to critically endangered animals and ensuring their survival I am not going to knock the place.... much better than the majority of zoos and worth the admission fee of 20 Euros without a doubt.One tip..... take a picnic with you.... there are loads of places to stop and eat it...i Personally found the food in the zoo fairly standard fare and overpriced

A Great Place for Kids...and Adults. The zoo features more than animals. It is also a wonderful botanical garden featuring hundreds of exotic and rare plants and flowers. It also houses the Butterfly House that features thousands of multi-colored insects which fill the giant atrium with an ever changing rainbow of sensory delights....
Great. This was a really nice experience as you get real close to the animals such as the lions and elephants.

enjoy little monkeys. everywhere we go we like to visit zoo, this zoo was very nice, i enjoyed it. most of all i like the big glass room with tropical animals where they live like in the wild nature and not in cages, its was little monkeys so small and so tiny 15 cm or so. they was cute u can see them very closer.also i adore the sea cats,they swim in water and play and make nice sounds, there was many of them,its was enjoyeble view. zoo have nice big cafe as well where u can rest if u are tired.

Not bad - aquarium is best bit. Quite a good little zoo. The standard animals are present, and they have a couple of cafes and a good play area for the kids. The real highlight is the aquarium, which seems to never end and is full of fascinating sea critters. We were a family of 5 (kids aged 8,8,11) and could easily have spent a whole day here.
A bit sad and tired. Some nice gardens and plenty of shady places to sit but animal exhibits look like they need some money spending on them in my opinion.

Great Zoo!. You can tell the animals are taken care of in this zoo. They have a good variety of birds that you don't normally see in most zoos. You can get really close to the animals. The grounds are nicely landscaped. Really nice flower beds.

Nice zoo. It has a good variety of felines, an aquarium, an insectarium and a petting zoo. The penguins display is really nice. It has some places to have snacks and a couple of places to eat, and the one we tried was nice. I found the gift shop a bit lacking, though.
nice!. nice experience but i was expecting to see more animals and the park to be more organized.!i've been last year to berlin zoo and the difference is big!

Very nice zoo as well as the gardens. It was a very different from the US zoos where you are far from the animals. The animals were actually doing things when we arrived not just sleeping. The only things I saw that were disturbing was the feeding of the vultures ( fed dead rabbits) and that a lot of the animals were pacing due to lack of room.
excellent day for childrens and adults. Great range of animals and lots of baby animals on view, able to get very close to the animals lots of cafes and picnic areas really recommended

Great zoo. Great zoo with lots to do. 19.50 per person on the door so i would recommend buying tickets before hand. we walked there from central station and it took ages so I would get the tram if i went back, we got the tram on the way home and it was only 2.80 euros each. food at the zoo was reasonable and not overpriced.

Perfect on a sunny day!. You can't get much better in Amsterdam for a family friendly place which you can literally stay all day in! I recommend on a sunny day taking a picnic with you and really making use of the great green spaces they have! The variety of animals is great, the children's climbing area & slides are brilliant. The aquarium is outstanding and during the summer months the zoo is open until sunset! One tip I would give you is to take your own drinks as bottles of water & pop are expensive however ice creams and ice lollies are quite reasonable! Enjoy :)

THIS ZOO IS GREAT !. we set aside a morning for a visit to the zoo since we had a 6 year old with us. it was a great decision and would recommend it for anyone...not just children. It is a hugh area and very well planned out. the exhibits were very well done. there is plenty of shade, flowers, playgrounds and gardens. If I ever go back to Holland, I will definitely go back there

Brilliant Day Out!. This is a great attraction! It's a full day out, took us 6 hours to see everything! Recommended! It cost around 20 Euro to get in, and was worth every penny! Some of the animals were roaming freely, so it was great being able to interact with them! The butterfly house was amazing, as was Lizard house.

Great day out.. Fantastic day out, lots to see and you can get fantastic photographic opportunities here due to the lack of fencing. Really good selection of animals and all only a short tram ride away from Centraal station.
Royal Zoo of Artis. The names says it all. It's one of the best zoo I've been to. The aquarium in Artis Zoo is almost doubled the size of London aquarium and it has vast range of animals.

A fantastically varied, must-see Zoo. Me and my girlfriend visited Artis Zoo on the last day of our visit to Amsterdam and it was a great way to end our trip. The Zoo is a little out of the City Centre, however this should not put you off as it is easy enough to find via the tram (number 9 or 14 from the centre of Amsterdam - about a 10 minute journey). Admission was free with the I Amsterdam card and there was very little queueing. The zoo is fairly large and we were amazed by how much there was to see all in the same place - as well as the usual animal enclosures, there was also an insect house, butterfly house, bird sanctuary, reptile house, small mammal house, farm yard, planetarium, aquarium and zoo museum. When we first entered the Zoo, we were also given the option of having our photo taken alongside the camels and buffaloes, which can then be collected for a fee of 8 Euros at the exit. On viewing the photograph, we decided we would buy as the photo was of good quality and it was a nice souvenir to take away.The layout is well thought out and there are plenty of places to eat and drink. There were a couple of small negatives which is why I have deducted one star from my overall rating. Firstly, the signs that accompany all of the animals are mainly in dutch and there are very little English translations. Secondly, the Zoo shop was very small for such a large Zoo and there was very little choice. However, these are only small gripes and did not take away from a fantastic day out.
A great place to take children and childish adults. Like me...I loved it. Spent half a day there. Wonders around every bend. First place I ever saw an anteater!
Not a large zoo, but varied and well laid-out. The zoo fulfills its duty as an educational institution, and is also laid out with areas of formal plantings, making it prettier than your average zoo.

Really huge zoo.... There is tons to see here, it has a huge array of animals big and small... Its a good full day and alot of walking but so worth it... At first thought ooh a bit pricey but the sheer amount here and the spaces to lunch and sit and relax are worth it...

Great day out in sunny!. Not far from tram stops. Long walking about the zoo, amazing to see adorable small, medium and large animals. They got everything including aquarium but disappointment that aquarium was shut for a day. As I understand that past unhappy comments about Artis zoo on this site but zoo getting improved and better from the now, animals look feed well, healthily and grooming. My favourite animal is a penguin and they got little penguin and I can get close up them, they are cutes and want take them home! Best time if you go there when the weather is dry, if raining animals will go back to shelter and you won't able to see them. I liked the Butterfly area, when you enter in and various of of colourful butterfly flying about round you and close up.

Artis Zoo. Probably my favorite place on earth! I enjoyed every moment of the Artis. Every animal was unique and well-kept, and friendly and willing to meet onlookers. Beautiful gardens. Staff was heartfelt and great. Five stars, if not more.

All varieties of animals. Amazing. Very good value for money! Was most iimpressed by the lions, big cats, camel and penguins.
Perfect for all ages! Only a 10 min walk or a few stops on the tram from the city centre.

A great day out and a wonderful way to end a trip to Amsterdam.. I visited here with a friend during our weekend in Amsterdam. Entrance is free with an Iamsterdam city card and the queues were very reasonable. The range of animals is superb, seeing elephants in the centre of Amsterdam certainly makes it a special visit. They even have sloths, which for one as obsessed with the fabulous creates as I, is a huge bonus. The zoo grounds are lovely, as are the restaurants and cafes. A must visit when in Amsterdam.
It's a zoo!. A variety of small and large animals, some of which looked happier than others. The zoo is raising funds to give the elephants a larger enclosure which they need.

Zoo, Garden, Planetarium, Aquarium and sculpture all in One!. What fun, a zoo with beautiful gardens and sculpture. Loved lemur island, where you can get up close and personal with them. Many of the animal enclosures are humane and up to date, but there still could be improvement. Considering that this zoo is 175 years old it is aging with grace. I did not get to either the planetarium or aquarium. Next time.
Cute. Lovely exhibits - a personal favourite was the casual, open air penguins just hanging about. Very adorable and quaint.

Close to the Animals-- Great Photo shoots!. The Artis Zoo is an awesome little zoo in the city. All of the exhibits put you extremely close to the animals-- so don't stick your hand through the fence to pet the wolves!This is a great morning walking zoo with a great variety of animals and beautiful botanical specimens throughout the zoo. The waterfall is a bonus feature.For those with small children, there is a fully furnished, large playground near the cafe so parents can drink their tea and the kids can run like crazy!The aquarium and planetarium are also nicely done!Overall, a really nice experience!

cool garden. we found great animals at a great location. this is a place not to be missed and it is very easy to locate. they even had a bar inside where you can eat something fast and drink a coffee, The gorillas are impresive. we visited it in december but it is great to visit in the summer when the animals ar all outside and they have a lot of place.

Great way to end your stay in Amsterdam. Located on the east side of the Central Station and not too far away. Well worth a visit if you have a few hours to spare and the entry is free with the iAmsterdam card. Didn't have to wait too long to get in and the animals seemed to be looked after much better than those at London Zoo.

Favorite. I think this is my favorite zoo I've been too! I spent the entire day here. Not hard to do really. there is so much to see. And I found myself going back to some of my favorite animals a few times, each time seeing something different. Keeper talks with the seals are funny! A great show to stick around for. There is also tons of great photo opportunities to get great pictures of the animals. Most of the enclosures have low fences or other barriers to keep animals in making for great pictures.

Great Zoo. I thought this Zoo is one of the best I have been to.
Very friendly staff
Modern, well laid out, clean
All the animals looked well cared for
A pleasure to walk around
Easy to get to
Great day out

Nice Zoo for a great afternoon. Well this is an institution in A'dam since 125 years and the lines for the tickets are still long. But they are worth it. It is a real city zoo with a nostaligic atmosphere. But luckiy times changed here too and the animals are gettting better and more modern places to live more and more. There is a lot to see although the Lemur Island, the Butterflygarden and Aquarium are my favorit. There are also free shows in the Planetarium.
Pleasantly surprised!!. My husband and I went to the zoo today and had the best time!! I would recommend it to anyone including kids and adults!!

Good outdoors activity. The zoo area is much more than just the animals, as the area is nice to walk around with all the landscape and historical items. You will get fairly close to the animals and there are a couple of areas where the animals (birds, lizards, small monkeys etc) will roam completely free among the visitors. The habitats for the big cats (lions etc) were in a bad shape an they had very small living areas compared to many other zoos. Luckily we catched the sealion feeding time which was a real laugh as the animals were well trained (animalkeeper was also there to answer questions afterwards). Generally speaking the selection and number of animals was disappointing compared to Vienna zoo for example, but Artis does have a limited space - they cannot expand as they're in the middle of the city - but it's not all about animals here though.If you get hungry the restraurants in the area offer snacks with reasonable prices and there are also mobile (bicycle) snack bars in the area. Entry fee is expensive, nearly €20 per person. However with the red Amsterdam tourist card entrance was free. A bit of a walk from central, so a tram takes you there more easily.
A wide variety of animals!. Such a huuuuge place and you are likely to get lost! I think I saw most of it and I was very impressed!

Not just a zoo. Popped into the zoo (reluctantly) on the recommendation of a friend. What a find! As well as the animals there are quiet places just to sit and enjoy the ambience, the whole place is set out for one to stroll around, relax and realise that the animals are also at ease.Delightful spider monkeys, MAGICAL butterfly house, like being in a child's storybook, fascinating aquarium, and then the memorial room to (sorry, forgot her name) the hippo, complete with tributes from schoolchildren.I could go on, but will conclude by saying that you will leave this place with a smile on your face..

Best Zoo Ever - Truly the Best day out in Amsterdam !!!. This Zoo was totally amazing not like any zoo I had been too before . Was amazed at all the animals I had not seen before . This Zoo puts the animals in there in closers in such away that netting and barriers are not needed . You can see the animals clearly without obstructions . My Favorite part would have to be walking through there big greenhouse with all the monkeys running around over my head and they come down in front of you to feed . Actually being that close to the monkeys was amazing . The Lions there wear amazing and playful . Another highlight was the Chimpanzees I was fascinated by them and how simular they were to humans . This Zoo has an Aquairum, Planetarium , Reptile house , Tropical House , Birds House and butterfly house and that's just a few of the inside stuff there are hundreds of different animals outside like Elephants , giraffes , Sea Lions , Monkeys and loads of other animals . Truly the Best day out in Amsterdam
not just a zoo. could spend all day there - it is not just for children and the grounds have marvellous plants and flowers. make sure you see the giant tortioses
Artis Zoo in central Amsterdam. We walked here from Central Station which took around 20min. The Zoo had plenty of animals to see, and it was a nice walk round. Need around 2 hours.
Wonderful! . Me and my partner loved everything about this Zoo, it had everything!!!The animals were clean, good staff, good ice cream prices - rocket lolly 99c Is a good day out, worth 20 euro each

family fun- ohhh yeah!. And wow, this is one of the best zoos I have ever seen. (in my profession, I have seen quite a few!) It was super neat seeing some critters that we don't ever see in the states, and with all the lush greenery and flowers around, you almost forget you are in a zoo but rather a botanical garden with animals. My children loved it- and the play areas they have for wee ones are pretty great. Even my hard to please teen enjoyed herself!

Amazing zoo!All in one ZOO... We stay 4 hours to enjoy with everything because they have everything from flowers till bones of dinosaurus!You have to search it and dont rush with this zoo!Good aquarium also..

Worth a visit if you are in Amsterdam for a few days. Not really a must see, but there is plenty of animals on display. I felt there wasn't a huge amount of room in the enclosures of the large animals (particularly the big cats). Which I didn't like very much. Apart from that, the majority of animals seemed happy and well looked after. The aquarium section was impressive.

Excellent. We did not plan on visiting the zoo, but it was such a nice day that we decided it would be a good thing to do, and we were not disappointed. There are a huge variety of animals, places to eat and plat area's for children, There is also a planetarium, which we did not get chance to visit.We particularly liked the reptile house and forest part near the start of the zoo.

Fantastic zoo!. Coming to Amsterdam, a visit to the zoo wasn't high on our list of "must-sees", but it was included on the iamsterdam cards so we went for a look. We were glad that we did as we had a great time walking around the zoo all afternoon. There is a huge variety of animals and the enclosures are all of a good size so they seem comfortable. Being a nice sunny day the animals were all out making the most of it as well meaning they were easy to see. There must have been a lot of people there but it didn't seem that way and we had no trouble with crowds blocking our view at any point. A highlight was the forest walkthrough section where you are actually in with the monkeys, bats and iguanas. This was one of the most enjoyable things we did the whole time we were in Amsterdam and I highly recommend a visit!
Wonderful day out. One of the best zoos I have visited set in beautiful grounds. Well worth a visit. Kids will love it.

Lovely zoo, but one with problems. This is a small, old zoo set in the heart of the city and is well worth a visit as it has many good qualities. The surroundings are beautiful and the architecture is well worth seeing, plus the zoo has made a great effort to make sure there are plenty of educational displays available to make the day out a learning experience.Parts of the zoo are spectacularly good, especially the areas dedicated to birds - the rare macaws, storks, spoonbills and pheasants had really nice, spacious enclosures and looked happy and clean. The aquarium is a must-see, with a huge range of fish in beautiful surroundings. One drawback of the aquarium as a wheelchair user was the fact that the tanks are quite high up, which meant craning my neck to see, and I wasn't able to see the bottom areas of the tanks because of the angle and the heavy wooden framing.The vulture flight area was also impressive, and having the huge birds fly over your head is a really great experience. The penguin pool is so good that it had attracted a lot of local herons, looking quite happy and obviously quite at home.On the downside the big cats were in really small, and totally unsuitable cages which were dark and provided very little stimulation or opportunities for exercise. The lions had almost no space to move around and looked very fed up, a lot of the smaller cats were showing disturbing repetitive pacing behaviour which was upsetting and quite unneccessary in these modern times when the stress caused by small enclosures is well understood. The wolves were in a very small, unadorned enclosure which gave them no opportunities to run or play and for such intelligent creatures must be desperately boring. I would much prefer to see this zoo specialise in the smaller animals so that they can give them the best possible enviroment, rather than keep large creatures in such small spaces. The butterfly house was definitely a highlight, accessible and really well kept, with beautiful butterflies and lovely plants, we could have happily stayed there much longer.Facilites in the park seemed good, but the wheelchair we borrowed was rather like a metal shopping trolley and very uncomfortable. It also had four small wheels which meant that I couldn't push myself and this meant that my companion had to push me the whole day, which wasn't ideal for either of us.There seemed to be quite a few places to eat, but by the time we got to the eating areas all the food was sold out and so we weren't able to try the local delicacies. We did have a nice icecream by the penguin pool earlier in the day though, which was great.
Amazing day!. Me and my partner went for the day and it was amazing! We loved every min ov it and it was well worth the price. A must see in my opinion

More than just a zoo... We went on the 19/05/2013 to celebrate my son's 3rd birthday! Wow, what an amazing place! Clean & lovely! I personally love the flowers & fascinated with the Aquaria.. The fishes were huge, I cant stop admiring as it is not something that we can see in our everyday life.. There are flamingos, penguins, gorillas, jaguar, giraffes, bear, chimpanzees, lion, and lots more.. There is also a planetarium and surrounded by old buildings that are so beautiful.. This is a place where u can easily spend half a day & still feel excited & not bored with it.. A good place to bring your kids & have a picnic in the park.. Its more than just a zoo, its back to nature.. :)

Cute lions. I love zoos. I love to see the giraffes. The giraffes were not out because they were eating, but I was able to see them. The lions were all snuggling together. They have a lot of birds. They had a different variety of monkeys as well. They also had an aquarium with many fishes. It was an enjoyable morning. The zoo is in a residential area, and maybe close to the University of Amsterdam. They had an elephant, raccoons, and wolves. The wolves were also out.

Nice place. Im not such a big fan of zoos, but this one is really big and has a lot of open spaces. I hated the bear habitat, I felt it was too small. But in the other hand the insect and aquarium sections were really great. The seals were also incredible and very interesting to watch.

Artis is wonderful.. Artis is one of our favorite zoo's. There a lot of animals and there habitat is very well maintained. My family love to come here. See everything with a easy pace and enjoy the scenery. We did a birthday party here once, it was a lot of fun to do a backstage tour. You can bring your own food and drink, but in the park there enough places to get something healthy and oke coffee. There are playgrounds for kids, so the adults can take a break. There are also lots of activities to do depending on the time of year. We recommend to visit Artis at night if you get the opportunity during the Night of Artis and in the summer they have varies of programma's at the end of the day.Artis a must see in Amsterdam.

Beautiful zoo, continuously improving. Artis Zoo is a 175 year old urban zoo, smack in the center of Amsterdam. It is a great mix of old and new buildings, in a parklike environment with beautiful flower arrangements. And animals. Progressively, the old cramped cages are being replaced by more open walk-through spaces. The new monkey exhibit and the butterfly garden are great. And you can still see lions, zebras, elephants. The selection of animals seems to have been reduced as a result of renovation, however the enjoyment increased. Tips: order tickets on-line, and allow yourself 4 hours at least. And check out the planetarium on a rainy day or when you need a rest.

Beautiful 19C Zoo almost in the heart of town. An atmosphere that combines 19C hardware with 20C software. Attention to detail (flowerbeds!) shows that this Zoo is run and supported by lovers of nature and Amsterdam.April/May seems a good time to visit as all flowerbulbs spring to life. No special effect attractions but many surprises (butterflies, atmoshere of the Aquarium, pheasantry, 'small mamals' house, reptiles. Catering options could be better although 10 points for kute poffertjes house. Look forward to seeing the completed renovation of another group of 19C buildings. If I would live in Amsterdam I would go for a wander every three months.

Urban gem of a zoo. Like: Compact zoo with wandering paths, bilingual exhibits and plenty of benches to sit and observe.Dislike: Many of the animals that I've been fond of have seemingly vanished. Some have been replaced by other interesting animals (Yellow Martens!) but it seems the number and variety have been compromised in order to improve the housing of others. I suppose it's unfair to say "Dislike" when what I should say is "couldn't there be a note telling us what happened to the ...... that used to be in this spot?"
Amsterdam zoo. It is great you can spend a day there, there is a lot to see and the flowers are beautifuland the cafés have the most delicious apple cake

Great zoo, but small spaces for the animals. All kinds of animals are represented in a traditional outset. The park is in the middle of the city, quite romantic and great fun for kids, but if you care about animals in bigger spaces or even roaming around free in a meadow, this is not your place.

Worth a visit. I have been to this zoo a few times, the first time the enclosures seemed very small but with each visit the enclosures get bigger and better each time. The price is steep but so is the price with most things in Amsterdam. Would visit again and again.

my girlfriend loved this zoo. my girlfriend loved this zoo we could of stayed there all day we have been here few times when we were in Amsterdam and never get sick of it. its such a good zoo loads to see from loins down to meerkats . If you are going on a trip to Amsterdam this is a must do for everyone.

worth it just for the lemurs. This zoo is across the street from the Dutch Resistance Museum, and you can easily do them both in the same day. We went on a cold spring day, but found the animals lively and healthy in appearance, especially the baboons. There is a lemur area where they run loose and you can get close to them for photos. Lots of owls here. In many of the areas, of the animals don't want to be on display they can retreat, which I liked. They have white wolves whose area was being upgraded. The zoo is a manageable size, good for younger kids who can't walk for miles.

worth it just for the lemurs. This zoo is across the street from the Dutch Resistance Museum, and you can easily do them both in the same day. We went on a cold spring day, but found the animals lively and healthy in appearance, especially the baboons. There is a lemur area where they run loose and you can get close to them for photos. Lots of owls here. In many of the areas, of the animals don't want to be on display they can retreat, which I liked. They have white wolves whose area was being upgraded. The zoo is a manageable size, good for younger kids who can't walk for miles.

One of the best organized zoos. Although they are still working on giving certain animals more room (elephants definitely need more room!), the zoo is clean, green and has a good walking flow. The playground is very nice and restaurant has good food - it's just badly organized that it always takes a lot more time then necessary when it's busy.

Decent sized zoo in city center. We went to Artis and found is really nice for a small family outing with kids. My son enjoyed a lot. You can buy pass for whole year and visit it several time during the year, good for local residents. Best part is its in the city center and easily accessible by public transport. About the zoo, lesser species as its comparatively smaller zoo, but definitely a must visit if you have a small kid with you.

Beautiful zoo!. We had such a great time at the Artis zoo. They have a wonderful aquarium and butterfly house. The vultures are also a very interesting exhibit, especially if you never seen them up close. Very cool. We spent about 3 hours at the this zoo and were entertained the entire time.

Animal oasis in Amsterdam. The zoo was easy to find, it was nice and clean, and the animals were well cared for. Animal enclosures all have good public viewing areas so lots of photos were taken. We spent 3 hours there and would recommend a visit if you have this amount of time to do it justice. Favourites were lions, gorillas, giraffes, zebra and aquarium. The only thing that spoilt the visit [15-04-13] was school trips with children racing around not noticing the animals.[[Gift shop quite expensive]].

Nice place for a family outing. To be very honest I had expected a lot from Atris and I was somewhat dissapointed. There were quite a few species of animals at the zoo, no issues with the variety, but I felt that they were not properly "arranged" in the zoo. The aquarium and the aviary were quite good and housed some really beautiful creatures. The aquarium has to be the best feature at Artis and any visitor should not miss it. The aviary and the penguin enclosure are also a muse-see. The zoo is quite large and requires quite a bit of walking. There should be more signs in the zoo to let people know what to see and where. Maybe it was because Artis was under renovation, but the zoo felt off colour. Good location to spend a day on a weekend for families with or without children, especially for the latter.
Great Zoo. We spent about 3 hours here and particularly enjoyed the aquarium. There is a great collection of animals and the grounds are really well kept. If you are a zoo lover you must go.
Nice Zoo. We really enjoyed this zoo. Nice and clean. Lots of different animals the aquarium was nice and no extra charge. Easy to take photos. I really recommend this.

Small City Zoo. Enclosure small and unsuitable, some animals had more room than others.Big cats had tiny insufficient enclosures, why are two lionesses separated from the rest?!! One Lioness was poked to come outside, unnecessary!Everything is concrete with bars, very unnaturalistic. Bird houses no sanitiser?! contact with animals is possible. Most enclosure seemed unclean.Insufficient use of space, lots of unused grassland!Easy to navigate round, decent restaurant with toilet facilities. Butterfly House was beautiful, and very good & informative insect house.Gift shop was good.

Amazing day. This was our second time visiting Artis Zoo, but the first time with our son who is 20 months old. The zoo is very clean and spacious. Even though we visited on a Sunday it wasn't very busy. When we left at 1pm there were long queues so I'd recommend buying your tickets in advance. The enclosures are large and provide plenty of room to view the animals. The kids facilities are brilliant and the pictures of the sea lions kept the little one happy whilst I changed his nappy. We will definitely return during our next trip.

A great zoo - one of the best. Loved this zoo. So much to see and do. It's very well kept (including the animals) and all tourists are well catered for. Recommend to anyone going to Amsterdam. Easy walking distance too.

So much to see!. This is one of the better zoo's that I've been to. We went for my son's birthday and although it was difficult to get to with the tram stop being closed it was worth the walk. There were several dedicated buildings to allow you to be out of the weather. We particularly enjoyed the monkeys and the birds. Found a great waterfall hidden behind the giraffes.

Amsterdam famous zoo. It took me few years to visit Artis zoo, but it was worth it. A place where every photographer could get amazing pics. If you are not into photography, you could enjoy the wide selection of animals hosted in it.

Fun Day Out. Having been to Amsterdam many a time I never got to hear about a zoo, until I read a tour guide ! I think it was about €30 each, my brain was a bit hazy !!! Don't do what we did, don't leave the aquarium till last, it closes an hour earlier that the rest of the zoo, i was cheesed off when I missed it, the rest of the zoo is top class, a must see it you have a few hours spare.

Enjoy the view. We spent 6 hours in the zoo although the guide told us 2 hours was suffice. It has to be one of the better zoos I have visited, very clean, such a wide variety of animal life. You are so very close to all the animals. The butterflies are amazing, the marine life is vibrant , the birds are so beautiful, the whole place is just so inviting. A must visit if you are in Amsterdam..

Really good day out. A zoo would not normally be my first choise attraction in a city like Amsterdam, but a nephew said it was really good. He was right, tnis was probably the best zoo you will visit in Europe. Highlights.... gorillas, butterflies, cheetah cafe....

Plenty of animals... good way to pass a few hours away!. Visited this Zoo with my girlfriend and was plesantly surprised with the quality of it. There are lots of animals to see and places to eat, rest etc. Everything is quite close together too so found it easy to get around. Overall a good experience!

Such a beautiful retreat from the city. Artis is old, it oozes a beatiful atmosphere and it is well worth a visit. Like any zoo it is a great place to go with kids. Although it is very close to the centre of Amsterdam, it is quite big, laid out like a citypark and you can easily spent a few hours there. Artis is in the " Plantage buurt" a part of the city with very nice houses and architecture and some good not touristy cafes.

A zoo and more. At first glance at a map you might think this would be a rather cramped city zoo.In fact its actually quite big with more than enough to keep you busy for a day. As well as a zoo with plenty of animals on show, both in pens and indoor areas, there is a planetarium,aquarium, butterfly house and geological museum. The highlight for me was one of the buildings inside which a number of small monkey species can roam about climbing frames of natural materials with no separation at all between them and their tail-less visitors. Plenty of places to eat - the food perfectly good and well priced, but rather limited choice. Excellent value compared to most other attractions in the city.

OK. The zoo itself is quite big and has a selection of animals, but I was disapointed by the size of the enclosures especially for the Lions :( The penguins didnt have any water, although I think it might have been drained as it was so cold everything was freezing over! - But then dont penguins live in cold climates? with ice? The railings for this enclosure were very low about waist height, you could actually put your hand over and touch them if you wanted.....although its probably advisable not to! It did seem the zoo were doing some work on some enclosures. But I was a little disapointed...

Great zoo. We went by line 9 tram from Centraal station, and enjoyed ourselves even though it was cold! managed to spend about 3-5 hours here (mainly in the aquarium) and we even managed to see a seal performance. Animals are mainly in moats of have other barriers than just mesh and cages so there are lots of brilliant photo opportunities. it is very interactive and has lots of things to do, only marked it down because the larger cats were in quite small cages. I would return again

Amazing!. I came here just because I heard that tulips arent blooming yet this time of the year, was originally planning to go to kerkenhof today. The zoo is overwhelming! It is very big, with lots of animals! There are some areas where you can stand side by side with the animals, without fences. Its a great experience and it is definitely worth ?19.5!

Great day out. Just returned from spending 4hrs at the zoo.First thing to note if you can pre book do so, we spent 40 mins waiting in line at 10.15 am, whilst pre booked just walked up to the gate and scanned tickets in. Once in the zoo we found it to be much bigger than we thought it would be. Great close contact with the animals in the bird house, many free flying including Owls as well as monkeys and lizards. Lots of moated animals so no wires in way of getting good photos. All the small animal cages were really well done and newer parts excellent. The only negative for me and the reason for 4 stars and not 5 , was the small cages for the big cats.. I know the zoo is 175 yr old but the lion enclosure wasn't up to the modern high standards one expects these days. All in all a great zoo and well worth the time we spent there.

Great zoo. This is very impressive to have such a great zoo near the city center. Black panther, Serval, creepy insects...all the animald you wish to see are there! I loved seeing so many cubs!If you are a zoo lover I would recommend to spend the whole day there! We spent 6h and wished to have more time.It really worth the price.
Packed with people and their kids. Better zoos exist elsewhere and this one is not special, at least in the cold weather. Come summer, it is probably more interesting.

Raaaarrr! Fun day at the zoo!. Loooooong lines on Easter weekend, but once you are in, it was a lot of fun. The seals and the lions were cool, and the baby elephant. Nice walkways, clean, easy to navigate (good signage).

expensive for what you pay for. Zoo was fun and have me and my boyfriend something to do but there was lots of building works and some animals were moved which meant we didn't get to see them, so maybe should have been made temporarily cheaper in order to compensate for this

Ok, but needs modernising. This is very much a traditional city centre zoo: the enclosures for the big animals, such as lions, elephants and bear were not big enough by modern standards. The walk through avery was very good with primates jumping amongst visitors.The planetarium is quite modern looking; however, the commentary is in Dutch with no headphones for translation so it is difficult to know what is going on: the other half used it as an hour for a snooze!
always a good day out. We never miss going to Artis everytime we are in Amsterdam, one of their hidden gems, always something new to see

Little space for big animals. I was very upset when I left this Zoo. Although the animals looked cared for the enclosures were very small. The wolves were pacing up and down in a desert like small space with little to do and nothing climb on and keep them selves entertained. The most distressing were the lions, these are not animals that should be shoved in a small pen ...not enough space for one let alone three! If we are going to keep wild animals locked up should we not at least give them enough space and try to re-create some of the natural environment they might be used too?
Monkeys & Butterflies. Great day out in the centre of Amsterdam with fantastic butterfly garden. Spacious quarters for the animals and lots of fun info.

Huge. Very big, very nice and well kept... eveeything was perfect, only thing that left me disappointed is that we didint find any students discount here, like in all attractions we have visited in amsterdam.

Why does it look a bit deserted?. Having come a few times in the past, this time we felt a bit strange because the outside space obviously needs attention. Maybe is this time of year, I am sure the cold wet weather doesn't help as well but hopefully they will soon sort everything out! Other than that is a great day out for both children and adults and allow yourselves at least 5-6 hours!

Very impressed. We entered the zoo on a very wet March day thinking 41 euros for two and a map was a bit steep, also because of the weather we were expecting the animals to be hiding away, however we were presently surprised. Excellent zoo, considering when we've paid more for a zoo and aquarium separately in some city's so afterward we thought it was excellent value, especially as the aquarium was equally as good. Highly recommend, the highlight was the gorillas which were great fun to watch.

Wonderful Zoo. We visited here during our stay to Amsterdam and we both loved it, my wife loves animals and zoo's so this was a must.Although it was literally freezing, -2, the animals looked like they were comfy and well looked after, all the exhibits were clean, some of the animals could rome around the enclosures, and the monkeys put on a good show, so did the penquins chasing around a shadow of a light-very funny stuff.The price for entry is well worth what you get to see.They have plenty of food, not too many places to use the loo though.

Excellent zoo. We visited the zoo on a very cold Saturday in February and were very impressed. It is a very natural zoo and you can get up close to all the animals. Although it was cold the animals were quite active. It was very good value for money and we would go back again. Can't believe we have been to Amsterdam about 10 times and never been there before!

Animal attraction. Plenty to see from big cats to little fish, bears to sea lions excellent day out for all the family. There is some building working taking place but doesn't really disrupt your visit.

REACENT visit. as a birthday treat we made a special visit to the zoo. what a treat,we were even more imprest .so clean ,all the animals so comfy and happy. the zoo is well planned out easy acces for all age groups  restaurant DE TWEE CHEETAHS good food child friendly.all in all well worth a visit

Day Out. Went to Artis Zoo with friends who live in Amsterdam, It is a good zoo but not enough there to spend a full day. The Croc's were not there when we went due to maintance. lots of walking and as always spend about an hour at my son's favourite (the Gorilla's)Would go again as it is good for the kids, But its about 20 euros per adult.

Great way to spend a day. Loved the zoo, great way to spend the day. Amazing arrange of animals, birds and fish on display. The lions looked tight for space, but I believe they're building a bigger habitat for them.Highlight was being inside a hot house and only 2 feet from the most adorable small monkey, with no bars separating us. Magical moment. Thanks to all the staff maintaining the Artis.

Exceeded expectations. Before going to the zoo I wasn't expecting a whole lot. Looking on the map it seemed to be quite small compared to some of the zoos I've been to in the last 5-10 years. It's safe to say that Artis Zoo exceeded my expectations with its wide assortment of animals. We ended up spending between 3-4 hours here and greatly enjoyed our experience. Some of the animals were either put away for the winter or not available due to renovations. The only real negative that I can find with the Artis Zoo is that the food wasn't very good, and I'd advise bringing your own food (not sure if allowed) or eating outside the zoo.
fantastic zoo. great place to visit in Amsterdam lots of animals to see , best zoo i have been to great , i really enjoyed this place and was amazed by the amout of things to do

Dimemu. Wonderful place, only there isn't a big shark. Also the best period for visiting the Zoo is in summer or when is warm weather, because the garden is buatiful and there is a lot placese to visit

Excellent zoo - Classic architecture. Artis Zoo has been around for well over 175 years. Many diverse animals on display which are always great to watch. The zoo itself is not one of the ubermodern ones and many of the buildings have a very classic early 1900s feel to them.The aquarium, which did get a huge overhaul years ago, is very impressive. Recommended for animal fans who are staying in Amsterdam. About 15 minutes tram ride from Amsterdam Central Station.

great!. not too busy, great selection of animals, can get very close to them! not a great selection of places to eat BUT close to the main town so short walk to many different options of food places. very cold in winter and mainly outdoors so wrap up warm!

Great city zoo. We visited the zoo on Wednesday 20th February. It was a freezing cold day but there were plenty of people visiting despite this. It was a bit expensive in my opinion (56euro for 2 adults and one child) but all in all it is a good zoo which is well kept and the animals appear to be well cared for. We walked to the zoo from our hotel, which was near Centraal station, it wasn't too far away but because it was so cold we were glad that there was a tram stop at the corner of the road that the zoo entrance is on. A good day out if you have kids.

I'm not a big zoo fan, but Artis is a good one. Bigger than you'd think. Well kept, and with helpful staff. Especially good for kids. Watch out for the wandering peacocks. The food's not that great though.

A real city zoo which dates back to the 1838. Nice place to wander around when you have got some spare time. Some nice aspects are: the vlindertuin, the birdhouse, the elephants and last but not least the aquarium
great time. If you are looking for a little off the beaten path something to do, then I would highly recommend the Artis Zoo. We spent almost a whole day.Next time I am in Amsterdam I will go back.

animals in the heart of Amsterdam. The zoo is working on the welfare of the animals: the jaguars are getting a bigger house, which is being build at the moment. Some animals don't need as much space but other do. The wolves would be much happier if they had a lot more space. The bear (who was only temporarily here) looked confused and kept walking around his water pool. Visiting zoos is a way to learn about animals and to pass knowledge on to other generations.

Great zoo..... But a bit heartbreaking.. We visited Artis Zoo this weekend (17th feb) and was pleasantly surprised at the amount of animals that were kept here. I loved the whole experience and my favourite being the aquarium ... However I felt the animals such as the lions, leopard and wolves didn't have as much space as they could have.

We came away unhappy. We decided to visit Artis Zoo largely on the strength of the positive reviews on this site. I have to say, i'm a little mystified as to why this place has had so many positive reviews. Although there were elements of our visit that we enjoyed, we came away with some serious reservations about the welfare of the animals. Although the animals seemed to be in fairly good physical health, the enclosures are far too small in my opinion, one of the first exhibits we came upon was the wolves, there were about 20 wolves confined in a space no bigger than our two bedroom flat, the place was a quagmire of mud with nowhere dry for the wolves to sit. The wolves, although looking well fed and healthy, were definitely not happy, milling about and pacing the small space, their legs coated in muck. The stench of ammonia coming from the enclosure was appalling. Not a good early impression of Artis Zoo.After that we went to see the penguins, and it was the same story, perhaps 50 birds in a muddy space not much bigger than our living room, emanating waves of the stench of waste.There is an Amur Leapord at Artis Zoo, and while it was amazing to see such a rare and beautiful creature so close up, the experience was tainted by the habitat, a low, shallow glass fronted enclosure about 5-6 metres deep and maybe forty metres long.The worst of all by far was the Bear, having never seen a bear in the flesh before I was very excited to see it. We approached the enclosure, yes, you've guessed it, it was tiny. The bear itself was pacing around a small empty pool, it would do a full circle, raise itself up on its back legs, wave its front paws in the air, and go around the pool again, repeating this over and over, around and around. This animal had clearly lost it's mind.It was upsetting and traumatic to say the least, we didn't even want to take a picture and walked away from the poor stricken creature deeply saddened, I believe the kindest thing to do would be for somebody to put the damn thing down and end it's misery.Other than the small spaces the animals had to inhabit, there were other aspects of Artis Zoo that left us feeling a bit uncomfortable, such as the exhibits of dead specimins, I'm sorry, but I really don't want to see a load of dead stuffed birds and beetles and butterflies nailed to a board, or a pickled elephant foetus in a jar. Does anybody?We wandered on, many of the enclosures were empty and deserted, the reptile house was closed many of the animals listed on the website weren't there.
