No Lion to be seen, no Polar Bear, no Giraffes, no Armadillos, no Red Panda, no African Wild Dogs. We enjoyed seeing the feeding of the sea lions but the pool looked too small and very dirty, it was very nice to see these lively creatures doing their tricks for fish and I'm sure the keepers' talk was very interesting but since it was entirely in Dutch I'll never know. I know it is somewhat presumptuous to expect English to be spoken but most of the audience that turned up for the seal lion feeding clearly didn't understand what was being said.We tried to make the best of our day at Artis Zoo, it was lovely to see the gorillas, a silverback and a couple of females with a baby. The aquarium was also pretty good. Great to see the Oryx and some of the smaller animals too.However we came away troubled, this 19th Century Zoo is too small, archaic and in my opinion has no place in modern society. The size of the enclosures borders on cruelty, they should either reduce the number of exhibits and expand the size of the habitats, or close the place down.If you have children they'll have a great time, but for a thinking adult with a conscience, Artis Zoo is in general a negative experience. I wouldn't go again and would not recommend any of my friends visiting Amsterdam to do so.
Great experience. Our son really loved it. So far this was the best zoo we have been to. Highly recommend to all ages, and plan to spend at least 2-3 hours to see all

Whoever thought a zoo could be scary. I visited the Artis zoo during the winternights special offer. It gives you a completely different feel to be strolling around in the dark with minimal lights to guide you and the calls of the wild in the background. I am sure it wud be equally fun during the day!

Lovely Zoo.. Me and my boyfriend visited Artis Zoo on our 3 day weekend to Amsterdam. The zoo was lovely and full of things to see. Really enjoyable day out. Lots of animals and great views to see them unlike some zoos. We was here for a good 3 hours and we skipped a few things so this is an all day thing really but overall a really good day out :)

A really great day out!. I was sceptical, when going into the zoo it looks small and dingy.. How wrong i was! Its a great and well presented place with a large variety of animals suitable for all ages. ?20 ish entry but whats that for a whole day out? We spent a good 4 hours there and couldve stayed longer! A must visit gem in the centre of amsterdam
A must see if you have a few days in Amsterdam. Diverse zoo. Great history. Animals seem well cared for. Good habitat management. Animals seem content

Fantastic day out. My whole family loves zoo and were not disappointed here. There was a locker area to walk thro at the start which has small monkeys lizards and bats running free. It also had a second part with birds but I am scared of birds so did not go in. Only thing I would find I would mark it down on is lion enclosure seemed to small. There is a young cub there at the moment who I could of watched for hours full of mischief . I got on free using IAnsterdam card it is normaly a 20 euro entry. Also the cafe food was nice and cooked fresh in front of you. Would recommend to go if your an animal lover.

Zoo-riffic!. Our family and a friend went to this wonderful zoo back in August of 2012. I recently made a scrapbook of our trip and was reminded just how wonderful this park is. It is very open with lots of park style grassy areas where you can sit under the shade trees. Beautiful facility with European stye and charm. Take time to go, you won't be disappointed.

Not Just for the Kids. Grabbed a No.9 tram across from our hotel about 9.30 am and headed for the Artis Zoo. What a place! Beautiful layout and gardens loaded with tulips and Spring flowers of all kinds. Passed through the huge iron gates to the ticket counter (39 euro for two adults). Some exhibits are behind the times, still having lot's of concrete enclosures for some of the large cats. The is a multi level aquarium, a planatarium, buterfly house and free flight avairy. It was quite an experience to walk among reptiles and birds in the avairy. there are also Lemure's roaming free but insight of their keeper, A reat place to spend the day.

Amazing :). It was my first experience in a zoo. This place is lovely, and there are lots of different species and animals to see from reptiles to birds and mammals.. The place is kept very clean and its huge .. there is also the butterfly pavillion which is lovely .. you must check it out :)

beautiful & well-organized zoo. It was a great pleasure to visit the Zoo even in cold January (minus 5 degrees) so I expect it would be even more in warm spring & summer days. Animals are amazing, except mammals there are great collections of birds, fish and insects Tickets are little bit expensive - 19.5 EUR for the adult but it worth every cent! I enjoyed my every minute there and will definitely come back there in the summer.

Love this zoo. Really nice historical zoo in one of the most interesting neighbourhoods of Amsterdam. Artis really had some improvements over the last years, the new birds house is really nice just as the butterfly pavillion and the maki island.

lovely zoo !!. visited the zoo in early January had a super time the animals looked very well cared for, and the enclosures were spacious and clean.. it was nice not to be peering through wire mesh as a lot of the attractions were surrounded with a moat and a low level wall.. the restraint was clean and reasonably priced. there was plenty to do there aquarium and a planetarium also.. would be very nice in the summer too as plenty of picnic areas and seating all around. great for all ages you could easily spend the day wandering around. well worth it.......

Had a great time. This was my second visit to the zoo and was well worth it. At 19 Euros for an adult ticket it’s priced just about right as well. It’s a fairly big zoo with lots to see so I’d allow (at an absolute minimum) 2 hours for your visit, but I’ve spent 3-4 hours there on both occasions. There’s several cafés dotted around the zoo where food and drinks (especially when they have a captive market) are reasonably priced (info here: http://www.artis.nl/en/food-drink/restaurants/). There’s all the ‘big’ animals that you’d hope to see at a zoo but there’s also some unexpected treats. For example, there’s seals. Who on both of my trips here have been incredibly playful and fun to watch. There’s some underwater viewing windows but you can also go above and see them from there. For the elephants, gorilla’s and chimpanzees there’s indoor viewing areas so if they are not outside you’ll still be able to see them. If you’re lucky the big cats will be out and prowling around, there’s lions, a panther and a leopard amongst others. There’s also a monster of a crocodile in the reptile house that has to be seen to be believed. Regardless of your age, don’t miss out of the petting zoo. As you come in the main entrance you’ll see the gift shop on your right hand side, the gate to get in is next to the shop. There were goats, sheep, calf’s, chickens, rabbits, etc all running around. Great fun getting up close to the animals and having a few pictures taken with them, watch where you tread though!Couple of tips: Make sure if you are visiting that your camera’s charged! You can also use the I amsterdam city card here. Finally, buy a map (it’s in English) for 1.99 Euro. It’s walkable from the centre, but you can get tram number 9 from Central Station or tram 14 from Dam Square to get there.

Artis zoo is pretty cool. If you like strolling in an old time zoo this is for you....small and well kept...it has an old feel but there are some great surprises...there is a long building you really need to check out...there are habitats seperated by plastic sheets in which you can see up close to the animals. Neat!I liked the birds best of all...they had some cool reptiles too! The lions and elephants are pretty standard! If you get a city coupon book admission is free and the employees are nice! Some good rstaurants in the area are good....especially right across the canal behind the zoo.

Great for kids!. Nice zoo nearby the city centre of Amsterdam. Prices are high(?) €19 for adults and €13 for kids. Large range of animals. Great tip to watch the feeding of the seelions. Check the website when that is.

Excellent value, need more time than you first think.. We decided to spend the afternoon here, thinking it was just a small zoo and we would't need much time. Turns out we where wrong, this zoo has its usual outdoor enclosures with a variety of animals such as giraffes, elephants, wolves, zebra, camels and a variety of gazelle like species. The highlights for me where the indoor sections, this is veryhelpful if itsa cold or rainiy day or if like us it starts to get dark a little earlier than anticpated. These indorr section are all well lit, and as it was a little cold many of the species where indoors. However there was a bird house which was a lovely section of large indoor enclosures all very well designed with the birds flying free enabling them to live an almost normal existence. The first section of the birdhouse had a rain forest feel to it with flora to match, you had to look closely but there were birds in the undergrowth,small little squirrel like creatures, iguana relaxed on long ropes, fruit bats were asleep on the roof and a variety of marmosets and other monkey species where happily grooming and swimming in the trees going about their normal behavior. I little ale monkey gathered apples and ate them not a feet away from me at compete eye level and seem completely unbothered by my starting in awe as its little fingers unpeeled the skin from the apple slice before being devoured :)...sooo cute. Other indoor sections was the insect and reptile houses amazing collections again all very well laid out, there is also an amazingly large aquarium which also has a little museum section in it, the aquarium itself has some breathtaking aquariums which have to be seen to be believed. I tend not to go to zoos in different countries as i find that perhaps the same standards of welfare are not in place as what would be expected in the UK, however i was extremely impressed with what i saw, many of the species had large indoor and outdoor section of their enclosures all animals seemed happy and healthy. There was also a planetarium in the zoo which we didn't get chance to see, they only do the shows in dutch though so that was a little disappointing. But overall excellent day out just make sure you go earlier in the winter periods as we didn't quite get to see all species of animals as it got dark. Great day out of you have kids as there is a little play area for them as well. It costs 19 euro 50 cents each plus 1 euro 99 cents if you want a map. Which is extremely cheap when you look at the prices to go into a uk based zoo. And i have payed more than that to go into an aquarium by itself!! Highly recommend excellent value and time well spent, easy to get to as well from central station just get the no 9 tram.

Expensive but worth a visit. Me and boyfriend loved our visit to Amsterdam Zoo. The tickets are quite expensive about 20 euro each for an adult ticket but its worth it! (also buy a map at the ticket counter it is really helpful) The zoo is set right in the city which is convenient and easy to get to, both tram 9 from central station and tram 14 from Dam Square stop close to the zoo. The location is beautiful with historical buildings, flower gardens, a planetarium and an aquarium, we spent half a day exploring the zoo and had a great time.

My kids loved it! Lots to see!. We went in November '12 when it was quiet (but a few of the different restaurants inside advise that they are closed during the colder weather) and we found it a really lovely zoo that had a lot to see! The butterfly house & aquarium were also really good. My younger son loved the children's petting zoo. There were only a couple of enclosures that looked like they could have been a bit bigger but I have definitely seen worse. The area where there is a the main big restaurant and a large play area near the giraffes and large birds of prey was great in our opinion. Our kids loved climbing the huge structure! The restaurant was also fantastic. I know if we went to Amsterdam again my kids would be definitely asking to go back there!!
An amazing place. This zoo is fantastic with such a different array of animals, we were there a whole afternoon and still had not managed to see everything.

Top zoo with all kinds of animals!. Alot of zoo's dont have a widespread of animals but amsterdams zoo has hundreds of species to look at. Feel a bit sorry for summer animals in freezing temp but it happens in all zoo's.

Good mix of animal. This zoo pack more into it than I expected as it was in the centre of Amsterdam.Great collection of paired animals that seem to be happy as have cubs (tigers, elephant, wolf, penguin to name a few that I can remember).On the downside some of the enclosures are tiny. A puma in a cage not bigger than 10ft by 10ft and an adult elephant that steps from side to side as if mad or totally bored of its environment but this animal may well have came to the zoo like this. If you visit the zoo do intend to spend at least 4 to 5 hours as you will be surprised at how much time it takes to walk round especially when you visit the aquarium which israther good as well.

Truly amazing experience. My boyfriend and I recently visited this zoo while on Amsterdam for a city break the tram stop was alexanderplein the zoo for both of us and a map was €39 but your there for hours and its well worth the money loved the first building we went in to had little monkeys roaming free in the room aswell as peacocks lizards and bats some great photo opportunitys also loved the sharks and aquarium building and the butterfly pavilion a great day out truly magical my favourite zoo!

Don't go there in the evening!. We went there at 5pm and we payed 55 euro for 2 adult and one kid and we can't see anything, I don't know why the sold the ticket in the evening! But the butterfly's salon was great.

Perfect Day for the Kids. The zoo is easy to navigate and peppered with playgrounds for the children to burn some energy. You can spend the entire day here, eat at the cafe and if it rains go to the reptile, butterfly house or the aquarium.You can use a buggy for your toddler. Insert a euro (maybe it was 2) and then when you return it, you get your money back.

Wonderfully laid out!. From San Diego and used to the Zoo there, this had large shoes to fill and I was very impressed! The open exibitions were fabulous! I just loved walking through the animals like you can with many different animals! I cant wait to see what they do with the new feline exhibits theyre building!

Enjoyed it as a kid and it still hasn't lost its charm. I still have a picture of me and my dad visiting the Zoo in 1992. Since then the Zoo has been updated and changed, but the classic cages at the beginning of the Zoo are the same.It is a nice place to visit, preferably when the sun is shining, if you like to stroll around and watch animals.

A piece of nature. We lived not far away from the Artis Zoo during our visit to Amsterdam, and we have to admit that a zoo is always new to you since you were a child when your last visit to a zoo occurred. Definitely, a nice place, and there is a lot of nice and interesting animals you might not have seen before. It's like a journey to a part of the wild nature. And yeah: a black/white cat lives in the zoo at the gorillas' place. :)

Great day out in Amsterdam. Definitely something to include on a trip to Amsterdam, but give yourself plenty of time to go around and enjoy it - we spent over five hours in the zoo and just about managed to see everything. Something else to note is that it is largely outdoors so plan it for a sunny day as we did. The highlight was the butterfly pavilion, which was fantastic. It was also great value for the size of the zoo. The aquarium was slightly disappointing but still really informative and interesting and by no means the main attraction. The staff were friendly and helpful and we would definitely visit again.

Great for all ages. At first the 18e entry put us off going but we are so glad that we did.We took our 15 year old along with us and he loved it too. Loads of animals and birds that we had never seen before. Nice to get up close to animals and even walk through with alot of them.Loads to see inside heated areas if the weathers not to good. The aquarium is huge.We ate at the zoo and the food was nicely priced. Lovely cuppa too !. There are little carts availble to pull toddlers around in.Great day out but we wished we went slightly early so that we had more time.Would go again.

A-MA-ZING!!!!. This was by far one of the best Zoo's I have ever been to. The animals were amazing and you could get so close to them. It was so much bigger than we expected and they had animals I had never seen before. It was raining when we went but we really didn't seem to care because we were enjoying ourselves so much. If you do go to Amsterdam you really must come here!!!

Plan it for a day!. To properly visit Artis you need a whole day! Book that in your planner and you will not be sorry! We were misled by information in a booklet and lost a hour in planned visit to Artis, so had to hurry to see most animals and attractions . It was worth it! One of the best ZOOs we ever visited!

Nice zoo, good place to spend the day. The zoo is very nicely located near the city center of Amsterdam with a lot of historic buildings. There is a nice collection of animals and a lot to learn about animals. Also enough things are indoors, so even enjoyable on a cold or rainy day.

Absolutely perfect. I think this is one of the most beautiful zoo i've ever seen...there are a lot, really a LOT of animals of all kind from kangaroos and elephants to crocodiles and snakes...there are also an acquarium, a reptilarium and a insectarium! Very very good!

Good zoo but not the best. Had a good time at the zoo, it isn't the best and biggest but its good to visit for a few hours. The bird house and reptile house were great, some enclosures for the larger animals are too small though
Well worth visiting. Definitely enjoyed our time at the zoo. We got a good discount through our IAmsterdam card. Que was quite big but worth it

Excellent place to visit. We spend a good few hours here, plenty to see and do. Did not eat at the zoo but there was plenty of cafes. Definitely a thing to do if visiting Amsterdam. Worth the money...:)

A Wonderful Zoo. We had a wonderful day at the Artis Zoo. It is a nice size and considering it is one of the oldest zoos and it is very clean and well maintained. There is so much to see, many animals and great exhibits such as the wonderful butterfly exhibit where you are in the exhibit with the butterflies.  Don't let the rain stop you, it rained very heavy for a while when we were there and everyone managed to find shelter in an exhibit or restaurant. The grounds are lovely and it was an easy walk to get there. It was a wonderful oasis in the city. You might also find discount admission tickets online. Go and Enjoy it.

visit to the Zoo. Arttis belongs to the oldest zoos in Europa and exists since 1832, we spent there many hours and if we would have had more time, we would spend there a couple of days but like they say, there are so many attractions in Amsterdam and you want to see them all, but in Amsterdam go and visit Artis.

Nicely done, but small zoo. We went in the summer with our 2 children and had a very nice afternoon. The staff around the place were very nice and friendly. It is well laid out, with lots of variety and extemely clean BUT it is undeniably small. The enclosures for me were far too small. Although they were natural looking the pure lack of space was upsetting. I know it is a city zoo but I was still disappointed by this. Chester Zoo in the UK manages to have much larger enclosures. As I said though, the children had a lovely time and were able to see many animals up close.

Great zoo!!. Lots of different animals, they got giraffes too (i thought they were warm temp animals). The monkey from the lion king is here, haha. The panther is amazing. The birds are free all over the zoo, and u can take pictures from a close distance (1 mts)

Nice zoo. It was years since I visited a zoo. I went to visit the resistance museum and was and hour to early (09:00), I found the Artis zoo right across the street and decided to visit (with my I Amsterdam Card). At the end I spent about 3 hours here instead of the intended 1 hour. I liked the animal collection and the nice buildings. It's also very nice to just walk around between the plants and trees. Nice to see this much green in Amsterdam (the Plantage district)

Zoos - not just for kids!. We were moored up opposite the Artis Zoo in Entrepotdok and woke each morning to the majestic sight of Giraffes and Zebras roaming around their paddock! Our children have long grown up and were most certainly not accompanying us on this holiday. Nevertheless we were sufficiently intrigued and decided to spend a couple of hours in the zoo.It turns out that a couple of hours would in no way do justice to a visit here. All of the enclosures and 'houses' were beautifully maintained and thoughtfully designed. The diversity of wildlife was amazing. Highly recommended.

The oldest zoo in the netherlands. When in Amsterdam, especially with kids, don't miss the artis. It's a lovely zoo in which you could also visit the "back office", i.e. The housing arrengments of the big beasts. Beautiful butterflies section. But what we loved the most was a rep representation of an amsterdam's canal including the big frightening looking fish...a good reason not to fall into one of those canals my children concluded.

great afternoon out but still a zoo. I have to say i had an excellent afternoon out at the Artis Zoo but it is still a zoo. Some of it is absolutely fantastic such as the forest house with monkeys lose and jumping from tree to tree... however the elephants and other large animals are housed in enclosures far to small for them and the elephant was clearly trying to relieve his boredom by dancing on the spot which made me quite sad. The penguins and sea lions where fantatic and clearly having a great time.

Always relaxing. Compact zoo where most animals live in "natural" environment. I like the aquarium especially.As a friend of Artis I can visit whenever I want. In summer the free concerts are not to miss.

Lovely zoo!. Great place to go while in Amsterdam. One of the best zoos I've been to (and I've been to a few!) the layout is good becaus there's minimal fencing, which means that taking pictures is ace. Also it's pretty crazy being in some of the accommodation with animals running around or swinging through trees without any barriers at all! (a 'person' style of Longleat... but no monkeys pulling your windscreen wipers off!)2 euros for a map of the zoo is rubbish though - we didn't get one, but followed the signs instead. Give yourself at least 3 hours.

Fantastic place!. The Artis zoo was the highlight of my holiday. There is so much to see and do, suitable for the whole family. It took us 4 hours to look around but could have spent a lot more time there. Some lovely Animals, highly recommend the zoo!

Excellent Zoo. This zoo did a tremendous job of displaying a limited selection of animals in spacious enclosures in an overall attractive setting. Particularly well done were the aquariums, an unexpected treat, and the butterflies.

retro feeling. the retro atmosphere of the place is very nice! There is a building where one can see small animals being "free". It's like a covered garden, with lots of plants, trees as well as animals and birds moving in the space. The aquarium is also worth visiting! However, a zoo is still a zoo (with the cages etc).

Beautiful ZOO, well worth visiting!. From a few reviews and advice from friends, we were recommended to stay away and go somewhere else. Me and my friend although decided to give it a go and bought the tickets. We are both adults and had an amazing time in the ZOO, clean and the animals are well taken care of. Staff is very helpful and friendly (I lost my Iphone case, and the guy called security to have a look around and see if anybody handed it in, they all went an extra mile to help me, outcome? I lost it, never mind) I still had a great time in there, You need a good 3-4 hours to go through the ZOO, one of the best attractions in Amsterdam. If it helps tram number 9 goes there, its about two minutes walk from the tram stop, ask anybody, Dutch people are very nice and helpful.

Artis Zoo. Lemurs running free outside, sunbathing and doing "yoga" moves. Amazing 19th century aquarium over three floors. Animals seems well cared for and happy and the cafes serve healthy, reasonably priced food

Zoo... Well, unfortunately I lived near the San Diego Zoo for many years and it is incomparable. This zoo is kind of sad. The city should invest more in upgrading it for animal comforts. But, it's OK.
Great place for kids. This park has it all. Even with pouring rain, we stayed ther almost all day.We loved the park, with so many attractions. Planetarium, aquarium, zoo, butterflies, reptails, etc.

Amazing Animals !!!. Have such a great time seen animals that I've never seen before in my life. Especially, at the Aquarium was very well maintain and animals seemed healthy (Bright skin colors). The lions family were young and really seemed happy.Young cub would looked for mom. The toilets are to die for...Yod will need a couple of hours to complete the visit. At first thought the zoo was small but in reality is BIG
takes a whle but fascinating. one for the families but me as part of a couple loved it too, its a bit of a trek and it takes a long time to get around but theres so much to see. fascinating

Pleasant. This is a pleasant, older zoo. My husband and I needed a fun place for my son to run about in between our museum crawl and this was perfect. Although the staff was helpful and friendly, the cafes were not clean--trash piled up and spilled food was left for the wasps and birds to pick over. I couldn't help but think that some of the exhibits were tiny spaces for the animals (I'm thinking of the big cats). A reall overhaul is needed for this zoo! In spite of my complaints, I would go back to see this zoo again!

Well Built. Really well built. an amazing layout and beautiful overall. Has some really nice and cool big animals some unique stuff. Like a huggge gator. Horribly maintained though. The place obviously needs more care.

A must do when in Amsterdam. Plan a day because this place is really something to see. Many of the birds and smaller animals basically roam free. Not a lot of bars except the big cat exihibits. Wonderful experience for young and old.
Great fun. Loved the zoo - had a great time. Good selection of animals. Would definitely recommend and only €14 - bargain

A nice place to visit. Used the iamsterdam card to gain admission. Was very surprised as how nice zoo actually was. Many different animals and things to see. Right in middle of town. Might not have gone if not for card but worth the trip.

Even if you don't like zoos, give it a try. We went on a rainy day, and it was wonderful. Why? The rest areas/cafes here are top notch, and the hospitality is so good! The animals don't have bars, the displays are lovely. And Dutch kids are well behaved. Just go--you'll be glad you did!

The best City zoo in the word. This Zoo is unique for a city zoo. It has a great collection of animals. It is as if you are in a old village with lovely buildings.
The garden is beautiful and it is a relaxing place for(local)parents and grandparents.
Interesting. we enjoyed the setting and the animals. Wish the animals had bigger spaces, but the zoo itself is lovely.

Lovely zoo. We went to the Artis zoo at about noon, and it was relatively quiet, with no queues, and most of the animals were out and about. We especially liked the butterfly house and the bird house, where the birds are free to roam the building.It's also possible to get food in the zoo at reasonable prices, including the local pancakes which come in a little tray with powdered sugar. The zoo mascot, Artis de Partis, is a sock monkey who appears on all instructional signs, making them easy to see, and lending a sense of fun! You can buy him in the shop too!

Very impressed. One of the best zoos. Designed with the animals at heart, minimum cages or glass. Big cats and crocodiles unmissable; displayed so well so that it encourages 'natural' behaviour which is missing from so many zoos. Lots of landscaped space to walk and picnic. Aquarium a bit cramped into its Victorian building but the rest was well worth the Euro 14 entry fee.On 9 tram route from Centraal Station.

Artis Zoo - Amsterdam. The Artis Zoo in Amsterdam is GREAT FUN! My boyfriend and I spent 3 hours in there, its massive, with every single animal you could imagine, it has a gift shop and places to eat and it is only 18 Euros to get it. I would definitely recommend.

best zoo we've seen. we left the zoo til last and after visiting it we wished we had a full day there - it's great you get to be up close with the monkeys and lizards, you can walk through the lemurs enclosure in which they come up to you and play with your back pack and lick your hands! all the animals enclosures look really impressive and they looked very well looked after! my boyfriend insists on going to a zoo on every holiday and this topped all the other zoos including the English! A must see!
artis zoo. spent a whole day here, Most of it was interesting but some of the enclosures seemed far too small for the animals. Felt very sorry for the family of lions..

Enjoyable. Had a really fun couple of hours here. Some of the enclosures seemed a bit random but nonetheless it was good. The Sea-lions were particularly enjoyable. Not the biggest or the best zoo i've been to but it was a good way to spend a couple of hours.

Best zoo I've ever been to. Spent most of the day here, there is so much to see. There are massive aquariums and everything. So many different animals to see and the enclosures are so different to ones I've seen in other zoos. They look so much better. The lemur island is great, walking around the island with them all running about playing. The price was really good. I would recommend the Artis Zoo to anyone who is visiting Amsterdam
Best day out!!. Literally had the best couple of hours,so many amazing animals so clean and just a beautiful zoo to visit!!!

An excellent zoo. I brought my 2.5 yr. old niece to Artis while on vacation in Amsterdam. There was 6 of us in the party and we all thoroughly enjoyed our time at this zoo. What sets this zoo apart is the access you will have to a wide array of animals spanning several continents. Each exhibition allows you an up-close look and the animals were all out and about which made the viewing all the more enjoyable. The layout made it very easy to spend a half day at the zoo and capture all it had to offer. Another benefit is we were able to take the tram from downtown to the zoo for less than 2 euro each and the kids ride free. My niece is a zoo fanatic and she is still talking about the zoo upon our return home. A true highlight for all of us. If you are traveling to Amsterdam with children do make this a stop on your trip. They even have a nice gift shop that did not break the bank to purchase a little gift for the kids. The price is reasonable with the kids in free and 25 euro a piece for the adults. The zoo offers animal viewing and has wonderfully placed parks within the zoo for the young ones. Lastly, the food was great for a zoo and our lunch was affordable- not something we are used to at attractions in the U.S.

Nice day out, not the newest Zoo. My grandchildren and I went to Artis in Amsterdam, we wanted to have a nice day out in Amsterdam and for the children the Zoo was on the top of their list. The Zoo is at the edge of the old center, it has a big parking (which is much cheaper than any other parking in Amsterdam) and there is one entrance, where we had to wait about 10 minutes due to a queue. My grandchildren wanted to see the flamingos and from there we passed the other birds (which have just been put in new enclosures) and went straight for the aquarium which is smaller/ also different than the Oceanium at Blijdorp Zoo. The Zoo is not that big, but has a lot of variety in animals... for us the highlights were the seals, the butterflies, the Savannah, lemur island and the young lion. We ate poffertjes, there are several places where you can eat, there is also a playground next to the Savannah.The Zoo is old, they are in the middle of renewing all enclosures, but the biggest project still needs to start and to be honest this is also the most important project. All big cats are now living in old and small enclosures, on one hand this is nice as you can see all that is happening (well that goes for the lions, the others have green areas in their enclosures which make them invisible now and then), but this is no longer how Zoo's (should) display their animals. So the Zoo would be even better once all of this is done and then it will be a really good Zoo.Now we just had a few hours of good fun.

Fun. If you want to visit the zoo in relative calm, be sure to get there as soon as it opens. After 11.30 it starts getting crowded, especially with kids. The more noise there is, the more the animals hide. Not only that, but the lines are incredebily long at noon. When we left the start of the line was literally 100m before the main entrance on the street!Just after opening, with no one there, we got really close to the animals in The Monkey House, which was a pretty unique experience. Be sure to get there using public transport, it's a big place and our feet were already tired from the walk. What also helps is mapping out a general route, passing everything you really want to see. Ours took about 3 hours, after which we were tired and hungry, so we left to get some food. If you want it's perfectly possible to spend an entire day there, which would justify the expense a bit more because it isn't cheap (€18.5pp).

A very pleasant zoo.. This zoo was very well laid out and had a wide range of animals and displays. The sealion show was very nice and informative as well as entertaining. It is a lovely walk around in what feels open air. It is expensive if paying in but one of the most advantageous aspects of the I-amsterdam card. Food is relatively expensive- which is to be expected in a zoo. We had a pleasant picnic in one of the many gardens. I gave it four stars because many animals were noticably missing from quite early afternoon- we didn't see elephants, giraffes or some other species. The aquarium is fascinating and enjoyable.

wonderful!. Beautifully arranged zoo, with a planetarium, small aquarium, even smaller insect-arium (different from the butterfly pavillion). We were there for 3 hours, and could have spent longer, but the zoo was closing. The animal enclosures were well maintained and there's lots of beautiful scenery and trees when you walk between the enclosures. Favourites were the seals/sea lions, vast array of birds (caged and wandering freely around!), anteater, and flamingo pond. Overall a very nice and engaging time!The only thing that would have been nice was if they had more (detailed) English explanation of the animals. In parts of the aquarium there were only Dutch descriptions.
great zoo. lovely zoo (as far as zoos go), very well maintained, also quiet compact, can get busy, but people spread easily, recommendable

beautiful gardens - well worth a visit!. The zoo is well worth the visit - healthy and happy looking animals in a very beautiful garden.i would say the zoo is a great place to take a picnic if you have young children - lots of attractive picnic areas and some grassy areas you can sit on - as they could run around without falling in a canal in the time it takes you to open the picnic box. The small area where you can stroke goats and sheep was fun as was the seal 'show' (the keeper talking and playing with the animals). Highly entertaining the porcupine you meet on the way in and the prairie dogs - it was quite obvious they were looking at us looking at them!! :-). If you don't want to take a picnic, there is a reasonably priced café near the entrance with a pleasant terrace overlooking a small, lake there for flamingo. We both (middle aged mum and teenage son) enjoyed the experience of walking through the butterfly hall and having exotic butterflies fly around us. We were lucky enough to visit the zoo in hot, sunny weather but I think that even in the rain it would be a pleasure. It is also obviously a place where Dutch people go for a day out - it was the only place where for 3 hours I didn't hear anyone speak English or Italian (or anything other than Dutch, come to that) - which was nice!

Artis Zoo. The enclosures are too small for the animals, but that means you see them a lot closer...lions and bears looked depressed. The little monkeys that run free on a little island are wonderful...you can practically touch them. My granddaughter loved the little pull along trolleys you can use for €2 (which you get back) the noisy waterfall was nice. Great cafe's. Nice to see the chimps walking above your head in a mesh tunnel. Small zoo but still worth a visit.

Small zoo- Good for younger or older visitors. I must say, the place is beautiful and they keep up the grounds very nicely. There are all the things you hope for and places to relax. If you are from a big city with these Mega Zoo's, you probably will not like this zoo. You all think the amount of animals is so small and be disappointed. If you do not have a big zoo, have kids 4-12, or 60 plus, this is an ideal zoo and will feel like it is magical. I have many people who also been there and I get mixed feelings about it. If you are in the demographic I say, then a definite must. If not, there are many other places to visit to satisfy your needs.

Very nice Zoo. I made the mistake of going later in the day and missed the aquarium. There is lots to see here so go early. Tram 9 or 14 will take you right very close to the zoo. Very clean, well set up with plenty of room for the animals. I also felt the gardens are nice than at Hortus Botanical. If you are interested in animals, this is a must see.

Amazing zoo in the centre of Amsterdam!. This is great! In the centre of Amsterdam near Waterlooplein you will find the Artis Zoo. Tram 14 takes you there (for dam square, but take right direction to plantagekerklaan!) This zo has everything, butterfly garden, elephants, monkeys, birds, bugs, girafs, ext. Inside are also beautiful gardens where you can sit down and relax. Also the aquarium is famous because it's in and old building at the back of the parc but has also one aquarium that has gives you a view of the life of fish in the Amsterdam canals!Food is also good and in nice restaurants. There is much to learn for children. The zoo is good for one day entertainment, but to see it all it will take a hole day. The zoo is renovating so there is changing a lot and the new habitats are wonderfull. Now you can walk between the 'ringstaart monkeys'! For the tourist a perfect place to be and also when it rains. There are movies about space that's also a must to see! Have a great time like we did!

what a terrible zoo. was there yesterday and is was a pathetic sight. Of all the great cats there were only the lions and the amur leopard, the rest of the cages were empty, no tigers, lynxes etc. A lot of cages with other animals were empty. There were no bears anymore and a lot of cages had not been maintained: the zoo was dirty. There were few snakes, only 2 gharial. In general: this is a zoo that does not deserve visitors.
Nicest zoo ever. Quait, animal running free. Clean and beautifully laid out. Good value. Butterfly enclosure magical.

(One of) the best city Zoo's in the world. What looks like a small Zoo, is in fact a very pleasant, entertaining and species-packed animal park in the middle of town.One can get really close to the different species, like walk amongst the butterflies, birds or monkeys; visit the aquarium or sit down and have look at the penguins or sea lions, whilst the caretakers explain more about the animals and their environment. There's Giraffes, Elephants, zebras, gnus and snakes & tortoises. Next time you visit Amsterdam, reserve one day to visit.Please note that the Planetarium is great, but lacks translation into other languages than Dutch.

Interesting zoo in the suburb of Amsterdam , a bit expensive but worth the effort. A bit difficult to find but still worth all the effort of time and money (parking as well). The variety of the animals is extensive and interesting. Though it was a rainy day we enjoyed the visit, U can hide in some of the buildings like the aquarium so u better have the map with u. Water or hot drinks would help while y r dripping. Still the elephants in the pool were a delight, the monkies and many more to adult and kids alike. A joy.

A well maintained zoo. A good variety of animals mostly from africa, live in this well maintained zoo. The place located almost in the heart of amsterdam also houses a beautiful batterfly pavillion, a reptile room and an aquarium. We spent a nice morning, but the ticket was a little too expensive.

Excellent morning. This zoo was quite exceptional for being in the middle of Amsterdam. It was well laid out and easy to walk around. The aquarium section was just as good as an individual aquarium. It was neat to walk amid butterflies and mini monkeys. Needs at least a half day or more.

Really Enjoyable and Fun!. I can’t believe that Amsterdam has a Zoo of this size right in the centre of it! We spent a good highly entertaining three hours here in great weather. The highlight has to have been the sealions but there is so many great attractions! Freely roaming monkeys, a unique butterfly den and adorable red pandas!

The zoo of the Netherlands. A very nice zoo! It has everything. Lot`s of animals, you can see very close. You can see that the animals enjoy staying here. The parc itself is also very nice to walk through. Nice people who can help you with questions about the animals.

Liked it!. Artis visit is not cheap, but I think you should do it if you like animals and zoos. The zoo is big and quite nice. There are many animals and benches for you to rest. There are also nice places, where you could lay and relax. You can easily spend the whole day there, just make sure you are not in a hurry and enjoy.

Lovely but Expensive Experience. We really weren't sure about going to the zoo after some of the reviews on here. The last thing you want to see is animals in enclosures that are too small. We were also hesitant because of the price. 18.95 Euros is an expensive bit of fun for one adult, but 15.95 Euros for children aged 3-9 is a bit ridiculous!We arrived an hour and a half before closing time on a Sunday afternoon. There weren't too many people, but owing to the late hour and the size of the zoo that wasn't too surprising.The zoo itself is rather large which is hopefully a blessing when there are large amounts of people. With some of the usual features (petting zoo, reptile house, big cat enclosure) it also has some unusual ones including a planetarium, aquarium, zoological museum, and butterfly pavilion. It would seem that there is something to do no matter what the weather. It's designed to please everyone and should certainly keep everyone entertained no matter what their age.Wandering the zoo is like navigating a park. Pleasant and shady walkways lead all over the zoo allowing you to take different paths to each enclosure. There are well-maintained toilets at regular intervals and several food kiosks and restaurants throughout the zoo.The animal's enclosures weren't massive, but they also weren't tiny as some of the reviews here detail. Perhaps some work has been done in the meantime. Generally they were kept up. The penguins were a bit smelly (the water in their enclosure didn't look very clean) but otherwise we didn't notice anything out of the ordinary. There were however a lot of dead rodents in the Vulture enclosure. It didn't appear to be feeding time, and the Vultures didn't look so interested so the result was rather macabre.The ibexes however were pretty cool. Their enclosure is modeled to look like a mountain and they seemed to very much enjoy clambering around in it. We also really enjoyed the peacocks which appear to roam around the zoo freely. We were even treated to a show as the male tried to woo the female!The aquarium was not as large as we expected but very well kept. The tanks were pristine and the selection of fish was rather large. The petting zoo was pleasantly large and had all the usual animals along with a few cows and a slightly grumpier pig.As a couple who love animals it was a pleasant way to spend our last afternoon in Amsterdam. We were pleased with what we saw in an hour and a half but I imagine you could easily spend several more hours checking out other areas of the zoo. Despite the zoo closing at 18:00, we managed to wander back to the gates and leave around 18:30 without anyone reminding us that they closed at 18:00.The gift shop was lovely. Would have loved to buy one of the beautiful calendars but at 15 Euros it seemed a bit excessive. I should also add that unless you have one of the touristy free gift coupons that you also have to pay 2 euros for a map at the entrance!Overall, we enjoyed it, but the price of admission certainly isn't for the faint of heart, especially if you happen to be students or a young family with limited funds. We didn't eat there so I can't say whether the food was reasonably priced or not. Those on a budget should consider carefully if it's worth it for them.

A day at the zoo. We spent many hours on a hot, sunny day at this zoo. Lovely area to wander around with good landscaping. Some animal enclosures seemed particularly small - the bear who showed signs of extreme boredom by repeating the same little walking patttern over and over again :( One of the elephants had a repetitive rocking movement also .... but then these behaviours can be found in any zoo. The Small Mammal house was particularly pleasant. The giraffes were splendid and the smaller elephants a delight. Many animals and birds to see here. We ate in the pleasant, large, airy restaurant that offers a good range of foods - from snacks to meals.
excellent. this was definetly woth the money and we spent a long time exploring. If you have children they will love this place!

So many Animals & Great Restaurant. My daughters liked the variety of animals at this zoo. We were not even going to go to the zoo but decided to anyways. I am glad we went because we would have missed out on such much fun. It is a lot of walking but they do have concession stands for refreshments and such. We ate lunch at the Flamingoserre and had the best Pannenkoekens and Indian Curry Tomato soup with ham and cheese sandwiches. You get to watch the Flamingoes looking at themselves in the mirror as you eat which was fun....It is a zoo wher many of the enclosures have no fence and allow the animals to fence themselves...different from the US zoos so that made it cool as well....

An Impressive City Centre Zoo. This is a very well laid out zoo with decent sized enclosures for the animals and lots of landscaping throughout that makes it a pleasure to stroll around. We particularly enjoyed the enormous aquarium section. Most areas/displays had brief english translations but not always.

Surprisingly good zoo. Disclaimer: I love animals so I might be slightly biased. I came to Amsterdam without any plans, and I had four days here, so I figured I would look into the Artis Zoo. I walked there from my hotel in the canal district (maybe 15-20 minutes by foot), which was interesting by itself, and paid to go into the zoo. The fee is average - 18.50€, Jacksonville is ~$20 so comparable. The zoo was surprisingly well stocked and had a lot of interesting animals. I was able to get closer to the animals here than any other zoo I'be been to. And none of the cages looked undersized or anything. Everything was compact but well-done, which seems to be how a lot of things are in Holland. The zoo also borders a large canal and there was a nice breeze this afternoon, maybe mid 60s. It was quite warm in the sun though, which was nice. I took around 200 pictures which I will have to go through later. Overall I felt it was a great experience, and would definitely recommend it to anyone who enjoys viewing animals or zoos.

Fabulous - great value - must see. Hadn't included the zoo in my initial itinerary but liked the look of it passing by. Of course it had animals including pink flamingos and storks and african penguins which I'd never seen before. But in addition to all the animals it had an Acquarium and a Planitarium. The Planetarium had an amazing film viewed under a large domed screen which made you feel you were sitting under the heavens; it was fabulous. This attraction was fabulous value for money and had something to keep the whole family entertained.

What a gem and in the centre of town. Its more like a park than a zoo. But everything is there, maninly without bars, accesible and perfect for kids. Perhaps best of all it's a pleasant 15 or 20 minute walk fron the Central Station.

Nice and compact - lots to see. Spent a very pleasant afternoon at the Amsterdam Zoo. Walking distance from the centre of the city.
I loved the butterfly house.
Staff were friendly and helpful and all spoke English.

Awesome animals!. Visited the zoo because we wanted to have a look at some European native animals, this zoo has a lot of animals from all over the world! It's definitely worth a visit! Lots of different birds, big cats, an insect house And a reptile house, and lots more. It's not too expensive at €18 per person. The only thing is we went on a Sunday and it was quite busy.

Amazing Zoo, one of the best and lots of exotic animals. Artis Zoo in Amsterdam is a must see if you are a animal lover. The zoo is nicely spaced with loads of great habitats and a lot of exotic animals besides the most common zoo animals, like elephants and giraffes at a close distance. Pretty big Zoo could take you a half or full day to see everything without a hurry.

Over priced and a little small; but lots of animals to get close to. Pros:Planetarium (only in Dutch language)Tons of different speciesCan get quite close to animals (we even touched a giraffe!)Cons:ExpensiveAnimal pens are smaller than zoos we're familiar with

My favourite zoo. I'm partial, living in Amsterdam, but for me Artis is the best zoo in the world. The animals are well looked after and as a hobbyist photographer I always end up with some nice shots. Pay attention to the feeding times and take the chance to chat with the zookeepers. They have great stories about the animals. The new indoor spaces with free roaming animals are very exciting as well. Reserve enough time or accept that you will not see everything: even though it's not that big on the map, you will easily spend 3-5 hours here.If you think you will visit more than once in a year, I highly recommend buying the membership. It'll turn out to be a better deal.

Nice well maintained ZOO. Loved going to this ZOO, it was clean and informative. Loved taking awalk with my wife and looking at wildlife. The animals look to be in good shape and well fed. For my next visit would love to bring my kids to this zoo.
Don't Miss This. We spent a day there, but could have stayed longer!Lots of unusual animal, birds etc, in great environments.Butterfly house amazing.Baby Elephant haveing a bath bril.

What a great zoo!. We loved going to this zoo. There were 3 musical groups performing and the animals seemed to enjoy it as much as the visitors. The zoo was open till dark on the night we were there and we loved the ambiance and all the seemingly happy critters. Some of the animals actually roam free and you can pet them. Very amazing. People buy BBQ and sit with their families on the lawn enjoying it all.

Good appearance. I have visited many zoo's mainly to see if the animals appear to be treated well. I was quite impressed with Amsterdam with all that I seen. The grounds are spacious but compact and easy to get around. It is also well located in Amsterdam which is Tram 9 from Central Station and the tram driver always announces the stop. Avoid taxis at all costs in this city as a day tram pass is great and Amsterdam is all in walking distance.

Nice open spaces with happy animals. With nice weather this place is a charm. Not nearly as crowded as the main parks with nice spacious pens with a selection of animals that seem happy, cared for, and clean. A very pleasant excursion.

Compact but well-maintained zoo. The ring-tailed lemurs running free were likely the highlight of the visit, but so too were the various monkeys. The big cats and gorilla were sort of sleepy, so that wasn't exciting as it could have been, but it was a good day all around.

Best zoo ever. The Artis Zoo is a wonderful space with the animal enclosures very natural. The animals were active and the zoo keeper presentations were fun to watch. The food was also good which was surprising at a zoo!

Artis Zoo. Lovely zoo and nice to see the animals in more open environments. Huge for a city zoo . With a aquarium, insect house, planetarium as well as all the usual animals you would find in the zoo , there is loads to do and good for couples and families. In a really lovely part of town too. Well worth a visit

Nice Zoo.. I love going to zoo's, even without kids. This zoo was well laid out, clean and with a nice variety of animals. Nice well kept grounds. We spent most of the day here. Really liked the in-house movie room, really comfy bean bags to sit/lie on and look up at the movie. What was it about? I was so comfy after a tiring day I shamelessly slept soundly on the bean bags through to the end!Good photo ops, easy to get to, better than London Zoo.

Small but quaint. We had a chance to visit the Artis zoo today. We found it on the smaller side but well kept, clean and staffed by helpful people. Great butterfly house. The exhibits for the elephants and giraffes allowed decent access. We thought we would easily do the whole zoo in two hours but managed to spend five hours there. Signage and information is in Dutch and English.

Small and unclean conditions for the animals!!. I went to the Artis zoo as part of a volunteer program and I left very disturbed and quite heartbroken actually. The facilities were very unclean and the smell was overwhelming, I couldn't bare to be in the bird area for more than a few minutes due to the overwhelming smell and filth everywhere...imagine how these poor creatures feel!! Some of the cages look like they haven't been cleaned in months, and the size of the living compartments for the animals is disheartening. I watched a leopard just pace back and forth from one end to the other, living alone in such an isolated environment is bound to drive a creature crazy. I was not all at pleased with the cramped and dirty living conditions of these animals, and felt quite ashamed to have even been visiting a place like this for "entertainment". I would never recommend this establishment.

so much to see. A lovely well maintainted and set out zoo, get up close to the animals, stroll around the beautiful gardens walk around the wonderful butterfly house, be amazed by the collection of fish & sea life in the splendid aquarium building. Plenty of interactive facts and information for children to enjoy & learn. The main cafe is situated right next to the giraffe enclosure and the food is reasonably priced and of good quality and what a pleasure to sit in the sun eating lunch while watching the giraffes eat theirs! A day of tranquillity in an otherwise bustling crazy Amsterdam.

for kids and adults. If you have children this is a defiantly to go. If you don't have any and you're in Amsterdam with a friend it is still a place to visit. My favorite part was the butterfly house. So many butterflies, so much beauty, I just walked around and never wanted to leave, however I had to, the heat was a bit overwhelming (and I had a time to keep). There is something for everyone in here and the animals seems to have it ok under the circumstances, something highly feels important to me.
Good place to spend the day. The place is clean and friendly... a good place for a day with the family...

Good for a family day out, just a bit overpriced!. Been here a couple of times (students in Amsterdam get to visit it for only 2,50eur) and I'd have to say I really wouldn't pay 20euro entrance tickets if I had to.Quite a big zoo in the middle of hectic Amsterdam. The aquarium was kind of neglected when we visited. The planetarium was worth a visit.They have a lot of animals but the gorillas were hiding when we were there so we didn't get to see them.The only thing I liked about it was the Butterfly garden, it's one of those indoors tropical parks where you can experience the weather in tropical countries.

I'm member of this zoo for several years. And I'm member because I know they're busy with the future of this zoo to give the animals more space to live. They already did this for the giraffes. They will do this for a lot of animals, like the elephants. They take well care of the animals and the park with a variety of trees.Summerevenings in the park with a basket with friends is also great, nice to picknick. And of course the new born animals every time makes my heart smell.

Best zoo ive visited in a long time. Such a wonderful zoo, me and my partner loved it. Not expensive to eat or drink too and plenty to see. Only complaint is where are the meerkats? Fantastic aquarium.

Good in the rain. We visited on a rainy day. There was no queue and we entered quickly. There is so much to see at this zoo it is just fantastic! Even in the rain there was plenty to do and different inside parts of the zoo. Fabulous day out!

Animal Lovers Beware. It was quite heartbreaking to see the size of some of the enclosures for the animals at this zoo, I've been to many zoo's all around the world and I was very sad when I left here. It was also very expensive, but afterwards I didn't mind paying the money in the hopes of it meaning that they would be making improvements and expanding.

Great city zoo with good range of animals. We visited this zoo on a Saturday during the recent sunny spell. Unsurprisingly there was a queue of families waiting to go in but it only took about 10 mins or so to get our tickets. Maps are an additional 1.99e which is a little bit cheeky after paying admission as I'd say you do need a map to ensure you see everything. Hopefully I managed to 'pay it forward' when we left by leaving our map on a bench for someone else to use.It took us about 2.5hrs of wandering to see the whole zoo and some areas we didn't spend long in; the butterfly house, as on one of the hottest days of the year so far it was waaaay to warm in there to be bearable and also the aquarium which looked great but someone was allowing three small children to run around screaming at full volume which didn't make for peaceful viewing of our aquatic friends.There was a large number of young or newly born animals (gorillas, lions, elephant, wolves) on display too which pays credit to the zoo's breeding programme. All other animals seemed to be in good condition and in well kept enclosures. The whole place was very clean and tidy, probably a benefit of it not being huge.Definitely worth a trip!

Not just for kids. A wonderful half-day spent at the zoo! Lots of interesting animals (some I never saw before!). Dont skip the aquarium-it is cleverly laid out. Other than the fact that it was a really hot day and a lot of the animals were sleeping, it was super!
Amazing Zoo. Great Zoo, all kind of species.The ticket are not so cheap, but worth it.

A great day out!. I went to the zoo today with my mum as we had time to fill in and it was such lovely weather. The zoo was great! Being from Australia there were plenty of animals i saw here that we don't have In our zoo at home, there were flamingoes, bison, jaguars and even bears! It was 17€ each which we thought was a pretty decent price. There's plenty of grassed areas around where you could eat your own lunch if you wanted to save a bit of extra money rather than but something. All together it was a great day out :)
perfect zoo for the space it has. pity this zoo can't expand as it is an amazing place. I was fortunate enough to go when there were baby animals which for any zoo-goer is cool!
Worth half a day. A really nice zoo, plenty of different animals to see (some really close up and unrestricted) and cheaper than i expected.
From Australia and have been to may zoos there, this one was brilliant and has a playground for kids. very pricey at around 70 euros would be the only fault but probably worth it

GREAT DAY OUT. Visited the zoo in January with my boyfriend. We left it a little late and went at 3.30ish but we found that it was plenty of time. The animalS in the zoo were all very lively and looked well cared for. Normally in zoos the tigers ect can hardly be seen but at this zoo they were walking around and were given toys and food throughout the day. The aquarium was huge and very interesting. Overall great attraction but a bit pricey at €18.

Truly a large collection of animals.. It was an enjoyable experience to be in close encounter of the lions and the one that amused me most was the Orangutan. But the sea lion was gorgeous. It should be nice to come earlier to get some rest in between and proceed to the next.One should not hurry. You will enjoy if you take time in a leisurely manner. There is a restaurant inside the zoo. The 2 Cheetah restaurant can support you in between and not expensive.The viewing place for the various fishes is in another house. The reptiles too are in another.Young children as well as the oldies will surely enjoy this adventure.
Fun place. Known as Amsterdam's second best attraction - I agree.

Some unusual animals too. To add to what the other reviewers have said: There are a fair number of unusual animals, that one may barely have heard of, let alone seen. Though I was travelling alone (its an ideal family outing) and have seen other zoos in Europe, I found it very interesting and started a `identify the animal' post on my facebook page ! The added attraction is that it is located close to a lot of other attractions. I had the I Amsterdam card and given the steepish entry fee, I thought thsi was a good bargain !
Great Fun!! . Hugh place with lots of things to see . If you come when the weather is good, you'll get to enjoy the beautiful gardens and Parks. You can even smoke a J in from it of the lions :)
A must do. We really enjoyed this zoo,though the bear did give us some concern.But apart from this everything including the food was spot on.Great for all the family.
With love to the animals. We had a very enjoying afternoon at the Zoo. Though it rained ocasionally we were pleased with the site, the organization and the variety of animals.

would have been good but for the stress of large animals. First the good. The tropical houses which allow birds small monkeys lizards butterflys to be as natural as any enclosed animal can be and allowed close interaction with the animals. Many of the outside enclosures allowed the smaller animals and birds a large degree of freedom and the aquarium was very good. Now the bad. A brown bear which although having an enclosure walked round a concrete pad stood on its back legs turned fully round one way then turned round fully the other before repeating the walk round the pad and the turning round over and over and again. So sad to look at that a large mammal has been reduced to insanity. How can a first nation zoo allow this to be done to an animal. Pictures of animals behaving like this came out of the communist countries after the collapse of their dictatorships. The other large animals had small enclosures and either sat there in a listless fashion or showed signs of the same stress behaviour as the bear but to a lesser degree
You should visit it!. It's great place! Very beautiful and interesting! It was quite funny to observe animals, especially dancing elephant, playing seals, families of penguins! :)

Very nice zoo. This is a rather large zoo with a big mix of animals considering its central location in such a packed city. The exhibits are set up nicely and you can even walk through a few of them amongst the animals - mostly the birds and small monkeys.

Beautiful Zoo. I love this Zoo - out of all the European Zoo's I have been to, Artis is really special. The new marmoset house is brill, as is the new bird sanctuary and the butterfly house. Lemur land is new and the Lemur's were still a little shy compared to some brazen Lemurs I have met elsewhere! The grounds are lovely and the original buildings really capture Amsterdam from yesteryear. The only gripe I had was the price of food. 2 pieces of cake and 2 coffee's 12 euros and they were tiny, but Amsterdam as a whole is expensive so take a packed lunch!

Fabulous!. This zoo has everything. Large indoor areas for viewing fish, reptiles, warm-climate mammals, butterflies, and insects. The outdoor enclosures are large and appear to have the animals comfort in mind with their design.The food places are really expensive for the type of food they offer. Perhaps bringing in a packed lunch would be better.They also have an amazing play structure that is great for all ages. Both my 5 yr old and 2 yr old thoroughly enjoyed the park.

A great day out. Having visited alot of zoos I didn't know what to expect from the Artis Zoo. In reality it was great. There were so many animals to see including penguins, lemurs and a red panda (that was my favourite). I really would recomend the zoo to anyone of any age as is a great day out for all (even in the rain).

Artis Royal Zoo -Excellent place. If you are going with kids, then keep at least 4 to 5 hours to see and enjoy. One can enjoy otherwise also. I loved the place. I watched every thing on my pace.. I strongly recommend to visit if you love the nature and animals.The zoo admission fee is included in the I AMSTERDAM card.
very small cages for animals. its generally a big zoo but unfortunatly they keep lions and other big animals in very very small cages. If you have children its good to go- for the expirience.

Fun afternoon at Artis. We spent the afternoon of easter Sunday here and have to say that we had a great time. It is well spaced out and the gardens are beautiful. In terms of the animals, I take the point that others have made regarding some of the small pens for the larger animals, but overall, the animals looked happy and well cared for. The highlights for us were the butterfly house, which was amazing (and worth the visit on it's own), the insect house and the aquarium, which was really really good. There were many small animals I had not seen in other zoos and we all learned something from our visit. Well worth a visit - we had 4 hours there and just about managed to see everything. Would recommend and would go back.

Nice zoo. Very nice zoo with a variety of animals. Nicely laid out. Right in the heart of the city. The Dutch Resistance museum is across the street from the zoo entrance. The zoo admission fee is included in the I AMSTERDAM card. I highly recommend that card. We got the 48 hour card. We didn't rush to cram in museums or anything but would have spent twice as much on admission fees if we had gone to everything we did without the card.Have a nice smoke in a coffeeshop before going to the museum or go to the Ij Brouwerij after visiting the zoo for a good beer.

Great little Zoo in the heart of the City. I rarely bother visiting Zoos in other Countries as animals are much the same anywhere, and the Melbourne Zoo is exceptional, but this one looked interesting and it was. The use of space and the range of animals and the enclosurers were very well done and I would recommend it to anyone.

Well worth a visit. I have seen this zoo advertised as good for young children. I would like to say that myself, aged 53 yrs and my daughter aged 25 yrs thoroughly enjoyed our visit to Artis zoo.I took my daughter to Amsterdam for 3 days, I had been before and wanted to show her all the sights that I have enjoyed in past visits , but she saw an advert for the zoo and fancied seeing it. We walked from the centre of Amsterdam. It only took about 20 minutes to walk it from Neumarket. The entry price was reasonable and my first impression of the enclosures was .. wow!. The animals seemed so close and the first enclosure had no bars or anything to spoil photos. There were herons nesting in trees and flying freely around the park. Most of the animals were close enough to see and photograph without difficulty. It was big enough to take up a whole afternoon but small enough to be able to relax with a drink or ice cream and not be tired of walking around. I was disappointed the the red pandas were not there as they were altering their enclosure, and the polar bears must have gone since the 2003 guide book we were reading but there were meerkats, elephants and baby, giraffes, zebras, birds of prey, big cats, brown bear, butterflys, camels, ant eater and many more... The butterfly house was amazing. My daughter loves butterflies and we haven't seen a butterfly display this good near home.We had a lovely time there and I will take my husband there the next time we visit as I'm sure he will love it too.

A good day out - even in the rain!. We visited on a very wet Easter Monday. Despite the weather we had an enjoyable time - there's certainly plenty to see under cover. The gorillas were a highlight, along with the butterfly house and aquarium. I agree with other reviewers about the small size of the cages for the big cats, this I felt was the only negative thing about the zoo. I had a baguette and drinks in the cafe, reasonably priced for a tourist attraction. There were very few other people there on the day we visited, mostly young Dutch families. Not sure if this was because of the weather or the Easter holiday.Our family enjoyed it greatly, I think the kids could have spent all afternoon watching the gorillas (and we enjoyed pointing out the similarities between our kids behaviour and the young gorillas!)

Watch out for the parking. My review is based purely on the parking... we haven't had a chance to visit the zoo yet. We drove up for the day (after stopping in the Kuekenhof)... a three hour stop in their lot cost us 40 euros! I know parking is limited in Amsterdam, but whoa! Just keep an eye out for that before you go...

Huge zoo!. Wide range of animals - GreatInsectarium, Aquarium - GreatSpend a full day there, well worth the money (18.95 euro) - GreatButterfly House - GreatOnly bad points, some of the enclosures are small :(

Lots of variety. Artis Zoo offers a huge range of animals from sealife to monkeys. The monkey house gives the visitors the opportunity to watch closely on how monkeys feed and live. I especially liked how the zoo-keepers had time to chat with us about the animals they were taking care of.However the zoo are is quite complex so remember to take a map with you. Check out minicards.com for a free map at the entrance. Reserve at least 2-3 hours for your stay.

Excellent. Visited on a lovely sunny afternoon, spent four hours there and still never managed to see everything. Not usually a fan of zoos, I was totally relaxed and felt the animals were very well cared for. We took a picnic and would recommend this zoo as a must visit for all ages.
Artis Zoo. Loved the monkey house with monkeys walking right around you.

Beautiful zoo. This is one of the nicest zoos I have visited. The animals all look healthy, alert and busy with natural behaviours; the grounds and the animal enclosures are spacious and beautifully planted. Some of the Animal Houses are made from the beautiful old buildings, but restored inside to modern zoo standards.I thought the Forest House and Bird House were very special, in the Forest House you walk through the "jungle" and monkeys and iguanas are walking and climbing all around you, and fruit bats sleeping up in the trees.

Loved it. After leaving the "heavy" Anne Frank's House we went to the zoo to finish the trip. Best idea ever. Impossible not to laugh and relax with all those animals, and we can get really close to them, some are even free to walk around with the visitors. I Loved it and recommend.
Great zoo, right in the center of town!. This zoo has lots of animals, several "indoor" displays, and a huge outdoor playground.

artis zoo...very enjoyable. Artis Zoo in our experience was great, we thought the zoo itself was fairly large and spent a few hours there...Lucky for us it was a lovely warm day when we went .The majority of the animals looked contented especially the lions who were lying quite happy asleep in the hot sun..Felt the "bear" enclosure was perhaps a bit too small,wasnt a lot of room for him to roam around in and he looked quite sad at times..Loved the aquarium section,and the butterfly section was big and really interesting with all the different species flying round you...Staff were really helpful and friendly and the zoo itself was very clean.We had our lunch before we went in so saved money there..Photos of the day there were excellent..Would go back again..
City Zoo. Just a city zoo, cramped cages, poor variety of animals, not enough enrichment for them either.
€19 entry, lovely way to spend an Afternoon in Amsterdam. Especially liked the Lynx, the Panther and the Butterfly house, took our own food and drinks etc, so worked out a relatively cheap afternoon.

A Fabulous Zoo. Artis Zoo makes for a great day out... and i mean literally a day - admission is reasonable for the amount of time you can spend seeing different animals. Artis is unique in that it had enclosed areas which you walk through are the animals move around you. This includes birds and small monkeys. There is a great variety of animals from all over the world and it also includes an aquarium. It is clean and well maintained. It is equipped for children too with a playing ground as well as little carts for children to sit in and be carried along when they get tired.

Great for kids. We visited this zoo with our 2kids age 2 and 4 yrs. last week and I really liked this Zoo. It got so many animals and amazing aquarium. We all had a great time. Highly recommend for family day out.

Best day out!. Amazing! Spent a whole day at the zoo and it was the highlight of the trip for me! There is so much to see and it's one the nicest zoos I've been to. Would recommend it to people with kids because they would love it!

Nice zoo, on the edge of the center of amsterdam. The Zoo is not that big, but they have some in and outdoor things, which was good, because when we were there it was freezing... still the kids just wanted to go to the Zoo.. the zoo has some older parts which need attention (mainly the big cats section), but there are large parts that are new and are nice to look at and good for the animals... the children had a great day despite the cold.

Unhappy animals with enclosures that are far too small. Myself and my boyfriend are instinctively very cautious about any type of zoos as we love animals and can't bare to see them distressed or unhappy in their surroundings and we certainly don't want to help fund these places by paying the admin fees. We took a chance at Artis Zoo and although we were happy to see the majority of animals looking cared for we were a bit disturbed at the size of the enclosures for some of the animals animals. The lion enclosure, for instance, was completely inadequate for the one lion, two lionesses and one young lion that it housed. The older male was constantly pacing back and forth while the others followed his lead and they all looked very bored and unhappy. We moved on to the elephant enclosure and, although that was much bigger in comparison, it still seemed far too small for all the elephants that were in there - one was stood for what seemed like ages rocking backwards and forwards and it was quite upsetting to see, especially as lots of Dutch families were cooing over the baby elephant yet seemed completely unaware of this beautiful adult that was clearly miserable.One of the worse sights for us was another large cat pacing back and forth in a caged space around 4 feet long, like he was trying to wear a trench in the soil beneath him. It was extremely sad to witness and made us feel sick. The zoo itself is large and there are many things for families and couples to see and do, the aquarium and amphibian section was a particular favorite but on the whole I wouldn't recommend this zoo to any of my animal loving friends as I know they would be as distressed as we were. I'm also taking into account that it was a chilly February day when we went but even that couldn't mistake a zoo that looks very run down and wholly inadequate to cater for the animals it houses.We're used to visiting places such as 'The South Lakes Wild Animal Park' in Cumbria where the enclosures are huge and the animals have such freedom you leave feeling totally at peace with the standard of their care and housing.We definitely won't be going back to the zoo but we genuinely hope that the money Artis reaps from the entrance fees will go towards better care for these beautiful creatures that quite simply deserve better.

You know about Mumba?!. On a wet, cold day in february it might not be your first choice but the Zoo in Amsterdam was quite a nice option for me as i had some alone time. I asked about the elefant area at the entrance as they were my main interest. They got a baby elefant in july which i thought to be huge (both in matter and size) but the otherwise really helpful guy at the desk was totally surprised that knew about it! That really surprised me...The areas are (as far as i can judge) quite modern and spacey except of the wild cats which had a tiny cage outside living alone. The ape area was nice as well, but a little crouded i thought. The big aquarium house was interesting but missed some feel - touch - do it your self experience. That was actually my whole experience. Very nice to look at and good walking path as well as way finders but no "wow ". They were no possibilities to feel or touch any animals or get really close to them. I am not talking about taming them but the did not seem to be interested in the few visitors at all. But Mumba was cool though they were no things with him at the store :-(

Best gorilla enclosure we've experienced. The highlight of my trip to the zoo was definitely the gorilla enclosure. Separated only by the thickness of the plexi-glass, we felt up close and personal with these gorillas. The enclosure was indoor and while my husband and I were enjoying the rest of the zoo, walking into this enclosure gave us the 'wow' factor.
